doc_description:
Composites One LLC
 is the leading supplier of essential materials for 
wind energy, aerospace, defense, consumer recreation
 and 
construction composites manufacturing.
 We have a global presence and operate 
44
 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each team member with 
respect
 and 
offers opportunities for growth and personal success.
Learn more about us compositesone.com!
The 
Regional Sales Manager
 is responsible for managing, developing and leading the sales team, while meeting or exceeding assigned territory metrics for the Northeast Region.
*
Primary Responsibilities: *
Establishes and implements sales strategies to assists sales representatives to maximize the number of products sold to customers and convert target accounts at highest GPM, implementing corporate strategies.
Establishes regional and territory sales budgets and monitors sales representatives’ progress to meet and exceed objectives.
Coaches and educates sales representatives to manage territories and achieve higher performance levels measured in product sales and margin generation.
Responsible for calling on major regional accounts with the applicable sales representative to establish relationships at multiple levels.
Works closely with operations personnel to facilitate communication and cooperation for the benefit of the customer base and to grow sales.
Maintains a high-level product knowledge with technical expertise to sell all products.
Communicates with suppliers to implement strategies and facilitate cooperation.
Resolves business related conflicts with customers and suppliers to produce fair and positive solutions.
Makes an ongoing effort to maintain an understanding of the customer’s needs, business, competition, products, processes, etc.
Acts as a liaison between the sales team and all available resources and customers, internal and external, in the sales process.
Position Requirements: 
A minimum of 8 years of experience in sales is required.
Experience in composites or related materials with demonstrated territory management ability is preferred.
Managerial experience a plus.
Knowledge and understanding of Composites industry safety standards preferred.
Composites products and process expertise is preferred.
Ability to learn internal systems required.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 software strongly preferred.
Experience with SAP a plus.
Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field required.
Ability to travel 50% required.
*
Competitive Benefits Include: *
Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision)* available on the 1st day of employment!*
401K Plan with Company Match
Profit Sharing
Paid Time Off
Flexible Spending Accounts (Health and Dependent Care)
Employee Assistance Program
Educational Assistance Program.
Why you should join us?
CULTURE, INTEGRITY, CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION
We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of 
Respect, Teamwork, and Communication!
Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO)
Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or other protected classification as defined by applicable law and regulation.
ADA Accommodations
Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please contact the ADA Coordinator by email at ADACoordinator@compositesone.com.
Experience
Required
8 year(s): Related Sales Experience
Education
Required
Bachelors or better in Business Administration or related field
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Job Description Summary
 Responsible for activities and processes that assist the Environmental Health and Safety organization achieve business objectives. Accountable for the quality of own work. Subject to direct operations supervision/prescribed work instructions/systems checking. Executes within a well-defined operations framework. There is generally a step by step sequence of standard operational tasks which need to be followed to achieve an end result
 

 
 Job Description

 
 About us:

 
 LM Wind Power, a GE Renewable Energy business is a world leading supplier of blades and service to the wind industry. The wind turbine industry is becoming increasingly complex, with radical progress made over the last few decades, providing great opportunities for professional development and a work environment that promotes initiative and creativity. If working in a company which creates state-of-the-art technology and processes attracts you, LM Wind Power has a career for you.

 

 
 Roles and Responsibilities:

 

  
 Individuals that have responsibility for leading EHS governance audits and GE's EHS audit & governance strategy.

  
 These individuals are tied to the governance team, not to a specific business or site/service operation.

  
 Additionally, while they generally focus within one region they may work across regional boundaries on specific initiatives.

  
 Developing conceptual knowledge of professional discipline.

  
 May include support roles with specialized expertise or technical knowledge in broad area.

  
 Applies general knowledge of business developed through education or past experience.

  
 Understands how work of own team contributes to the area.

  
 Resolves issues using established procedures.

  
 Consults supervisor or more senior team members for issues outside of defined instructions/parameters.

  
 Collaborates with others to solve issues. For customer facing roles, develops strong customer relationships and serves as the interface between customer and GE.

  
 Exchanges technical information, asks questions and checks for understanding.

 

 

 
 Required Qualifications:

 

  
 Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college in Engineering or related EHS field

  
 Minimum of 3 years of experience in EHS

  
 Ability and willingness to travel 20% of the time

 

 

 
 Desired Characteristics:

 

  
 Experience in wind industry, construction projects or customer services activities

  
 Local legislation must be following as a minimum

  
 Demonstrated professional experience and deep domain expertise in Environment, Health & Safety

  
 Experience in Wind Industry in required, Experience in Offshore Wind Industry in a plus

  
 Medical ability for working at height is mandatory

  
 Superior leadership, interpersonal and strategic skills

  
 Excellent computer skills for use of digital tools

  
 Ability to work in a matrix environment, influence and motivate diverse teams to achieve a unified goal

  
 Ability to interface effectively with all levels of the organization as well as organizations outside LM/GE (customers and regulatory agencies)

  
 Strong oral and written communication skills

  
 Fluent English skills; additional language is a plus.

 

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        
 GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

       

      

     

    

   

  

 

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        
 GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable). 

       

      

     

    

   

  

 

 

 
As a federal government contractor, GE may in the future be required to have U.S. employees fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Some GE customers currently have vaccination mandates that may apply to GE employees.

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        
 Relocation Assistance Provided: 
Yes

doc_title: Offshore Substation Engineering Manager - Kiewit Power Engineering
doc_description:
Requisition ID: 136088


Job Level: Mid Level


Department: Design Engineering


Market: Power


Employment Type: Full Time



Position Overview



Kiewit is seeking an experienced Offshore Substation Engineering Manager to provide design oversight, technical expertise, and guidance for HVAC and HVDC offshore wind collection stations and interconnections to onshore stations. This position is for an experienced engineering manager with a background in high-voltage station design, with expertise in offshore station equipment and functionality, design criteria and applicable codes. The candidate must possess leadership experience, excellent communication skills and demonstrate a strong desire to work collaboratively within a group of experienced professionals.

On our team, you’ll have the opportunity to see more and do more than you ever imagined. Working hard will not only bring you the satisfaction of a job well done but will help propel you forward in your career faster than you may expect. We’ll train you, develop your skills and allow you to take on power projects that will impact millions across North America. With top-notch health benefits, a wealth-building 401k plan and unbeatable growth opportunities, by joining Kiewit, you’re ensuring a lifetime of success.


District Overview



Kiewit Engineering Group, Inc is a full-service consulting and engineering firm serving the infrastructure and engineering markets. Our combined staff of more than 1,300 engineers and design professionals have expertise that spans all major engineering disciplines to serve transportation, power, water/wastewater, mining, building, and oil, gas & chemical markets. Backed by 130 years of construction experience, our construction-driven engineering focuses on constructability and safety in the earliest phases of projects to ensure on-time and on-budget project delivery.

Our rapidly growing Power district, which includes structural, civil, piping, mechanical, process, process safety, electrical, instrument and control disciplines, is a multi-faceted division of Kiewit with best-in-class technical expertise focused on the EPC delivery model for power facilities. We offer a variety of engineering services, including owner's engineering, project development, detailed engineering and design, construction management and plant services. Our engineering teams bring power projects to life across North America in the following areas:


Gas-fired generation
Power delivery
Environmental retrofits
Renewables and new technology
Water/wastewater

We are a high performing team of engineers and designers that develop projects through the project life-cycle engaging exciting projects throughout North America. Our staff leads the power markets engineering process and collaborates with Kiewit’s construction teams to approach construction-driven engineering with a focus on safe, cost-effective, and innovative designs that achieve client expectations and further Kiewit’s legacy of excellence.





Location



This position is US based. Sponsorship opportunities available.



Responsibilities


Provide engineering leadership, oversight, and coordination to assigned offshore substation projects.


Management of all technical team members and tasks including, but not limited to: definition of project scope, including functional layouts, optimization, and operability, design basis development


Contribute technical expertise to discipline lead engineers to ensure technical compliance, while maintaining optimal project cost and schedule.


Communicate and coordinate project activities with project director, clients and other stakeholders.


Lead project risk assessments and risk mitigation strategies


Manage the use and provide insight in the development/use of Kiewit tools in order to increase efficiency in planning, design, and project execution.


Monitor QA/QC of project and coordinate with QA/QC team to resolve any design or process issues.


Manage and support contractor RFIs.


Promote and support interdisciplinary coordination.


Responsible for ensuring compliance with Kiewit quality control program.


Develop and improve processes, tools and/or technology


Interface with clients on a regular basis.


Responsible for grid code compliance


Manage all lessons learned and incorporate them into department standards/processes


Qualifications


Bachelor of Science degree (B.S.) in electrical engineering from an ABET accredited university


Proven history of successful engineering management on offshore substation projects


Deep understanding of offshore wind farm electrical system design requirements and solutions including interface points between onshore and offshore substations


Experience working as a project engineer on an offshore wind project.


Capability to manage people effectively in order to meet quality and project schedule.


Professional Engineer (PE) preferred


Legally able to work within the United States for any length of time


Strong written and verbal communication skills; fluent in English language


Knowledge and understanding of US engineering standards including (but not limited to):


ANSI C2, C37, C57, C62


IEEE 1, 4, 80, 120, 1300, 1375, 1459, 1584, 1862


NFPA 70, 70E, 110, 780, 791, 850


Knowledge and understanding of US Regulatory Requirements including (but not limited to):


29 CFR 1910


29 CFR 1926


30 CFR 585 – Renewable Energy and Alternate Uses of Existing Facilities on the Outer Continental Shelf


CFR Title 33 – Navigation and Navigable Waters


NERC Reliability Standard FAC-001


Knowledge and understanding of international engineering standards including (but not limited to):


DNGL-ST-0145 – Offshore Substation Standard


DNVGL-OS-C101 – Design of Offshore Steel Structures


DNVGL-OS-D201 – Electrical Installations


DNVGL-RP-C205 – Environmental Conditions and Environmental Loads


DNVGL-ST-N001 – General Guidelines for Marine Projects


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

About TPI
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI Transportation also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.
TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.
About the Role
The Program Manager is responsible for all aspects of assigned automotive prototype, development, and production programs coordinating with business development, engineering, finance, quality, supply chain and operations teams. The work is complex, difficult in character, and requires independent problem solving with general direction and guidance from corporate and business unit strategy. Superior leadership and communication abilities are required to manage multiple programs simultaneously. Work requires program leadership responsibility for critical programs based on strategic importance.
To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee multiple programs and project teams using excellent time management and interpersonal skills.
If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role.
**
**
Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Responsible for overall program timing and delivery – technical, quality, and cost/budget.
  • Provides expert tactical leadership in coordinating, facilitating, motivating, and directing efforts of cross-functional program teams including individuals from
  • Engineering, Business Development, Product Development, Quality, Supply Chain, and Manufacturing.
  • Ensures efficient use of team and resources within budget.
  • Gains support for and develops program objectives and deliverables. Ensures full team participation and that all groups involved understand all the demands for the successful launch of a program. Objectives include timing, engineering support, cost, quality, and delivery. Ensures customer and Company requirements are met.
  • Ensures that the profitability of the program is maximized throughout the program launch.
  • Leads the communication of all issues and responsibilities both within the Company and to the customer and ensures that technical and tactical objectives are clearly documented and cascaded to each functional area.
  • Works with internal and external resources to maintain strong customer relationships with dedication to customer program schedules.
  • Demonstrates expertise, in all customer systems as required, to support programs in launch. Ensures countermeasures are initiated to correct unfavorable variances by communicating alternative measures to the customer, which may be used to solve engineering problems. Ensures the success of the future production of the programs in the launch phase.
  • Documents and monitors program objectives per PMP by mean of open issue lists, milestone reviews, and launch (manufacturing) readiness reviews. Demonstrates expertise in all systems required for launching programs.
  • Participates in continuous improvement efforts of PDP/PMP processes to support product launches.
  • Performs other duties as necessary for completion of projects and achievement of goals.

Who we’re looking for:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Business Administration or equivalent with a minimum of five years’ experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience in the automotive industry is preferred.
  • Leadership abilities in managing multiple programs to meet goals (quality, cost and delivery of programs) from concept through launch in coordination with internal and external contacts.
  • Organizational, project management, and leadership skills to prioritize, coordinate projects, manage conflicting needs based on strategic importance, and deal with many issues at one time.
  • Ability to work on long-term assignments, broad in nature, using a high level of originality and ingenuity. Must be self-motivated and able to develop long-term technical strategies/plans to meet future business needs and growth opportunities.
  • Financial skills to prepare budgets, develop and understand financial aspects of program deliverables.
  • Ability to lead and motivate others through support, training, etc. towards organizational goals.
  • Ability to thoroughly research, recommend, and oversee implementation of new products, materials, processes, etc. and present information to support product launches.
  • Ability and willingness to travel domestically up to 30%.

Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island. Relocation benefits to the greater Providence RI are available.
Location: 373 Market Street, Warren, RI 02885

Location: 373 Market Street, Warren, RI 02885

Job Type: Full-time

Description:

This position is for a Commissioning Manager to represent the Coastal VA Offshore Wind project. The CVOW project entails the construction and installation of 176 wind turbine generators (WTG) and 3 offshore substations (OSS); as well as, associated cables and equipment.
The Commissioning Manager will report to the Director of Construction Projects - Offshore Wind. The Commissioning Manager is responsible for the organization, planning, and implementation of the Offshore Sub Station commissioning plan, and Wind Turbine Generator commissioning plan as required by the OEM, installation or fabrication contractor, and interconnect agreement. Close day-to-day interaction with the site construction team and the Construction Manager will be required to ensure all equipment is commissioned and delivered as required in a timely manner. The candidate will be required to work with the commissioning managers and teams of various prime Contractors to aid in the development of a commissioning strategy that will meet the Owner's requirements. This person will use the contracted scope and technical specifications to ensure that the OSS and WTGs are constructed, tested, and delivered with all required documents and certificates needed for service.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Review, comment, and assist in the development of the commissioning plan/specifications for the Offshore Sub Station and Wind Turbine Generator installation (including foundation and transition pieces).
  • Monitor and report on the status of commissioning activities.
  • Confirm mechanical and electrical as-built documentation is current and in compliance.
  • Liaise with Operations and Marine Coordinators regarding work plans and requirements of main component and installation contractors.
  • Provide advice and recommendations to ensure the continuing development of construction, commissioning, and operations philosophies, strategies, and procedures.
  • Verify that all turnover documentation for testing, commissioning, and maintenance is provided per the Contract.
  • Liaise with BSEE (Bureau of Safety & Environmental Enforcement) in meeting requirements for Commissioning oversight.
  • Ensure that tests are carried out and commissioning work is documented according to rules, procedures, and templates.
  • Review and monitor the progress of commissioning.
  • Provide accurate reporting in daily progress reports.
  • Act as the technical consultant for queries related to the commissioning of all systems and equipment of the Offshore Wind project.
  • Provide support to the project team and assist in resolving technical, commissioning, and warranty issues.
  • Attend FATs as required (may involve international or domestic travel); Including but not limited to components and equipment for the OSS, Foundations, Transition Pieces, Wind Turbine Generators
  • Ensure that all commissioning activities are fully documented and that this documentation is properly controlled and made available to the Operations Group.
  • Manage closeout of any punch list items that arise during commissioning
  • Manage warranty issues, in conjunction with Operations Manager.
  • Conduct critical reviews and/or assessments of construction and commissioning systems and processes.
  • Prepare weekly and/or daily commissioning status reports.
  • Coordinate commissioning walk-downs together with the supplier.
  • Report in NCs, and follow up on closure of relevant quality issues.
  • Participate in the review, preparation, and coordination of detailed commissioning schedules.
  • Verify that tests are carried out and documented.
  • Review of tests to ensure compliance with the commissioning manual/Contract.
  • Ensure readiness of take-over documentation and quality status for the Operations team.
  • Participate in verifying that HSE procedures are implemented.
  • Co-ordinate handover from manufacturing and to installation.

Soft Skill Requirements:

  • Strong communication skills both verbal and written
  • Ability to lead, collaborate, or work effectively in a variety of teams, including multi-disciplinary teams

Nice-To-Have Skills:

  • GWO training
  • Offshore / Maritime experience

High-Level Project Overview:

  • Coastal VA Offshore Wind (CVOW) in Engineering/Procuring/Constructing/Installing 176 Siemens Gamesa offshore wind turbines off the coast of VA, including offshore sub stations, cables, foundations, and transition pieces.
  • The project will create a nominal 2.6 GW of wind power.
  • Each turbine is capable of producing 14MW.

Main Contractors

  • DEME Group with Prysmian are responsible for transport and installation of Foundations, Transition Pieces, OSS, and cable.
  • Prysmian manufacturing and installing cable (Offshore Export and Inter-array).
  • Siemens Gamesa with provide and install the WTG (Wind Turbine Generators) including Tower, Nacelle, and Blades.
  • Bladt with Semco is designing and fabricating the Offshore Substations
  • Bladt is fabricating the Transition Pieces
  • EEW is fabricating the Monopile foundations

Required Years of Experience:

  • 10 plus years experience in design/construction/commissioning.
  • Experience in offshore wind construction or industrial environment
  • Good knowledge of marine, mechanical, electrical, and controls system.
  • Familiar with marine safety systems.
  • Offshore
  • Wind Energy

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in marine engineering or other engineering disciplines.
  • Will also consider equivalent work experience.

_Length of Assignment: 1 year term to start – will be extended based on performance/project need
Length of Project: 3Q 2023 – 1Q 2027_

doc_description:
It needs to be clarified that this position is located in Broomfield, CO, just north of Denver, CO.

 
We are a global supplier of CNC type systems and leader in our industry. We are an established EOE company with over 30 years in the field. We started working with Formula 1 teams in the late 70’s and 80’s and now manufacture high-end CNC deburring machines. These machines are multi-axis coordinated motion machines that help produce commercial aircraft, military aircraft and vehicles, wind energy systems, agricultural equipment, commercial automotive, OHV, etc. Our equipment touches virtually every aspect of the modern world. In fact, our machinery has touched every plane in the sky!

 
We currently have an opening for a CNC Machinist. You will be responsible for all aspects of running a CNC lathe or mill from running an parts order to completion.

 
Our equipment includes: 

 

  
3-Axis Mill

  
Live-Tool Lathe

  
Manual 17" lathe

  
Manual 8" lathe

  
Two Bridgeports

  
Two Sunnen Hones

  
Two drill presses

  
Two 11-Axis deburring machines

  
One 5-Axis deburring machine

  
Full fab shop and much more

 

 
You will also: 

 

  
Run the jobs

  
Document your process

  
QC your own parts

  
Be required to work flexible hours

 

 
Qualifications/Requirements: 

 

  
Minimum of 1 years of experience as a CNC Machinist and not accident prone

  
Able to read blueprints including GD&T

  
Able to use standard measuring equipment to measure dimensions and tolerance

  
Work with team to discuss and implement quality improvements, process improvements, work-holding solutions, and cycle time improvements

 

 
We require these qualities in all of our team members: 

 

  
Flexible

  
Reliable

  
Team Player

  
Good Attitude

  
Follow Instructions

  
Perform Work On Time

  
Continuously Improve

 

 
Job Type: Full-time

 
Pay: $35,360.00 - $72,800.00 per year

 
Benefits:

 

  
Health insurance

  
Paid time off

 

 
Schedule:

 

  
Monday to Friday

  
Weekend availability

 

 
Experience:

 

  
Machining: 1 year (Required)

 

 
Shift availability:

 

  
Day Shift (Preferred)

 

 
Work Location: Multiple Locations

International Wind
 is a maintenance and repair service provider for the burgeoning commercial wind power generation industry. We specialize in providing repairs primarily in the field at customer locations (Wind farms). Our field workers are trained and are required to maintain certification for climbing, working at heights, confined space entry and specialty processes such as composite repair for blades.
Due to exceptional growth and future opportunity, we are seeking a detail oriented, well organized, and highly motivated individual to assist with Wind Operations. This person will provide day-to-day operations support for projects and customers under his/her purview to include work scheduling, training, logistics and management of personnel to ensure safe, smooth, and effective support for our client’s needs.


*
Job duties*
The Operations Support Manager’s over-arching purpose is ensuring that the business operates safely and effectively in support of our client’s needs. Duties and obligations that support that objective include but are not limited to:



 
Ensure a strong commitment to safety

 
Establish safety as our first core value

 
Foster a safety conscious work environment where all employees understand reporting options and are empowered to improve our safety culture

 
Ensure everyone understands they have the power to stop work when circumstances lead to uncertainty





 
Establish a strong relationship with designated customer contacts by demonstrating transparency, integrity, and honesty in dealing with each assigned client

 
Function as the single point of contact maintaining continuous client contact to build and/or strengthen the relationship

 
Deliver strong and frequent leadership engagement with assigned clients to ensure we understand and can deliver on their needs

 
Present a proactive posture regarding our performance – except and react promptly





 
Install a culture of continuous improvement and set high standards and expectations for our field personnel

 
Conducting periodic reviews of procedures and processes to identify improvement opportunities within the operation of the business

 
Communicate with field personnel frequently to understand operational challenges and support requirements to help ensure successful execution of contracted work

 
Remain available and approachable to our field employees





 
Oversight of operational and contract budgets with focus on establishing savings while maintaining or improving effectiveness

 
Understand all contracts associated with assigned clients

 
Ensure that operational plans support execution of the contract and identified work scope

 
Diligently enforce best practices with respect to spend for items such as vehicles, travel, hotel, materials, and contracted services





 
Conduct periodic site visits to:

 
Reinforce safety culture

 
Improve customer relationship

 
Garner feedback from field employees and

 
Ensure field performance and behavior supports contract requirements and best practices with respect to safety, quality, and schedule




*
Job Requirements: *



 
5 years of relevant Wind experience with at least 1 in an operations role preferred

 
Field Service experience in support of periodic maintenance activities including logistics for mobilization and demobilization

 
Experience with recruiting and staffing highly desirable

 
Can quickly identify key resources and build high performing teams

 
capable of providing input for a succession planning model that maintains a defense in depth for position evolutions.





 
Effective communication – written and verbal – with both management and craft

 
Ensure transparent communication regarding status, planning and expected outcome

 
Influence others (internal and external) to improve project outcomes





 
Effectively manages his/her time and that of other’s

 
Experience and/or active certifications as a trainer for GWO and/or ENSA a plus

 
Desire a candidate with established ties to Wind Industry management. OEM and Wind Farm connections desired in both USA and Europe

 
Understanding of wind turbine blade production/engineering principles highly considered

 
Rope Access experience highly desired

 
Existing certification to provide training in support of certification to Global Wind Organization (GWO) standards

Pay: $100,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

401(k)

About TPI 
 TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. 

 
The Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) Manager is the key individual responsible for ensuring a safe and environmentally compliant organization. The fundamental task is to plan, direct, and implement environmental, health and safety programs to ensure a safe, healthy, accident-free and sustainable organization by performing the following duties personally or through subordinate team members. 

 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities 

 

  
Plans and implements EHS policies and procedures in compliance with local, state, and federal Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) rules and regulations. 

  
Plans and implements programs to train managers and employees in work site safety practices, fire prevention, and correct handling techniques for chemicals, equipment, and other materials. 

  
Leads air permit, hazardous waste, community right to know, and other applicable regulatory compliance activities including record keeping and reporting and reporting requirements. 

  
Prepares studies and analyses of industrial accident causes and hazards to health for use by company personnel and outside agencies. 

  
Inspects organization facilities to detect existing or potential safety and health hazards, determines corrective or preventative measures where indicated, and follows up to ensure measures have been implemented. 

  
Provides information, signs, posters, barriers, and other materials to warn of potential and actual safety hazards and to prevent access to hazardous conditions. 

  
Leads and trains others in the investigation of accidents and injuries and cooperates in the preparation of material and evidence for organization use in hearings, lawsuits, and insurance investigations. 

  
Oversees the administration of workers' compensation program, including working with the insurance carrier to reduce employee lost time. 

  
Prepares and arranges safety exhibits and material for display, promotional work, industry conferences, and exhibitions. 

  
Represents the organization in community or industry safety groups and programs. 

  
Maintains safety files and records. 

  
Directly supervises 1-2 employees within the EHS function. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. 

  
Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems. 

 

 
Who we’re looking for: 

 

  
Bachelor’s degree in Environmental (preferred) or related field (natural sciences, engineering, chemistry, or similar) and minimum of 7+ years work experience Safety/Environmental leadership experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. 

  
Demonstrated success in improving EHS performance and establishing best practices. 

  
Proven examples of effective communication and listening skills. 

  
Demonstrated team leadership skills. Experience in managing EHS programs. 

  
Passion and drive for environmental and safety compliance. 

  
Knowledge of environmental and OSHA regulations. 

  
Broad knowledge of workers’ compensation regulations and best practices. 

  
Ability to read and interpret technical documents and regulations. 

 

 
Location 
 This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren RI.

  Are you ready for a rewarding career?  
   We are searching for a Process Materials Market Manager to join our growing  Aerospace   Team!  
   
  Now is the time to move forward and make an impact!  
   As a  Process Materials Market Manager,  you will be responsible for leading and facilitating Composites One’s Process Materials commercial growth efforts in the North American Aerospace markets. This includes the corporate development of strategic business objectives and movement into new sub-markets and/or geographies, while also identifying and cultivating key customer, supplier, and OEM relationships.  
   How will you impact our organization on a daily basis?  
   
   Lead and facilitate Composites One’s Process Materials growth efforts in the North American Aerospace Markets.  
   Develop and prioritize market and account specific plans to penetrate and develop targeted market opportunities.  
   Maintain a target pipeline in C4S.  
   Articulate the key products, tools, and capabilities required to be successful in meeting Process Materials growth goals to the organization.  
   Provide product and technical sales support and direction to sales personnel to drive sales conversions.  
   Work with Product Management to develop marketing plans.  
   Continuously monitor market conditions, opportunities, threats, and trends through communication with suppliers, customers, Sales team, and OEMs and communicate pertinent information internally in a timely fashion.  
   Engage frequently with Competitive intelligence resources to provide up-to-date competitive information.  
   Provide support to Product Management by identifying new product opportunities and suppliers that help Aerovac Composites One develop and maintain the most competitive and well-rounded product offering in the industry.  
   Attend trade shows, industry meetings, and events to develop relationships with existing and new customers and suppliers, obtain market information, and represent the company to the industry.  
     Work with executive leadership to determine resources needed to ensure success in meeting determined Process Materials growth objectives. Focus efforts across C1 functional groups to deliver results and support customer satisfaction.    
   Engage and partner with Aerovac and Composites One technical resources to bring innovation and technical credibility to Aerovac Composites One current customers and business development opportunities.  
   Advise on what is needed to create and maintain a process materials best-in-class kitting and conversion platform to deliver innovative and valued solutions to customers.  
   Provide critical feedback to Aerovac Composites One management to help develop product innovations to establish and maintain a competitive advantage in the market.  
   Provide key field support to find solutions for Customers and to strengthen Customer relationships.  
   Routinely travel with Sales reps and Corporate Account reps to support sales target development and closure.  
   Collaborate with Marketing Communications Team to build out sales promotion tools that are easy to use and digest.  
     Encourage and engage in strong cross-functional relationships by identifying teamwork opportunities.    
   Establish and facilitate strong relationships between Aerospace team and DC Managers, Customer Service team, Sales Team, etc.; work with Operations team to ensure understanding of the relevant market; establish product training programs for internal staff as necessary.  
   
    Required Skills and Qualifications:  
   
   A minimum of 5 years in Process Materials and composites industry experience is required.  
   A proven track record of business development or related commercial success and technical skills is desired for this position.  
   Diverse knowledge in composites materials including resin systems, prepregs, tooling products, fiber reinforcement, vacuum bagging, resin infusion, and enhanced bonding technologies is necessary.  
   Knowledge/experience with composite processing methods, especially automated fiber placement and tape laying, as well as autoclave and out-of- autoclave processing, is a significant plus.  
   Bachelor’s Degree in Composites Engineering or related industries is required.  
   Must be proficient in MS Office software, including Word and Excel.  
   Requires ability to learn internal database and software systems, i.e. MXP, SAP.  
   Ability to travel up to 70%.  
   Strong interpersonal skills; positive, customer service focus; ability to work in a team environment.  
   Ability to work with internal personnel and customers to assess needs and generate appropriate solutions to various problems or identified needs.  
   Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills; ability to research and analyze information and data to identify trends and make recommendations and decisions.  
   Strong, effective written and verbal communication skills.

Job Description Summary
 We are looking for an experienced Project Manager to join our Certification, Validation, & Compliance (CVC) function within LM Engineering & Technologies. You will be reporting to Director of RETL Program Office. 
 
 
 
 LM’s CVC function operates some of the most advanced accredited full scale rotor blade and rotor test rigs in the industry and holds an IEC RETL (Renewable Energy Test Lab) approval for rotor blade testing. LM designs, manufactures, validates, and certifies over a dozen products early utilizing its internal accredited test rigs and external test centers.
 
 
 
 You will organize, plan, and oversee the execution of full-scale rotor blade test & certification projects within CVC performed by external suppliers mainly in the USA, by executing effective project management & execution of business asks of the project milestones. This includes coordination of activities between blade design engineering, test engineering and the Test Laboratory, and communicate progress and timelines to stakeholders.
 
 
 
 You ensure availability and organize the use of external test capacity mainly with our American based suppliers. 
 
 
 
 We believe in technology, problem solving, and technical solutions being applied to our products. Having a robust project management and execution of our committed milestones is key to our success. You are a strong project manager and business execution individual with personal drive and are process oriented with excellent problem-solving skills in project management.
 

 
 Job Description

 
 About us:

 
 LM Wind Power, a GE Renewable Energy business is a world leading supplier of blades and service to the wind industry. The wind turbine industry is becoming increasingly complex, with radical progress made over the last few decades, providing great opportunities for professional development and a work environment that promotes initiative and creativity. If working in a company which creates state-of-the-art technology and processes attracts you, LM Wind Power has a career for you.

 

 
 Why we come to work:

 
 At GE Renewable Energy, our Project Managers work with integrity, great commitment, and incredible collaborative skills. Their projects can be global and complex, so they thrive under pressure and complicated management chains. While the work can be tough, the sense of pride they feel at the end result motivates our Project Managers to hang tough and focus on outcomes. Through your personal integrity and unparalleled organizational skills, you can work in a role that delivers an incredible sense of accomplishment, making a mark on the future of our world.

 

 
 Essential Responsibilities:

 
 As Project manager in CVC, RETL Program Office you are responsible for project management and execution of full-scale rotor blade test programs with external suppliers, to the agreed time, cost, and quality. 

 

 
You will be responsible for following scopes:

 

  
 Execution of Project Management for Full scale test and validation

  
 Responsible to manage, plan, execute timely, at cost, quality & safe delivery of full-scale test.

  
 Development of partnership, capacity, & strategic initiatives to ensure LM’s leadership in validation, certification, and compliance across global test centers.

  
 Execute testing contracts with suppliers, within the defined quality, budget, and time.

  
 Secure and support delivery of the asked outcome from internal validation centers or externals and capacity management

  
 Foster an effective close working relationships with product engineering project managers and leadership to deliver customer’s commitments.

  
 Ensure a robust risk control, time follow up, and budget for the test programs.

  
 Secure satisfaction of the customer and stakeholders of the project. Communication with customers, internally & externally.

  
 Full ownership and responsibility for leading projects with teams and stakeholders located across the globe and time zones, executing & managing deliverables until successfully implemented with proven outcome.

  
 Equal accountability with rest of CVC function in delivering the expected outcome of the programs. 

 

 

 
Required Qualifications: 

 

  
Bachelor's degree in engineering, industrial, manufacturing, or similar project management.

  
 Minimum of 5 years of proven expertise in project management, executing industrial projects.

 

 

 
 Desired Qualifications:

 

  
 Strong hands-on operational experience and understanding of project management principles.

  
 Strong working knowledge of data analysis and performance/operations metrics.

  
 Strong operational project expertise with exposure to direct customer and manufacturing.

  
 Structured problem-solving techniques, and execution for on time delivery.

  
 Ability to assess operational tradeoffs, effectively assess project risk, and optimize execution.

  
 Can communicate (English) your results in a clear and convincing manner.

  
 Proactive, Persistent, and consequent in actions.

  
 Good communication and interpersonal skills, and can collaborate with global team members across cultural boundaries effectively

  
 Able to influence others and lead initiatives.

  
 Manage work with integrity and build and maintain strong working relationships with customers and third parties.

  
 Strive on driving improvement and change, and you enjoy a good laugh with colleagues.

  
 Experience with LEAN tools such as Kaizen, Kanban, and Value stream mapping

  
 Experience with MS Project

  
 Project Management Certificate

  
 Experience with site management in international environments

 

 

 
 Additional Information

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        
 GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

ABOUT SKYSPECS


At SkySpecs, our mission is to simplify renewable asset management so less can do more for the planet. SkySpecs is helping to make this possible by automating the operations and maintenance of wind farms using advanced robotics paired with our custom-built asset performance management software, Horizon.


SkySpecs launched the world's first completely autonomous blade inspection product in 2016 with a custom designed drone system. Since then, SkySpecs has inspected over 95,000 wind turbines in over 27 countries, becoming the world leader in understanding the health of turbine blades. Identifying issues with turbine blades is only the first step. In 2019 SkySpecs launched Horizon to be a platform for SkySpecs to offer a multi-layered solution for customers that includes: data collection, wind turbine blade engineering expertise, and a place for all stakeholders to collaborate to manage and analyze massive amounts of data, spot trends, and create plans for high-cost repair campaigns. In 2021, SkySpecs acquired two companies specializing in wind turbine drivetrain monitoring and financial management, further expanding our asset management portfolio. Ultimately, this will help reduce the cost and risk of operations for the industry


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


SkySpecs is seeking an Associate Product Manager that will gain a deep working understanding of SkySpecs' products and work with various stakeholders throughout the organization to coordinate various product activities. You will be tasked with helping SkySpecs take our autonomous inspection product to the next level to continue double-digit growth. The Associate Product Manager role is a high-visibility role within the organization, and you will have the opportunity to work directly with customers to understand their needs, work with SkySpecs leadership on product strategy, work with Sales and Marketing to build go-to-market materials and to work with the technology teams to develop amazing software.


REQUIREMENTS


Product instincts that focus on the user and drive delivering value to the customer

1+ years in a software product management, business analysis, or product engineering role working on web-based applications

BA/BS in Business, Engineering, or another technical/analytical field

Demonstrated project management skills in development, implementation, or technical analysis projects

Experience developing software requirements and communicating with development teams

Strong written, presentation, and communication skills to both internal and external stakeholders

Interest in Renewable or wind energy asset management

Product design, user interface design, or software development experience

Exposure to Pragmatic Marketing/Gartner marketing methodology experience is ideal

Startup mindset


THE WORK


As a SkySpecs' Associates Product Manager, your role is to build new products and features by combining existing ideas with new ideas from your experience and interactions with customers and prospects. You will need to have a deep technical understanding of the SkySpecs products, as well as a big-picture understanding of the challenges that face our customers and technologies needed to solve those challenges. You will:


Talk to customers as often as possible to better understand what they are doing, working on, and what challenges they have

Define product requirements and work with developers to design and build new features

Assist in QA of the software and documentation writing

Answer customer support questions and work with customers to find resolution on their issues

Work with Marketing to develop sales support materials, demos, and use cases

Work with Sales to develop technical sales materials, inspection analysis materials, and demonstrations

Develop relationships with key customers and broaden adoption of our products within their companies

Work with the Solutions Delivery team to help deliver value to customers and improve internal products

doc_title: Preservation and Completion Manager, Offshore Wind
doc_description:
Job Description Summary
 The Project Preservation & Completion Manager is responsible for all defined Completion list closures, preservation and storage management of turbine components that are delivered from the GE Supply Chain and GE factories.
 
 
 
 You will be responsible for the proper preservation and storage of turbine components that leave the Supply Chain factories, as well as for managing work on completing items that do not conform to contract specification, before the handover to the client. The key objective is to maintain the good condition of the components until their installation and commissioning offshore.
 

 
 Job Description

 
 About us:

 
 GE Renewable Energy is one of the world's leading offshore wind energy companies, with a portfolio of offshore wind turbines ranging from 6 MW to 14 MW that offer increased value to customers with proven performance, reliability, efficiency and availability. We have invested more than $400 million to develop the Haliade-X, an investment that will also drive down offshore wind farms’ levelized cost of energy, helping make offshore wind energy more competitive for our customers. The Haliade-X was the industry’s first 14MW offshore wind turbine to operate, and is the only 12+MW offshore wind turbine platform that has been operating for over two years, specifically at its Rotterdam prototype site.
 
 
Roles and Responsibilities:

 

  
 Responsible for all Completion & Preservation activities related to the construction and commissioning on customer site, from site mobilization, through erection and commissioning work as well as management of activities related to this scope, i.e., Manpower, spares, documentation, and quality

  
 Develops and implements the preservation plan and strategy based on the project with the Preservation and Completions leader

  
 Develops and implements the completion plan and strategy in conjunction with the GSC, Quality dept., Sourcing dept.

  
 Recruit and develop talent as the project dictates.

  
 Management of teams EHS knowledge, awareness, and performance.

  
 Responsible for site training on digitalized completion recording and closure activities.

  
 Manage preservation and completion teams.

  
 Organize and lead weekly coordination meetings for preservation and completion activities

  
 Manage handover of equipment (nacelles, towers, blades) during various project phases 

  
Review and approve supplier invoices

  
 Manage the project preservation budget

  
 Track preservation and completion activities KPIs and report to the client

  
 Share lessons learned for future projects

  
 Progress reporting to the management team, with escalation of potential roadblocks and risks

  
 Developing in-depth knowledge of a technical discipline. Uses prior experience and acquired technical expertise to execute policy/strategy.

  
 In-depth understanding of key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work. In-depth understanding of how work of own team integrates with other teams and contributes to the area.

  
 Uses some level of judgment and has ability to propose different solutions outside of set parameters but with guidance. Uses prior experience and on-the-job training to solve straightforward tasks. Has access to technical skills and analytic thinking required to solve problems. May use multiple internal sources outside of own team to arrive at decisions.

  
 A job at this level is likely to be an individual contributor with proven interpersonal skills or an early people leader who can hire and develop talent. Provides informal guidance to new team members

 

 

 
 Required Qualifications:

 

  
 Bachelor's Degree or Diploma in Electrical/Electronic Engineering or equivalent experience/knowledge

  
 Minimum 3 years of experience in Wind turbine experience and electrical systems 

 

 

 
Desired Characteristics:

 

  
 Strong oral and written communication skills. 

  
Demonstrated ability to analyse and resolve problems.

  
 Ability to document, plan, and execute programs. Established project management skills.

  
 Education and training in electricity or electronics

  
 Experience in offshore wind industry with a focus on power conversion systems.

  
 Ability to work from procedures, as built drawings & System Schematics.

  
 High degree of EHS and quality awareness.

  
 High degree of flexibility, highly motivated with the ability to work under pressure.

  
 Strong interpersonal and leadership skills.

  
 Good knowledge of Microsoft Office package.

  
 Fluent English both spoken and written. 

  
Able to work at height and at sea. 

  
Service and customer oriented. 

  
Efficient, proactive, and reliable.

  
 Able to work within a multicultural/multidisciplinary team.

  
 Organized and transparent. 

  
Available to travel (once/twice per month)

Job Description

About us:

LM Wind Power, a GE Renewable Energy business is a world leading supplier of blades and service to the wind industry. The wind turbine industry is becoming increasingly complex, with radical progress made over the last few decades, providing great opportunities for professional development and a work environment that promotes initiative and creativity. If working in a company which creates state-of-the-art technology and processes attracts you, LM Wind Power has a career for you.

Why we come to work:

At GE Renewable Energy, our service teams keep our world moving. They’re adaptable, determined, and safety-focused, thriving in high-pressure situations. They’re the kind of people who dig deep for answers, work collaboratively with the right teams to drive solutions, and who sit back and smile when they know they have done a great job. As part of this team, you’ll be rewarded with autonomy and trust, a collaborative, supportive team, and the chance to be empowered and successful, every single day

Essential Responsibilities:

Lead cross-functional Project Teams and be fully responsible for project schedule, budget and profitability

Be the single point of contact for the customer on all project matters and represent GE Wind Energy in front of customers (externally) as required on all project related issues and question

Represent the customer to GE Wind (internally) for project specific issues

Ensure safe, compliant and successful execution of all project obligation

Coordinate and perform administrative activities as per relevant PM processes, including developing of project budgets, track site activities, manage component deliveries, indirect purchases, manpower levels, project schedules, Invoicing, bank/payment guarantees, requisitions, documentation requirements etc.

Participate in process & quality improvement and business initiatives and provide feedback on lessons learned to other departments

Assist with project execution input in support of Proposal Development and assist the Proposal Manager to develop executable & competitive proposals

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree

Minimum of 3 years of experience in Project Management, Construction, Manufacturing or other Operations intensive field

Desired Characteristics:

Proven ability to drive projects and initiatives to completion within acceptable time frame.

Ability to lead and succeed in a matrix environment

Ability to communicate effectively across a diverse audience, including senior leaders in the organization and external customers senior representatives

Demonstrable financial acumen and being business savvy

Ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously

Strong oral and written communication skills.

Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems.

Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs.

Established project management skills.

Additional Information

GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

As a federal government contractor, GE may in the future be required to have U.S. employees fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Some GE customers currently have vaccination mandates that may apply to GE employees.

Relocation Assistance Provided: 
No

Responsibilities

  • Provide thoughtful leadership with stakeholders to design and build the future state of the supply chain operating model for the offshore region.
  • Integrate the global and regional supply chain models that are in line with business requirements
  • Implement a Supply Chain Safety culture that embodies the values of Vestas safety culture optimizing the business in the short and long term
  • Work with each functional group within Supply Chain to develop and implement a strategy for building/landing all SC requirements as, but not limited to
    • Warehousing - location, setup, 3PL provider
    • Planning - forecast creation
    • Procurement - vendor identification and setup
    • Logistics - transportation requirements and responsibilities
  • Risk identification and development of customized strategies to address offshore challenges
  • Ability to coordinate RFP process from specification development, quote process, supplier selection, contract development, stakeholder management and business awards.
  • Align with the global and regional supply chain planning and operations teams to ensure solution designed are seamless with business requirements
  • Plan and facilitate the change management process to ensure seamless adoption to the target operating model across the organization
  • Responsible for directing the business priorities to shape, define and implement the procurement strategy for the Offshore Wind project scopes as follows:
  • Indirect subject matter expert in procuring consulting services, fleet, equipment, cranes, blade trucks lifting devices, other equipment, and facilities to support the business
  • Directly supervise new and existing regional supplier relationships and leverage internal stakeholder/category relationships to maximize global supplier partnerships Freely handle strategic purchasing initiatives and develop reporting materials (PowerPoint presentations, business cases, etc.)
  • Build supplier market intelligence and ensure that supply-base data is available to support business decisions
  • Ability to motivate and influence change with our Suppliers to meet Vestas’ business requirements.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or Associates degree in Supply Chain, Operations, Business, Logistics, Project Management, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7+ years of experience in supply chain or operational domain, wind industry preferred
  • 3+ years of project management or related experience
  • Experience in supply chain business transformation within a large organization with a specialization in either demand, project management, offshore logistics or planning
  • High acumen working with business tools (MS Office mandatory), Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. SAP knowledge highly preferred
  • Ability to travel (25%) within North America for extended periods of time as the business needs dictate.
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification preferred
  • Experience building business cases or strategies (for a category, commodity, piece of the supply chain or for a business unit, etc.)

Competencies

  • Ability to demonstrate leadership, stakeholder and change management skills
  • Convey a high degree of supply chain and analytics proficiency
  • Not restricting himself/herself within the Roles & Responsibilities boundaries and willingness to reach out for getting things done. Ability to work on and through ambiguity to provide clarity
  • Working style is well structured, and committed.
  • Ability to communicate complex supply chain information in a simple and transparent manner
  • Function effectively in a time-sensitive situation in environments of rapid change and conflicting demands and is capable of balancing responsibility

We offer an exciting Project Management position with great development opportunities in an inspiring environment at the world's number one wind turbine producer. We value initiative, responsibility, and accuracy. You will become part of an international environment with a commitment to sustainability and safety and you will work among colleagues that take care of each other.

  • Great benefits coverage that includes dental and vision
  • Generous Paid Time Off policies
  • 401(k) plan
  • Tuition assistance
  • Highly developed Training Program
  • Global bonus program
