doc_description:
ABOUT SKYSPECS


At SkySpecs, our mission is to simplify renewable asset management so less can do more for the planet. SkySpecs is helping to make this possible by automating the operations and maintenance of wind farms using advanced robotics paired with our custom-built asset performance management software, Horizon.


SkySpecs launched the world's first completely autonomous blade inspection product in 2016 with a custom designed drone system. Since then, SkySpecs has inspected over 95,000 wind turbines in over 27 countries, becoming the world leader in understanding the health of turbine blades. Identifying issues with turbine blades is only the first step. In 2019 SkySpecs launched Horizon to be a platform for SkySpecs to offer a multi-layered solution for customers that includes: data collection, wind turbine blade engineering expertise, and a place for all stakeholders to collaborate to manage and analyze massive amounts of data, spot trends, and create plans for high-cost repair campaigns. In 2021, SkySpecs acquired two companies specializing in wind turbine drivetrain monitoring and financial management, further expanding our asset management portfolio. Ultimately, this will help reduce the cost and risk of operations for the industry.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

SkySpecs is seeking a Product Manager that will gain a deep working understanding of the SkySpecs' products and work with various stakeholders throughout the organization to coordinate various product activities. You will be tasked with helping SkySpecs take our autonomous inspection product to the next level to continue double-digit growth. The Product Manager role is a high-visibility role within the organization, and you will have the opportunity to work directly with customers to understand their needs, work with SkySpecs leadership on product strategy, work with Sales and Marketing to build go-to-market materials and to work with the technology teams to develop amazing software.

REQUIREMENTS

Product instincts that focus on the user and drive delivering value to the customer

3+ years in a software product management or product engineering role working on web-based applications

BA/BS in Business, Engineering, or another technical/analytical field

Expertise using business intelligence tools such as Tableau or Sisense to perform analysis on large datasets to drive business value

Demonstrated project management skills in development, implementation or technical analysis projects

Experience developing software requirements and communicating with development teams

Strong written, presentation, and communication skills to both internal and external stakeholders

Comfortable using SQL database tools to manage large datasets and manipulate data

Willingness to travel up to 25%

Based in the SkySpecs' Ann Arbor office

Renewable or wind energy asset management experience

Product design, user interface design, or software development experience

Pragmatic Marketing/Gartner marketing methodology experience

Startup experience

THE WORK

As a SkySpecs' Product Manager, your role is to build new products and features by combining existing ideas with new ideas from your experience and interactions with customers and prospects. You will need to have a deep technical understanding of the SkySpecs products, as well as a big-picture understanding of the challenges that face our customers and technologies needed to solve those challenges. You will:

Talk to customers as often as possible to better understand what they are doing, working on, and what challenges they have

Define product requirements and work with developers to design and build new features

Assist in QA of the software and documentation writing

Answer customer support questions and work with customers to find resolution on their issues

Work with Marketing to develop sales support materials, demos and use cases

Work with Sales to develop technical sales materials, inspection analysis materials, and demonstrations

Develop relationships with key customers and broaden adoption of our products within their companies

Work with the Solutions Delivery team to help deliver value to customers and improve internal products

PERKS YOU'LL RECEIVE

A great downtown Ann Arbor office with access to coffee, shopping, bars, restaurants, etc.

A fun, energetic, often zany workplace that is open and accepting of all interests

An open vacation policy (our policy is: Get your work done; be reliable; go above and beyond because you want to, and take rest and relaxation when you need it!).

A flexible work schedule and work environment

Health benefits

ABOUT THE NORDEX GROUP


The manufacture of wind energy plants in the on-shore segment has been our core competence and passion for around 35 years. With more than 37 GW installed capacity worldwide, our turbines supply sustainable energy to more than 80% of the global energy market and we are one of the largest companies in the wind industry. National subsidiaries in more than 30 markets and production facilities in Germany, Spain, Brazil, the USA, Mexico and India offer our more than 8,500 employees the opportunity for international and intercultural cooperation.



We are growing and together driving forward the expansion of alternative energies worldwide - if you wish, from now on with you. Join the #TeamNordex


Project Manager, Blades

REQUISITION ID: 2757

LOCATION:
West Branch, IA, US Chicago, IL, US

DEPARTMENT: Service

Do you want to be part of an agile team where colleagueship truly matters?

As a global company, we interact with a variety of people and cultures. Integrity, Respect, Colleagueship and Ownership are the unifying force for all departments and regions around the world. It’s the individual that defines the team. And it’s the team that makes the difference. Join the #TEAMNORDEX and shape the future of energy with us.


As Services Project Manager, you will be responsible for managing any Special Project designated within the Services Department.


Special Projects are considered, Retrofits Campaigns, Site Support, and Major Corrective campaigns.


This position includes Cost Forecast and Control, Resources management, Materials Coordination, Scheduling, and Monitoring of any activity related to the Project.




Location

Nordex USA, Inc. is located in Chicago, Illinois, or West Branch, Iowa


Regular traveling throughout the United States.




Responsibilities:


Project planning, estimating, and executing individual US projects.

Budget Forecast and Cost Control. Profit and loss responsibility.

Prepares budget, cost allocation, and control of special projects; maintenances, inspections, retrofits, large component exchanges, and repairs


Prepares plans and schedule resources for Technical management projects as well as large component exchanges and repairs.

Negotiates cost of equipment, tooling, and subcontractor agreements.

Coordinates logistics/mobilization of necessary specialized tooling and equipment for maintenance and repair activities at the site.

Cost and budget compliance with the individual project reporting and claim management.


Subcontractors quotes Request / Negotiation.


Coordination and implementation of technical solutions in cooperation with the Engineering and Supply Management department.

Perform pertinent operational and departmental tasks as required.


Perform other related duties as required or assigned.

Follow standard Nordex Project Management processes


Visit project sites, suppliers, and international support groups to facilitate successful completion of job duties; TRAVEL Requirements about 25%.




Specific Responsibilities:


Coordination and implementation of technical solutions (retrofits).


Manage costs, monitor and validate contractor invoices.


Coordination and execution of all major correctives within the Services Department


Supervise and coordinate resources on-site during a project.


Communicate project status to Site Managers to facilitate customer communications.




Requirements:


Degree in technical or engineering field, or 5+ years of equivalent experience.


Experience in the Wind Turbines Blade field, structural repairs of 3+ years.


Must demonstrate understanding of international and domestic supplier relations Strong interpersonal, organizational, and intercultural skills.


Basic knowledge and appreciation for the technical, commercial, and political aspects driving the wind industry.

Computer skills to include MS Office.


Must possess a thorough knowledge of service processes (Operations, Maintenance, Customer Responsiveness, and Engineering) and quality assurance principles.


Highly motivated and business orientated.


Capable of working independently.

Demonstrated ability to organize/prioritize work, meet deadlines, and prepare plans and reports.


Demonstrated ability to manage several activities/projects at once, organize/prioritize work, meet deadlines, and prepare plans and reports


Proficiency in Spanish is preferred


Travel to project sites required (25% travel).




We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We will consider applicants for this position without regard to any category protected by applicable federal, state or local law, including but not limited to: race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status or uniformed service member status.






Nearest Major Market: 
Cedar Rapids



Nearest Secondary Market: 
Iowa City

UNMANNED AUTONOMOUS VEHICLE (UAV) OPERATOR 

  
Intertek’s Asset Integrity Management is planning to add an 
Unmanned Autonomous Vehicle (UAV) Operator 
in 
Houston, Texas 
at our 
Space Centre Blvd 
office. The ISS UAV Operator possesses extensive experience with robotics and is responsible for setting up and operating various drone devices including Falcon 8+, Elios2, DJI M Series, Autel, DJI Mavic, etc. with different inspection payloads, performing different levels of data acquisition, and processing and reporting collected data. 

  
How you’ll make an impact at Intertek: 

  

   
Utilizes expert knowledge to define plans, organize, and execute complex flight programs in all industries, including O&G offshore, wind power, petrochemical, construction, etc. 

   
Ensures successful project execution and client deliverables. 

   
Evaluates the requested scope of work and through direct liaison with Clients, prepares appropriate Execution/Safety Plans (with support) and flight path plans. 

   
Monitors and documents UAV Projects, and the ability to communicate detailed feedback. 

   
Maintains UAVs in optimal condition. 

   
Performs flights while utilizing UAV designed functions for R&D. 

   
Properly interprets regulations, codes, and industry standards. 

   
Processes Photogrammetry, LIDAR or other types of point cloud data in various software programs depending on client deliverables. 

   
Compiles and submits daily reports, inspection reports, and inter-office communications including completed performance/inspection reports in a timely manner. 

   
Maintains a positive relationship between client, facility, and customer; and promotes a positive attitude towards coworkers. 

   
Ensures that all Intertek and site safety policies and procedures are being followed. 

  

  
What it takes to be successful in this role: 

  

   
Technical or Associate's Degree in Engineering Technology / CAD Drafting & Design Technology (or related field) or equivalent technical / job experience is required 

   
4 CFR Part 107 Remote Pilot Certificate is required 

   
Experience with FAA Rules and Regulations 

   
Elios2 and/or DJI M300 and point cloud dataset processing experience is required 

   
Knowledge using Flyability Inspector Software package 

   
Knowledge using Pix4D Software 

   
Ability to work on offshore facilities such as drill ships, FPSOs, semi-submersibles, production platforms, etc. 

   
Effective communication skills (written, verbal and listening) and solid interpersonal skills are required 

   
Operate a vehicle safely in oil and gas facilities and field sites. 

   
Must be detailed-oriented and able to effectively prioritize and organize workload, with efficient time management 

   
Ability to communicate and interact effectively in verbal written and presentation formats 

   
Must possess the fundamental technical and administrative skills required to perform the job duties 

   
Travel domestic and international (up to 50%) passport required 

  

  
PREFERRED ADDITONAL SKILLS 

  

   
Experience in operating Remote Operated Vehicles (ROVs) – Both land and water. 

   
Industry recognized Certifications and/or training would be highly regarded. 

   
Non-destructive testing (API Certification) 

   
Offshore Survival Certification (e.g. BOSIET, HUET, FOET) 

   
Military background 

  

  
Physical Requirements 

  

   
Ability to lift, move, push and pull 30 to 50 pounds frequently; Occasionally, over 50 pounds with assistance 

   
Ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, (hearing) and to make the discriminations in sound 

   
Ability to kneel and squat occasionally 

   
Ability to walk and stand for long periods of time 

   
Ability to work outdoors in adverse weather conditions, including hot and cold temperatures 

  

  
Why work at Intertek? 

  
Intertek is a world leader in the $250 billion Quality Assurance market, with a proven, high-quality business model and a global network of customer-focused operations and highly engaged subject matter experts. At Intertek, we exercise our spirit of innovation, the passion of our people and our unmatched customer commitment to realize our purpose of making the world an ever better, safer, and more sustainable place for all. Learn more about Our History and What We Do . 

  
Intertek is committed to a safe work environment for our employees and clients. Learn more about our COVID-19 Policy . 

  
What we have to offer: 
 When Working with Intertek , you can expect salary and benefit package competitively placed within the local market, including medical, dental, vision, life, disability, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement and more. 

  
Intertek is a drug-free workplace. As a condition of employment, all hires are required to pass a pre-employment drug test. 
 Intertek believes that Our People are our strongest tool for success. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status or on the basis of disability. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, or gender identity. 

  
For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, or who need assistance applying, please email hr.eeoc.data@intertek.com or call 
1-877-694-8543
 (option #5) to speak with a member of the HR Department.

Description: 2959

Length of Assignment: 1 year term to start – will be extended based on performance/project need

Length of Project: 3Q 2023 – 1Q 2027

What is the preferred candidate location (local, non-local, remote?) and is there flexibility? No preference, however as the we move into actual construction 1Q 2024 candidate will need to be located in VA.

If you are open to looking at non-local candidates will per diem be offered?Yes - CONUS

Will travel be required for this position? Yes (domestic and internationally) as required

Are any certification required:

This position is for a Commissioning Manager to represent client for the Coastal VA Offshore Wind project. The CVOW project entails the construction and installation of 176 wind turbine generators (WTG) and 3 offshore sub stations (OSS); as well as, associated cables and equipment.
The Commissioning Manager will report to the Director Construction Projects – Offshore Wind. The Commissioning Manager is responsible for organization, planning, and implementation of the Offshore Sub Station commissioning plan, and Wind Turbine Generator commissioning plan as required by the OEM, installation or fabrication contractor, and interconnect agreement. Close day to day interaction with the site construction team and the Construction Manager will be required to ensure all equipment is commissioned and delivered as required in a timely manner. The candidate will be required to work with the commissioning managers and teams of various prime Contractors to aid in the development of a commissioning strategy that will meet the Owner’s requirements. This person will use the contracted scope and technical specifications to ensure that the OSS and WTG’s are constructed, tested, and delivered with all required documents and certificates needed for service.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Review, comment, and assist in the development of commissioning plan/specifications for Offshore Sub Station and Wind Turbine Generator installation (including foundation and transition pieces).
  • Monitor and report of status of commissioning activities.
  • Confirm mechanical and electrical as built documentation is current and in compliance.
  • Liaise with Operations and Marine Coordinators regarding work plans and requirements of main component and installation contractors.
  • Provide advice and recommendations to ensure the continuing development of construction, commissioning and operations philosophies, strategies, and procedures.
  • Verify that all turnover documentation for testing, commissioning, and maintenance are provided per the Contract.
  • Liaise with BSEE (Bureau of Safety & Environmental Enforcement) in meeting requirements for Commissioning oversight.
  • Ensure that tests are carried out and commissioning work documented according to rules, procedures, and templates.
  • Review and monitor progress of commissioning. Provide accurate reporting in daily progress reports.
  • Act as the technical consultant for queries related to commissioning of all systems and equipment of the Offshore Wind project.
  • Provide support to the project team and assist in resolving technical, commissioning and warranty issues.
  • Attend FAT’s as required (may involve international or domestic travel); Including but not limited to components and equipment for the OSS, Foundations, Transition Pieces, Wind Turbine Generators
  • Ensure that all commissioning activities are fully documented, and that this documentation is properly controlled and made available to the Operations Group.
  • Manage closeout of any punch list items that arise during commissioning
  • Manage warranty issues, in conjunction with Operations Manager.
  • Conduct critical reviews and/or assessments of construction and commissioning systems and processes.
  • Prepare weekly and/or daily commissioning status reports.
  • Coordinate commissioning walk-downs together with the supplier.
  • Report in NCs, follow up on closure of relevant quality issues.
  • Participate in review, preparation, and coordination of detailed commissioning schedules.
  • Verify that tests are carried out and documented.
  • Review of tests to ensure compliance with commissioning manual / Contract.
  • Ensure readiness of take-over documentation and quality status for Operations team.
  • Participate in verifying that HSE procedures are implemented.
  • Co-ordinate handover from manufacturing and to installation.

What soft skill requirements do you have (team fit and personality requirements)?

  • Strong communication skills both verbal and written
  • Ability to lead, collaborate, or work effectively in a variety of teams, including multi-disciplinary teams

Nice to Have Skills:

  • GWO training
  • Offshore / Maritime experience

High Level Project Overview:

  • Coastal VA Offshore Wind (CVOW) is Engineering/Procuring/Constructing/Installing 176 Siemens Gamesa offshore wind turbines off the coast of VA, including offshore sub stations, cables, foundations and transition pieces. The project will create a nominal 2.6 GW of wind power. Each turbine is capable a producing 14MW.

Main Contractors
Group are responsible for transport and installation of Foundations, Transition Pieces, OSS, cable. Prysmian is manufacturing and installing cable (Offshore Export and Inter-array).
Siemens Gamesa with provide and install the WTG (Wind Turbine Generators) including Tower, Nacelle, Blades.
Bladt w/ Semco is designing and fabricating the Offshore Substations
Bladt is fabricating the Transition Pieces
EEW is fabricating the Monopile foundations

Required Years of Experience:

  • 10 plus years’ experience in design/construction/commissioning.
  • Experience in offshore wind construction or industrial environment
  • Good knowledge of marine, mechanical, electrical, and controls system. Familiar with marine safety systems.

•

Education:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in marine engineering or other engineering discipline. Will also consider equivalent work experience.

Are there any specific companies/industries you’d like to see in the candidate’s experience?

  • Offshore
  • Wind Energy

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $80.00 - $92.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Richmond, VA 23219: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

  • wind turbines: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

We are a global supplier of CNC type systems and leader in our industry. We are an established EOE company with over 30 years in the field. We started working with Formula 1 teams in the late 70’s and 80’s and now manufacture high-end CNC deburring machines. These machines are multi-axis coordinated motion machines that help produce commercial aircraft, military aircraft and vehicles, wind energy systems, agricultural equipment, commercial automotive, OHV, etc. Our equipment touches virtually every aspect of the modern world. In fact, our machinery has touched every plane in the sky!

 
We currently have an opening for a CNC Machinist. You will be responsible for all aspects of running a CNC lathe or mill from running an parts order to completion.

 
Our equipment includes: 

 

  
3-Axis Mill

  
Live-Tool Lathe

  
Manual 17" lathe

  
Manual 8" lathe

  
Two Bridgeports

  
Two Sunnen Hones

  
Two drill presses

  
Two 11-Axis deburring machines

  
One 5-Axis deburring machine

  
Full fab shop and much more

 

 
You will also: 

 

  
Run the jobs

  
Document your process

  
QC your own parts

  
Be required to work flexible hours

 

 
Qualifications/Requirements: 

 

  
Minimum of 1 years of experience as a CNC Machinist and not accident prone

  
Able to read blueprints including GD&T

  
Able to use standard measuring equipment to measure dimensions and tolerance

  
Work with team to discuss and implement quality improvements, process improvements, work-holding solutions, and cycle time improvements

 

 
We require these qualities in all of our team members: 

 

  
Flexible

  
Reliable

  
Team Player

  
Good Attitude

  
Follow Instructions

  
Perform Work On Time

  
Continuously Improve

Pay: $35,360.00 - $72,800.00 per year

Health insurance

  
Paid time off

Monday to Friday

  
Weekend availability

Unit Drop Forge Co., Inc. 
is a privately-held heavy manufacturing company. On one hand, it's the kind of gritty, old-school heavy metal manufacturing plant that's pretty rare these days. But on the other hand, it's a high-tech, leading-edge manufacturer with sophisticated engineering and CNC machining capabilities.

Located in West Allis, Wisconsin, Unit Drop Forge is a world class manufacturer of custom designed closed-die forged steel components. We have been producing exceptional quality parts for a wide variety of markets such as: Construction, Off-Highway, Mining, Railroad, Wind Energy, Oil Field, Compressors, Forestry and Defense.




We can't offer a sign-on bonus, but what the UDF Team does offer is
 a culture of mutual trust, respect, and accountability. Called a great place to work for generations, many employees have spent their entire careers with us.




Job Summary:

Proficient in operation of manual milling, drilling, and grinding machines. Blueprint interpretation, fork lift operation. Perform inspection operations per specifications. Capable of operating power manual equipment.




Qualifications:


Basic manual machine operations with mechanical aptitude


High School graduate or equivalent education


Blueprint reading ability


Ability to stand, bend, climb, and lift 50 lbs.


Ability to drive forklift truck


Ability to read and write English


Good verbal and written communication


Successful candidate must pass a hair drug screen, physical, and back ground check.



Unit Drop Forge Co., Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

XJ6

Graco manufactures and markets premium equipment to move, measure, control, dispense and spray a wide variety of fluid and powder materials. What does that mean? Well, we pump peanut butter into your jar, and the oil in your car. We glue the soles of your shoes, the glass in your windows and the screen on your phone. We spray the finish on your vehicle, coatings on your pills, the paint on your house and texture on your walls. Graco is part of your daily life.

Graco has excellent opportunities available to individuals who want to be part of fast-moving, growing company – especially candidates committed to quality, innovation and solving customer problems. Graco was proud to be named a Best Place to Work in Manufacturing and Production by Fortune Magazine in 2016, 2018, 2019 and 2021.

Job Purpose:

To support the Strategic Business Unit and the Manufacturing Cell and apply coursework to real-world applications as a Manufacturing Engineer Intern. Position involves providing ideas, inputs and analysis as a project team member.

Graco is a global leader in the design, development and manufacture of highly-engineered systems for numerous industrial and commercial applications. This position supports our Lubrication Equipment Division (LED) in Anoka, MN. At LED, Industrial Lubrication products are used in wind energy, general manufacturing and steel and mining industries ( http://bit.ly/1jTCVMI ). Petroleum Management products control fluids traditionally used for servicing vehicles, including pumps, tanks, hose reels, and meters ( http:// bit.ly/ 1krX8Tf ).

The Graco Co-Op Program is designed for students who seek a culture of innovation, quality, and A+ customer service. At Graco, you will have the opportunity to grow knowledge of the industry, develop solutions to real business challenges, and make important connections for the future. During the Co-Op, you will work on projects that align with the needs of the business that allow you to have a hand in key company initiatives. Throughout your time with us, you will be invited to attend educational and social events and will complete a final presentation on your internship experience.

Essential Duties:

Planning, executing and reporting of priorities including man-hour estimates, reacting to changing priorities, and record-keeping and reporting.

Providing general production support for machining and/or assembly area as needed:

Participate in the evaluation of upgrades for machining or assembly.

Troubleshoot issues (quality, efficiency, etc.) on assembly line or machine.

Weigh in on situations that need technical assistance.

Participate in hands-on problem solving and resolution.

Report and facilitate correction of out-of-specification conditions.

Determining the proper processes:

Review, analyzing standards and operation layouts and make suggestions for change.

Assist in the selection of and implementation of tooling and fixtures for machining and/or assembly job.

Participate in capital equipment justification as needed.

Participate in the planning and implementation of preventive and corrective actions for reducing scrap, rework and down time.

Research and suggest ideas for new technology.

Essential Qualifications:

Currently enrolled and pursuing a Mechanical or Manufacturing Engineer degree from an accredited university

Someone entering junior or senior year preferred

Good written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills are necessary in order to act as a liaison between engineering, production, marketing, purchasing, and members of the manufacturing team.

Work as a team player

Good mechanical aptitude

Proven Quality. Leading Technology. Launch your career with Graco!

Graco offers attractive compensation, benefits and career development opportunities. Graco’s comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, stock purchase plan, 401(k), tuition reimbursement and more.

Our expectations are high. That's why we are always looking to hire the brightest and the best!

Plan and direct shipping/warehouse activities implementing best practices with regards to stock levels, WIP, inventory days and inventory levels
 
  
Responsible for issues regarding quality, safety, health and environment for Logistics employees. Ensures that all safety and security procedures are followed. Supports the factory goals and continuously improves the QSE efforts.
 
  
Directly supervises employees in the Shipping/Warehouse department. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws.
 
  
Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
 
  
Responsible for budget for own department; works within approved budget and develops and implements cost saving measures.
 
  
Ability to create 3 - 5 year strategies that define growth, effectiveness and capability improvement
 
  
Create tasks and coordinate projects to support the strategic targets of the factory
 
  
Oversee work procedures and work schedules, and expedite workflow; ensure all employees are complying with established policies and procedures
 
  
Review material delivery to production based on production plan
 
  
Review shipments of blades based on shipping plan. adjust shipping priorities, work assignments, and shipping methods required to meet shipping and receiving schedules.
 
  
Assure shipping/warehouse is adhering to Safety and Quality standards
 
  
Ensure proper training for employees on care and preservation of items received, stored, and shipped; methods and use of equipment in handling, storing, maintaining, and shipping stock; and related problems
 
  
Communicate and ensure all shipping teams safely expedite the transport of hazardous materials and waste, from accumulation sites, to 90 day storage, within strict regulation requirements.
 
  
Ensure that all shipping teams inspect, weigh, load, document, transport of hazardous materials and waste through shipping and receiving documents, bill of lading, and manifests.
 
  
Comply with state and federal regulations for handling, storage, disposal, transport etc. of hazardous materials and waste.
 
  
And all other responsibilities as assigned.
 
 
 
 
Competencies:
 
 

  
Bachelors' degree (Business, Engineering or related field) preferred or 4 - 6 years related experience in Warehouse, Shipping/Transportation; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
 
  
Minimum 6 years progressive leadership experience
 
  
Associates Degree, Bachelor's Degree, or two - five years related experience in Warehouse, Shipping/Transportation; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
 
  
Good knowledge of safe operations with loading and operating heavy equipment.
 
  
Background in transportation 

  
Computer Skills:
 
  
General Microsoft skills in Excel, Word, Outlook, etc.
 
  
Knowledge of MRP, Time systems, Supply Chain Systems
 
  
Qualified Natural Ability to lead/ coach the team
 
  
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
 
  
Skilled Natural Ability to Work in Teams
 
  
Ability to create and maintain a safe work area

 

 
 
 
 

 
Qualifications:
 
 

  
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite computer skills (Windows, Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, and additional software programs)
 
  
Ability to supervise a team
 
  
Will be required to see and hear alarms, timers and follow verbal instructions
 
  
Will be required to wear the required Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) for the duration of the task
 
  
Ability to create and maintain a safe work area
 
  
Ability to interact frequently with others in a professional, courteous manner
 
  
Effective written and oral communication skills; able to express oneself clearly and in technical and non-technical terms

 

 
 
 
 

 
Annual Salary: $100,000-$120,000

About Vestas
 Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We specialize in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.
 Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than our competitors in the renewable energy arena. We consider ourselves forerunners within the industry, as Vestas continuously aims to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 145 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, Vestas has an unmatched history demonstrating our expertise within the field.
 With 29,000 employees globally, Vestas is a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.
 Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives, and gives everyone equal access to opportunity.
 To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

About us Johns Manville is a small business in Fernley, NV. We are professional, innovative, collaborative and our goal is to Who We Are Johns Manville is a leading manufacturer and marketer of premium-quality insulation and commercial roofing, along with glass fibers and nonwovens for commercial, industrial and residential applications. Our products are used in a wide variety of industries including building products, aerospace, automotive and transportation, filtration, commercial interiors, waterproofing and wind energy. A proud member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies, we serve customers in more than 80 countries around the globe. We are committed to delivering positive and powerful experiences, because we are successful only when our employees and customers thrive. We are passionate, we care about people, we perform at a superior level, and we protect others and our environments.. Our work environment includes: Growth opportunities On-the-job training Safe work environment Who We Are Johns Manville is a leading manufacturer and marketer of premium-quality insulation and commercial roofing, along with glass fibers and nonwovens for commercial, industrial and residential applications. Our products are used in a wide variety of industries including building products, aerospace, automotive and transportation, filtration, commercial interiors, waterproofing and wind energy. A proud member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies, we serve customers in more than 80 countries around the globe. We are committed to delivering positive and powerful experiences, because we are successful only when our employees and customers thrive. We are passionate, we care about people, we perform at a superior level, and we protect others and our environments. The base hourly rate for this position is $36.43 The purpose of the Maintenance Technician’s role is to perform routine and non-routine maintenance on production and facility equipment to support production of roofing materials while meeting facility targets for safety, productivity, and machine uptime. This role will conduct effective problem solving and troubleshooting processes to develop corrective actions to repair and maintain all electrical, mechanical, and facility related functions, equipment, systems, buildings and/or physical structures in a manner that allows the plant to operate effectively and efficiently, working from general instructions from the plant management team, and all levels within the organization in support of the four Johns Manville core values: People, Passion, Performance, and Protection. This position will report directly to the Maintenance Supervisor under supervision of the Plant Engineer. Shift will be Tuesday – Friday from 5:00pm - 3:00am (subject to change based on production demand). With two weeks of training on day shift (7am – 3:30pm) at job start. Your Day to Day: Follow all Johns Manville safety and environmental procedures and policies. Attend plant safety and training meetings as scheduled. Follow Job Safety Analysis (JSA's), use safe work practices, and report hazardous conditions at all times. Wear protective clothing & equipment as required. Develop JSA’s for new tasks and review JSA’s annually. Demonstrate ability to train coworkers about various systems in the plant. Perform routine and non-routine maintenance activities of mechanical and electrical systems. Develop and modify preventive maintenance plans for new and modified equipment. Display advanced working knowledge of electrical troubleshooting (single phase and 3 phase), control systems, of plant power distribution systems, mechanical, hydraulics, and pneumatics systems. Install and repair electrical conduit and cable, including connections, controls, grounding, etc. Work from electrical and mechanical schematics to troubleshoot or install new or modify existing equipment. Perform voltmeter, ammeter, wattmeter, and other electrical measurements. Inspect equipment and reports on defective part and unsatisfactory conditions to further preventative maintenance program. Provide solutions to improve the efficiency of the equipment. Maintain, adjust, service and lubricate equipment keeping it in good operating conditions with respect to proper aligning, functioning and lubrication of parts. Participate in continuous improvement and Root Cause Corrective Action (RCCA) teams. Assist co-workers as directed. Perform and complete other work as assigned by supervisor. Provides feedback and solutions to leadership on critical equipment issues pertaining to safety or operational capabilities Display flexible outlook toward change management, working on cross-functional teams, training for the use of new tools and methodologies, and willingness and ability to obtain operating knowledge of all production equipment. Participate in daily housekeeping efforts. Ensure job site is consistently clean after every job and clean maintenance shop after every shift. What You Bring to the Team: High school diploma or equivalent 3 - 5+ years of industrial maintenance experience 2-year technical degree approved by manager or equivalent (preferred) Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot and handle multiple priorities and projects Ability to disassemble, diagnose, repair, and perform preventative repair measures on mechanical equipment including, but not limited to: pumps, gearboxes, reducers, couplings, seals, rotating elements, blowers, fans, hydraulic units, valves, chillers, and compressors Demonstrate advanced Mechanical aptitude, including pipe fitting, fabricating (preferred) Advanced knowledge of use of hand tools and power tools Advanced knowledge of shop machinery, including hydraulic press, mill & drill press, lathe, and saw(s) (band & Chop) Advanced knowledge of building lighting systems Advanced knowledge of AC/heating systems Advanced knowledge of building fire alarm systems Advanced knowledge of Lock, Tag, Clear, and Try program (Lockout/Tagout) Advanced knowledge of PLC troubleshooting Advanced knowledge of VFD troubleshooting Display advanced understanding of 480V system to include arc-flash training and safe working practices per NFPA 70E Ability to provide troubleshooting and diagnosis on process heating and cooling equipment Ability to consistently make appropriate decisions while being flexible with regard to work assignments and priorities. Strong commitment to safety Ability to work well with others Strong problem-solving capabilities Excellent interpersonal and communications skills Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment Advanced computer skills Local travel for training purposes Physical Requirements: The physical requirements of this position are: (these requirements are typical for most of our manufacturing roles) The ability to stand for extended periods The ability to manually lift, push or pull at least 50 pounds safely and with proper body mechanics, sometimes while in awkward positions. Use of hands (repetitive motion, grabbing, feeling, sensing, pulling) The ability to work safely in a fast-paced, sometimes stressful work environment The ability to safely and effectively work in an often-dusty work environment that experiences a broad range of temperatures (very hot to very cold). The ability to withstand the rigors of working a 12(or 8)-hour rotating shift schedule. The ability to bend, stoop or kneel repetitively. The ability to reach or work above the shoulder The ability to operate light-heavy industrial equipment (forklift, JLG, scissor lift) Please Keep in Mind If you do not meet 100% of these requirements, we at JM still want to hear from you. So, if you are interested in the role, we encourage you to apply so we can learn how your skills and talents can contribute to our team. Benefits Johns Manville (JM) offers a wide range of benefits to employees. Some are subsidized by the company and others are fully employee-paid. Health benefits include a choice of comprehensive medical plans, a dental plan, vision plan, wellness program and critical illness insurance. JM sponsors a 401(k) plan which includes a sizeable company match. JM offers paid vacation and also provides paid sick and parental leave for eligible employees. Additionally, Johns Manville provides basic life Insurance, short-term and long-term disability coverage, an employee assistance program, and business travel accident coverage. Supplemental life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment insurance are available as well. The company also offers a variety of tax saving accounts; health spending account, traditional flexible spending account, and a dependent care spending account. JM also offers a tuition reimbursement program for undergraduate and certain graduate programs. Diversity & Inclusion Johns Manville believes diversity and inclusion in our workplace is critical for the long-term success of our company. We are committed to retaining, developing and attracting a diverse workforce that fosters an inclusive work environment in which all employees are treated with dignity and respect. This is the right thing to do for our employees, our company and our communities. Our D&I council is composed of employees from locations across North American & Europe who meet regularly and work to promote and foster an environment of inclusion. Born from our D&I council is our network of employee resource groups (ERGs) that are focused on supporting diverse communities in the workplace. Review more about our diversity & inclusion initiatives on JM’s Career page. Incumbent must be physically able to perform essential job functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $36.43 per hour Expected hours: 40 per week Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Employee discount Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Relocation assistance Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance Experience level: 3 years Schedule: 10 hour shift 4x10 Monday to Friday Night shift Work setting: In-person Ability to Relocate: Fernley, NV 89408: Relocate before starting work (Required) Work Location: In person

doc_description:
About TPI
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI Transportation also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.
TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.
About the Role
The Program Manager is responsible for all aspects of assigned automotive prototype, development, and production programs coordinating with business development, engineering, finance, quality, supply chain and operations teams. The work is complex, difficult in character, and requires independent problem solving with general direction and guidance from corporate and business unit strategy. Superior leadership and communication abilities are required to manage multiple programs simultaneously. Work requires program leadership responsibility for critical programs based on strategic importance.
To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee multiple programs and project teams using excellent time management and interpersonal skills.
If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Responsible for overall program timing and delivery – technical, quality, and cost/budget.

 
Provides expert tactical leadership in coordinating, facilitating, motivating, and directing efforts of cross-functional program teams including individuals from Engineering, Business Development, Product Development, Quality, Supply Chain, and Manufacturing.

 
Ensures efficient use of team and resources within budget.

 
Gains support for and develops program objectives and deliverables. Ensures full team participation and that all groups involved understand all the demands for the successful launch of a program. Objectives include timing, engineering support, cost, quality, and delivery. Ensures customer and Company requirements are met.

 
Ensures that the profitability of the program is maximized throughout the program launch.

 
Leads the communication of all issues and responsibilities both within the Company and to the customer and ensures that technical and tactical objectives are clearly documented and cascaded to each functional area.

 
Works with internal and external resources to maintain strong customer relationships with dedication to customer program schedules.

 
Demonstrates expertise, in all customer systems as required, to support programs in launch. Ensures countermeasures are initiated to correct unfavorable variances by communicating alternative measures to the customer, which may be used to solve engineering problems. Ensures the success of the future production of the programs in the launch phase.

 
Documents and monitors program objectives per PMP by mean of open issue lists, milestone reviews, and launch (manufacturing) readiness reviews. Demonstrates expertise in all systems required for launching programs.

 
Participates in continuous improvement efforts of PDP/PMP processes to support product launches.

 
Performs other duties as necessary for completion of projects and achievement of goals.




Who we’re looking for: 



 
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Business Administration or equivalent with a minimum of five years’ experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience in the automotive industry is preferred.

 
Leadership abilities in managing multiple programs to meet goals (quality, cost and delivery of programs) from concept through launch in coordination with internal and external contacts.

 
Organizational, project management, and leadership skills to prioritize, coordinate projects, manage conflicting needs based on strategic importance, and deal with many issues at one time.

 
Ability to work on long-term assignments, broad in nature, using a high level of originality and ingenuity. Must be self-motivated and able to develop long-term technical strategies/plans to meet future business needs and growth opportunities.

 
Financial skills to prepare budgets, develop and understand financial aspects of program deliverables.

 
Ability to lead and motivate others through support, training, etc. towards organizational goals.

 
Ability to thoroughly research, recommend, and oversee implementation of new products, materials, processes, etc. and present information to support product launches.

 
Ability and willingness to travel domestically up to 30%.




Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island. Relocation benefits to the greater Providence RI are available.


Location: 373 Market Street, Warren, RI 02885


Job Type: Full-time

At Composites One our culture is founded on a clear set of Core Values that has at its core Respect, Teamwork, and Communication. Our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as one Team, respect each other in our daily interactions, and communicate effectively while doing the one thing that is critical to our success – taking care of our customers. Are you ready for a rewarding career? We are searching for a Warehouse Manager to join our Operations Team! Now is the time to move forward and make an impact! As a Warehouse Manager you will be responsible for the overall activity of the warehouse, including safety/risk management, Quality, RCCA, receiving, transportation (private fleet and 3rd party carriers), warehousing and equipment/building maintenance/repair operations, all in accordance with established Company and regulatory policies and procedures. In this role you will manage the process and performance involved in daily activities of the warehouse to achieve established operating income and ROA goals. How will you impact our organization as a Warehouse Manager on a daily basis? Develop and establish necessary staffing systems, processes and procedures to ensure consistent, accurate and timely customer order fulfillment. Investigate and establish root cause of shipping and receiving errors and implement corrective action plans. Build and maintain supplier partnerships; Works with suppliers to assure items are delivered to time and quality specifications. Work in conjunction with the regional Buyers and Supply Chain Managers to coordinate product movement, warehouse space requirements and stock rotation. Assist in developing plans for selling aged inventory in partnership with Sales team and regional Buyers. Monitor and approve all freight transactions, including review of freight adders on a semi-annual basis. Oversee the annual physical inventory process and regularly scheduled cycle counts. Develop systems, processes and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources, including effective material movement and logistics, while delivering value to our customers. Utilize third party rating tools, routing techniques and mapping tools that assist in making quality decision that minimize freight costs. Monitor the receipt, coordination and safety of goods coming through the warehouse using the Warehouse Management System. Ensure orders arrive and are dispatched on time to appropriate destinations and in expected quantities. Trace history of items to determine reasons for discrepancies between inventory and stock control records; recommend corrective actions to resolve discrepancies. Plan layout of warehouse and other storage areas, considering turnover, size, weight and related factors of items stored. Analyze records and recommend corrective action for reported non-usable, aged and excess stock. Review records for accuracy of information and compliance with established procedures, and to determine adequacy of inventory levels. Monitor and evaluate expectations and performance of warehouse and delivery staff through coaching and development opportunities. Promote a high level of customer focus and lead a Quality Managed warehouse environment; create an environment that encourages respect, teamwork, communication, customer satisfaction and productivity between team members and following the Integrity Service model. Communicate and ensure all requirements pertaining to warehousing/ material handling, safety and shipping are followed by staff. Required Skills and Qualifications: High School Diploma or GED Equivalent required. Associates Degree preferred. Minimum 5 years experience in a warehouse environment, including supervisory experience. Proven track record in a team development role. Experience with order picking, shipping, receiving, inventory counts, pick/pack. In-depth knowledge of FIFO, OSHA, Safety Awareness and HAZMAT shipping. Management experience within a Quality System such as ISO 9001 or similar strongly preferred. Forklift Certification strongly preferred. Must be proficient in MS Office; ability to learn and master internal systems required. Why should you join Composites One? CULTURE: This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of Respect, Teamwork, and Communication. INTEGRITY: The foundation of all strong relationships is TRUST. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and Team Members to build meaningful relationships! CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION: To remain successful, we must continuously improve and innovate. At Composites One, we value collaboration, and sharing ideas so that we can grow and drive continuous improvement and innovation together. Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve! About Us: Composites One LLC is the leading supplier of essential materials for Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, Consumer Recreation and Construction Composites Manufacturing. We have a global presence and operate 44 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each Team Member with respect and offers opportunities for growth and personal success. Learn more about us at compositesone.com! Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion At Composites One, all qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or other protected classification as defined by applicable law and regulation. ADA Accommodations Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please contact the ADA Coordinator by email at ADACoordinator@compositesone.com. Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Company Description
  
 ITW (NYSE: ITW) is a Fortune 200 global multi-industrial manufacturing leader with revenue totaling $14.5 billion in 2021. The company’s seven industry-leading segments leverage the unique ITW Business Model to drive solid growth with best-in-class margins and returns in markets where highly innovative, customer-focused solutions are required.  ITW is a great employer with a distinct culture that empowers our people to think and act like entrepreneurs within ITW’s strategic framework. Commitment to our core values, safety and our culture is a competitive advantage for the company, and we are committed to fully leveraging its strength.

  Job Description
  
 POSITION SUMMARY:

  

  
 The Human Resources Manager is a business partner that will help drive strategic talent initiatives across our division. The HR Manager role is a hands-on and a collaborative role that requires great attention to detail and high level of confidentiality.

  
 Key Responsibilities:

  
 Enterprise Strategy & 80/20 Objectives

  

   
 Establish competency, leadership and credibility necessary to be a partner and key contributor while delivering great results within HR and the sites you support

   
 Develop an understanding of the ITW Business Model with the ability to implement meaningful change based on business unit and division strategic priorities

   
 Partnership with plant operations leadership team to support 80 focus areas

   
 Be able to effectively communicate and/or lead changes impacting the business

  

  
 Human Resource Management

  

   
 Effectively manage all areas of the HR function for your client groups from managing daily and tactical tasks to effectively leading the strategic elements such as workforce planning, morale/culture, change management and risk mitigation.

   
 Partner with Division HR Director for execution of annual talent management cycle

   
 Partner with operations leadership while assuming local management leadership role for plant operations

   
 Initiate, support and drive change, as needed throughout the business

   
 Revise and/or create, implement, and effectively communicate human resource or people related processes and policies

   
 Interpret, report and manage compliance with the applicable state/country laws and regulation

   
 Travel approximately 25% to 40% to support the Norcross, GA and Rockland, MA plants

  

  
 Talent Acquisition

  

   
 Engage with local and division leadership regarding employee needs within plant and division

   
 Execute division recruitment process; partner with managers and lead all phases of the recruitment process

   
 Develop recruitment strategies for exempt and non-exempt roles

 Managerial courage to identify and coach managers and/or leaders in real time

 Employee Relations

 Compensation & Benefits

 Excellent written and verbal communication skills are necessary, as well as the ability to build networks of contacts externally and internally

   
 Ability to link company/business objectives to HR strategies

   
 Must be able to exercise independent judgment, ability to work independently and function well in a team environment

 EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  
 Required

  

   
 Bachelor’s Degree

 Preferred

RWE Renewables Americas LLC

Provide support to the operating fleet and construction for short term immediate technical expertise. In addition, work with the reliability and performance group to run tests, improve work instructions and own reliability of the turbine at handover of wind farms during construction and EOW. Coordinator will be expected to spend 40% of their time on active projects next to their management tasks. He/she will be part of setting up performance reporting and personal development

As RWE Renewables is growing in terms of managed assets as the existing fleet ages, the position supports the growing asset base and growing maintenance needs which often come with age.

Responsibilties:

Adhere to the Company’s values and behaviors as aspired by RWE and the RWE NA Operations Vision.

Manage the wtg technical support team of to provide direct support to the RWE fleet wind farms

Manage the team as the main contact to the site for WTG performance and engineering

Manage the Support blade repair teams including repair design work instructions

Implement and maintain the dynamic maintenance support including maintenance schedules

Improve performance structural maintenance schedule for parts as needed in close cooperation with operations and the reliability and performance group

Ensure Dispositions and inspections of drive train and blade damage (Up 70% to 80% demand for Drive Train and Blade Engineers) are delivered by the team in a timely manner

Manage the Development and Support Turbine Maintenance Work Instructions

Manage the Installation and manage tests in the field of new equipment, measurements etc for RCAs

Support Operations for short term / turbine Issues (repair, troubleshooting after site has exhausted their options)

Qualifications:

Five (5) years (10 preferred) of overall experience in operations and/or maintenance of electrical, mechanical, hydraulic, or pneumatic systems. With at least three (3) of those years being in wind energy

Demonstrated ability to lead a team of engineers whilst understanding the needs of the field staff.

Ability to strategically think about the long term success of the team

Focus on people and people development

Ability to deal with a large variety of ad-hoc work and vision on how to reduce/manage that

Good spoken and written communication skills including presentations

Ability to understand complex data

Costumer focused mindset

We look forward to meeting you!

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.
 
 
Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

  
 
  
 
  
Your Impact:

  
 Here at Jacobs, we apply our expertise and knowledge as we look into the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference. If you want to join a company invested in you, your success and the global community - join us as our Offshore Wind Engineering Lead to help our communities achieve a net-zero future.
 
  
As a vital member of our team, you’ll be recognized as an industry leader and expert within Jacobs and spearhead our growing Offshore Wind practice. Primary focus will be on the US market, but you’ll be coordinating and working across multiple disciplines and regions to leverage Jacobs’ advisory, planning, permitting, and engineering expertise to strengthen our position in the offshore wind market. As the OSW Engineering Lead, you will help lead and build a multi-disciplinary team that can successfully deliver on the design and review of structures needed for offshore wind projects.
 
  
At Jacobs you’ll be instrumental in the growth and development of our Offshore Wind business strategy. You’ll contribute to our alternative energy wind projects/initiatives that have a significant impact upon our business. Your expertise in the design and construction of offshore structures will be critical in the delivery and positioning of Jacobs for upcoming offshore wind opportunities and programs.
 
  
Working together, we’ll help you grow and pursue what fulfills you so that we can make impacts on the future – big and small, global and local.
 
  
At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.
 
  
Here’s What You’ll Need:

  

   
 Substantial years of experience in structural dynamics, numerical modeling, 3D finite element analysis, integrated load analyses, monopile design, steel jacket design, fatigue analysis, design of offshore structures, industry software, and program languages (e.g. STAAD.Pro, SAP, ROBOT, SACS, SESAM, BLADED, SQL, Matlab, Python)

   
Strong knowledge of industry standards, offshore regulations, health & safety, and environmental legislation associated with offshore construction projects

   
Be highly experienced in interfacing with other discipline specialists (structural, geotechnical, coastal, electrical, mechanical, BIM, etc.) and familiar with offshore codes and standards (DNVGL, ISO, UFC, AISC, API, etc.)

   
Proven track record delivering large, complex, multidisciplinary projects and execution of works in an offshore environment

   
Familiarity with the US offshore wind industry, its players, and market outlook and relationships with offshore wind developers, contractors, suppliers, or utilities involved in the development of offshore wind projects in the US

   
Have an outgoing and customer-oriented attitude with the ability to build, and develop client relationships, and be a demonstrated and recognized Project Director and technical leader

   
Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering with Structural Focus

   
Professional Engineering Registration

  

  
 
  

   
 
   
Ideally, You’ll Also Have:

   
 
   

    
Advanced degree in structural or geotechnical engineering

    
Experience in the development of an offshore wind including program management functions (e.g. budget, schedule, procurement).

    
Familiarity and experience in the design of offshore floating structures

    
Leadership skills and the ability to identify suitable candidates to help grow our offshore wind practice.

    
SE Designation

   

  
 
  
Your most impactful mission in this role is to embrace living inclusion every day and enabling diversity and equality globally. For us, this means creating a culture of belonging where we all thrive by embracing all perspectives. An inclusive culture with many perspectives through diverse backgrounds allows us to leverage knowledge, leadership and connection to bring forth opportunity, creativity and growth.
 Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.
  
 At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

At Composites One our culture is founded on a clear set of Core Values that has at its core 
Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.
 Our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as one Team, respect each other in our daily interactions, and communicate effectively while doing the one thing that is critical to our success – taking care of our customers. 

 
Are you ready for a rewarding career?
 
 
 We are searching for a Distribution Center Operations Manager to join our growing Team!
 
 
 
 
Now is the time to move forward and make an impact!
 
 
 As a 
DC Operations Manager
 you will be responsible for the managerial oversight of the operational function of multiple distribution centers, including 
customer service, safety/risk management
, 
receiving, transportation
, 
warehousing, equipment/building maintenance/repair operations
 and 
office/business administration tasks. 
In this role you will adhere to and promote Company values by performing duties in a manner that is consistent with being a team leader and supports the continued growth of the company.
 
 
 How 
will you impact our organization as an DC Operations Manager on a daily basis?
 
 
 
  
Support, manage and analyze DC customer service functions to continuously improve all levels of customer satisfaction.
 
  
Serve as liaison between the Customer Service, Warehouse and Sales Team to resolve issues and maintain focus on the customer.
 
  
Analyze and manage warehouse and delivery functions to continuously improve the efficiency levels and safety.
 
  
Oversee and manage the daily operations of the DC to achieve specific operating income and ROA goals.
 
  
Monitor and approve all freight transactions, including review of freight adders on a semi-annual basis in partnership with Supply Chain Managers.
 
  
Develop systems, processes and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources, including effective material movement and logistics, while delivering value to our customers.
 
  
Review monthly financial statements and investigates variances against budget; identifies areas for improvement in efficiency and cost reductions.
 
  
Implement best practices as they relate to manufactured goods such as slitting, material repackaging and quick tint operations.
 
  
Responsible for risk management at the DC level.
 
 
 
 
Leadership and Communications Skills:
 
 
 
  
Monitor and evaluate expectations and performance of DC staff through coaching and development opportunities.
 
  
Facilitate the hiring process of DC staff and long term planning for staffing requirements.
 
  
Provide motivational and developmental leadership to DC staff on a daily basis; conduct semi-annual performance reviews for direct reports.
 
  
Establish performance objectives and training plans; conducts strategic planning for the facility.
 
  
Create a safe and compliant work environment by providing adequate safety training; conduct monthly safety meetings and complete training as determined by HSE.
 
 
 
 
Required Skills and Qualifications:
 
 
 
  
A minimum 5 years of supervisory experience.
 
  
Progressively responsible experience in supply chain, distribution, warehouse and/or logistics sectors in the manufacturing or distribution industry.
 
  
Experience in the Composites industry is preferred.
 
  
Experience in Quality Assurance is strongly preferred.
 
  
Experience in Aerospace is strongly preferred.
 
  
High school diploma, GED, or Equivalent is required.
 
  
Bachelors Degree in Business, or related field, strongly preferred.
 
  
Occasional travel, up to 10%.
 
 

 

  Why should you join Composites One?
 
 
 

  
CULTURE:
 This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.
 
  
INTEGRITY:
 The foundation of all strong relationships is TRUST. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and Team Members to build meaningful relationships!
 
  
CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION:
 To remain successful, we must continuously improve and innovate. At Composites One, we value collaboration, and sharing ideas so that we can grow and drive continuous improvement and innovation together.
 
 
 
 
Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve!

 
 
 
 
 
 About Us:
 
 

  
 Composites One LLC
 is the leading supplier of essential materials for 
  
Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, Consumer Recreation 
and
  
 Construction Composites Manufacturing. 
We have a global presence and operate 44 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each Team Member with respect and 
  
offers opportunities for growth and personal success.

 
 
 
 
 

  
Learn more about us at compositesone.com!

 

 
 
 
 
 
 Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
 
 At Composites One, all qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or other protected classification as defined by applicable law and regulation. 
 
 
ADA Accommodations
 
 Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please contact the ADA Coordinator by email at ADACoordinator@compositesone.com.

 

 
 Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

Sprague is passionate about delivering the diverse products and programs that warm, power and move the world. We keep homes warm through Northeastern winters and hospitals cool through summer. We help small businesses focus on serving their communities, and our renewable fuels keep our country’s infrastructure running. From importing wind energy components to deploying leading-edge solar technology to help power terminal facilities, we are committed to continually evolving to meet our customers’ changing energy needs.
 
 
 What we offer:
 
 
 
  
Pay $28.00/hr
 
  
Traditional and Roth 401(k) plans with employer match
 
  
Defined Contribution Plan with an automatic 5% contribution from Sprague
 
  
Tuition reimbursement up to $6500
 
  
On the job training
 
  
Paid Volunteer Time
 
  
Choice of Health Plans to fit your individual need
 
  
Gym membership

 

 
 
 
Sprague values innovation, safety, integrity and people. We know that our people are what set us apart from our competition, and we work hard to make sure each employee across our 20+ locations knows how important they are to our organization. We recently surveyed our employees to ask them their favorite part of the job. Unanimously, they answered with "the people I work with." You are part of a team and a family at Sprague, and everyone works together to ensure the success of both the company and the individual.
 
 
 And in addition to great coworkers, you’ll enjoy perks like medical benefits and retirement contributions that 
start on your first day.
 Do you like to get involved where you work? Sprague has a range of committees to support varying initiatives (Sustainability, Charitable, Scholarship, etc.). Sprague is a place that cares about its employees, its community, and about creating a place where people want to come to work every day.
 
 
 Job Summary / General Purpose:
 
 
 The primary responsibility of the successful candidate will be in assisting during the loading and offloading of marine cargo vessels. When not engaged in that activity work will be assigned with both our maintenance and operations teams.
 
 
 As a valued crew member, the 
Terminal Operator/Crane Operator
 at our Searsport, ME, will work in a team environment with leadership to optimize efficiency while focusing on safety every shift. We are looking for a terminal operator/crane operator capable of a wide range of duties at an oil tank farm/bulk handling facility. A variety of skills/specialization may be utilized, some of which may require licensure or certification. Work hours primarily are Monday through Friday and often require weekends and nights to help handle our busy operations. Overtime is frequently available, though not guaranteed, and often required. Work is primarily performed outdoors, and the terminal operator will work with the maintenance team and the operations team in a maritime environment 24 hours a day, 365 days per year. Regular travel to other Sprague terminals will be required.
 
 
 Major Duties / Responsibilities:
 
 
 
  
Ability to operate vessel crane and assist with loading/offloading marine cargo vessels - primary position
 
  
Operation of construction equipment (ex: skid steer, pay-loader, forklift, hopper, etc.)
 
  
Valve alignment, piping skills, pump skills, and construction skills
 
  
Pump And Motor maintenance and PM’s
 
  
Insulating and Pipe installation
 
  
Hydraulics and Fittings
 
  
General heavy equipment and vehicle maintenance
 
  
Assist with mooring vessels
 
  
Assist with offloading of liquid and bulk cargo vessels
 
  
Ability to obtain Rigging, Signalmen, and Heavy Lift certifications
 
  
Assist with maintenance of grounds, buildings and/or equipment
 
  
Participate in oil spill response drills
 
  
Welding/Fabrication (with suitable training/certification as required)
 
  
Travel to other Sprague facilities will be required
 
  
Other duties as required
 
 
 
 
Education / Experience / Skill Requirements
 
 
 
  
Knowledge of basic math
 
  
Basic computer knowledge
 
  
Mechanical aptitude
 
  
Valid driver's license
 
  
Good verbal and written communication skills
 
  
Travel to other Sprague facilities may be required
 
  
High school diploma or equivalent
 
  
Previous experience as a general laborer preferred
 
  
Previous experience operating heavy equipment a plus
 
  
Specialized licensure in certain areas a plus (i.e. PIC qualification, equipment operator certification)
 
  
Operator must be able to be trained and become proficient in the operation of cargo handling equipment including vessel cranes, hopper, skidsteers, forklifts,and other various pieces of equipment.

 

 
 
 
 
 
 Physical activity/strength requirements are demanding and may include:
 
 
 
  
Standing up to 75% of the day
 
  
Lifting up to 75 lbs. (i.e. steel parts, spouts)
 
  
Carrying up to 50 lbs. (i.e. oil, parts, tools)
 
  
Pulling up to 75 lb. capacity (i.e. mooring lines)
 
  
Extended climbing (i.e. tank ladders/stairs/ramps)
 
 
 
 
Incumbent must possess the ability to work in a safe manner and maintain a constant state of alertness as the nature of work performed within our terminal operations create conditions where a momentary lack of concentration or alertness can lead to catastrophic results.
 
 
 Come join us to learn why we are consistently celebrating 20-, 30-, and even 40-year anniversaries here at Sprague! 

 
Sprague is an EEO/AA employer. We strongly encourages minorities, females, Vets and individuals with disabilities to apply.
