Job Description

The Machinist is responsible for safely machine quality parts using operating instructions and perform set-up/change over and light machine maintenance as needed.

Job Responsibilities

  • Communicate with peers, area supervisor and area engineer to ensure a quality product and internal/external Customer satisfaction.
  • You will read, interpret and follow operating instructions, dimensional sheets, job orders, tooling instructions, and process control charts.
  • You will ensure quality of the product through various inspection, setup, and reporting techniques including the set up and use of precision instruments such as micrometers, dial indicators, jigs and fixtures, other precision measuring instruments, as well as the effective use of gauging frequency charts.
  • You will operate and perform basic routine maintenance on a variety of conventional or CNC machine tools such as drills, lathes, mills, hobbs, broaches and grinders in different manufacturing cells.
  • You will use problem-solving skills to perform machine set-up operations within time allowed as detailed in the operating instructions (for CNC qualified this includes any CNC program offsets that are needed) to ensure a quality part.
  • You will assist in maintaining an atmosphere of continuous improvement and team efforts for accomplishing departmental and plant goals.
  • You will perform cell housekeeping duties on each shift along with basic machine cleaning & care, to meet 5-S requirements.
  • You will perform procedures necessary to ensure compliance with the Safety Process and ensure the personal safety of the incumbent including eye safety, hearing conservation, machine safety guards, ergonomic movement, lock out/tag out, MSDS procedures, and OHSA regulations.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned by supervisor.

Background & Skills

  • A high school diploma or equivalent from an accredited institution
  • Experience working with manual or CNC machines in a professional or academic setting
  • Possess a certificate in Machining from an accredited institution or two years of manual or CNC production machining experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Familiar with geometric tolerancing

Preferred Qualifications:

  • understand and effectively apply information contained in documents such as geometric dimensioning and tolerancing
  • Working knowledge of Geometrical Dimensioning and Tolerancing methods.
  • Good working knowledge of standard manufacturing equipment, shop tooling, such as CNC or conventional mills, lathes, broaches, drills and hobs.
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively work in a team environment and communicate and work with peers, supervisors, engineers, and other plant personnel.
  • Possess excellent problem-solving skills, as would be regularly demonstrated on the job.

Demonstrated excellent understanding of basic metrology concepts, with a good knowledge of geometry and trigonometry.

  • Ability to read, understand, interpret, and effectively apply information contained in all applicable documents such as operating instructions, engineering drawings, specifications, design standards, dimensional sheets, and/or blueprints (including geometric dimensioning and tolerancing).
  • Demonstrate working knowledge of precision measuring instruments such as hand tools, micrometers, dial calipers, precision gage blocks, optical comparators, CMM, surface plate equipment, and special instruments for checking form, finish, and metallurgical characteristics.
  • Prior history of satisfactory operation of mechanized material handling devices such as fork truck and scissor lift and/or willingness and ability to complete
  • Ability and willingness to work overtime, weekends and any shift as needed.

Danfoss – Engineering Tomorrow

At Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways - driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees.

Following our founder’s mindset “action speaks louder than words”, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030.

Danfoss is an EO employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.


Danfoss engineers solutions that increase machine productivity, reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and enable electrification.

Our solutions are used in such areas as refrigeration, air conditioning, heating, power conversion, motor control, industrial machinery, automotive, marine, and off- and on-highway equipment. We also provide solutions for renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, as well as district-energy infrastructure for cities.

Our innovative engineering dates back to 1933. Danfoss is family-owned, employing more than 42.000 people, serving customers in more than 100 countries through a global footprint of 95 factories.


Danfoss engineers solutions that increase machine productivity, reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and enable electrification.

Our solutions are used in such areas as refrigeration, air conditioning, heating, power conversion, motor control, industrial machinery, automotive, marine, and off- and on-highway equipment. We also provide solutions for renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, as well as district-energy infrastructure for cities.

Our innovative engineering dates back to 1933. Danfoss is family-owned, employing more than 42.000 people, serving customers in more than 100 countries through a global footprint of 95 factories.

Company Description

ITW (NYSE: ITW) is a Fortune 200 global multi-industrial manufacturing leader with revenue totaling $12.6 billion in 2020. The company’s seven industry-leading segments leverage the unique ITW Business Model to drive solid growth with best-in-class margins and returns in markets where highly innovative, customer-focused solutions are required. ITW has nearly 50,000 dedicated colleagues in operations around the world who thrive in the company’s unique decentralized and entrepreneurial culture.

ITW is a great employer with a distinct culture that empowers our people to think and act like entrepreneurs within ITW’s strategic framework. This decentralized, entrepreneurial culture is one component of the powerful and highly differentiated ITW Business Model. Commitment to our core values, safety and our culture is a competitive advantage for the company, and we are committed to fully leveraging its strength.

ITW Polymers Sealants North America, Inc. offers expanded sealants solutions to various industries and its key markets including construction (roofing, surfacing, metal building, and fenestration), aerospace composites and wind energy. Our brands with a proven history of success include ERSystems®, Permathane®, Tacky Tape®, STA’-PUT®, Pacific Polymers®, Acryl-R®, Miracle®, and Elastek®.

Job Description

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Human Resources Manager is a business partner that will help drive strategic talent initiatives across our division. The Human Resources Manager role is a hands-on and collaborative role that requires great attention to detail and a high level of confidentiality.

Key Responsibilities:

Enterprise Strategy & 80/20 Objectives

Establish competency, leadership, and credibility necessary to be a partner and key contributor while delivering great results within HR and the sites you support

Develop an understanding of the ITW Business Model with the ability to implement meaningful change based on business unit and division strategic priorities

Partner with plant operations leadership team to support 80 focus areas

Be able to effectively communicate and/or lead changes impacting the business

Human Resource Management

Effectively manage all areas of the HR function for your client groups from managing daily and tactical tasks to effectively leading the strategic elements such as workforce planning, morale/culture, change management, and risk mitigation.

Partner with Division HR Director for execution of the annual talent management cycle

Partner with operations leadership while assuming a local management leadership role for plant operations

Initiate, support, and drive change as needed throughout the business

Interpret, report, and manage compliance with the applicable state/country laws and regulation

Talent Acquisition

Engage with local and division leadership regarding employee needs within plants and across the division

Execute division recruitment process; partner with managers and lead all phases of the recruitment process

Develop recruitment strategies for exempt and non-exempt roles

Proactive and regular review of non-exempt workforce planning needs to ensure staffing levels meet production needs

Training & Development

Manage the identification and development of "High Potential" employees, working with management and corporate leaders for intentional development

Identify, design, and deliver training and mentoring programs that promote employee development and engagement

Manage performance review process for all employees, including performance issues of individuals and teams

Employee Relations

Facilitate, counsel, and coach employees and managers to a resolution regarding employee relations

Partner, notify and/or elevate sensitive employee relations matters to Division HR Director and/or Corporate HR, ensuring a shared risk approach

Responsible for FMLA, STD and LTD administration, leveraging Corporate HR as needed

Compensation & Benefits

Coordinate compensation review process for promotions, merit increases and bonus plans

SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:

Excellent written and verbal communication skills are necessary, as well as the ability to build networks of contacts externally and internally

 Ability to link company/business objectives to HR strategies

Must be able to exercise independent judgment, ability to work independently and function well in a team environment

High level of intellectual curiosity with ability to find problems and provide solutions

Strategic thinking with the ability to accelerate and influence change

Excellent time and project management capabilities, must have a sense of urgency, able to prioritize including the ability to manage competing priorities

Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Required

Bachelor’s Degree

Minimum of 5 years of progressive HR generalist experience

Preferred

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or an HR-related field

7+ years of progressive HR Generalist experience, preferably with at least one previous leadership role

Prior manufacturing experience

Bilingual English/Spanish

Experience with third-party recruiting tools such as LinkedIn Recruiter

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that ar
e required of the position.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

ITW is an equal opportunity employer. We value our colleagues’ unique perspectives, experiences and ideas and create workplaces where everyone can develop their careers and perform to their full potential.

As an equal employment opportunity employer, ITW is committed to equal employment opportunity and fair treatment for employees, beginning with the hiring process and continuing through all aspects of the employment relationship.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Job Summary:

A leading supplier of essential materials for Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, and Composites Manufacturing is seeking an experienced DC Operations Manager to join their growing team! The DC Operations Manager will be responsible for the oversight of the operational function of multiple distribution centers including customer service, safety/risk management, receiving, transportation, warehousing, maintenance operations, and business administration tasks.

This is a Direct Hire opportunity.

Pay ranges from $100-140K depending on experience.

DC Operations Manager Duties:

  • Support, manage, and analyze DC customer service functions
  • Manage and approve all freight transactions
  • Develop systems, process, and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources
  • Responsible for risk management at the DC level
  • Review monthly financial statements and investigate variances against budget

DC Operations Manager Qualifications:

  • A minimum of 5 years of supervisory experience
  • Experience in supply chain, distribution, and/or logistics sectors in manufacturing or distribution industry required
  • Experience in the Composites industry is preferred
  • Experience in Quality Assurance is strongly preferred
  • Experience in Aerospace is strongly preferred
  • High school diploma or GED is required

About Express Employment Professionals:

Express Employment Professionals is a staffing development agency assisting businesses in attracting and developing top talent. Since opening in 1995, we have employed over 30,000 people in the Tarrant county area. Express can help you find a job that is the perfect fit for your needs and abilities, and you will never pay a fee for our services and support. Whether you are looking for a full-time position, part-time work, or a more flexible schedule, Express has a wide range of jobs available including Administrative, Light Industrial, Skilled Trades, and Professional positions through evaluation-hire, contract, and direct hire opportunities. Let us help you today! Express has helped five million people find work over the last 35 years. We are the #1 staffing franchise and our 800 locations are focused on putting the next million to work.

Express offers a competitive benefits package for evaluation-hire and contract positions including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Holiday and 401(k), Short-Term Disability, and Life Benefits

About TPI
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.
The Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) Manager is the key individual responsible for ensuring a safe and environmentally compliant organization. The fundamental task is to plan, direct, and implement environmental, health and safety programs to ensure a safe, healthy, accident-free and sustainable organization by performing the following duties personally or through subordinate team members.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Plans and implements EHS policies and procedures in compliance with local, state, and federal Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) rules and regulations.

 
Plans and implements programs to train managers and employees in work site safety practices, fire prevention, and correct handling techniques for chemicals, equipment, and other materials.

 
Leads air permit, hazardous waste, community right to know, and other applicable regulatory compliance activities including record keeping and reporting and reporting requirements.

 
Prepares studies and analyses of industrial accident causes and hazards to health for use by company personnel and outside agencies.

 
Inspects organization facilities to detect existing or potential safety and health hazards, determines corrective or preventative measures where indicated, and follows up to ensure measures have been implemented.

 
Provides information, signs, posters, barriers, and other materials to warn of potential and actual safety hazards and to prevent access to hazardous conditions.

 
Leads and trains others in the investigation of accidents and injuries and cooperates in the preparation of material and evidence for organization use in hearings, lawsuits, and insurance investigations.

 
Oversees the administration of workers' compensation program, including working with the insurance carrier to reduce employee lost time.

 
Prepares and arranges safety exhibits and material for display, promotional work, industry conferences, and exhibitions.

 
Represents the organization in community or industry safety groups and programs.

 
Maintains safety files and records.

 
Directly supervises 1-2 employees within the EHS function. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws.

 
Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.




Who we’re looking for: 



 
Bachelor’s degree in Environmental (preferred) or related field (natural sciences, engineering, chemistry, or similar) and minimum of 7+ years work experience Safety/Environmental leadership experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 
Demonstrated success in improving EHS performance and establishing best practices.

 
Proven examples of effective communication and listening skills.

 
Demonstrated team leadership skills. Experience in managing EHS programs.

 
Passion and drive for environmental and safety compliance.

 
Knowledge of environmental and OSHA regulations.

 
Broad knowledge of workers’ compensation regulations and best practices.

 
Ability to read and interpret technical documents and regulations.




Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren RI.


Location: 373 Market Street, Warren, RI 02885


Job Type: Full-time

doc_description:
Composites One LLC
 is the leading supplier of essential materials for 
wind energy, aerospace, defense, consumer recreation
 and 
construction composites manufacturing.
 We have a global presence and operate 
44
 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each team member with 
respect
 and 
offers opportunities for growth and personal success.

  
 Learn more about us compositesone.com!

  

  
 This individual will provide oversight and strategic governance over the tools, and resources to drive growth and success. Partnering with the sales team, the Sales Enablement and CRM Manager will 
develop
 and 
execute
 impactful, data-driven solutions for transforming the sales process. Success is measured by the overall business impact of these solutions and cross-functional collaboration.

  
 
Responsibilities Include:

  

   
 Design, implement, evaluate, and test solutions to meet strategic objectives of the organization related to enablement of the sales force. In specific non-technical areas, this resource will be responsible for maintenance and configuration of solutions.

   
 Supports the End to End journey of the customer, which includes the collection, organization and use of customer data to maximize revenue.

   
 Manage, administrate, and ensure adoption of global Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system, SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C)/Sales Cloud, including user setup, security, profiles, workflow rules, and reports.

   
 Create and continually enhance user-based dashboards and analytics including on-demand reporting.

   
 Serve as consultant and Subject Matter Expert (SME) to 200+ internal global users and 20K customers in driving utilization and adoption of SAP C4C (Cloud 4 Customer, C4/Hana) CRM system.

   
 Work in a cross functional environment with various business groups, IT and end users to identify, document, and communicate business processes.

   
 Responsible for training sales & service staff in CRM and ensuring that records are being updated and accurately in a timely manner.

   
 Provide recommendations to sales leadership team on how to leverage our CRM to execute on their strategic vision, including lead scoring, prospecting, and retention strategies.

   
 Integrate with marketing department in the execution of digital marketing/advertising campaigns.

   
 Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.

   
 Prepare ad-hoc queries using common reporting tools and other available tools and resources.

  

  
 
Required Skills, Abilities & Education:

  

   
 Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or related field; or equivalent experience is required.

   
 5+ years of experience managing CRM and marketing automation platforms software.

   
 SAP experience is a plus.

   
 C4C/ Sales Cloud, including creating executive level dashboards and reporting key metrics is preferred.

   
 Experience using Microsoft Office programs is required.

   
 Experience in Cloud for Sales.

   
 Experience with Sales Enablement is required.

  

  
 
What we offer:

  
 Health Insurance eligibility as of Day 1 (Medical, Dental, Vision), 401K Plan with Company Match and Profit Sharing, Paid Time Off, Flexible Spending Accounts (Health and Dependent Care), Employee Assistance Program, Educational Assistance Program.

  

  
 Why should you join our team?

  
 CULTURE:
 This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of 
Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.

  
 INTEGRITY:
 The foundation of all strong relationships is 
TRUST
. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and employees to build meaningful relationships!

  
 CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION:
 In order to remain successful, 
we must continuously improve our processes and practices
. Each of our employees understands they have a 
responsibility to innovate
 and look for opportunities to become better at what we do.

At Composites One our culture is founded on a clear set of Core Values that has at its core 
Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.
 Our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as one Team, respect each other in our daily interactions, and communicate effectively while doing the one thing that is critical to our success – taking care of our customers.
 
 
 Are you ready for a rewarding career?
 
 
 We are searching for a Systems Manager to join our growing Information Technology Team!
 
 
 
 
Now is the time to move forward and make an impact!
 
 
 As a
 Systems Manager
 you will be responsible for 
hardware and software management
, 
managing the Systems Services Team
 and 
provide Level 2 support where necessary
, ensuring issues are escalated to management appropriately. As a service-oriented workplace culture, we are keen on supporting our internal as well as external customers. By allowing us to increase our scope of support to our internal team members and external customers, the Systems Manager is instrumental in scaling our brand and re-enforcing our guiding mission.
 
 
 How will you impact our organization as an Systems Manager on a daily basis?
 
 
 
  
Analyze, troubleshoot, and evaluate server and storage needs across the enterprise to ensure business applications, and users operate with minimal interruption.
 
  
Oversee the maintenance process of systems and related software; this includes Server hardware, storage, security systems, active directory, Azure AD, Azure, etc.
 
  
 
Manage vendor relations, ensure compliance with applicable licensing agreements, and manage supporting staff to support the IT team and company’s overall goals.
 
 
  
Possess a strong knowledge of Windows Server 2016 and higher experience (Active Directory / Domain Environment / DNS/Azure AD).
 
  
Knowledge of Linux-based operating systems (e.g., Ubuntu 16.04 and later), and virtualization.
 
  
 
Maintain system management and day-to-day operations of the IT function.
 
 
  
Oversee and document equipment performance, new hardware/software installations, and manage the patch management of relevant software platforms.
 
 
 

 
Leadership and Communications Skills:
 
 
 
  
Manage, mentor and coach new team members and junior level staff of the IT department.
 
  
Communicate a strong sense of urgency in solving problems and getting work done.
 
  
Ensure time, resources and actions are focused on priorities that contribute to meeting business goals and objectives.
 
  
Work to create an environment that values and rewards drive, initiative, and achievement of results.
 
  
Set the standard as a role model for providing Stellar Service; demonstrates positive, customer service focus.
 
 
 
 
Required Skills and Qualifications:
 
 
 
  
Familiarity with hardware technology and the global, regional, and local hardware architecture, including virtual servers.
 
  
Ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, or activities, making effective judgments as to prioritization and time allocation.
 
  
Knowledge of and experience with configuring, installing, and supporting the hardware and connectivity components of a single user workstation.
 
  
Knowledge of and experience with installing, configuring, and supporting the software, connectivity, computing and database services and interfaces available to a single-user workstation.
 
  
Expertise with network, computer, and mobile equipment for an enterprise comprised of numerous sites and hundreds of end users.
 
  
Knowledge of Microsoft Apps for communication and collaboration.
 
  
Bachelor’s degree in related field, and/or a combination of education and experience.

About Re:Build Manufacturing & Oribi

Oribi Manufacturing, located in Denver, CO, is a leader in the development and production of advanced thermoplastic composites. Re:Build Manufacturing is a rapidly growing family of industrial businesses combining enabling technologies, operational superiority, and strategic M&A to build America's next generation industrial company. At Re:Build we deploy deep expertise in operations management and technology to supercharge performance of our subsidiaries by implementing core technologies across industrial platforms in diverse growth markets. Our goal is to help revitalize the U.S. manufacturing base over the coming decades, creating substantial opportunities for our employees and the communities where we operate.

We leverage deep professional expertise and a candid, principled operating culture to drive differentiated outcomes for our customers, our employees, our communities and our investors. Ours is a fast-paced environment where individuals can stretch and be challenged with a wide variety of opportunities and projects. We empower and support our employees to pursue their fullest potential and provide meaningful avenues for personal and professional growth.


Who we are looking for

The Operations Manager will be responsible for high-level managerial and administrative functions of the day-to-day business operations including Production, Purchasing, Production Control / Planning, Maintenance, and Shipping/Receiving. The ideal candidate will form strategies to improve performance, procure material and resources efficiently, secure compliance, and implement best practices across all levels.

What you will get to do

  • Provides leadership, and management of employees to ensure effective selection, retention, development, disciplinary action, and performance management.
  • Leads and coordinates organization operation strategies and activities.
  • Collaborates in the development and implementation of organization policies, practices, procedures, and attainment of operating goals.
  • Reviews, analyzes, and prepares reports, records, and directives, and confers with managers/supervisors to obtain data required for planning activities, such as new commitments, the status of work in progress, and problems encountered.
  • Analyzes performance metrics and summarizes operational data.
  • Assigns, or delegates responsibility for, specified work or functional activities and disseminates policies and objectives to supervisors/staff.
  • Coordinates with other support departments such as Human Resources, Finance, Quality, Engineering, Program Management / Sales to ensure successful production operations.
  • Oversees Production, Purchasing, Production Control/Planning, Maintenance, Shipping and Receiving.
  • Determines labor needs to meet production goals.
  • Assists with budget preparation for the operations unit.
  • Coordinates with Engineering, Technology, and Business Development teams to determine pricing, timing, and NRE.

What you bring to the team

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Management, Business Administration, Technical field (e.g. Engineering), or related field required.
  • 6-10 years experience in a leadership role, preferably in a manufacturing environment.
  • Strong customer service orientation, interpersonal skills, and relationship-building abilities required.
  • Critical thinking, sound judgment, and the ability to appropriately handle confidential, sensitive information are required.
  • Excellent leadership, managerial and supervisory skills.
  • Extensive knowledge of operations and production management, including experience with Lean principles and practice, and ERP systems.
  • Ability to interpret financial data as needed to set production goals.
  • Ability to mentor and coach team members.
  • Proficiency in MS Office applications required.

 Sprague is passionate about delivering the diverse products and programs that warm, power and move the world. We keep homes warm through Northeastern winters and hospitals cool through summer. We help small businesses focus on serving their communities, and our renewable fuels keep our country’s infrastructure running. From importing wind energy components to deploying leading-edge solar technology to help power terminal facilities, we are committed to continually evolving to meet our customers’ changing energy needs.
 
 
 What we offer:
 
 
 
  
Pay rate 
$28.00/hr
 
  
Tuition reimbursement up to $6,500
 
  
401(k) Traditional and Roth plans with employer match of 60% of the first 6% of the employee’s contribution
 
  
Defined Contribution Plan with an automatic 5% contribution from Sprague
 
  
Paid Volunteer Time
 
  
Choice of high deductible and PPO Health Plans to fit your individual needs
 
  
Wellness Program, and gym membership to a nearby facility
 
 
 
 
 In addition to great coworkers, you’ll enjoy perks like medical benefits and retirement contributions that 
start on your first day
. Do you like to get involved where you work? Is giving back important to you? It’s important to us, too! 
Sprague donates back
 to the communities in which we live and work every year and provides opportunities for employees to support the charity of the week. Sprague has a range of committees to support varying initiatives (Sustainability, Charitable, Scholarship, Innovation, etc.). Sprague is a place that 
cares about
 
its employees, 
its
 community
, and about creating a place where people want to come to work every day.

 
 
 
 
 
 About the position:
 
 
 Our 
Crane Operator/Terminal Operator
 is primarily responsible for operating vessel cranes during bulk discharges and, secondarily, to assist in the maintenance and repair of the conveyor system. Work hours/shifts will vary as circumstances dictate and overtime is frequently available but not guaranteed. Work is primarily outdoors in a maritime environment 24 hours a day, 365 days per year. Some travel to other Sprague facilities will be required.
 
 
 Your duties and responsibilities can include, but are not limited to any of the following:
 
 
 
  
Operate bulk vessel cranes (12 hour shifts) for duration of discharge.
 
  
On completion of discharge will be responsible for clean-up/wash down of entire conveyor system.
 
  
Regular travel will be required to other bulk terminals to operate bulk vessel cranes as needed.
 
  
When not otherwise employed will be responsible for assisting with conveyor maintenance and repairs.
 
  
Ability to pass rigger / signalman course is necessary.
 
  
Will also be trained in cement silo truck loading operations and responsible for operations if silos reactivated.
 
  
Possible operation of large construction equipment once trained (loader, bulldozer, skid steer, forklift).
 
  
Assist with mooring vessels.
 
  
Assist with liquid cargo operations.
 
  
Ability to work at heights in adherence with company policies.
 
  
Participate in oil spill response drills.
 
  
Welding skills helpful but not required.
 
  
Possible operation of Oxy/Acetylene torch once trained.
 
  
Available/Receptive to respond to afterhours maintenance issues.
 
  
Other duties as required.
 
 
 
 
Education / Experience / Skill Requirements:
 
 
 
  
Prior crane operation experience a plus but not required
 
  
High school diploma or equivalent
 
  
Minimum of 2 years experience as a general laborer
 
  
Knowledge of basic math
 
  
Mechanical aptitude
 
  
Receptive to and available for training opportunities outside the workplace
 
  
Good computer skills
 
  
Valid driver’s license
 
  
Ability to obtain a TWIC
 
  
Good verbal and written communication skills
 
 
 
 
Physical activity/strength requirements are demanding and may include:
 
 
 
  
Standing up to 75% of the day
 
  
Lifting up to 75 lbs. (i.e. steel parts, spouts)
 
  
Pulling up to 75 lb. capacity (i.e. mooring lines)
 
  
Extended climbing (i.e. tank ladders/stairs/ramps/conveyors)
 
  
Ability to work in an outdoor, maritime environment in a variety of shifts
 
  
Applicant must possess the ability to work in a safe manner and maintain a constant state of alertness as the nature of work performed within our terminal operations create conditions where a momentary lack of concentration or alertness can lead to catastrophic results.

 

 
 
 
 
 
 We want to hear from you!
 
 
 Do you like to solve problems and consider yourself forward thinking? If you are looking for a place where you can learn a lot about the energy industry while constantly challenging yourself, then Sprague is your place. Sprague employees are dedicated and driven, and we constantly strive to be the best in the industry. We work best as a team, knowing that collaboration leads to innovation and the best customer experience. As a company that has continued to evolve with the energy industry for the last 150 years, we are looking for hardworking employees to join us as we remain at the forefront of the industry.
 
 
 Come join us to learn why we are consistently celebrating 20-, 30-, and even 40-year anniversaries here at Sprague! 

 
Sprague is an EEO/AA employer. We strongly encourage minorities, females, Vets and individuals with disabilities to apply.

Requisition ID: 26371
Job Location(s): Van Wert, OH, US

Job Description

This position will involve the set-up, gauging, prove out programs, and operate machine tools to perform a series of progressive machining operations on repetitive work to exacting tolerances. Actively support and strive to meet the strategic goals set by yourself, the facility and Danfoss. This position is a 3rd Shift position at our Van Wert location.

Job Responsibilities

  • Must be able to learn, apply and retain new techniques, concepts and procedures required for continuously improving products, processes, services, deliveries and overall quality
  • Ability to read and understand blueprints, control plans, routers, job instructions and measurement tools
  • Must meet or exceed all quality standards set by the customers and individual Value Stream. Must also maintain the quality standards defined for the entire facility
  • Maintain flexibility to be able to move from work area to work area to meet the delivery expectations of the customers and the productivity goals for the plant. Able to work efficiently to establish standards without constant supervision
  • Always promotes cooperation and “team oriented” work environment under the direction of the leadership team
  • Creates/maintains a safe work environment and practices safety for himself and others at all times
  • Must maintain a clean and well-organized work environment and support our 5S program
  • Work from programming, operational data, setup instructions defining and coding tool arrangements, fixtures, and material clamping methods
  • Setup machine calibration and console settings for operations such as boring, milling, drilling, facing, threading, and occasional profiling and contouring
  • Operate Coordinate Measurement Machines (CMM) to verify part quality
  • Employee is responsible for maintaining oils, coolant levels and all filter changes on the machines
  • Ability to multitask as it includes: operating overhead cranes, large band saws, cutting and stenciling various sizes of bar stock and delivering stock to the individual machines

Background & Skills

Basic Qualifications:

  • Ability to work in a fast paced/demanding and rapidly growing Manufacturing work environment
  • Must be able to lift 50 pound cartons consistently

Preferred Qualifications:

  • High School Degree
  • Blueprint reading including Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerance (GD&T)
  • Basic math skills (measurement conversion, addition/subtraction, decimals/fractions)
  • Gauging concepts and techniques (calipers, high gages, micrometers, profiometer, roundness gauges, plug gages, air gages, dial depth gages, etc.)
  • At least 2 years’ experience operating manual, NC and/or CNC machine tools with experience in jobs setups requiring tooling and fixturing changes

Danfoss – Engineering Tomorrow

At Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways – driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees.


Following our founder’s mindset ‘action speaks louder than words’, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030.


Danfoss is an EO employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.


Danfoss engineers solutions that increase machine productivity, reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and enable electrification.

Our solutions are used in such areas as refrigeration, air conditioning, heating, power conversion, motor control, industrial machinery, automotive, marine, and off- and on-highway equipment. We also provide solutions for renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, as well as district-energy infrastructure for cities.

Our innovative engineering dates back to 1933. Danfoss is family-owned, employing more than 42.000 people, serving customers in more than 100 countries through a global footprint of 95 factories.

At Composites One our culture is founded on a clear set of Core Values that has at its core Respect, Teamwork, and Communication. Our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as one Team, respect each other in our daily interactions, and communicate effectively while doing the one thing that is critical to our success – taking care of our customers.

Are you ready for a rewarding career?

We are searching for a Warehouse Manager to join our growing Operations Team!

Now is the time to move forward and make an impact!

As a Warehouse Manager you will be responsible for the overall activity of the warehouse, including safety/risk management, Quality, RCCA, receiving, transportation (private fleet and 3rd party carriers), warehousing and equipment/building maintenance/repair operations, all in accordance with established Company and regulatory policies and procedures. In this role you will manage the process and performance involved in daily activities of the warehouse to achieve established operating income and ROA goals.

How will you impact our organization as a Warehouse Manager on a daily basis?

  • Develop and establish necessary staffing systems, processes and procedures to ensure consistent, accurate and timely customer order fulfillment.
  • Investigate and establish root cause of shipping and receiving errors and implement corrective action plans.
  • Build and maintain supplier partnerships; Works with suppliers to assure items are delivered to time and quality specifications.
  • Work in conjunction with the regional Buyers and Supply Chain Managers to coordinate product movement, warehouse space requirements and stock rotation.
  • Assist in developing plans for selling aged inventory in partnership with Sales team and regional Buyers.
  • Monitor and approve all freight transactions, including review of freight adders on a semi-annual basis.
  • Oversee the annual physical inventory process and regularly scheduled cycle counts.
  • Develop systems, processes and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources, including effective material movement and logistics, while delivering value to our customers.
  • Utilize third party rating tools, routing techniques and mapping tools that assist in making quality decision that minimize freight costs.
  • Monitor the receipt, coordination and safety of goods coming through the warehouse using the Warehouse Management System.
  • Ensure orders arrive and are dispatched on time to appropriate destinations and in expected quantities.
  • Trace history of items to determine reasons for discrepancies between inventory and stock control records; recommend corrective actions to resolve discrepancies.
  • Plan layout of warehouse and other storage areas, considering turnover, size, weight and related factors of items stored.
  • Analyze records and recommend corrective action for reported non-usable, aged and excess stock.
  • Review records for accuracy of information and compliance with established procedures, and to determine adequacy of inventory levels.
  • Monitor and evaluate expectations and performance of warehouse and delivery staff through coaching and development opportunities.
  • Promote a high level of customer focus and lead a Quality Managed warehouse environment; create an environment that encourages respect, teamwork, communication, customer satisfaction and productivity between team members and following the Integrity Service model.
  • Communicate and ensure all requirements pertaining to warehousing/ material handling, safety and shipping are followed by staff.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma or GED Equivalent required.
  • Associates Degree preferred.
  • Minimum 5 years experience in a warehouse environment, including supervisory experience.
  • Proven track record in a team development role.
  • Experience with order picking, shipping, receiving, inventory counts, pick/pack.
  • In-depth knowledge of FIFO, OSHA, Safety Awareness and HAZMAT shipping.
  • Management experience within a Quality System such as ISO 9001 or similar strongly preferred.
  • Forklift Certification strongly preferred.
  • Must be proficient in MS Office; ability to learn and master internal systems required.
Why should you join Composites One?
  • CULTURE: This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.
  • INTEGRITY: The foundation of all strong relationships is TRUST. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and Team Members to build meaningful relationships!
  • CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION: To remain successful, we must continuously improve and innovate. At Composites One, we value collaboration, and sharing ideas so that we can grow and drive continuous improvement and innovation together.

Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve!

Pleasant Grove, UT | Full-time, Hourly

Reach new heights in your career with one of the fastest growing industries in the country. At VIKOR, you have the opportunity to challenge yourself and become part of a team that strives for unity and is dedicated to elevation.

VIKOR is currently looking to add to its team of dedicated individuals with a full-time Hydrovac Operator in Pleasant Grove, UT. As a Hydrovac Operator, you will install underground utilities for power, fiber, and communications sites around the Midwest and Mountain states. ‍

General Responsibilities:

  • Working with 811 to assure that locates are done
  • Operation of a hydrovacc to excavate and identify existing utilities
  • Operation of directional drill, locator, excavator, skid loader, and other heavy equipment
  • Drilling underground utilities
  • Provide employee required tools
  • Treat company tools and equipment with good care and keeping
  • Receive and follow direction of crew chief
  • Assist crew chief in assuring jobs are brought in on time
  • Assist in training new employees as directed

Responsible for Safety

Because of the nature of the work at VIKOR, we are dedicated to and obsessed with safety. That means all of our employees are, too. If you join the VIKOR team, you will be expected to follow all the safety and regulatory policies and procedures put in place by VIKOR and OSHA in order for all team members to feel confident and protected during the workday. This includes attending the daily safety meetings, maintaining a clean driving record and frequently inspecting trucks and equipment.

The VIKOR Culture

We believe people do their best work when they feel heard and supported. That is why we strive to live out our values of UNITY, DEDICATION and ELEVATION every day. Our employees experience an environment centered on respect, allowing them to perform at their highest level.

VIKOR specializes in commercial tower construction, maintenance, and service work for the wireless, utility, and wind energy industries. With offices in Sioux Falls, SD; Rapid City, SD; Pleasant Grove, UT; Denver, CO; Tulsa, OK; Sebree, KY; Phoenix, AZ; and Bismarck, ND our geographic footprint spans from the Great Plains to the Mountain States.


For more information contact Human Resources at ctucker@vikor.com or call (605) 331-6972.

Who we are: *
Sprague is passionate about delivering the diverse products and programs that warm, power and move the world. We keep homes warm through Northeastern winters and hospitals cool through summer. We help small businesses focus on serving their communities, and our renewable fuels keep our country’s infrastructure running. From importing wind energy components to deploying leading-edge solar technology to help power terminal facilities, we are committed to continually evolving to meet our customers’ changing energy needs. Sprague takes a collaborative, customer-centric approach to providing best-in-class energy products and related services throughout the Northeast. As a publicly-traded company (NYSE: SRLP) founded in 1870, we pride ourselves on offering customers the expert solutions and high-quality service that help their businesses thrive in any market landscape.
Sprague values innovation, safety, integrity, and people. We know that our people are what set us apart from our competition, and we work hard to make sure each employee across our 20+ locations knows how important they are to our organization. We recently surveyed our employees to ask them their favorite part of the job. Unanimously, they answered, "The people I work with." You are part of a team and a family at Sprague, and everyone works together to ensure both the success of the company and of the individual.
*
What we offer: *
In addition to great coworkers, you’ll enjoy perks like medical benefits and retirement contributions that 
start on your first day
. Sprague also provides tuition reimbursement for any employee that would like to further their education. Do you like to get involved where you work? Is giving back important to you? It’s important to us, too! 
Sprague donates back
 to the communities in which we live and work every year and provides opportunities for employees to support the charity of the week. In addition, Sprague offers paid volunteer time to allow employees to support charities which are meaningful to them. Sprague has a range of committees to support varying initiatives (Sustainability, Charitable, Scholarship, Innovation, etc.). Sprague is a place that 
cares about
 
its employees, 
its* community*, and about creating a place where people want to come to work every day.
Plus, we have some great benefits!
401(k) Traditional and Roth plans with employer match of 60% of the first 6% of the employee’s contribution
Defined Contribution Plan with an automatic 5% contribution from Sprague

Choice of high deductible and PPO Health Plans to fit your individual needs
Wellness Program, and gym membership to a nearby facility

Job Description Summary

As Product Manager in the Product Engineering team, you will lead development of new wind turbine blades, from initial idea to implementation in LM and non-LM factories, according to the LM Wind Power product development manual.



Furthermore, you will be responsible for full lifecycle product ownership; including product optimization and management of factory/field support.



Implementation and managing of product and customer related challenges will be done in close cooperation and with support from Regional functions in US, India and China.

Job Description

About us:

LM Wind Power, a GE Renewable Energy business is a world leading supplier of blades and service to the wind industry. The wind turbine industry is becoming increasingly complex, with radical progress made over the last few decades, providing great opportunities for professional development and a work environment that promotes initiative and creativity. If working in a company which creates state-of-the-art technology and processes attracts you, LM Wind Power has a career for you.

Why we come to work:

At GE Renewable Energy, our Project Managers work with integrity, great commitment, and incredible collaborative skills. Their projects can be global and complex, so they thrive under pressure and complicated management chains. While the work can be tough, the sense of pride they feel at the end result motivates our Project Managers to hang tough and focus on outcomes. Through your personal integrity and unparalleled organizational skills, you can work in a role that delivers an incredible sense of accomplishment, making a mark on the future of our world.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Develop and implement new blade models in LM and non-LM factories, adhering to customer requirements.

Project execution according to the agreed schedule, cost, budget, and product requirements.

Ensure commitment from internal stakeholders, working closely with cross-functional teams in accordance with LM tollgate process for NPI blades

Full product lifecycle ownership; including continuous improvement of existing products and managing factory/field issues.

Communicate project status, risk, and milestones to internal and external stakeholders.

Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Leads small projects with low risks and resource requirements.

Explains information; developing skills to bring team members to consensus around topics.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in mechanical engineering, aeronautical engineering, or equivalent).

Minimum 3 years of project management or product development experience.

Desired Characteristics:

Project management skills and proven ability to manage multiple priorities and work through ambiguity to deliver results.

Demonstrated leadership to successfully motivate and drive accountability for diverse teams through involvement, safety and collaboration in a global organization.

Experience with the interfaces between the customer, design engineering, and manufacturing.

Extensive knowledge of wind turbine blade designs, materials, manufacturing & operations.

Strong English language skills (verbal and writing).

Lean Six Sigma certification

Overview


Avangrid Renewables, a subsidiary of AVANGRID, Inc. (NYSE: AGR), is a leading developer, owner, and operator of renewable energy facilities in the United States with an eight-gigawatt portfolio of onshore wind and solar projects across 22 states. Avangrid Renewables’ offshore wind business is pioneering this new industry with a development pipeline of five gigawatts off the East Coast. Our offshore portfolio consists of our 50% ownership in the first-in-the-nation Vineyard Wind 1 project, which will deliver 800 MW of clean energy into Massachusetts starting in 2023. Additionally, Avangrid Renewables owns 100% of Park City Wind, an 804 MW project to serve the state of Connecticut and Commonwealth Wind, a project that will deliver up to 1200 MW to Massachusetts. Finally, Avangrid Renewables owns 100% of Kitty Hawk Offshore Wind that has the potential to deliver 2,500 MW of clean energy into Virginia and North Carolina. The company will also actively pursue additional lease areas in the Atlantic and Pacific Coasts and the Gulf of Mexico.

We aspire to be the employer of choice by providing purposeful and challenging work revolutionizing the renewable energy industry in the United States. This role will support the senior management team that is developing, constructing and operating large scale offshore wind projects which will provide affordable, clean energy and will have a transformational impact on local communities. Avangrid Renewables’ offshore business is located in Boston, Massachusetts.

Purpose


The Manager – OSW (Offshore Wind) WTG (Wind Turbine Generator) Engineering role is focused on assisting with the delivery of operational requirements in the US Offshore business. Working with Contractors and multiple departments within Offshore Operations and Commercial Services to ensure that Avangrid’s long term asset value and production revenue is maximized. The role will be focused on supporting the wind turbine equipment in Avangrid’s Offshore wind projects and will interface with the wind turbine OEMs and O&M service providers. This position is based in Boston, MA, on a Hybrid schedule.

Belonging to the Offshore Operations Team the Manager – OSW WTG Engineering will be responsible for defining and implementing robust and cost-effective engineering strategies for the operational requirements including management of contractors and associated interfaces, and ensuring quality, best practices and excellent H&SE performance are applied.

The Manager – OSW WTG Engineering will also be responsible for building and leading the WTG engineering team. This team will support the various projects in all matters related to WTG and will also liaise with the wider O&M Global teams for implementing lessons learned from Iberdrola’s group’s projects into the US projects and exchanging best practices.

The Manager – WTG Engineering is responsible for providing high quality and consistent service across offshore projects within Avangrid.

The individual will be working as part of a global business with activities in many countries across US, UK, and the rest of the world. The position may require travel to various locations.

Offshore industry is still relatively immature, and a key focus is on driving down cost. This role will play a large part in developing initiatives to reduce the cost of service during the operational phase.

Responsibilities


  • Delivery of robust and cost-effective engineering strategies for the operational requirements, providing engineering support, assistance and recommendations to ensure delivery within time, to budget and quality following industry best practice and observing the maximum respect for Health, Safety and the Environment to ensure regulatory and legal compliance’
  • Manage WTG engineering team, develop talent, and provide mentorship to junior engineers
  • Implement offshore standards, procedures, tools, best practices, and quality requirements.
  • Develop technical specifications for maintenance agreements.
  • Developing HSE strategies for operations and ensuring a high standard of health and safety awareness is maintained.
  • Provide advice on operational solutions / risk levels affecting technical integrity or asset performance to Principal Project Managers to ensure that cost effective solutions are identified, fully evaluated and the risk profile is fully understood.
  • Make technical recommendations to Project Managers based on the condition of the assets, production, and other KPIs.
  • Support the coordination of EPC interfaces and Project Services Engineering Team to ensure the operational requirements are identified, fully evaluated, and actioned during project execution.
  • Liaise with the other Global Offshore Business Hub Engineering teams ensuring lessons learned and best practices are capture and shared across the different Offshore Projects.
  • Deliver technical due diligence to the handover from construction and the transition through end of warranty of offshore wind assets.
  • Ensure that all assessment, advice, and recommendations are fully documented in accordance with all internal procedures and industry best practice, and that sufficient technical and commercial due diligence (whether internal or external) exists to support those business decisions.

Competencies

  • Be a role model
  • Be agile
  • Collaborate and Share
  • Develop Self & Others
  • Empower to grow
  • Focus to achieve results
  • Technical Skills

Skills and Requirements


  • Degree in engineering, math, physics, or other technical discipline
  • Postgraduate experience, preferable in operation of wind turbines
  • Some experience with offshore wind operations preferred.
  • Experience of renewables / power generation industry preferred.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Developed report writing and presentation skills and ability to summarize parameters and drivers impacting the scope of works.
  • Good organizational and operational skills with the ability to link this awareness to technical judgement and decision making.
  • Good planning and analysis skills with the ability to look forward and anticipate problems and thereafter plan and implement mitigating solutions to negate the effect of such problems.
  • Ability to support the management of a scope of works which require interface and coordination. Advice on the impact of technical/ specialist risks and issues and the viability of solutions recommended.
  • Experience and understanding of technical due diligence.
  • Problem solving – dealing with conflicting requirements
  • Tenacity, persistence, and determination to succeed in overcoming obstacles.
  • High capacity for change.
  • Experience of working in teams involved in large projects in international environments.
  • Pro-active and diligent approach.
  • Sound relationship management skills and confidence working with senior colleagues.
  • Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
  • Analyze technical/ specialist risks and issues and the viability of solutions recommended.
  • Computer literacy, with a good working knowledge of Microsoft Office components especially Excel and database packages, e.g., Microsoft Access, and programming languages as well as an ability to deal with new software.
  • Eligible to work in the US
  • Flexible to travel around the US and overseas
  • Ability to climb 100-meter steel towers on a regular basis to perform engineering inspections of wind turbines
  • Ability to occasionally lift items weighing up to 50 pounds.
  • Ability to complete GWO basic safety and sea survival training

TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.
TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.


About the Role


We are looking for an experienced, highly organized technical manager to lead production and development operations in our quickly growing, high-volume automotive composites manufacturing press hall area. The manager will be responsible for the technical oversight of all critical process equipment and the launching of new equipment. The electro-mechanical systems include programable fiber cutting systems, hydraulic presses, resin injection systems, robotic pick-n-place, CNC cutting and machining systems, and ancillary support equipment. The manager will develop capacity plans, build and manage department schedules, assess and manage resource needs.


The manager will be responsible for managing their department and working with support operations to ensure EH&S standards, materials, labor, planning, maintenance, and quality support needs for operations are being met to satisfy customer and business expectations while ensuring compliance to our IATF / ISO certified QMS.


If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role.


To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee several operations at a time with excellent time management and interpersonal skills.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Assume ownership of press hall production process including meeting production deadlines and quality specifications.

 
Troubleshoot and solve challenging integrated equipment systems, support equipment, tooling design, and processing problems.

 
Lead the development, implementation, and sustaining of a robust TPM system to drive significant OEE sustained improvements with goal to meet >/= 85%

 
Improve shop organization and production workflow utilizing 5S and lean initiatives.

 
Ensure all needed and developed safeguards are in place and maintained in areas where autonomous operations are performed by equipment and robotic systems.

 
Estimate labor resources and capacity requirements for product build schedule.

 
Maintain daily Gemba meetings are supported and effective in driving communication and continual improvement

 
Provide updates to senior management on status of operations.

 
Provide day-to-day direction for subordinate team members.

 
Provide leadership to maintain an engaged and motivated work force.




Who we’re looking for: 



 
Four-year degree in technical field such as mechanical or industrial engineering, plus 5 years of experience in machine building/design; 5 years of production experience in automation; 3 years of management experience in production environments; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 
Experience leading lean initiatives including TPM, SMED, 5S, and Kaizen events

 
Experience in automotive manufacturing environment with ISO and IATF standards certification.

 
Experience in leading RCCA projects, FMEA’s, Control Plans, and Flow Plans

 
Very strong computer skills, particularly with the MS Office suite.

 
Knowledge of safety standards for a manufacturing environment.

 
Substantial knowledge of manufacturing and assembly processes such as machining, grinding, CNC, hand assembly, fasteners, etc.




Extra Skills & Abilities



 
SolidWorks or comparable CAD experience.

 
Experience with project management methods, practices and tools including scoping, facilitations, delegation, and risk management best practices.

 
A strong machine maintenance background.

 
Experience with the application of motion components and electric actuators.

 
Experience with automation or manufacturing related equipment.

 
Experience working within cross-functional teams to handle multiple priorities and meet scheduled milestones.

 
Ability to accurately estimate the level of effort required to complete a project build on time and within budget.

 
Desire and capability to coach and mentor direct reports and other project partners.

 
Demonstrated ability to create drawing packages, electronic bills of materials and engineering change orders.




Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island.

Position Description
 
 
Supervise the prioritization, development, implementation, maintenance, and continuous improvement of the Blade Engineering function to optimize turbine component reliability and cost. Supervise and coordinate a highly skilled and committed team of Engineers focused on ensuring the reliability of wind turbine components. Engage and influence internal, external, local, and global stakeholders to take appropriate action to improve overall reliability and customer satisfaction. Supports the business case creation, validation, and escalation of solution development and upgrades associated with turbine components.

Facilitate escalation of relevant CIM and component upgrades to Group functions and collaborate on acceptable solutions.
 
  
Establish aspirational and achievable goals for the team and project progress and achievement of goals.
 
  
Influence relevant stakeholders as needed to accomplish AME Service reliability goals.
 
  
Direct efficiency via continuous improvement of processes, tools, and collaborative relationships.
 
  
Write, review, or present technical reports, presentations, and customer communications to internal, external, local, and global stakeholders. Ensure personnel targets are met.
 
  
Uphold, adhere to, and promote safe practices.
 
  
Travel domestically and internationally up to 25%.

5+ years of leadership experience in a specialized field
 
  
5 or more years of experience in the wind industry is a preference

Professional methodical and problem-solving skills; ability to develop clear and repeatable solutions to complex problems and use sound judgment in choices
 
  
Professional ability to communicate in English, professional oral, written communication, and presentation skills.
 
  
Achieves work results through reflective planning and productive actions.
 
  
Commitment to customer service, quality, and continuous improvement in processes and knowledge sharing.
 
  
Flexibility, collaboration, teamwork, and resourcefulness.
 
  
Professional interpersonal skills and proven ability to interface with senior management confidently with regard to technical issues. Ability to perform in a time-sensitive setting and changing work environment.

About Vestas
 Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We specialize in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.
 Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than our competitors in the renewable energy arena.  With 29,000 employees globally, Vestas is a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Job Description Summary

Inspect, plan and repair wind turbine blades, fill in for Service Supervisor and ensure EHS compliance within the team.

Job Description

About us:

LM Wind Power, a GE Renewable Energy business is a world leading supplier of blades and service to the wind industry. The wind turbine industry is becoming increasingly complex, with radical progress made over the last few decades, providing great opportunities for professional development and a work environment that promotes initiative and creativity. If working in a company which creates state-of-the-art technology and processes attracts you, LM Wind Power has a career for you.

Why we come to work:

At GE Renewable Energy, our service teams keep our world moving. They’re adaptable, determined, and safety-focused, thriving in high-pressure situations. They’re the kind of people who dig deep for answers, work collaboratively with the right teams to drive

solutions, and who sit back and smile when they know they have done a great job. As part of this team, you’ll be rewarded with autonomy and trust, a collaborative, supportive team, and the chance to be empowered and successful, every single day

Role Summary/Purpose:

The Lead Service Technician role will complete field and workshop based work as required. The role provides on site technical direction, hands on service, and leadership during installation and maintenance of customer owned blades and components. The Lead Tech will also ensure EHS compliance within the team. The role will also fill in for the Service Supervisor on an as needed basis.

Essential Responsibilities:

Prepare job planning documents that define the scope of work to be performed through engineering instructions, drawings, and process instructions. Be responsible for ensuring the team is performing daily/weekly/monthly inspections on tools, equipment, and PPE.

Travel to job sites

Perform blade repairs according to the specified instructions.

Prepare applicable service documentation including details of repairs.

Perform inspections and communicate with LM Wind Power staff appropriately.

Communicate with customers regarding service work

Ensure site rules, regulations and procedures are being followed at all times.

Fill in for Service Supervisor when absent

Act as point of contact for EHS issues

Enter any information required in Gensuite and support incident follow up

Ensure inspections are completed

Arrange and execute quarterly drills

Maintain confined space documents

Plan and execute safety trainings to team

Identify, locate and adhere to the “LM Quality Policy”

Must wear the appropriate PPE and follow all health and safety instructions and dispose of chemicals appropriately.

Clean around work area throughout the day to maintain 5S.

Any other function as determined by the company

Qualifications/Requirements:

High School Diploma or GED required

Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience

Desired Characteristics:

Safety training

Previous manufacturing experience preferred

Previous composite materials experience preferred

Proven experience in leading field service team;

Strong communication and computer skills

Must be able to work at heights 250 feet above ground

Must be able to travel domestic and international for long periods of time

Must be able to climb and remain standing for extended periods of time

Must be able to work outside in a variety of weather conditions

Ability to work alone or as part of a team

Additional Information

GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

As a federal government contractor, GE may in the future be required to have U.S. employees fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Some GE customers currently have vaccination mandates that may apply to GE employees.

Relocation Assistance Provided: 
No

 We are searching for a Systems Manager to join our growing Information Technology Team!
 
 
 
 
Now is the time to move forward and make an impact!
 
 
 As a
 Systems Manager
 you will be responsible for 
hardware and software management
, 
managing the Systems Services Team
 and 
provide Level 2 support where necessary
, ensuring issues are escalated to management appropriately. As a service-oriented workplace culture, we are keen on supporting our internal as well as external customers. By allowing us to increase our scope of support to our internal team members and external customers, the Systems Manager is instrumental in scaling our brand and re-enforcing our guiding mission.
 
 
 How will you impact our organization as an Systems Manager on a daily basis?
 
 
 
  
Analyze, troubleshoot, and evaluate server and storage needs across the enterprise to ensure business applications, and users operate with minimal interruption.
 
  
Oversee the maintenance process of systems and related software; this includes Server hardware, storage, security systems, active directory, Azure AD, Azure, etc.
 
  
 
Manage vendor relations, ensure compliance with applicable licensing agreements, and manage supporting staff to support the IT team and company’s overall goals.
 
 
  
Possess a strong knowledge of Windows Server 2016 and higher experience (Active Directory / Domain Environment / DNS/Azure AD).
 
  
Knowledge of Linux-based operating systems (e.g., Ubuntu 16.04 and later), and virtualization.
 
  
 
Maintain system management and day-to-day operations of the IT function.
 
 
  
Oversee and document equipment performance, new hardware/software installations, and manage the patch management of relevant software platforms.
 
 
 

 
Leadership and Communications Skills:
 
 
 
  
Manage, mentor and coach new team members and junior level staff of the IT department.
 
  
Communicate a strong sense of urgency in solving problems and getting work done.
 
  
Ensure time, resources and actions are focused on priorities that contribute to meeting business goals and objectives.
 
  
Work to create an environment that values and rewards drive, initiative, and achievement of results.
 
  
Set the standard as a role model for providing Stellar Service; demonstrates positive, customer service focus.
 
 
 
 
Required Skills and Qualifications:
 
 
 
  
Familiarity with hardware technology and the global, regional, and local hardware architecture, including virtual servers.
 
  
Ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, or activities, making effective judgments as to prioritization and time allocation.
 
  
Knowledge of and experience with configuring, installing, and supporting the hardware and connectivity components of a single user workstation.
 
  
Knowledge of and experience with installing, configuring, and supporting the software, connectivity, computing and database services and interfaces available to a single-user workstation.
 
  
Expertise with network, computer, and mobile equipment for an enterprise comprised of numerous sites and hundreds of end users.
 
  
Knowledge of Microsoft Apps for communication and collaboration.
 
  
Bachelor’s degree in related field, and/or a combination of education and experience.
 
  
Minimum of five years of relevant IT technologies experience with emphasis on planning/managing enterprise-level data systems environment.
 
  
Additional experience with managing public cloud infrastructure and security management tools is required.

INTEGRITY:
