Job Description Summary
 To be part of the Installation Department of GE Wind Offshore. The department is responsible to engineer the offshore installation strategy of the wind turbine components and provides the methods, all the transport and installation tools and manpower, and is responsible to manage the offshore execution.
 
 
 
 The team is looking for a project manager for the development, manufacturing, test and validation phases of major tools used to ensure transport and installation of the offshore wind turbines
 

 
 Job Description

 
 About us:

 
 GE Renewable Energy is one of the world's leading offshore wind energy companies, with a portfolio of offshore wind turbines ranging from 6 MW to 14 MW that offer increased value to customers with proven performance, reliability, efficiency and availability. We have invested more than $400 million to develop the Haliade-X, an investment that will also drive down offshore wind farms’ levelized cost of energy, helping make offshore wind energy more competitive for our customers. The Haliade-X was the industry’s first 14MW offshore wind turbine to operate, and is the only 12+MW offshore wind turbine platform that has been operating for over two years, specifically at its Rotterdam prototype site.

 

 
 Why we come to work:

 
 At GE Renewable Energy, our Project Managers work with integrity, great commitment, and incredible collaborative skills. Their projects can be global and complex, so they thrive under pressure and complicated management chains. While the work can be tough, the sense of pride they feel at the end result motivates our Project Managers to hang tough and focus on outcomes. Through your personal integrity and unparalleled organizational skills, you can work in a role that delivers an incredible sense of accomplishment, making a mark on the future of our world.

 

 
 Essential Responsibilities:

 

  
 Manage multidisciplinary team to ensure on time delivery of major offshore installation tooling such as blade rack, blade transport frame or tower stands

  
 Organize project reviews to align design engineering, procurement, manufacturing, quality, transport and test and validation campaign

  
 Manage priorities, conduct business plan and report progress to Project Office direction and Project director

  
 Prepare and follow budget with Finance team and steering committee

  
 Follow-up manufacturer selection process with Sourcing and participate to survey

  
 Ensure on time delivery of the parts and manage subcontractor

  
 Organize quality and test plan, manage subcontractors, certification body and tooling designer

  
 Mobilize resources on site to run test and validation campaign and load-out operations

  
 Ensure reporting to project management team and Project Office team

 

 

 
 Qualifications/Requirements:

 

  
 Master’s degree or equivalent in mechanical engineering or strong experience in offshore project execution and management of operations

  
 Minimum of 8 years of experience in wind, construction or O&G sector

 

 

 
 Desired Characteristics :

 

  
 Experiences in conducting mechanical engineering subjects prior to move to project management including site operation including complex logistic and lifting of large components

  
 Experienced in contract management

  
 Good knowledge in mechanical and electrical engineering

  
 Good knowledge of Microsoft Office

  
 Knowledge in supply chain management

  
 Organized and transparent

  
 Good communication skills, high flexibility

  
 Able to work within a multicultural team

 

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        
 GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

       

      

     

    

   

  

 

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        
 GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable). 

       

      

     

    

   

  

 

 

 
As a federal government contractor, GE may in the future be required to have U.S. employees fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Some GE customers currently have vaccination mandates that may apply to GE employees.

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        
 Relocation Assistance Provided: 
Yes

Job Description Summary
 You will be part of the Project Management Office (PMO)—Marshalling Harbor department—in a cross-functional role which manages the various component preassembly functions at the New Bedford Marine Commerce Terminal, reporting directly to the Deputy Hub Manager. You may also be required to cover additional missions for the PMO to support the project.
 
 
 
 The Tower Preassembly Manager is responsible for overseeing and ensuring the full scope of Mechanical and Electrical/Preassembly operations of the Vineyard Wind 1 Project. The Tower Preassembly Manager is responsible for the management of the full tower erection on the quayside, ensuring they are carried out with good workmanship in accordance with project requirements/schedule, contractor procedures and strict compliance to EHS regulations and QA/QC policy.
 
 
 
 You will demonstrate excellent communication, proactivity, and in-depth knowledge in the field of Mechanical and Electrical completion/construction. The successful candidate will also be expected to follow and enforce GE’s Quality Management System for the Project.
 
 
 
 The position will be based in New Bedford, MA for the Vineyard Wind 1 Project.
 

 
 Job Description

 
 Roles and Responsibilities

 

 

  
 Tower section(T1/T2/T3) lifting operation including Upending of tower sections

  
 Assembly of tower section to erect the full tower on their respective foundation

  
 Installation and termination of cables inside the tower

  
 Customization activities when necessary

  
 Preparation of the full tower for load-out to the feeder barge

  
 Manage all preassembly activities of the main WTG components within the Hub including activities such as heavy lifting, component handling and preservation, operation method reviews, and mechanical and electrical completion works to achieve Customer & GE OFW goals and objectives

  
 Measure the on-time delivery of tower pre-assembly and loadout activities

  
 Verify that the work tasks are performed safely and in accordance with the approved procedure(s)

  
 Oversee the development of all Tower pre-assembly method statements and lift plans

  
 Manage all technical aspects of tower preassembly activities including all SIMOPS/COMOPS activities if necessary.

  
 Ensure all required equipment is mobilized and operational, including main components (nacelles, towers, and blades)

  
 Manage barge loadouts and backloading activities on quayside

  
 Ensure preassembly activities completed in time to meet internal targets and key loadout dates

  
 Support the issuing of Mechanical & Electrical certificates to make sure the tower is preassembled according to the schedule and quality procedure

  
 Ensure that highest level of Environmental, Health & Safety (EHS) standards are enforced and applied

  
 Sign work permits prior to start of lifting or preassembly activities

  
 Ensure that all EHS requirements are met prior to launch of operation. Ensure that documentation is in order and available (work permit, lift plans, Method Statements & Risk Assessment including all certificates as required)

  
 Troubleshooting and management of punch lists

  
 Ensure Toolbox Talks with the Marshalling Hub subcontractor are completed on each day of operations. Oversee toolbox talks and/or pre-lift meetings prior to the start of any preassembly operations

  
 Confirm with the Marshalling Hub subcontractor that Tooling, Material and PPE used for the operation is available, incl. certificate (when applicable)

  
 Interface with the warehouse team daily

  
 Management of offshore and onshore preassembly kits for bolting, tooling, and M&E equipment

  
 Confirm with Hub subcontractor that personnel have acquired the appropriate levels of training and certification for their respective tasks

  
 Monitor operations performed by the subcontractor on WTG components during Storage, Preservation, Preassembly and Loadout.

  
 Collect all required documentation provided by the subcontractor at the end of the operation and update system accordingly.

  
 Share any EHS, non-conformance or damage reports with the EHS or Quality team.

  
 Capture and escalate all changes in scope, schedule. Advise of any major issues, especially those affecting EHS, or schedule aspects of the contract to the Deputy Hub Manager

  
 Work on the Vineyard Wind 1 Marshalling Hub daily

  
 Undertake other tasks as may be requested by the PMO.

 

 

 
 Required Qualifications

 

  
 Bachelor's Degree

  
 Minimum of 8 years of experience managing Mechanical/Electrical/Construction activities

 

 

 
 Desired Characteristics

 

  
 Proven experience working on complex construction projects and schedule management

  
 Experience working on wind projects would be advantageous but is not a prerequisite

  
 Open to working with multinational people and team of diverse backgrounds and a subcontractor workforce made up of union and non-union personnel

  
 Knowledge & understanding of Heavy lifting activities and associated EHS requirements

  
 Strong experience managing Mechanical and Electrical activities

  
 Familiar with OSHA and standard site safety regulations

  
 Proven experience with subcontractor management

  
 Passionate and motivated

  
 Excellent ability to communicate at all levels

  
 Good inter-personal skills to bridge between customer representatives and various subcontractors working on site

  
 Ability to negotiate with different stakeholders

  
 Good English and excellent PC and Microsoft Office computer skills

 

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        
 GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

 #LI-Remote - This is a remote position

About SkySpecs


At SkySpecs, our mission is to simplify renewable asset management so less can do more for the planet. SkySpecs is helping to make this possible by automating the operations and maintenance of wind farms using advanced robotics paired with our custom-built asset performance management software, Horizon.


SkySpecs launched the world's first completely autonomous blade inspection product in 2016 with a custom-designed drone system. Since then, SkySpecs has inspected over 95,000 wind turbines in over 27 countries, becoming the world leader in understanding the health of turbine blades. Identifying issues with turbine blades is only the first step. In 2019 SkySpecs launched Horizon to be a platform for SkySpecs to offer a multi-layered solution for customers that includes: data collection, wind turbine blade engineering expertise, and a place for all stakeholders to collaborate to manage and analyze massive amounts of data, spot trends, and create plans for high-cost repair campaigns. In 2021, SkySpecs acquired two companies specializing in wind turbine drivetrain monitoring and financial management, further expanding our asset management portfolio. Ultimately, this will help reduce the cost and risk of operations for the industry


What we're looking for


SkySpecs is seeking a Solutions Manager who will work directly with customers, managing and delivering software onboarding, presales, and other consulting projects or analytic deliverables. You will be tasked with overseeing projects end-to-end, from ideation and scoping to delivery. You will work closely with customers to understand their unique renewable asset management needs and provide data-driven and actionable insights based on those needs. You will also be responsible for onboarding new customers into our SaaS platform (Horizon), overseeing any necessary training, process mapping, or technical integrations. In addition to working directly with customers, you will work with various SkySpecs teams to aid in the expansion of our solutions and products. The Solutions Manager role may at times be billable to the customer, and you may be responsible for generating revenue through your consulting projects, but your primary goal will be to help our customers learn how to best use our technology, software, and their own data to solve real business challenges in the renewable energy industry.


Requirements


Experience scoping and executing projects that deliver business value to enterprise, industrial, or commercial customers

3+ years in engineering or technical consulting practice and/or project management in a technical or renewable energy field

Strong communication skills to both internal and external stakeholders

Experience using and developing business intelligence tools such as Sisense or Tableau to perform analysis on large datasets that drive business value

Customer-focused with a self-starter mentality

Demonstrated project management skills in services, analytics, implementation, or technical analysis projects

BA/BS in Business, Engineering, or another technical/analytical field

Willing collaborator with cross-functional team experience

Comfort dealing with ambiguous situations and solving unique problems

Willingness to travel up to 25%


Nice to Have


Enterprise software implementation project experience

MBA or master's in engineering, supply chain, or another technical field.

Renewable or wind energy industry experience

Startup experience


The Work


As a SkySpecs' Solutions Manager, your role is to work together with customers to maximize the value they derive from SkySpecs' products and services. You will be responsible for developing, managing, and executing services and implementation projects for key customers, using their data and SkySpecs' expertise, analytics, and BI tools. You will need to have a deep technical understanding of the SkySpecs products, as well as a big-picture understanding of the challenges that our customers face, and the technologies and methods needed to solve those challenges. You will:


Create project plans for customers that account for project timelines, budgets, and expected deliverables.

Develop statements of work for customer projects, track billable/non-billable time and revenue generation.

Manage data collection, analysis, tracking, and execution of projects timely, accurately, and exceeding customers' expectations.

Manage technical implementation and integration projects, change management, and process development projects to bring customers into the Horizon platform.

Deliver analytic findings, presentations, and dashboards through SkySpecs' Horizon platform focused on providing business value to customers.

Talk to customers regularly to better understand their priorities and pain points, offering solutions and support whenever possible.

Foster relationships with key customers and broaden adoption of our products within their companies.

Work closely with Sales, Solutions Engineering, and Business Development roles to ensure customers' understanding of the services and capabilities available to them and that their needs are being met and communicated

Work closely with Product Management and Engineering to ensure that customer feedback and industry challenges are incorporated into future SkySpecs products and services


You are …


A motivated self-starter, able to prioritize, multitask and operate in the fast-paced environment of a growth-stage company

Comfortable creating processes and procedures where none may yet exist

Extremely focused on customer needs

A strong verbal and written communicator


Perks You'll Receive


A flexible work schedule and work environment

The respect of your teammates regardless of department or skillset

The option of working remotely when it suits you and your team

A fun, energetic, often zany workplace that is open and accepting of all interests

A great downtown Ann Arbor office with access to coffee, shopping, bars, restaurants, etc.

An open vacation policy (our policy is: Get your work done; be reliable; go above and

beyond because you want to; and take rest and relaxation when you need it!).

Medical, dental, and vision insurance

Sprague is passionate about delivering the diverse products and programs that warm, power, and move the world. We keep homes warm through Northeastern winters and hospitals cool through summer. We help small businesses focus on serving their communities, and our renewable fuels keep our country’s infrastructure running. From importing wind energy components to deploying leading-edge solar technology to help power terminal facilities, we are committed to continually evolving to meet our customers’ changing energy needs. As a valued team member, the E. Providence Terminal Operator will work in a team environment, alongside leadership, to optimize efficiency while focusing on safety on every shift. Being a member of Sprague's terminal operations will give you the opportunity to execute a variety of operations including but not limited to taking in and off-loading ships/barges, conducting tank to tank transfers, assisting and training customers to load product, preventative maintenance, customer service and general upkeep of the terminal. Through on-the-job training, a successful terminal operator will have access to apply for promotional opportunities throughout our entire network of terminals. And you will also be able to enjoy extensive employee benefits including medical, dental and retirement as well as paid time off. Duties and Responsibilities: Assisting with loading and offloading of vessels Gauging oil and gasoline tanks Providing rack customer assistance Conducting Detex Rounds Troubleshooting VRU issues Maintenance and repair of storage tanks, loading rack and dock. Maintenance of grounds, buildings and/or equipment Conducting scheduled equipment inspections and repairs Operating of terminal equipment and machinery Data entry and tracking Participating in security and oil spill drills and exercises Education/Experience: Experience in bulk fuel storage plants preferred. Proficient in basic math, including fractions. Working knowledge of mechanical trades Minimum of 2 years' experience as a general laborer Basic computer knowledge Knowledge of blueprint reading piping diagrams, boiler, and fuel specifications preferred. Willingness to do shift work including nights, weekends, holidays, and overtime as needed. Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license. Must be able to obtain a valid TWIC card. High school diploma or equivalent Physical activity/strength requirements are demanding and may include: Occasionally (1%-33%) Frequently ( 34%-66%) Constantly (67%-100%) Frequent standing, climbing-stairs ladders, slopes (i.e., tank ladders/stairs/ramps), grasping/handling, and in/out of truck. Constant walking. Occasional bending/stooping, squatting, reaching forward/overhead, crawling, kneeling, twisting, neck flexion/extension, balancing, and sitting. Constant lifting/carrying 1-10 lbs., frequently 11-20lbs, occasionally 21-100lbs plus lbs. (i.e. oil, steel parts, spouts, tools) Constant pushing/pulling 1-10lbs, frequently 11- 50 lbs, occasionally 51- 100 plus lbs. (i.e. mooring lines, barge and ship hoses) Frequent exposure to outside weather conditions including extreme heat/cold, noise, petroleum products, chemical agents and fumes and odors and slippery surfaces caused by weather conditions. Occasional exposure to dust, and vibrations Frequent driving, vehicle equipment and use of power tools/equipment. hearing and talking We want to hear from you! Do you like to solve problems and consider yourself forward thinking? If you are looking for a place where you can learn a lot about the energy industry while constantly challenging yourself, then Sprague is your place. Sprague employees are dedicated and driven, and we constantly strive to be the best in the industry. We work best as a team, knowing that collaboration leads to innovation and the best customer experience. As a company that has continued to evolve with the energy industry for the last 150 years, we are looking for hardworking employees to join us as we remain at the forefront of the industry. What we offer: Do you like to get involved where you work? Is giving back important to you? It’s important to us, too! Sprague donates back to the communities in which we live and work every year. And, we collect employee donations to support the charity of the week. Sprague has a range of committees to support varying initiatives (Sustainability, Charitable, Scholarship, Innovation, etc.). Sprague is a place that cares about its employees, its community, and about creating a place where people want to come to work every day. Plus, we have some great benefits! Medical Dental Paid Time Off Retirement Plan with an automatic 5% contribution Come join us to learn why we are consistently celebrating 20-, 30-, and even 40-year anniversaries here at Sprague! Sprague is an EEO/AA employer. We strongly encourage minorities, females, Vets, and individuals with disabilities to apply. As a federal contractor we adhere to OFCCP employment regulations. Click here for OFCCP compliance information Job Type: Full-time

customer service, safety/risk management

receiving, transportation

Analyzes and manages the warehousing and delivery functions to continuously improve the efficiency levels and safety.

  
Monitors and evaluates expectations and performance of DC staff through coaching and development opportunities.

Creates an environment that encourages teamwork, customer satisfaction, productivity and mutual respect between team members.

Click the logo above to learn more about Composites One!

 
 
 
 
 
 At Composites One our culture is founded on a clear set of Core Values that has at its core 
Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.
 Our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as one Team, respect each other in our daily interactions, and communicate effectively while doing the one thing that is critical to our success – taking care of our customers.

 
 
 
 
 
 Are you ready for a rewarding career?
 
 
 We are searching for a Systems Manager to join our growing Information Technology Team!
 
 
 
 
Now is the time to move forward and make an impact!
 
 
 As a
 Systems Manager
 you will be responsible for 
hardware and software management
, 
managing the Systems Services Team
 and 
provide Level 2 support where necessary
, ensuring issues are escalated to management appropriately. As a service-oriented workplace culture, we are keen on supporting our internal as well as external customers. By allowing us to increase our scope of support to our internal team members and external customers, the Systems Manager is instrumental in scaling our brand and re-enforcing our guiding mission.
 
 
 How will you impact our organization as an Systems Manager on a daily basis?
 
 
 
  
Analyze, troubleshoot, and evaluate server and storage needs across the enterprise to ensure business applications, and users operate with minimal interruption.
 
  
Oversee the maintenance process of systems and related software; this includes Server hardware, storage, security systems, active directory, Azure AD, Azure, etc.
 
  
 
Manage vendor relations, ensure compliance with applicable licensing agreements, and manage supporting staff to support the IT team and company’s overall goals.
 
 
  
Possess a strong knowledge of Windows Server 2016 and higher experience (Active Directory / Domain Environment / DNS/Azure AD).
 
  
Knowledge of Linux-based operating systems (e.g., Ubuntu 16.04 and later), and virtualization.
 
  
 
Maintain system management and day-to-day operations of the IT function.
 
 
  
Oversee and document equipment performance, new hardware/software installations, and manage the patch management of relevant software platforms.
 
 
 

 
Leadership and Communications Skills:
 
 
 
  
Manage, mentor and coach new team members and junior level staff of the IT department.
 
  
Communicate a strong sense of urgency in solving problems and getting work done.
 
  
Ensure time, resources and actions are focused on priorities that contribute to meeting business goals and objectives.
 
  
Work to create an environment that values and rewards drive, initiative, and achievement of results.
 
  
Set the standard as a role model for providing Stellar Service; demonstrates positive, customer service focus.
 
 
 
 
Required Skills and Qualifications:
 
 
 
  
Familiarity with hardware technology and the global, regional, and local hardware architecture, including virtual servers.
 
  
Ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, or activities, making effective judgments as to prioritization and time allocation.
 
  
Knowledge of and experience with configuring, installing, and supporting the hardware and connectivity components of a single user workstation.
 
  
Knowledge of and experience with installing, configuring, and supporting the software, connectivity, computing and database services and interfaces available to a single-user workstation.
 
  
Expertise with network, computer, and mobile equipment for an enterprise comprised of numerous sites and hundreds of end users.
 
  
Knowledge of Microsoft Apps for communication and collaboration.
 
  
Bachelor’s degree in related field, and/or a combination of education and experience.
 
  
Minimum of five years of relevant IT technologies experience with emphasis on planning/managing enterprise-level data systems environment.
 
  
Additional experience with managing public cloud infrastructure and security management tools is required.

 

 
 
 
 
 
 Why should you join Composites One?
 
 
 
  
CULTURE:
 This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.
 
  
INTEGRITY:
 The foundation of all strong relationships is TRUST. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and Team Members to build meaningful relationships!
 
  
CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION:
 
To remain successful, we must continuously improve and innovate. At Composites One, we value collaboration, and sharing ideas so that we can grow and drive continuous improvement and innovation together.
 
 
 
 
Click here to learn more about our benefits!
 
 
 Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve!

 

  
 
 
 
 

  
About Us:

 
 
 

  
Composites One LLC
 is the leading supplier of essential materials for 
  
Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, Consumer Recreation and Construction Composites Manufacturing.
 We have a global presence and operate 
  
44 
North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each Team Member with respect and offers opportunities for growth and personal success.
 
 
 
 Learn more about us at compositesone.com!

 
 
 
 
 
 Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
 
 At Composites One, all qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or other protected classification as defined by applicable law and regulation. 
 
 
ADA Accommodations
 
 Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please contact the ADA Coordinator by email at ADACoordinator@compositesone.com.

About SkySpecs
 
 
SkySpecs envisions a world where wind energy is the most affordable form of electricity and therefore ubiquitous around the world. SkySpecs is helping to make this possible by automating the operations and maintenance of wind farms using advanced robotics paired with our custom-built asset performance management software, Horizon. SkySpecs launched the world's first completely autonomous blade inspection product in 2016 with a custom designed drone system. Since then, SkySpecs has inspected over 50,000 wind turbines in over 25+ countries, becoming the world leader in understanding the health of turbine blades. Identifying issues with turbine blades is only the first step.
 
 
In 2019 SkySpecs launched Horizon to be a platform for SkySpecs to offer a multilayered solution for customers that includes: data collection, wind turbine blade engineering expertise, and a place for all stakeholders to collaborate to manage and analyze massive amounts of data, spot trends, and create plans for high-cost repair campaigns. Ultimately, this will help reduce the cost and risk of operations for the industry.
 
 
What will I be getting myself into?

 
 
 
SkySpecs will probably be unlike any place you've ever worked. You will find a high energy environment filled with incredibly smart people solving hard problems. SkySpecs values collaboration, multidisciplinary problem solving, and a mantra of ‘under-promise, over-deliver'. SkySpecs is at a critical growth period where there are an endless number of opportunities to make an impact.
 
 
As a Manufacturing Manager, you will:
 
 

  
Management of global manufacturing team members; roles and responsibilities, organizational development, performance management

  
 Implement effective communication to ensure a collaborative work environment

  
 Implement lean process controls to evaluate and improve quality and training

  
 Lead, develop and coordinate with cross-functional teams in the execution of manufacturing and engineering projects

  
 Setting KPIs and key metrics for the manufacturing team

  
 Maintaining department budget

  
 Inventory Management and cost control for manufactured products

  
 Part procurement

  
 Global facility oversight

  
 Collaboration with Head of Global Property for facility needs or build out

  
 Oversight of all Health, Safety and Environmental protocols and compliance in all global facilities, under the direction of SkySpecs' HSE Manager

  
 Global equipment allocation in coordination with Resource Management

  
 Support Applied Technology in pilot training and pilot feedback loop to improve technical training, field support and equipment maintenance

 

 
 Requirements of the job:
 
 

  
Bachelor's Degree in Manufacturing, Business Management or related field

  
 3-5 years experience in manufacturing management

  
 Excellent analytical, organizational, planning and communication skills; high attention to detail; consistent follow through; a stellar team player.

  
 Ability to travel up to 20% - domestic and international

  
 A valid driver's license and passport

 
 
 
Bonus points for:
 
 

  
experience in UAS or aviation industries

  
 Lean manufacturing certification

ABOUT SKYSPECS


At SkySpecs, our mission is to simplify renewable asset management so less can do more for the planet. SkySpecs is helping to make this possible by automating the operations and maintenance of wind farms using advanced robotics paired with our custom-built asset performance management software, Horizon.


SkySpecs launched the world's first completely autonomous blade inspection product in 2016 with a custom designed drone system. Since then, SkySpecs has inspected over 95,000 wind turbines in over 27 countries, becoming the world leader in understanding the health of turbine blades. Identifying issues with turbine blades is only the first step. In 2019 SkySpecs launched Horizon to be a platform for SkySpecs to offer a multi-layered solution for customers that includes: data collection, wind turbine blade engineering expertise, and a place for all stakeholders to collaborate to manage and analyze massive amounts of data, spot trends, and create plans for high-cost repair campaigns. In 2021, SkySpecs acquired two companies specializing in wind turbine drivetrain monitoring and financial management, further expanding our asset management portfolio. Ultimately, this will help reduce the cost and risk of operations for the industry.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

SkySpecs is seeking a Product Manager that will gain a deep working understanding of the SkySpecs' products and work with various stakeholders throughout the organization to coordinate various product activities. You will be tasked with helping SkySpecs take our autonomous inspection product to the next level to continue double-digit growth. The Product Manager role is a high-visibility role within the organization, and you will have the opportunity to work directly with customers to understand their needs, work with SkySpecs leadership on product strategy, work with Sales and Marketing to build go-to-market materials and to work with the technology teams to develop amazing software.

REQUIREMENTS

Product instincts that focus on the user and drive delivering value to the customer

3+ years in a software product management or product engineering role working on web-based applications

BA/BS in Business, Engineering, or another technical/analytical field

Expertise using business intelligence tools such as Tableau or Sisense to perform analysis on large datasets to drive business value

Demonstrated project management skills in development, implementation or technical analysis projects

Experience developing software requirements and communicating with development teams

Strong written, presentation, and communication skills to both internal and external stakeholders

Comfortable using SQL database tools to manage large datasets and manipulate data

Willingness to travel up to 25%

Based in the SkySpecs' Ann Arbor office

Renewable or wind energy asset management experience

Product design, user interface design, or software development experience

Pragmatic Marketing/Gartner marketing methodology experience

Startup experience

THE WORK

As a SkySpecs' Product Manager, your role is to build new products and features by combining existing ideas with new ideas from your experience and interactions with customers and prospects. You will need to have a deep technical understanding of the SkySpecs products, as well as a big-picture understanding of the challenges that face our customers and technologies needed to solve those challenges. You will:

Talk to customers as often as possible to better understand what they are doing, working on, and what challenges they have

Define product requirements and work with developers to design and build new features

Assist in QA of the software and documentation writing

Answer customer support questions and work with customers to find resolution on their issues

Work with Marketing to develop sales support materials, demos and use cases

Work with Sales to develop technical sales materials, inspection analysis materials, and demonstrations

Develop relationships with key customers and broaden adoption of our products within their companies

Work with the Solutions Delivery team to help deliver value to customers and improve internal products

PERKS YOU'LL RECEIVE

A great downtown Ann Arbor office with access to coffee, shopping, bars, restaurants, etc.

A fun, energetic, often zany workplace that is open and accepting of all interests

An open vacation policy (our policy is: Get your work done; be reliable; go above and beyond because you want to, and take rest and relaxation when you need it!).

A flexible work schedule and work environment

Health benefits

strategy

planning,
 and
 execution
 of the marketing communications team’s objectives.

 
 
Core responsibilities as the Marketing Communications Manager:

 

  
 Oversees marketing communication workstreams and leads in the development of the Marketing Communications team.

Must Haves

 Innate ability to pay attention to details when composing, typing, and proofing materials, establishing priorities, facilitating events, and meeting deadlines.

 Superior organizational and problem-solving skills.

 A minimum of 6 years’ experience managing complex marketing projects and/or teams is required.

  
 Knowledge of today’s communication tools and current trends as it relates to the professional environment is strongly preferred. 

  
Composites industry knowledge is a plus, but not required.

  
 Willingness to travel if required – up to 35%

  
 Advanced proficiency using MS Office software.

  
 Requires experience with Adobe Creative suite, internal database, and software systems. 

  
Experience with basic html, Office 365, Outlook, Teams, and SharePoint is preferred.

  
 Knowledge of Infographic applications and experience using email delivery systems such as Constant Contact or Mail Chimp.

doc_title: US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead
doc_description:
Local Unit & Position Description

Do you want to come help lead decarbonization and the advancement of Renewable Energy?

Are you excited about working with a diverse, collaborative team at the world s largest renewable energy consultancy? Do you have a passion for permitting renewable energy projects, and furthering your professional development in a company that truly puts people first?

At DNV our organizational culture and how we collectively influence the world for future generations matters deeply to us. Our team works every day to increase the widespread deployment and operation of renewables to address climate change and positively impact society; endeavors to achieve our purpose through the success of our customers; and strives to be high-performing and innovative. Our approach reflects the equity, respect, and diversity we wish to see in the world.

DNV s Environmental and Permitting Services (EPS) team is growing rapidly, and we are seeking a US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead to help us provide comprehensive permitting services in Midwest US and the rest of the United States (US). You will be responsible for overseeing a team and leading project development and environmental and permitting activities, including the preparation of local, state, and federal renewable energy permit applications, associated environmental and social impact studies, stakeholder engagement sessions, and land use and zoning permit applications for renewable energy projects located in the Midwest and, as well as other regions within and outside of the US. You will also be engaged in leading proposal efforts, business development for wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen facilities across the US, as well as assisting with project due diligence activities.

Our Customers can choose any number of consultancies to execute on specific tasks. However, our EPS team strives to develop long-term partnerships with our Customers, acting as their trusted advisor from the early site selection stage through to operations. Our Customers are at the forefront of the energy transition. Our team is nimble, highly experienced, and driven by our mission to ensure renewable energy projects are safely and sustainably sited, permitted, and operated.

Our team

The EPS team is comprised of siting, environmental, and permitting specialists who work directly with our Customers to help identify and address project risks for terrestrial wind, offshore wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen projects. Our mission is to guide the sustainable, responsible growth of the renewables industry by providing innovative environmental and permitting expertise to support the greater good.

To facilitate this work, excellent written and oral communication skills are paramount. Broadly, our work falls into four categories:

  • Biological services, including field surveys, habitat conservation plans, corporate avian and bat protection plans, review of mitigation strategies, and associated permitting.
  • Permitting services, providing support for permitting at the federal, state/provincial, and local level for wind, solar, battery storage and hydrogen projects; including stakeholder engagement.
  • GIS services, including mapping, constraints reviews, radiocommunication surveys, and critical issues analyses.
  • Siting services, including layout optimization, acoustical measurements, noise impact assessments, shadow flicker studies, blade/ice throw assessments, glint and glare studies, and visual impact studies.

This is a Remote position

What You ll Do

  • Oversee a team of project analysts, biologists, and engineers to deliver projects within allocated time and budget. Perform technical checking and initial approval of all work products completed by project team.
  • Lead the preparation and submission of permit applications, coordination of environmental fieldwork, authoring of environmental reporting documentation including critical issues analyses, technical permitting studies and management plans, Phase I ESAs, environmental impact assessments and technical project proposals and, agency consultation and stakeholder engagement programs.
  • Provide people leadership, coaching, and quality control for a team of approximately five.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with Midwest regulatory agencies (and/or other US regions).
  • Stay informed of applicable regulatory frameworks and participate in regulatory discussions and feedback discussions related to renewable energy developments in the US.
  • Actively seek out practical and realistic business development opportunities in the US. Prepare proposals and bids and engage in facilitating innovative and new service offerings to anticipate/meet market needs.

Position Qualifications

What is Required

  • Bachelor s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • At least 5 years of environmental and/or permitting experience in the US, preferably in the renewable energy industry
  • Advanced knowledge of environmental assessment regulatory frameworks as applied to renewable energy (wind, solar, or battery storage)
  • Experience engaging with and contacts within the federal and state regulatory agencies such as the USFWS, local communities, and Tribes or First Nations
  • Demonstrated skills in people leadership (academic and/or professional experience); and
  • Demonstrated skills in project management, agency consultation, environmental analysis, and business development, including experience building and maintaining relationships with a client base
  • Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
  • We conduct pre-employment drug and background screening

What is Preferred

  • Master s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • 8+ years of relevant experience preferred
  • Experience leading winning proposal efforts for Customers in the renewable energy industry;
  • Capable of travelling to projects in development, construction, and operation sites in varying locations (10%-20% annual time); and
  • Comprehensive understanding of the Midwest wind, solar, and battery storage markets (or other US regions)
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) or other technical accreditation such P.Eng., P.Geo, P.Biol., etc

*Immigration-related employment benefits, for example visa sponsorship, are not available for this position*What We Offer

  • Generous paid time off (vacation, sick days, company holidays, personal days)
  • Multiple Medical and Dental benefit plans to choose from, Vision benefits
  • Spending accounts FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, company-seeded HSA
  • Special programs Employee Assistance Program, ID theft protection, and accident and critical illness options for you and your family
  • Employer-paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace
  • 401(k) with company match
  • Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits
  • Tuition assistance
  • Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities
  • Advancement opportunities

**Benefits may vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionHow We Do ItWe Care, We Dare, We Share

DNV is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially.

DNV is proud to announce being named one of Houston s best places to work in the 2022 Houston Business Journal Best Places to Work competition.

For more information

https://www.eeoc.gov/know-your-rights-workplace-discrimination-illegal-poster

Read more here

Diversity at DNV

Meet our Employees

About DNV

Careers in DNV

Please visit our website at www.dnv.com

As required by the various Pay Transparency laws, DNV provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado, California, Washington, or New York. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the states of Colorado, California, Washington, and New York only, the range of starting pay for this role is $100,000 - $145,000

Company & Business Area Description

DNV is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions.

We provide assurance to the entire energy value chain through our advisory, monitoring, verification, and certification services. As the world's leading resource of independent energy experts and technical advisors, we help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry. We are committed to realizing the goals of the Paris Agreement, and support all stakeholders to transition faster to a deeply decarbonized energy system.

 Employment Type

 Company Overview

 Site Overview

  

  

    The Marine industrial division of Gurit is looking for a regional Sales Manager for the Westcoast
  

 

 
 
 

  

   
 Purpose of the Department Function

  

  

    Managing and owning all aspects of the sales process within the region – Westcoast from San Diego to Vancouver
  

 

 
 
 

  

   
 Description of the Role

  

  

   
Provide full periodic budgeting and forecasting 

   
 
   
Plan and lead the sales development for the region 

   
 
   
Develop the regional business in line with the business strategy 

   
 
   
Provide accurate and informed market / Sector intelligence

  

 

 
 
 

  

   
 Key Responsibilities

 market

 business strategy

 Skills and Experience

  

  

    Professional skills

 Why This Role is a Good Opportunity

 Applications Close Date

The WTG technician will perform fault finding, inspections-, maintenance- and repair works at offshore wind turbines. Those works will be done in joined teams with the turbine supplier or idenpendently.



LOCATION
Sassnitz; Port Neu Mukran; Germany



WORKING PATTERN
Permanent; full time; 14/ 14 rotation

RESPONSIBILITIES AND FUNCTIONS

  • Fault finding, Inspection, maintenance and repair of electrical, hydraulical and mechanical components at offshore wind turbines in accordance with European, national and company safety standards, norms and regullations
  • Statutory inspections, annual checks of safety equipment
  • Check and repair of cranes, ladders, Fallarrestsystems etc.
  • Check and repair of electrical components
  • Guidance and supervision of subcontractors
  • Execution of quality checks and audits
  • Support at generation or review of risk assessments and method statements
  • Maintenance and repair of tools and spares
  • Support of warehouse manager with administration and commissioning of spare parts
  • Reinforcement of the team at fire protection and fire fighting drills and exercises ( qualification as HLO/ HAD )
  • Provision of daily reports reflecting the executed works

MANDATORY SKILLS

  • Sucessfully completed vocational education preferable as electrician, industrial mechatronic or eelctrical engineer
  • Minimum 2 years experince in one of the above mentioned disciplins, preferably offshore
  • Fluent English and German skills, verbal and written
  • Medical fitness and willingness to work offshore
  • Ability to travel in Germany and abroad
  • Familiar with MS Office standard software

DESIRABLE SKILLS

  • Switching authorisation 33/66 kV
  • Experience in operations of cranes
  • GWO modules for offshore works

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Working in a fast growing industry with excellent future prospects
  • Adventurous job in an international environment with great team spirit
  • All technical trainings to fulfil the role
  • Long term employment
  • Competitive salary, performance related bonus and vacation package

Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.
 

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        

          Job Description
        

       

      

     

    

   

  

 

 

 

   Position Overview:
 

 

   As an Offshore Wind Turbine Generator (WTG) Manager, you will lead the technical efforts related to the wind turbine generators to be installed in multiple offshore wind projects. Such technical efforts will include evaluation of turbine supply offers, review of turbine supply contracts, coordinating WTG interfaces with foundation structures, assisting with WTG installation engineering, and coordinating commissioning activities for utility-scale offshore wind projects in Invenergy’s target markets throughout the world.
 

 

 

   Responsibilities:
 

 

  
 Technical & turbine technology
   

    
 Manage the technical efforts related to wind turbine generators across the organization for the offshore engineering team and offshore wind projects

    
 Work in collaboration with the Offshore Structural Manager, Offshore EYA & Siting Engineering Manager and Offshore Electrical Engineering Manager to optimize the layout for the wind turbines and inter-array cables

    
 Manage Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs), working in close collaboration with the procurement team, to manage the technical interface between OEMs and contractors

    
 Manage technical engineering consultants and contractors specialized in the installation of WTGs for offshore projects

    
 Maintain working knowledge of offshore wind turbine technology and affiliated technical and market trends

    
 Work with OEMs to optimize equipment selection for projects as it relates to power curves, operational modes, mechanical suitability considerations, and curtailment strategies

    
 Work with OEMs to identify, coordinate and improve control and logic architecture for the offshore wind farm

    
 Scale turbines model to for future project modeling (turbine dimensions, power curves, and foundation loads) plus benchmarking with consultants

    
 Work with OEMs on turbine site suitability and site-specific power curves

    
 Work with procurement team to determine best turbine options for each site

    
 Liaising with third party contractors to understand best construction methodologies and installation processes for the selected turbines

    
 Work with OEMs to understand operations and maintenance requirements during the O&M phase

    
 Collaborate in the design efforts for the inter-array and export cables designs for offshore wind farms, depending on the needs for the WTGs

    
 Prepare and supervise technical documentation for requisitions and solicitations to be used with OEMs, contractors and other third parties

    
 Liaise with OEMs, technologists, and manufacturers, to adapt designs according to the best industry practices and most recent design trends and products

    
 Coordinate loads and other required inputs from the OEMs to size foundations for WTGs and design the complete offshore wind farm

    
 Participate in the WTG sizing and layout optimization in collaboration with consultants and manufacturers

    
 Specify equipment and review/evaluate proposals in collaboration with consultants

    
 Provide WTG design inputs for offshore cables and substations

    
 Establish the required values and parameters for the WTG design to be collected during the offshore geophysical and geotechnical campaign in collaboration with the Offshore G&G Engineering Manager

    
 Participate in the preparation of WTG technical packages to be submitted as part of the permitting process

    
 Work and collaborate with the commercial and finance teams to provide necessary cost modeling inputs, and collaborate on cost optimization

    
 Coordinate design interface according to the recommendations provided by the certified verification agent (CVA)

    
 Coordinate work with other areas inside the organization as follows:

   

  
 Construction and installation
   

    
 Collaborate with OEMs and the procurement and logistics teams to define needs for transportation, as well as, marshalling and storage facilities

    
 Participate in the de-risk process to identify solutions for the installation of WTGs offshore

   

  
 Operations and maintenance
   

    
 Work on the list of spare parts and requirements in collaboration with the O&M team and OEMs

    
 Identify risks and potential issues for the WTGs during operations

    
 Participate in the identification of recycling options for blades and components

    
 Understand and coordinate improvements in the architecture and logic control system for a good WTG operation

   

  
 Engineering best practice
   

    
 Developing offshore wind engineering reference manual as it relates to evaluation of WTGs

    
 Attending relevant external training and workshops, supporting internal trainings and workshops, as required by the company

    
 Providing periodic reports to management as needed

   

 

 

 

   Required Skills:
 

 

  
 Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in an engineering or related technical discipline.

  
 10+ years of experience in the renewable energy industry.

  
 Proficient with Microsoft Office products including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

  
 Ability to multi-task and manage deliverables for multiple projects at a time

  
 Excellent verbal, writing, and interpersonal skills

  
 Demonstrated interest in offshore renewable energy

  
 Desire to work in a dynamic environment alongside people with multiple interests and backgrounds.

 

 

 

   Preferred Skills:
 

 

  
 5+ experience in offshore wind engineering

  
 Experience managing interfaces between contractors

  
 Be an effective leader and communicator - strong verbal skills are required

  
 International travels may be required.

 

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        

          Benefits
        

       

      

     

    

   

  

 

 

 

   Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), bonus, paid time off, etc.
 

 

 

   Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.

Job Summary:

A leading supplier of essential materials for Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, and Composites Manufacturing is seeking an experienced DC Operations Manager to join their growing team! The DC Operations Manager will be responsible for the oversight of the operational function of multiple distribution centers including customer service, safety/risk management, receiving, transportation, warehousing, maintenance operations, and business administration tasks.

  • Develop systems, process, and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources

  • Experience in supply chain, distribution, and/or logistics sectors in manufacturing or distribution industry required
  • Experience in the Composites industry is preferred

  • Experience in Aerospace is strongly preferred
  • High school diploma or GED is required

doc_description:
At Composites One our culture is founded on a clear set of Core Values that has at its core 
Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.
 Our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as one Team, respect each other in our daily interactions, and communicate effectively while doing the one thing that is critical to our success – taking care of our customers.
 
 
 Are you ready for a rewarding career?
 
 
 We are searching for a Systems Manager to join our growing Information Technology Team!
 
 
 
 
Now is the time to move forward and make an impact!
 
 
 As a
 Systems Manager
 you will be responsible for 
hardware and software management
, 
managing the Systems Services Team
 and 
provide Level 2 support where necessary
, ensuring issues are escalated to management appropriately. As a service-oriented workplace culture, we are keen on supporting our internal as well as external customers. By allowing us to increase our scope of support to our internal team members and external customers, the Systems Manager is instrumental in scaling our brand and re-enforcing our guiding mission.
 
 
 How will you impact our organization as an Systems Manager on a daily basis?
 
 
 
  
Analyze, troubleshoot, and evaluate server and storage needs across the enterprise to ensure business applications, and users operate with minimal interruption.
 
  
Oversee the maintenance process of systems and related software; this includes Server hardware, storage, security systems, active directory, Azure AD, Azure, etc.
 
  
 
Manage vendor relations, ensure compliance with applicable licensing agreements, and manage supporting staff to support the IT team and company’s overall goals.
 
 
  
Possess a strong knowledge of Windows Server 2016 and higher experience (Active Directory / Domain Environment / DNS/Azure AD).
 
  
Knowledge of Linux-based operating systems (e.g., Ubuntu 16.04 and later), and virtualization.
 
  
 
Maintain system management and day-to-day operations of the IT function.
 
 
  
Oversee and document equipment performance, new hardware/software installations, and manage the patch management of relevant software platforms.
 
 
 

 
Leadership and Communications Skills:
 
 
 
  
Manage, mentor and coach new team members and junior level staff of the IT department.
 
  
Communicate a strong sense of urgency in solving problems and getting work done.
 
  
Ensure time, resources and actions are focused on priorities that contribute to meeting business goals and objectives.
 
  
Work to create an environment that values and rewards drive, initiative, and achievement of results.
 
  
Set the standard as a role model for providing Stellar Service; demonstrates positive, customer service focus.
 
 
 
 
Required Skills and Qualifications:
 
 
 
  
Familiarity with hardware technology and the global, regional, and local hardware architecture, including virtual servers.
 
  
Ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, or activities, making effective judgments as to prioritization and time allocation.
 
  
Knowledge of and experience with configuring, installing, and supporting the hardware and connectivity components of a single user workstation.
 
  
Knowledge of and experience with installing, configuring, and supporting the software, connectivity, computing and database services and interfaces available to a single-user workstation.
 
  
Expertise with network, computer, and mobile equipment for an enterprise comprised of numerous sites and hundreds of end users.
 
  
Knowledge of Microsoft Apps for communication and collaboration.
 
  
Bachelor’s degree in related field, and/or a combination of education and experience.
 
  
Minimum of five years of relevant IT technologies experience with emphasis on planning/managing enterprise-level data systems environment.
 
  
Additional experience with managing public cloud infrastructure and security management tools is required.

 

 
 
 
 
 
 Why should you join Composites One?
 
 
 
  
CULTURE:
 This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.
 
  
INTEGRITY:
 The foundation of all strong relationships is TRUST. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and Team Members to build meaningful relationships!
 
  
CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION:
 
To remain successful, we must continuously improve and innovate. At Composites One, we value collaboration, and sharing ideas so that we can grow and drive continuous improvement and innovation together.
 
 
 
 
Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve!

 

  
 
 
 
 

  
About Us:

 
 
 

  
Composites One LLC
 is the leading supplier of essential materials for 
  
Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, Consumer Recreation and Construction Composites Manufacturing.
 We have a global presence and operate 
  
44 
North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each Team Member with respect and offers opportunities for growth and personal success.
 
 
 
 Learn more about us at compositesone.com!

 
 
 
 
 
 Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
 
 At Composites One, all qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or other protected classification as defined by applicable law and regulation. 
 
 
ADA Accommodations
 
 Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please contact the ADA Coordinator by email at ADACoordinator@compositesone.com.

At Composites One our culture is founded on a clear set of Core Values that has at its core  Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.  Our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as one Team, respect each other in our daily interactions, and communicate effectively while doing the one thing that is critical to our success – taking care of our customers.  
  Are you ready for a rewarding career?  
   We are searching for a Warehouse Manager to join our Operations Team!  
   
  Now is the time to move forward and make an impact!  
   As a  Warehouse Manager  you will be responsible for the overall activity of the warehouse, including safety/risk management, Quality, RCCA, receiving, transportation (private fleet and 3rd party carriers), warehousing and equipment/building maintenance/repair operations, all in accordance with established Company and regulatory policies and procedures. In this role you will manage the process and performance involved in daily activities of the warehouse to achieve established operating income and ROA goals.  
   How will you impact our organization as a Warehouse Manager on a daily basis?  
   
   Develop and establish necessary staffing systems, processes and procedures to ensure consistent, accurate and timely customer order fulfillment.  
   Investigate and establish root cause of shipping and receiving errors and implement corrective action plans.  
   Build and maintain supplier partnerships; Works with suppliers to assure items are delivered to time and quality specifications.  
   Work in conjunction with the regional Buyers and Supply Chain Managers to coordinate product movement, warehouse space requirements and stock rotation.  
   Assist in developing plans for selling aged inventory in partnership with Sales team and regional Buyers.  
   Monitor and approve all freight transactions, including review of freight adders on a semi-annual basis.  
   Oversee the annual physical inventory process and regularly scheduled cycle counts.  
   Develop systems, processes and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources, including effective material movement and logistics, while delivering value to our customers.  
   Utilize third party rating tools, routing techniques and mapping tools that assist in making quality decision that minimize freight costs.  
   Monitor the receipt, coordination and safety of goods coming through the warehouse using the Warehouse Management System.  
   Ensure orders arrive and are dispatched on time to appropriate destinations and in expected quantities.  
   Trace history of items to determine reasons for discrepancies between inventory and stock control records; recommend corrective actions to resolve discrepancies.  
   Plan layout of warehouse and other storage areas, considering turnover, size, weight and related factors of items stored.  
   Analyze records and recommend corrective action for reported non-usable, aged and excess stock.  
   Review records for accuracy of information and compliance with established procedures, and to determine adequacy of inventory levels.  
   Monitor and evaluate expectations and performance of warehouse and delivery staff through coaching and development opportunities.  
   Promote a high level of customer focus and lead a Quality Managed warehouse environment; create an environment that encourages respect, teamwork, communication, customer satisfaction and productivity between team members and following the Integrity Service model.  
   Communicate and ensure all requirements pertaining to warehousing/ material handling, safety and shipping are followed by staff.  
   
  Required Skills and Qualifications:  
   
   High School Diploma or GED Equivalent required.  
   Associates Degree preferred.  
   Minimum 5 years experience in a warehouse environment, including supervisory experience.  
   Proven track record in a team development role.  
   Experience with order picking, shipping, receiving, inventory counts, pick/pack.  
   In-depth knowledge of FIFO, OSHA, Safety Awareness and HAZMAT shipping.  
   Management experience within a Quality System such as ISO 9001 or similar strongly preferred.  
   Forklift Certification strongly preferred.  
   Must be proficient in MS Office; ability to learn and master internal systems required.  
  
  
   Why should you join Composites One? 
   
  
   CULTURE:  This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.  
   INTEGRITY:  The foundation of all strong relationships is TRUST. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and Team Members to build meaningful relationships!  
   CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION:  To remain successful, we must continuously improve and innovate. At Composites One, we value collaboration, and sharing ideas so that we can grow and drive continuous improvement and innovation together.  
   
  Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve!

    Composites One LLC  is the leading supplier of essential materials for 
   Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, Consumer Recreation  and
    Construction Composites Manufacturing.  We have a global presence and operate 44 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each Team Member with respect and 
   offers opportunities for growth and personal success.

Company Description

ITW (NYSE: ITW) is a Fortune 200 global multi-industrial manufacturing leader with revenue totaling $12.6 billion in 2020. The company’s seven industry-leading segments leverage the unique ITW Business Model to drive solid growth with best-in-class margins and returns in markets where highly innovative, customer-focused solutions are required. ITW has nearly 50,000 dedicated colleagues in operations around the world who thrive in the company’s unique decentralized and entrepreneurial culture.

ITW is a great employer with a distinct culture that empowers our people to think and act like entrepreneurs within ITW’s strategic framework. This decentralized, entrepreneurial culture is one component of the powerful and highly differentiated ITW Business Model. Commitment to our core values, safety and our culture is a competitive advantage for the company, and we are committed to fully leveraging its strength.

ITW Polymers Sealants North America, Inc. offers expanded sealants solutions to various industries and its key markets including construction (roofing, surfacing, metal building, and fenestration), aerospace composites and wind energy. Our brands with a proven history of success include ERSystems®, Permathane®, Tacky Tape®, STA’-PUT®, Pacific Polymers®, Acryl-R®, Miracle®, and Elastek®.

Job Description

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Human Resources Manager is a business partner that will help drive strategic talent initiatives across our division. The Human Resources Manager role is a hands-on and collaborative role that requires great attention to detail and a high level of confidentiality.

Key Responsibilities:

Enterprise Strategy & 80/20 Objectives

Establish competency, leadership, and credibility necessary to be a partner and key contributor while delivering great results within HR and the sites you support

Develop an understanding of the ITW Business Model with the ability to implement meaningful change based on business unit and division strategic priorities

Partner with plant operations leadership team to support 80 focus areas

Be able to effectively communicate and/or lead changes impacting the business

Human Resource Management

Effectively manage all areas of the HR function for your client groups from managing daily and tactical tasks to effectively leading the strategic elements such as workforce planning, morale/culture, change management, and risk mitigation.

Partner with Division HR Director for execution of the annual talent management cycle

Partner with operations leadership while assuming a local management leadership role for plant operations

Initiate, support, and drive change as needed throughout the business

Interpret, report, and manage compliance with the applicable state/country laws and regulation

Talent Acquisition

Engage with local and division leadership regarding employee needs within plants and across the division

Execute division recruitment process; partner with managers and lead all phases of the recruitment process

Develop recruitment strategies for exempt and non-exempt roles

Proactive and regular review of non-exempt workforce planning needs to ensure staffing levels meet production needs

Training & Development

Manage the identification and development of "High Potential" employees, working with management and corporate leaders for intentional development

Identify, design, and deliver training and mentoring programs that promote employee development and engagement

Manage performance review process for all employees, including performance issues of individuals and teams

Employee Relations

Facilitate, counsel, and coach employees and managers to a resolution regarding employee relations

Partner, notify and/or elevate sensitive employee relations matters to Division HR Director and/or Corporate HR, ensuring a shared risk approach

Responsible for FMLA, STD and LTD administration, leveraging Corporate HR as needed

Compensation & Benefits

Coordinate compensation review process for promotions, merit increases and bonus plans

SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:

Excellent written and verbal communication skills are necessary, as well as the ability to build networks of contacts externally and internally

 Ability to link company/business objectives to HR strategies

Must be able to exercise independent judgment, ability to work independently and function well in a team environment

High level of intellectual curiosity with ability to find problems and provide solutions

Strategic thinking with the ability to accelerate and influence change

Excellent time and project management capabilities, must have a sense of urgency, able to prioritize including the ability to manage competing priorities

Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Required

Bachelor’s Degree

Minimum of 5 years of progressive HR generalist experience

Preferred

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or an HR-related field

7+ years of progressive HR Generalist experience, preferably with at least one previous leadership role

Prior manufacturing experience

Bilingual English/Spanish

Experience with third-party recruiting tools such as LinkedIn Recruiter

e required of the position.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
