About TPI
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI Transportation also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.


TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.


About the Role
We are seeking an experienced and accomplished manufacturing quality professional to support the site through a period of exciting growth in our automotive products manufacturing operation division.
The Quality Manager plans and directs quality management activities for the Rhode Island manufacturing site, focusing on production and product quality and quality management systems implementation and management. Supervises quality control and quality engineering staff in the implementation of TPI’s quality policy, procedures, and plans.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Leads quality control, quality engineering, and quality systems activities through a broad-based understanding of business management.

 
Establishes quality plans and directs activities of assigned staff.

 
Supervises Quality Department personnel.

 
Serves as primary contact for customer issues.

 
Owns the following processes:

 
Internal audits (QM should be a trained lead auditor)

 
Customer Feedback

 
Monitor and Measure (Quality related)

 
CAPA and Nonconforming Material (MRB)

 
ISO certification and maintenance





 
Trains team members on quality related subjects, procedures, work instructions.

 
Provides input for yearly budgets for quality.

 
Writes team member annual performance reviews.

 
Coordinates quality related matters with other departments, promoting teamwork and continuous improvement in the process.




Who we’re looking for:



 
B.S. degree in engineering (mechanical, chemical, industrial), and at least 5 years of manufacturing management experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 
Previous automotive manufacturing quality experience.

 
Formal training in the field of quality (ISO, TQM, IATF, Auditing) and business management.

 
Computer proficiency including MS Office, and Minitab.

 
Familiarity with Statistical Process Control (SPC).

 
Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and specifications.

 
Knowledge of metrology (calibration) systems.

 
Ability to communicate clearly, both in writing and verbally, with people at all levels.

 
Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing principles

 
IATF or TS lead auditor experience preferred.




Location
This position is on site at our automotive composites manufacturing site in Warren, Rhode Island.


Our Mission 
is to deliver innovative and sustainable solutions to decarbonize and electrify the world by expanding the adoption of renewable energy. We accomplish this by cultivating an inclusive culture that attracts, develops, excites, and retains exceptional talent.
Additional Information
TPI Composites, Inc. offer competitive compensation and benefits, including but not limited to, health and dental insurance, 401(k) plan with company match, and paid vacation plans.
TPI Composites, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Background check and drug test required. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Location: 373 Market Street, Warren, RI 02885


Job Type: Full-time
Health insurance

About TPI

TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI Transportation also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.

TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.

About the Role

The Program Manager is responsible for all aspects of assigned automotive prototype, development, and production programs coordinating with business development, engineering, finance, quality, supply chain and operations teams. The work is complex, difficult in character, and requires independent problem solving with general direction and guidance from corporate and business unit strategy. Superior leadership and communication abilities are required to manage multiple programs simultaneously. Work requires program leadership responsibility for critical programs based on strategic importance.

To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee multiple programs and project teams using excellent time management and interpersonal skills.

If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Responsible for overall program timing and delivery – technical, quality, and cost/budget.
  • Provides expert tactical leadership in coordinating, facilitating, motivating, and directing efforts of cross-functional program teams including individuals from
  • Engineering, Business Development, Product Development, Quality, Supply Chain, and Manufacturing.
  • Ensures efficient use of team and resources within budget.
  • Gains support for and develops program objectives and deliverables. Ensures full team participation and that all groups involved understand all the demands for the successful launch of a program. Objectives include timing, engineering support, cost, quality, and delivery. Ensures customer and Company requirements are met.
  • Ensures that the profitability of the program is maximized throughout the program launch.
  • Leads the communication of all issues and responsibilities both within the Company and to the customer and ensures that technical and tactical objectives are clearly documented and cascaded to each functional area.
  • Works with internal and external resources to maintain strong customer relationships with dedication to customer program schedules.
  • Demonstrates expertise, in all customer systems as required, to support programs in launch. Ensures countermeasures are initiated to correct unfavorable variances by communicating alternative measures to the customer, which may be used to solve engineering problems. Ensures the success of the future production of the programs in the launch phase.
  • Documents and monitors program objectives per PMP by mean of open issue lists, milestone reviews, and launch (manufacturing) readiness reviews. Demonstrates expertise in all systems required for launching programs.
  • Participates in continuous improvement efforts of PDP/PMP processes to support product launches.
  • Performs other duties as necessary for completion of projects and achievement of goals.

Who we’re looking for:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Business Administration or equivalent with a minimum of five years’ experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience in the automotive industry is preferred.
  • Leadership abilities in managing multiple programs to meet goals (quality, cost and delivery of programs) from concept through launch in coordination with internal and external contacts.
  • Organizational, project management, and leadership skills to prioritize, coordinate projects, manage conflicting needs based on strategic importance, and deal with many issues at one time.
  • Ability to work on long-term assignments, broad in nature, using a high level of originality and ingenuity. Must be self-motivated and able to develop long-term technical strategies/plans to meet future business needs and growth opportunities.
  • Financial skills to prepare budgets, develop and understand financial aspects of program deliverables.
  • Ability to lead and motivate others through support, training, etc. towards organizational goals.
  • Ability to thoroughly research, recommend, and oversee implementation of new products, materials, processes, etc. and present information to support product launches.
  • Ability and willingness to travel domestically up to 30%.

Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island. Relocation benefits to the greater Providence RI are available.

International Wind
 is a maintenance and repair service provider for the burgeoning commercial wind power generation industry. We specialize in providing repairs primarily in the field at customer locations (Wind farms). Our field workers are trained and are required to maintain certification for climbing, working at heights, confined space entry and specialty processes such as composite repair for blades.
Due to exceptional growth and future opportunity, we are seeking a detail oriented, well organized, and highly motivated individual to assist with Wind Operations. This person will provide day-to-day operations support for projects and customers under his/her purview to include work scheduling, training, logistics and management of personnel to ensure safe, smooth, and effective support for our client’s needs.


*
Job duties*
The Operations Support Manager’s over-arching purpose is ensuring that the business operates safely and effectively in support of our client’s needs. Duties and obligations that support that objective include but are not limited to:



 
Ensure a strong commitment to safety

 
Establish safety as our first core value

 
Foster a safety conscious work environment where all employees understand reporting options and are empowered to improve our safety culture

 
Ensure everyone understands they have the power to stop work when circumstances lead to uncertainty





 
Establish a strong relationship with designated customer contacts by demonstrating transparency, integrity, and honesty in dealing with each assigned client

 
Function as the single point of contact maintaining continuous client contact to build and/or strengthen the relationship

 
Deliver strong and frequent leadership engagement with assigned clients to ensure we understand and can deliver on their needs

 
Present a proactive posture regarding our performance – except and react promptly





 
Install a culture of continuous improvement and set high standards and expectations for our field personnel

 
Conducting periodic reviews of procedures and processes to identify improvement opportunities within the operation of the business

 
Communicate with field personnel frequently to understand operational challenges and support requirements to help ensure successful execution of contracted work

 
Remain available and approachable to our field employees





 
Oversight of operational and contract budgets with focus on establishing savings while maintaining or improving effectiveness

 
Understand all contracts associated with assigned clients

 
Ensure that operational plans support execution of the contract and identified work scope

 
Diligently enforce best practices with respect to spend for items such as vehicles, travel, hotel, materials, and contracted services





 
Conduct periodic site visits to:

 
Reinforce safety culture

 
Improve customer relationship

 
Garner feedback from field employees and

 
Ensure field performance and behavior supports contract requirements and best practices with respect to safety, quality, and schedule




*
Job Requirements: *



 
5 years of relevant Wind experience with at least 1 in an operations role preferred

 
Field Service experience in support of periodic maintenance activities including logistics for mobilization and demobilization

 
Experience with recruiting and staffing highly desirable

 
Can quickly identify key resources and build high performing teams

 
capable of providing input for a succession planning model that maintains a defense in depth for position evolutions.





 
Effective communication – written and verbal – with both management and craft

 
Ensure transparent communication regarding status, planning and expected outcome

 
Influence others (internal and external) to improve project outcomes





 
Effectively manages his/her time and that of other’s

 
Experience and/or active certifications as a trainer for GWO and/or ENSA a plus

 
Desire a candidate with established ties to Wind Industry management. OEM and Wind Farm connections desired in both USA and Europe

 
Understanding of wind turbine blade production/engineering principles highly considered

 
Rope Access experience highly desired

 
Existing certification to provide training in support of certification to Global Wind Organization (GWO) standards




Job Type: Full-time


Pay: $100,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year


Benefits:



 
401(k)

 
Dental insurance

 
Health insurance

 
Paid time off

 
Vision insurance




Schedule:



 
10 hour shift

 
12 hour shift

 
8 hour shift

 
Day shift

 
Holidays

 
Monday to Friday

 
Night shift

 
On call

 
Weekend availability

Overview

   

   

   

    
 
    
Avangrid Renewables, a subsidiary of AVANGRID, Inc. (NYSE: AGR), is a leading developer, owner, and operator of renewable energy facilities in the United States with an eight-gigawatt portfolio of onshore wind and solar projects across 22 states. Avangrid Renewables’ offshore wind business is pioneering this new industry with a development pipeline of five gigawatts off the East Coast. Our offshore portfolio consists of our 50% ownership in the first-in-the-nation Vineyard Wind 1 project, which will deliver 800 MW of clean energy into Massachusetts starting in 2023. Additionally, Avangrid Renewables owns 100% of Park City Wind, an 804 MW project to serve the state of Connecticut and Commonwealth Wind, a project that will deliver up to 1200 MW to Massachusetts. Finally, Avangrid Renewables owns 100% of Kitty Hawk Offshore Wind that has the potential to deliver 2,500 MW of clean energy into Virginia and North Carolina. The company will also actively pursue additional lease areas in the Atlantic and Pacific Coasts and the Gulf of Mexico.

    
 
    
 
    
We aspire to be the employer of choice by providing purposeful and challenging work revolutionizing the renewable energy industry in the United States. This role will support the senior management team that is developing, constructing and operating large scale offshore wind projects which will provide affordable, clean energy and will have a transformational impact on local communities. Avangrid Renewables’ offshore business is located in Boston, Massachusetts.

    
 
    
 
   

  

  

   

    
 Purpose

   

   

    
 The Lead Engineer, Ops Field Support role is focused on assisting with the delivery of operational requirements in the US Offshore business. Working with Contractors and multiple departments within Offshore Operations and Commercial Services to ensure that Avangrid’s long term asset value and production revenue is maximized. The role will be focused on supporting the wind turbine equipment in Avangrid’s Offshore wind projects and will interface with the wind turbine OEMs and O&M service providers. This position is based in Boston, MA, on a Hybrid schedule.

    
 
    
 Belonging to the Offshore Operations Team the Lead Engineer, Ops Field Support will be responsible for defining and implementing robust and cost-effective engineering strategies for the operational requirements including management of contractors and associated interfaces, and ensuring quality, best practices and excellent H&SE performance are applied.
 
    
Lead Engineer, Ops Field Support is responsible for providing high quality and consistent service across offshore projects within Avangrid.
 
 The individual will be working as part of a global business with activities in many countries across US, UK, and the rest of the world. The position may require travel to various locations.
 
 Offshore industry is still relatively immature, and a key focus is on driving down cost. This role will play a large part in developing initiatives to reduce the cost of service during the operational phase.
 
   

  

  

   

    
 Responsibilities

   

   

    

     
 
     

      
Delivery of robust and cost-effective engineering strategies for the operational requirements, providing engineering support, assistance and recommendations to ensure delivery within time, to budget and quality following industry best practice and observing the maximum respect for Health, Safety and the Environment to ensure regulatory and legal compliance’

      
Implement offshore standards, procedures, tools, best practices, and quality requirements.

      
Develop technical specifications for maintenance agreements.

      
Developing HSE strategies for operations and ensuring a high standard of health and safety awareness is maintained.

      
Provide advice on operational solutions / risk levels affecting technical integrity or asset performance to Principal Project Managers to ensure that cost effective solutions are identified, fully evaluated and the risk profile is fully understood.

      
Make technical recommendations to Project Managers based on the condition of the assets, production, and other KPIs.

      
Support the coordination of EPC interfaces and Project Services Engineering Team to ensure the operational requirements are identified, fully evaluated, and actioned during project execution.

      
Liaise with the other Global Offshore Business Hub Engineering teams ensuring lessons learned and best practices are capture and shared across the different Offshore Projects.

      
Deliver technical due diligence to the handover from construction and the transition through end of warranty of offshore wind assets.

      
Ensure that all assessment, advice, and recommendations are fully documented in accordance with all internal procedures and industry best practice, and that sufficient technical and commercial due diligence (whether internal or external) exists to support those business decisions.

     

    
 
   

  

  

   

    
 Competencies
 
   

   

    
Be a role model 

    
Be agile 

    
Collaborate and Share 

    
Develop Self & Others 

    
Empower to grow 

    
Focus to achieve results 

    
Technical Skills 

   

  

  

   

    
Skills and Requirements
 
   

   

    

     
Degree in engineering, math, physics, or other technical discipline or equivalent experience

     
Postgraduate experience, preferable in operation of wind turbines

     
Some experience with offshore wind operations preferred.

     
Experience of renewables / power generation industry preferred.

     
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.

     
Developed report writing and presentation skills and ability to summarize parameters and drivers impacting the scope of works.

     
Good organizational and operational skills with the ability to link this awareness to technical judgement and decision making.

     
Good planning and analysis skills with the ability to look forward and anticipate problems and thereafter plan and implement mitigating solutions to negate the effect of such problems.

     
Ability to support the management of a scope of works which require interface and coordination. Advice on the impact of technical/ specialist risks and issues and the viability of solutions recommended.

     
Experience and understanding of technical due diligence.

     
Problem solving – dealing with conflicting requirements

     
Tenacity, persistence, and determination to succeed in overcoming obstacles.

     
High capacity for change.

     
Experience of working in teams involved in large projects in international environments.

     
Pro-active and diligent approach.

     
Sound relationship management skills and confidence working with senior colleagues.

     
Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines

     
Analyze technical/ specialist risks and issues and the viability of solutions recommended.

     
Computer literacy, with a good working knowledge of Microsoft Office components especially Excel and database packages, e.g., Microsoft Access, and programming languages as well as an ability to deal with new software.

     
Eligible to work in the US

     
Flexible to travel around the US and overseas

    
 
    

     
Ability to climb 100-meter steel towers on a regular basis to perform engineering inspections of wind turbines

     
Ability to occasionally lift items weighing up to 50 pounds.

     
Ability to complete GWO basic safety and sea survival training

This is applicable to employees that will work in Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, and New York within AVANGRD Network and Corporate functions. doc_title: Offshore Substation Engineering Manager - Kiewit Power Engineering
doc_description:
Requisition ID: 136088


Job Level: Mid Level


Department: Design Engineering


Market: Power


Employment Type: Full Time



Position Overview



Kiewit is seeking an experienced Offshore Substation Engineering Manager to provide design oversight, technical expertise, and guidance for HVAC and HVDC offshore wind collection stations and interconnections to onshore stations. This position is for an experienced engineering manager with a background in high-voltage station design, with expertise in offshore station equipment and functionality, design criteria and applicable codes. The candidate must possess leadership experience, excellent communication skills and demonstrate a strong desire to work collaboratively within a group of experienced professionals.

On our team, you’ll have the opportunity to see more and do more than you ever imagined. Working hard will not only bring you the satisfaction of a job well done but will help propel you forward in your career faster than you may expect. We’ll train you, develop your skills and allow you to take on power projects that will impact millions across North America. With top-notch health benefits, a wealth-building 401k plan and unbeatable growth opportunities, by joining Kiewit, you’re ensuring a lifetime of success.


District Overview



Kiewit Engineering Group, Inc is a full-service consulting and engineering firm serving the infrastructure and engineering markets. Our combined staff of more than 1,300 engineers and design professionals have expertise that spans all major engineering disciplines to serve transportation, power, water/wastewater, mining, building, and oil, gas & chemical markets. Backed by 130 years of construction experience, our construction-driven engineering focuses on constructability and safety in the earliest phases of projects to ensure on-time and on-budget project delivery.

Our rapidly growing Power district, which includes structural, civil, piping, mechanical, process, process safety, electrical, instrument and control disciplines, is a multi-faceted division of Kiewit with best-in-class technical expertise focused on the EPC delivery model for power facilities. We offer a variety of engineering services, including owner's engineering, project development, detailed engineering and design, construction management and plant services. Our engineering teams bring power projects to life across North America in the following areas:


Gas-fired generation
Power delivery
Environmental retrofits
Renewables and new technology
Water/wastewater

We are a high performing team of engineers and designers that develop projects through the project life-cycle engaging exciting projects throughout North America. Our staff leads the power markets engineering process and collaborates with Kiewit’s construction teams to approach construction-driven engineering with a focus on safe, cost-effective, and innovative designs that achieve client expectations and further Kiewit’s legacy of excellence.





Location



This position is US based. Sponsorship opportunities available.



Responsibilities


Provide engineering leadership, oversight, and coordination to assigned offshore substation projects.


Management of all technical team members and tasks including, but not limited to: definition of project scope, including functional layouts, optimization, and operability, design basis development


Contribute technical expertise to discipline lead engineers to ensure technical compliance, while maintaining optimal project cost and schedule.


Communicate and coordinate project activities with project director, clients and other stakeholders.


Lead project risk assessments and risk mitigation strategies


Manage the use and provide insight in the development/use of Kiewit tools in order to increase efficiency in planning, design, and project execution.


Monitor QA/QC of project and coordinate with QA/QC team to resolve any design or process issues.


Manage and support contractor RFIs.


Promote and support interdisciplinary coordination.


Responsible for ensuring compliance with Kiewit quality control program.


Develop and improve processes, tools and/or technology


Interface with clients on a regular basis.


Responsible for grid code compliance


Manage all lessons learned and incorporate them into department standards/processes


Qualifications


Bachelor of Science degree (B.S.) in electrical engineering from an ABET accredited university


Proven history of successful engineering management on offshore substation projects


Deep understanding of offshore wind farm electrical system design requirements and solutions including interface points between onshore and offshore substations


Experience working as a project engineer on an offshore wind project.


Capability to manage people effectively in order to meet quality and project schedule.


Professional Engineer (PE) preferred


Legally able to work within the United States for any length of time


Strong written and verbal communication skills; fluent in English language


Knowledge and understanding of US engineering standards including (but not limited to):


ANSI C2, C37, C57, C62


IEEE 1, 4, 80, 120, 1300, 1375, 1459, 1584, 1862


NFPA 70, 70E, 110, 780, 791, 850


Knowledge and understanding of US Regulatory Requirements including (but not limited to):


29 CFR 1910


29 CFR 1926


30 CFR 585 – Renewable Energy and Alternate Uses of Existing Facilities on the Outer Continental Shelf


CFR Title 33 – Navigation and Navigable Waters


NERC Reliability Standard FAC-001


Knowledge and understanding of international engineering standards including (but not limited to):


DNGL-ST-0145 – Offshore Substation Standard


DNVGL-OS-C101 – Design of Offshore Steel Structures


DNVGL-OS-D201 – Electrical Installations


DNVGL-RP-C205 – Environmental Conditions and Environmental Loads


DNVGL-ST-N001 – General Guidelines for Marine Projects


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

doc_title: Wind Turbine Technician Apprenticeship Rhyl Flats
doc_description:
RWE Renewables UK Management Ltd., Liverpool Bay

Full time, Fixed Term

Functional area:
 Apprenticeship; Renewables

Remuneration:
 Apprentice

Location: Llandrillo College (North Wales) and Rhyl Flats Offshore Wind Farm

Requirements: 5 GCSE’s at 4/C or above including Science and Maths (or equivalent)

Salary: c£14,000 in the 1st year, rising to c£22,000 in the 3rd year. Benefits include pension and private single medical cover.

Wind Turbine Technician Apprenticeship

RWE Renewables are offering the opportunity for motivated people to begin a career in renewable energy with us. This excellent 3 year apprentice scheme will enable the selected candidates to develop into technicians working on wind turbines. The first 2 years will be class room based at a bespoke Wind Turbine training facility at Llandrillo College, Rhos on Sea in North Wales.

The 3rd year will consist of on-site training at Rhyl Flats Offshore Wind Farm

MAIN PURPOSE OF JOB

We will provide a comprehensive and well supported learning programme including classroom-based learning and experience on site working with our technicians. Completing the Apprenticeship will result in an NVQ level 3 qualification in wind turbine operations and maintenance and a level 3 diploma in wind turbine maintenance.

Our Wind Turbine Technicians work as part of a small team dedicated to specific offshore wind farms. Successful candidates will learn to carry out all aspects of wind turbine maintenance including scheduled, unscheduled, proactive, and troubleshooting maintenance on wind turbines.

Your hard work will ensure our wind farms continue to deliver power to households and business. It is a rewarding job that allows you to work on highly advanced machinery in a challenging environment. Once trained you will be working at sea, in all weathers and at height, using heavy, complex mechanical and electrical equipment. You will be required to demonstrate a commitment to Health and Safety in all aspects of your work.

Initially the focus will be upon learning and developing engineering knowledge through education and training. However, examples of the tasks covered as Technicians in the longer term include:

Electro/Mechanical problem solving of wind turbines working in small teams at height in remote locations with user manuals as reference

Working with advanced mechanical, hydraulic and electrical equipment in a safe manner

The technicians will be required to plan in advance what tools, spares and materials are required for each job they do

Fault find and diagnosis of wind turbine main component condition to assist in determining if site repair is possible or whether the unit requires exchange

Support inspection of blades and performing minor repairs then writing condition reports

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

You will be keen to learn and undertake a practical role and standby maybe required.

Knowledge and Skills:

5 GCSE’s at 4/C or above including Science and Maths (or equivalent)

Willing to learn and develop

Interest in engineering

Able to work a height

Able to work at sea

Willing to work shifts

All apprentices will be expected to study full time for the first 2 years at Llandrillo College, Rhos-on-Sea in North Wales during term time, before being deployed at 
Rhyl Flats Wind Farm
 for the 3rd year for hands-on experience of working on a wind farm.

Important Dates:

Application closing date: 18 March 2022

Assessment Centre: 17/19 (To Be Confirmed) May 2022

Working at height and offshore/onshore fitness assessment centres: June 2022

Role start date: September 2022

RWE Renewables GmbH, based in Essen, Germany, is RWE’s youngest subsidiary and one of the world’s leading companies in the field of renewable energies. We focus on growth: on the American continent, on the European core markets and on new markets in the Asia-Pacific region.

doc_title: US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead
doc_description:
Local Unit & Position Description

Do you want to come help lead decarbonization and the advancement of Renewable Energy?

Are you excited about working with a diverse, collaborative team at the world s largest renewable energy consultancy? Do you have a passion for permitting renewable energy projects, and furthering your professional development in a company that truly puts people first?

At DNV our organizational culture and how we collectively influence the world for future generations matters deeply to us. Our team works every day to increase the widespread deployment and operation of renewables to address climate change and positively impact society; endeavors to achieve our purpose through the success of our customers; and strives to be high-performing and innovative. Our approach reflects the equity, respect, and diversity we wish to see in the world.

DNV s Environmental and Permitting Services (EPS) team is growing rapidly, and we are seeking a US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead to help us provide comprehensive permitting services in Midwest US and the rest of the United States (US). You will be responsible for overseeing a team and leading project development and environmental and permitting activities, including the preparation of local, state, and federal renewable energy permit applications, associated environmental and social impact studies, stakeholder engagement sessions, and land use and zoning permit applications for renewable energy projects located in the Midwest and, as well as other regions within and outside of the US. You will also be engaged in leading proposal efforts, business development for wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen facilities across the US, as well as assisting with project due diligence activities.

Our Customers can choose any number of consultancies to execute on specific tasks. However, our EPS team strives to develop long-term partnerships with our Customers, acting as their trusted advisor from the early site selection stage through to operations. Our Customers are at the forefront of the energy transition. Our team is nimble, highly experienced, and driven by our mission to ensure renewable energy projects are safely and sustainably sited, permitted, and operated.

Our team

The EPS team is comprised of siting, environmental, and permitting specialists who work directly with our Customers to help identify and address project risks for terrestrial wind, offshore wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen projects. Our mission is to guide the sustainable, responsible growth of the renewables industry by providing innovative environmental and permitting expertise to support the greater good.

To facilitate this work, excellent written and oral communication skills are paramount. Broadly, our work falls into four categories:

  • Biological services, including field surveys, habitat conservation plans, corporate avian and bat protection plans, review of mitigation strategies, and associated permitting.
  • Permitting services, providing support for permitting at the federal, state/provincial, and local level for wind, solar, battery storage and hydrogen projects; including stakeholder engagement.
  • GIS services, including mapping, constraints reviews, radiocommunication surveys, and critical issues analyses.
  • Siting services, including layout optimization, acoustical measurements, noise impact assessments, shadow flicker studies, blade/ice throw assessments, glint and glare studies, and visual impact studies.

This is a Remote position

What You ll Do

  • Oversee a team of project analysts, biologists, and engineers to deliver projects within allocated time and budget. Perform technical checking and initial approval of all work products completed by project team.
  • Lead the preparation and submission of permit applications, coordination of environmental fieldwork, authoring of environmental reporting documentation including critical issues analyses, technical permitting studies and management plans, Phase I ESAs, environmental impact assessments and technical project proposals and, agency consultation and stakeholder engagement programs.
  • Provide people leadership, coaching, and quality control for a team of approximately five.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with Midwest regulatory agencies (and/or other US regions).
  • Stay informed of applicable regulatory frameworks and participate in regulatory discussions and feedback discussions related to renewable energy developments in the US.
  • Actively seek out practical and realistic business development opportunities in the US. Prepare proposals and bids and engage in facilitating innovative and new service offerings to anticipate/meet market needs.

Position Qualifications

What is Required

  • Bachelor s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • At least 5 years of environmental and/or permitting experience in the US, preferably in the renewable energy industry
  • Advanced knowledge of environmental assessment regulatory frameworks as applied to renewable energy (wind, solar, or battery storage)
  • Experience engaging with and contacts within the federal and state regulatory agencies such as the USFWS, local communities, and Tribes or First Nations
  • Demonstrated skills in people leadership (academic and/or professional experience); and
  • Demonstrated skills in project management, agency consultation, environmental analysis, and business development, including experience building and maintaining relationships with a client base
  • Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
  • We conduct pre-employment drug and background screening

What is Preferred

  • Master s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • 8+ years of relevant experience preferred
  • Experience leading winning proposal efforts for Customers in the renewable energy industry;
  • Capable of travelling to projects in development, construction, and operation sites in varying locations (10%-20% annual time); and
  • Comprehensive understanding of the Midwest wind, solar, and battery storage markets (or other US regions)
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) or other technical accreditation such P.Eng., P.Geo, P.Biol., etc

*Immigration-related employment benefits, for example visa sponsorship, are not available for this position*What We Offer

  • Generous paid time off (vacation, sick days, company holidays, personal days)
  • Multiple Medical and Dental benefit plans to choose from, Vision benefits
  • Spending accounts FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, company-seeded HSA
  • Special programs Employee Assistance Program, ID theft protection, and accident and critical illness options for you and your family
  • Employer-paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace
  • 401(k) with company match
  • Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits
  • Tuition assistance
  • Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities
  • Advancement opportunities

**Benefits may vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionHow We Do ItWe Care, We Dare, We Share

DNV is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially.

DNV is proud to announce being named one of Houston s best places to work in the 2022 Houston Business Journal Best Places to Work competition.

For more information

https://www.eeoc.gov/know-your-rights-workplace-discrimination-illegal-poster

Read more here

Diversity at DNV

Meet our Employees

About DNV

Careers in DNV

Please visit our website at www.dnv.com

As required by the various Pay Transparency laws, DNV provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado, California, Washington, or New York. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the states of Colorado, California, Washington, and New York only, the range of starting pay for this role is $100,000 - $145,000

Company & Business Area Description

DNV is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions.

We provide assurance to the entire energy value chain through our advisory, monitoring, verification, and certification services. As the world's leading resource of independent energy experts and technical advisors, we help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry. We are committed to realizing the goals of the Paris Agreement, and support all stakeholders to transition faster to a deeply decarbonized energy system.

It needs to be clarified that this position is located in Broomfield, CO, just north of Denver, CO.

 
We are a global supplier of CNC type systems and leader in our industry. We are an established EOE company with over 30 years in the field. We started working with Formula 1 teams in the late 70’s and 80’s and now manufacture high-end CNC deburring machines. These machines are multi-axis coordinated motion machines that help produce commercial aircraft, military aircraft and vehicles, wind energy systems, agricultural equipment, commercial automotive, OHV, etc. Our equipment touches virtually every aspect of the modern world. In fact, our machinery has touched every plane in the sky!

 
We currently have an opening for a CNC Machinist. You will be responsible for all aspects of running a CNC lathe or mill from running an parts order to completion.

 
Our equipment includes: 

 

  
3-Axis Mill

  
Live-Tool Lathe

  
Manual 17" lathe

  
Manual 8" lathe

  
Two Bridgeports

  
Two Sunnen Hones

  
Two drill presses

  
Two 11-Axis deburring machines

  
One 5-Axis deburring machine

  
Full fab shop and much more

 

 
You will also: 

 

  
Run the jobs

  
Document your process

  
QC your own parts

  
Be required to work flexible hours

 

 
Qualifications/Requirements: 

 

  
Minimum of 1 years of experience as a CNC Machinist and not accident prone

  
Able to read blueprints including GD&T

  
Able to use standard measuring equipment to measure dimensions and tolerance

  
Work with team to discuss and implement quality improvements, process improvements, work-holding solutions, and cycle time improvements

 

 
We require these qualities in all of our team members: 

 

  
Flexible

  
Reliable

  
Team Player

Follow Instructions

Continuously Improve

ABOUT SKYSPECS


At SkySpecs, our mission is to simplify renewable asset management so less can do more for the planet. SkySpecs is helping to make this possible by automating the operations and maintenance of wind farms using advanced robotics paired with our custom-built asset performance management software, Horizon.


SkySpecs launched the world's first completely autonomous blade inspection product in 2016 with a custom designed drone system. Since then, SkySpecs has inspected over 95,000 wind turbines in over 27 countries, becoming the world leader in understanding the health of turbine blades. Identifying issues with turbine blades is only the first step. In 2019 SkySpecs launched Horizon to be a platform for SkySpecs to offer a multi-layered solution for customers that includes: data collection, wind turbine blade engineering expertise, and a place for all stakeholders to collaborate to manage and analyze massive amounts of data, spot trends, and create plans for high-cost repair campaigns. In 2021, SkySpecs acquired two companies specializing in wind turbine drivetrain monitoring and financial management, further expanding our asset management portfolio. Ultimately, this will help reduce the cost and risk of operations for the industry


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


SkySpecs is seeking an Associate Product Manager that will gain a deep working understanding of SkySpecs' products and work with various stakeholders throughout the organization to coordinate various product activities. You will be tasked with helping SkySpecs take our autonomous inspection product to the next level to continue double-digit growth. The Associate Product Manager role is a high-visibility role within the organization, and you will have the opportunity to work directly with customers to understand their needs, work with SkySpecs leadership on product strategy, work with Sales and Marketing to build go-to-market materials and to work with the technology teams to develop amazing software.


REQUIREMENTS


Product instincts that focus on the user and drive delivering value to the customer

1+ years in a software product management, business analysis, or product engineering role working on web-based applications

BA/BS in Business, Engineering, or another technical/analytical field

Demonstrated project management skills in development, implementation, or technical analysis projects

Experience developing software requirements and communicating with development teams

Strong written, presentation, and communication skills to both internal and external stakeholders

Interest in Renewable or wind energy asset management

Product design, user interface design, or software development experience

Exposure to Pragmatic Marketing/Gartner marketing methodology experience is ideal

Startup mindset


THE WORK


As a SkySpecs' Associates Product Manager, your role is to build new products and features by combining existing ideas with new ideas from your experience and interactions with customers and prospects. You will need to have a deep technical understanding of the SkySpecs products, as well as a big-picture understanding of the challenges that face our customers and technologies needed to solve those challenges. You will:


Talk to customers as often as possible to better understand what they are doing, working on, and what challenges they have

Define product requirements and work with developers to design and build new features

Assist in QA of the software and documentation writing

Answer customer support questions and work with customers to find resolution on their issues

Work with Marketing to develop sales support materials, demos, and use cases

Work with Sales to develop technical sales materials, inspection analysis materials, and demonstrations

Develop relationships with key customers and broaden adoption of our products within their companies

Work with the Solutions Delivery team to help deliver value to customers and improve internal products

At Composites One our culture is founded on a clear set of Core Values that has at its core Respect, Teamwork, and Communication. Our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as one Team, respect each other in our daily interactions, and communicate effectively while doing the one thing that is critical to our success – taking care of our customers. Are you ready for a rewarding career? We are searching for a Distribution Center Operations Manager to join our growing Team! Now is the time to move forward and make an impact! As a DC Operations Manager you will be responsible for the managerial oversight of the operational function of multiple distribution centers, including customer service, safety/risk management , receiving, transportation , warehousing, equipment/building maintenance/repair operations and office/business administration tasks. In this role you will adhere to and promote Company values by performing duties in a manner that is consistent with being a team leader and supports the continued growth of the company. How will you impact our organization as an DC Operations Manager on a daily basis? Support, manage and analyze DC customer service functions to continuously improve all levels of customer satisfaction. Serve as liaison between the Customer Service, Warehouse and Sales Team to resolve issues and maintain focus on the customer. Analyze and manage warehouse and delivery functions to continuously improve the efficiency levels and safety. Oversee and manage the daily operations of the DC to achieve specific operating income and ROA goals. Monitor and approve all freight transactions, including review of freight adders on a semi-annual basis in partnership with Supply Chain Managers. Develop systems, processes and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources, including effective material movement and logistics, while delivering value to our customers. Review monthly financial statements and investigates variances against budget; identifies areas for improvement in efficiency and cost reductions. Implement best practices as they relate to manufactured goods such as slitting, material repackaging and quick tint operations. Responsible for risk management at the DC level. Leadership and Communications Skills: Monitor and evaluate expectations and performance of DC staff through coaching and development opportunities. Facilitate the hiring process of DC staff and long term planning for staffing requirements. Provide motivational and developmental leadership to DC staff on a daily basis; conduct semi-annual performance reviews for direct reports. Establish performance objectives and training plans; conducts strategic planning for the facility. Create a safe and compliant work environment by providing adequate safety training; conduct monthly safety meetings and complete training as determined by HSE. Required Skills and Qualifications: A minimum 5 years of supervisory experience. Progressively responsible experience in supply chain, distribution, warehouse and/or logistics sectors in the manufacturing or distribution industry. Experience in the Composites industry is preferred. Experience in Quality Assurance is strongly preferred. Experience in Aerospace is strongly preferred. High school diploma, GED, or Equivalent is required. Bachelors Degree in Business, or related field, strongly preferred. Occasional travel, up to 10%. Why should you join Composites One? CULTURE: This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of Respect, Teamwork, and Communication. INTEGRITY: The foundation of all strong relationships is TRUST. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and Team Members to build meaningful relationships! CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION: To remain successful, we must continuously improve and innovate. At Composites One, we value collaboration, and sharing ideas so that we can grow and drive continuous improvement and innovation together. Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve! About Us: Composites One LLC is the leading supplier of essential materials for Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, Consumer Recreation and Construction Composites Manufacturing. We have a global presence and operate 44 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each Team Member with respect and offers opportunities for growth and personal success. Learn more about us at compositesone.com! Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion At Composites One, all qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or other protected classification as defined by applicable law and regulation. ADA Accommodations Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please contact the ADA Coordinator by email at ADACoordinator@compositesone.com. Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

About us Johns Manville is a small business in Fernley, NV. We are professional, innovative, collaborative and our goal is to Who We Are Johns Manville is a leading manufacturer and marketer of premium-quality insulation and commercial roofing, along with glass fibers and nonwovens for commercial, industrial and residential applications. Our products are used in a wide variety of industries including building products, aerospace, automotive and transportation, filtration, commercial interiors, waterproofing and wind energy. A proud member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies, we serve customers in more than 80 countries around the globe. We are committed to delivering positive and powerful experiences, because we are successful only when our employees and customers thrive. We are passionate, we care about people, we perform at a superior level, and we protect others and our environments.. Our work environment includes: Growth opportunities On-the-job training Safe work environment Who We Are Johns Manville is a leading manufacturer and marketer of premium-quality insulation and commercial roofing, along with glass fibers and nonwovens for commercial, industrial and residential applications. Our products are used in a wide variety of industries including building products, aerospace, automotive and transportation, filtration, commercial interiors, waterproofing and wind energy. A proud member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies, we serve customers in more than 80 countries around the globe. We are committed to delivering positive and powerful experiences, because we are successful only when our employees and customers thrive. We are passionate, we care about people, we perform at a superior level, and we protect others and our environments. The base hourly rate for this position is $36.43 The purpose of the Maintenance Technician’s role is to perform routine and non-routine maintenance on production and facility equipment to support production of roofing materials while meeting facility targets for safety, productivity, and machine uptime. This role will conduct effective problem solving and troubleshooting processes to develop corrective actions to repair and maintain all electrical, mechanical, and facility related functions, equipment, systems, buildings and/or physical structures in a manner that allows the plant to operate effectively and efficiently, working from general instructions from the plant management team, and all levels within the organization in support of the four Johns Manville core values: People, Passion, Performance, and Protection. This position will report directly to the Maintenance Supervisor under supervision of the Plant Engineer. Shift will be Tuesday – Friday from 5:00pm - 3:00am (subject to change based on production demand). With two weeks of training on day shift (7am – 3:30pm) at job start. Your Day to Day: Follow all Johns Manville safety and environmental procedures and policies. Attend plant safety and training meetings as scheduled. Follow Job Safety Analysis (JSA's), use safe work practices, and report hazardous conditions at all times. Wear protective clothing & equipment as required. Develop JSA’s for new tasks and review JSA’s annually. Demonstrate ability to train coworkers about various systems in the plant. Perform routine and non-routine maintenance activities of mechanical and electrical systems. Develop and modify preventive maintenance plans for new and modified equipment. Display advanced working knowledge of electrical troubleshooting (single phase and 3 phase), control systems, of plant power distribution systems, mechanical, hydraulics, and pneumatics systems. Install and repair electrical conduit and cable, including connections, controls, grounding, etc. Work from electrical and mechanical schematics to troubleshoot or install new or modify existing equipment. Perform voltmeter, ammeter, wattmeter, and other electrical measurements. Inspect equipment and reports on defective part and unsatisfactory conditions to further preventative maintenance program. Provide solutions to improve the efficiency of the equipment. Maintain, adjust, service and lubricate equipment keeping it in good operating conditions with respect to proper aligning, functioning and lubrication of parts. Participate in continuous improvement and Root Cause Corrective Action (RCCA) teams. Assist co-workers as directed. Perform and complete other work as assigned by supervisor. Provides feedback and solutions to leadership on critical equipment issues pertaining to safety or operational capabilities Display flexible outlook toward change management, working on cross-functional teams, training for the use of new tools and methodologies, and willingness and ability to obtain operating knowledge of all production equipment. Participate in daily housekeeping efforts. Ensure job site is consistently clean after every job and clean maintenance shop after every shift. What You Bring to the Team: High school diploma or equivalent 3 - 5+ years of industrial maintenance experience 2-year technical degree approved by manager or equivalent (preferred) Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot and handle multiple priorities and projects Ability to disassemble, diagnose, repair, and perform preventative repair measures on mechanical equipment including, but not limited to: pumps, gearboxes, reducers, couplings, seals, rotating elements, blowers, fans, hydraulic units, valves, chillers, and compressors Demonstrate advanced Mechanical aptitude, including pipe fitting, fabricating (preferred) Advanced knowledge of use of hand tools and power tools Advanced knowledge of shop machinery, including hydraulic press, mill & drill press, lathe, and saw(s) (band & Chop) Advanced knowledge of building lighting systems Advanced knowledge of AC/heating systems Advanced knowledge of building fire alarm systems Advanced knowledge of Lock, Tag, Clear, and Try program (Lockout/Tagout) Advanced knowledge of PLC troubleshooting Advanced knowledge of VFD troubleshooting Display advanced understanding of 480V system to include arc-flash training and safe working practices per NFPA 70E Ability to provide troubleshooting and diagnosis on process heating and cooling equipment Ability to consistently make appropriate decisions while being flexible with regard to work assignments and priorities. Strong commitment to safety Ability to work well with others Strong problem-solving capabilities Excellent interpersonal and communications skills Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment Advanced computer skills Local travel for training purposes Physical Requirements: The physical requirements of this position are: (these requirements are typical for most of our manufacturing roles) The ability to stand for extended periods The ability to manually lift, push or pull at least 50 pounds safely and with proper body mechanics, sometimes while in awkward positions. Use of hands (repetitive motion, grabbing, feeling, sensing, pulling) The ability to work safely in a fast-paced, sometimes stressful work environment The ability to safely and effectively work in an often-dusty work environment that experiences a broad range of temperatures (very hot to very cold). The ability to withstand the rigors of working a 12(or 8)-hour rotating shift schedule. The ability to bend, stoop or kneel repetitively. The ability to reach or work above the shoulder The ability to operate light-heavy industrial equipment (forklift, JLG, scissor lift) Please Keep in Mind If you do not meet 100% of these requirements, we at JM still want to hear from you. So, if you are interested in the role, we encourage you to apply so we can learn how your skills and talents can contribute to our team. Benefits Johns Manville (JM) offers a wide range of benefits to employees. Some are subsidized by the company and others are fully employee-paid. Health benefits include a choice of comprehensive medical plans, a dental plan, vision plan, wellness program and critical illness insurance. JM sponsors a 401(k) plan which includes a sizeable company match. JM offers paid vacation and also provides paid sick and parental leave for eligible employees. Additionally, Johns Manville provides basic life Insurance, short-term and long-term disability coverage, an employee assistance program, and business travel accident coverage. Supplemental life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment insurance are available as well. The company also offers a variety of tax saving accounts; health spending account, traditional flexible spending account, and a dependent care spending account. JM also offers a tuition reimbursement program for undergraduate and certain graduate programs. Diversity & Inclusion Johns Manville believes diversity and inclusion in our workplace is critical for the long-term success of our company. We are committed to retaining, developing and attracting a diverse workforce that fosters an inclusive work environment in which all employees are treated with dignity and respect. This is the right thing to do for our employees, our company and our communities. Our D&I council is composed of employees from locations across North American & Europe who meet regularly and work to promote and foster an environment of inclusion. Born from our D&I council is our network of employee resource groups (ERGs) that are focused on supporting diverse communities in the workplace. Review more about our diversity & inclusion initiatives on JM’s Career page. Incumbent must be physically able to perform essential job functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $36.43 per hour Expected hours: 40 per week Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Employee discount Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Relocation assistance Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance Experience level: 3 years Schedule: 10 hour shift 4x10 Monday to Friday Night shift Work setting: In-person Ability to Relocate: Fernley, NV 89408: Relocate before starting work (Required) Work Location: In person

Composites One LLC
 is the leading supplier of essential materials for 
wind energy, aerospace, defense, consumer recreation
 and

 We have a global presence and operate 
44
 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each team member with 
respect
 and 
offers opportunities for growth and personal success.

 
 Learn more about us compositesone.com!

 
 The 
Warehouse Manager
 will be responsible for the overall activity of the warehouse, including 
safety/risk management
, 
Quality,
 
RCCA
, 
receiving
,
 transportation
 (private fleet and 3rd party carriers), 
warehousing
 and 
equipment/building maintenance/repair operations
, all in accordance with established Company and regulatory policies and procedures. This person manages the processes and performance involved in daily activities of the warehouse to achieve established operating income and ROA goals. 
Adheres to and promotes Company core values
 by performing duties in a manner that is consistent with being a 
team leader
 and 
supports the continued growth of the company.

 

 
 Primary Job Responsibilities:

 

  
 Develops and establishes necessary staffing systems, processes and procedures to ensure consistent, accurate and timely customer order fulfillment.

  
 Investigates and establishes root causes of shipping and receiving errors and implements corrective action plans.

  
 Builds and maintains supplier partnerships; Works with suppliers to assure items are delivered to time and quality specifications.

  
 Works in conjunction with the regional Buyers and Supply Chain Managers to coordinate product movement, warehouse space requirements and stock rotation.

  
 Assists in developing plans for selling aged inventory in partnership with Sales team and regional Buyers.

  
 Monitors and approves all freight transactions, including review of freight adders on a semi-annual basis.

  
 Oversees the annual physical inventory process and regularly scheduled cycle counts.

  
 Develops systems, processes and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources, including effective material movement and logistics, while delivering value to our customers.

  
 Utilizes third party rating tools, routing techniques and mapping tools that assist in making quality decision that minimize freight costs.

  
 Monitors the receipt, coordination and safety of goods coming through the warehouse using the Warehouse Management System.

  
 Ensures orders arrive and are dispatched on time to appropriate destinations and in expected quantities.

  
 Traces history of items to determine reasons for discrepancies between inventory and stock control records; recommends corrective actions to resolve discrepancies.

  
 Plans layout of warehouse and other storage areas, considering turnover, size, weight and related factors of items stored.

  
 Analyze records and recommends corrective actions for reported non-usable, aged and excess stock.

  
 Reviews records for accuracy of information and compliance with established procedures, and to determine adequacy of inventory levels.

  
 Monitors and evaluates expectations and performance of warehouse and delivery staff through coaching and development opportunities.

  
 Promotes a high level of customer focus and leads a Quality Managed warehouse environment; creates an environment that encourages respect, teamwork, communication, customer satisfaction and productivity between team members and following the Integrity Service model.

  
 Communicates and ensures all requirements pertaining to warehousing/ material handling, safety and shipping are followed by staff.

 

 
 Position Requirements:

 

  
 High School Diploma or GED Equivalent required

  
 Associates Degree preferred

  
 Minimum 5 years experience in a warehouse environment, including supervisory experience

  
 Proven track record in a team development role

  
 Experience with order picking, shipping, receiving, inventory counts, pick/pack.

  
 In-depth knowledge of FIFO, OSHA, Safety Awareness and HAZMAT shipping.

  
 Management experience within a Quality System such as ISO 9001 or similiar strongly preferred

  
 Forklift Certification strongly preferred

 401K Plan with Company Match and Profit Sharing,

 Flexible Spending Accounts (Health and Dependent Care), 
Employee Assistance Program
, Educational Assistance Program.

 

 
 Why you should join our team!

 
 At Synergy55/Composites One we cultivate an environment of continuous growth and development. Our organization's culture is founded on the pillars of 
Respect, Teamwork, and Communication
. Much of our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as a cohesive team, respect each other in all of our daily interactions, and communicate effectively.

At Composites One our culture is founded on a clear set of Core Values that has at its core Respect, Teamwork, and Communication. Our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as one Team, respect each other in our daily interactions, and communicate effectively while doing the one thing that is critical to our success – taking care of our customers.

Are you ready for a rewarding career?

We are searching for a Warehouse Manager to join our growing Operations Team!

Now is the time to move forward and make an impact!

As a Warehouse Manager you will be responsible for the overall activity of the warehouse, including safety/risk management, Quality, RCCA, receiving, transportation (private fleet and 3rd party carriers), warehousing and equipment/building maintenance/repair operations, all in accordance with established Company and regulatory policies and procedures. In this role you will manage the process and performance involved in daily activities of the warehouse to achieve established operating income and ROA goals.

How will you impact our organization as a Warehouse Manager on a daily basis?

  • Develop and establish necessary staffing systems, processes and procedures to ensure consistent, accurate and timely customer order fulfillment.
  • Investigate and establish root cause of shipping and receiving errors and implement corrective action plans.
  • Build and maintain supplier partnerships; Works with suppliers to assure items are delivered to time and quality specifications.
  • Work in conjunction with the regional Buyers and Supply Chain Managers to coordinate product movement, warehouse space requirements and stock rotation.
  • Assist in developing plans for selling aged inventory in partnership with Sales team and regional Buyers.
  • Monitor and approve all freight transactions, including review of freight adders on a semi-annual basis.
  • Oversee the annual physical inventory process and regularly scheduled cycle counts.
  • Develop systems, processes and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources, including effective material movement and logistics, while delivering value to our customers.
  • Utilize third party rating tools, routing techniques and mapping tools that assist in making quality decision that minimize freight costs.
  • Monitor the receipt, coordination and safety of goods coming through the warehouse using the Warehouse Management System.
  • Ensure orders arrive and are dispatched on time to appropriate destinations and in expected quantities.
  • Trace history of items to determine reasons for discrepancies between inventory and stock control records; recommend corrective actions to resolve discrepancies.
  • Plan layout of warehouse and other storage areas, considering turnover, size, weight and related factors of items stored.
  • Analyze records and recommend corrective action for reported non-usable, aged and excess stock.
  • Review records for accuracy of information and compliance with established procedures, and to determine adequacy of inventory levels.
  • Monitor and evaluate expectations and performance of warehouse and delivery staff through coaching and development opportunities.
  • Promote a high level of customer focus and lead a Quality Managed warehouse environment; create an environment that encourages respect, teamwork, communication, customer satisfaction and productivity between team members and following the Integrity Service model.
  • Communicate and ensure all requirements pertaining to warehousing/ material handling, safety and shipping are followed by staff.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma or GED Equivalent required.
  • Associates Degree preferred.
  • Minimum 5 years experience in a warehouse environment, including supervisory experience.
  • Proven track record in a team development role.
  • Experience with order picking, shipping, receiving, inventory counts, pick/pack.
  • In-depth knowledge of FIFO, OSHA, Safety Awareness and HAZMAT shipping.
  • Management experience within a Quality System such as ISO 9001 or similar strongly preferred.
  • Forklift Certification strongly preferred.
  • Must be proficient in MS Office; ability to learn and master internal systems required.
Why should you join Composites One?
  • CULTURE: This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.
  • INTEGRITY: The foundation of all strong relationships is TRUST. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and Team Members to build meaningful relationships!
  • CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION: To remain successful, we must continuously improve and innovate. At Composites One, we value collaboration, and sharing ideas so that we can grow and drive continuous improvement and innovation together.

Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve!

About Us:

Composites One LLC is the leading supplier of essential materials for Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, Consumer Recreation and Construction Composites Manufacturing. We have a global presence and operate 44 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each Team Member with respect and offers opportunities for growth and personal success.
Learn more about us at compositesone.com!

System Seals is a recognized world leader in the development of hydraulic seals that out perform the competitors. Sprague is passionate about delivering the diverse products and programs that warm, power, and move the world. We keep homes warm through Northeastern winters and hospitals cool through summer. We help small businesses focus on serving their communities, and our renewable fuels keep our country’s infrastructure running. From importing wind energy components to deploying leading-edge solar technology to help power terminal facilities, we are committed to continually evolving to meet our customers’ changing energy needs. As a valued team member, the E. Providence Terminal Operator will work in a team environment, alongside leadership, to optimize efficiency while focusing on safety on every shift. Being a member of Sprague's terminal operations will give you the opportunity to execute a variety of operations including but not limited to taking in and off-loading ships/barges, conducting tank to tank transfers, assisting and training customers to load product, preventative maintenance, customer service and general upkeep of the terminal. Through on-the-job training, a successful terminal operator will have access to apply for promotional opportunities throughout our entire network of terminals. And you will also be able to enjoy extensive employee benefits including medical, dental and retirement as well as paid time off. The hiring range for this position is $22 to $24 per hour. Those with relevant industry experience, may be brought in at a higher hourly rate that reflects their expertise. This role operates on the second shift, Sunday through Thursday, 4pm to 12am. Duties and Responsibilities: Assisting with loading and offloading of vessels Gauging oil and gasoline tanks Providing rack customer assistance Conducting Detex Rounds Troubleshooting VRU issues Maintenance and repair of storage tanks, loading rack and dock. Maintenance of grounds, buildings and/or equipment Conducting scheduled equipment inspections and repairs Operating of terminal equipment and machinery Data entry and tracking Participating in security and oil spill drills and exercises Education/Experience: Experience in bulk fuel storage plants preferred. Proficient in basic math, including fractions. Working knowledge of mechanical trades Minimum of 2 years' experience as a general laborer Basic computer knowledge Knowledge of blueprint reading piping diagrams, boiler, and fuel specifications preferred. Willingness to do shift work including nights, weekends, holidays, and overtime as needed. Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license. Must be able to obtain a valid TWIC card. High school diploma or equivalent Physical activity/strength requirements are demanding and may include: Frequent standing, climbing-stairs ladders, slopes (i.e., tank ladders/stairs/ramps), grasping/handling, and in/out of truck. Constant walking. Occasional bending/stooping, squatting, reaching forward/overhead, crawling, kneeling, twisting, neck flexion/extension, balancing, and sitting. Constant lifting/carrying 1-10 lbs., frequently 11-20lbs, occasionally 21-100lbs plus lbs. (i.e. oil, steel parts, spouts, tools) Constant pushing/pulling 1-10lbs, frequently 11- 50 lbs, occasionally 51- 100 plus lbs. (i.e. mooring lines, barge and ship hoses) Frequent exposure to outside weather conditions including extreme heat/cold, noise, petroleum products, chemical agents and fumes and odors and slippery surfaces caused by weather conditions. Occasional exposure to dust, and vibrations Frequent driving, vehicle equipment and use of power tools/equipment. hearing and talking We want to hear from you! Do you like to solve problems and consider yourself forward thinking? If you are looking for a place where you can learn a lot about the energy industry while constantly challenging yourself, then Sprague is your place. Sprague employees are dedicated and driven, and we constantly strive to be the best in the industry. We work best as a team, knowing that collaboration leads to innovation and the best customer experience. As a company that has continued to evolve with the energy industry for the last 150 years, we are looking for hardworking employees to join us as we remain at the forefront of the industry. What we offer: Do you like to get involved where you work? Is giving back important to you? It’s important to us, too! Sprague donates back to the communities in which we live and work every year. Sprague has a range of committees to support varying initiatives (Sustainability, Charitable, Scholarship, Innovation, etc.). Sprague is a place that cares about its employees, its community, and about creating a place where people want to come to work every day. Plus, we have some great benefits! Medical Dental Paid Time Off 401(k) Plan with Employer Match Come join us to learn why we are consistently celebrating 20-, 30-, and even 40-year anniversaries here at Sprague! Sprague is an EEO/AA employer. We strongly encourage minorities, females, Vets, and individuals with disabilities to apply. As a federal contractor we adhere to OFCCP employment regulations.
