doc_description:
About TPI
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.
TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.
About the Role
We are looking for an experienced, highly organized technical manager to lead production and development operations in our quickly growing, high-volume automotive composites manufacturing press hall area. The manager will be responsible for the technical oversight of all critical process equipment and the launching of new equipment. The electro-mechanical systems include programable fiber cutting systems, hydraulic presses, resin injection systems, robotic pick-n-place, CNC cutting and machining systems, and ancillary support equipment. The manager will develop capacity plans, build and manage department schedules, assess and manage resource needs.
The manager will be responsible for managing their department and working with support operations to ensure EH&S standards, materials, labor, planning, maintenance, and quality support needs for operations are being met to satisfy customer and business expectations while ensuring compliance to our IATF / ISO certified QMS.
If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role.
To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee several operations at a time with excellent time management and interpersonal skills.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Assume ownership of press hall production process including meeting production deadlines and quality specifications.

 
Troubleshoot and solve challenging integrated equipment systems, support equipment, tooling design, and processing problems.

 
Lead the development, implementation, and sustaining of a robust TPM system to drive significant OEE sustained improvements with goal to meet >/= 85%

 
Improve shop organization and production workflow utilizing 5S and lean initiatives.

 
Ensure all needed and developed safeguards are in place and maintained in areas where autonomous operations are performed by equipment and robotic systems.

 
Estimate labor resources and capacity requirements for product build schedule.

 
Maintain daily Gemba meetings are supported and effective in driving communication and continual improvement

 
Provide updates to senior management on status of operations.

 
Provide day-to-day direction for subordinate team members.

 
Provide leadership to maintain an engaged and motivated work force.




Who we’re looking for: 



 
Four-year degree in technical field such as mechanical or industrial engineering, plus 5 years of experience in machine building/design; 5 years of production experience in automation; 3 years of management experience in production environments; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 
Experience leading lean initiatives including TPM, SMED, 5S, and Kaizen events

 
Experience in automotive manufacturing environment with ISO and IATF standards certification.

 
Experience in leading RCCA projects, FMEA’s, Control Plans, and Flow Plans

 
Very strong computer skills, particularly with the MS Office suite.

 
Knowledge of safety standards for a manufacturing environment.

 
Substantial knowledge of manufacturing and assembly processes such as machining, grinding, CNC, hand assembly, fasteners, etc.




Extra Skills & Abilities



 
SolidWorks or comparable CAD experience.

 
Experience with project management methods, practices and tools including scoping, facilitations, delegation, and risk management best practices.

 
A strong machine maintenance background.

 
Experience with the application of motion components and electric actuators.

 
Experience with automation or manufacturing related equipment.

 
Experience working within cross-functional teams to handle multiple priorities and meet scheduled milestones.

 
Ability to accurately estimate the level of effort required to complete a project build on time and within budget.

 
Desire and capability to coach and mentor direct reports and other project partners.

 
Demonstrated ability to create drawing packages, electronic bills of materials and engineering change orders.




Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island.


Location: 373 Market Street, Warren, RI 02885


Job Type: Full-time

International Wind
 is a maintenance and repair service provider for the burgeoning commercial wind power generation industry. We specialize in providing repairs primarily in the field at customer locations (Wind farms). Our field workers are trained and are required to maintain certification for climbing, working at heights, confined space entry and specialty processes such as composite repair for blades.
Due to exceptional growth and future opportunity, we are seeking a detail oriented, well organized, and highly motivated individual to assist with Wind Operations. This person will provide day-to-day operations support for projects and customers under his/her purview to include work scheduling, training, logistics and management of personnel to ensure safe, smooth, and effective support for our client’s needs.


*
Job duties*
The Operations Support Manager’s over-arching purpose is ensuring that the business operates safely and effectively in support of our client’s needs. Duties and obligations that support that objective include but are not limited to:



 
Ensure a strong commitment to safety

 
Establish safety as our first core value

 
Foster a safety conscious work environment where all employees understand reporting options and are empowered to improve our safety culture

 
Ensure everyone understands they have the power to stop work when circumstances lead to uncertainty





 
Establish a strong relationship with designated customer contacts by demonstrating transparency, integrity, and honesty in dealing with each assigned client

 
Function as the single point of contact maintaining continuous client contact to build and/or strengthen the relationship

 
Deliver strong and frequent leadership engagement with assigned clients to ensure we understand and can deliver on their needs

 
Present a proactive posture regarding our performance – except and react promptly





 
Install a culture of continuous improvement and set high standards and expectations for our field personnel

 
Conducting periodic reviews of procedures and processes to identify improvement opportunities within the operation of the business

 
Communicate with field personnel frequently to understand operational challenges and support requirements to help ensure successful execution of contracted work

 
Remain available and approachable to our field employees





 
Oversight of operational and contract budgets with focus on establishing savings while maintaining or improving effectiveness

 
Understand all contracts associated with assigned clients

 
Ensure that operational plans support execution of the contract and identified work scope

 
Diligently enforce best practices with respect to spend for items such as vehicles, travel, hotel, materials, and contracted services





 
Conduct periodic site visits to:

 
Reinforce safety culture

 
Improve customer relationship

 
Garner feedback from field employees and

 
Ensure field performance and behavior supports contract requirements and best practices with respect to safety, quality, and schedule




*
Job Requirements: *



 
5 years of relevant Wind experience with at least 1 in an operations role preferred

 
Field Service experience in support of periodic maintenance activities including logistics for mobilization and demobilization

 
Experience with recruiting and staffing highly desirable

 
Can quickly identify key resources and build high performing teams

 
capable of providing input for a succession planning model that maintains a defense in depth for position evolutions.





 
Effective communication – written and verbal – with both management and craft

 
Ensure transparent communication regarding status, planning and expected outcome

 
Influence others (internal and external) to improve project outcomes





 
Effectively manages his/her time and that of other’s

 
Experience and/or active certifications as a trainer for GWO and/or ENSA a plus

 
Desire a candidate with established ties to Wind Industry management. OEM and Wind Farm connections desired in both USA and Europe

 
Understanding of wind turbine blade production/engineering principles highly considered

 
Rope Access experience highly desired

 
Existing certification to provide training in support of certification to Global Wind Organization (GWO) standards




Job Type: Full-time


Pay: $100,000.00 - $135,000.00 per year


Benefits:



 
401(k)

 
Dental insurance

 
Health insurance

 
Paid time off

 
Vision insurance




Schedule:



 
Monday to Friday

 
Overtime




Work Location: One location

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.
 
 
Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

  
 
  
 
  
Your Impact:

  
 Here at Jacobs, we apply our expertise and knowledge as we look into the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference. If you want to join a company invested in you, your success and the global community - join us as our Offshore Wind Engineering Lead to help our communities achieve a net-zero future.
 
  
As a vital member of our team, you’ll be recognized as an industry leader and expert within Jacobs and spearhead our growing Offshore Wind practice. Primary focus will be on the US market, but you’ll be coordinating and working across multiple disciplines and regions to leverage Jacobs’ advisory, planning, permitting, and engineering expertise to strengthen our position in the offshore wind market. As the OSW Engineering Lead, you will help lead and build a multi-disciplinary team that can successfully deliver on the design and review of structures needed for offshore wind projects.
 
  
At Jacobs you’ll be instrumental in the growth and development of our Offshore Wind business strategy. You’ll contribute to our alternative energy wind projects/initiatives that have a significant impact upon our business. Your expertise in the design and construction of offshore structures will be critical in the delivery and positioning of Jacobs for upcoming offshore wind opportunities and programs.
 
  
Working together, we’ll help you grow and pursue what fulfills you so that we can make impacts on the future – big and small, global and local.
 
  
At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.
 
  
Here’s What You’ll Need:

  

   
 Substantial years of experience in structural dynamics, numerical modeling, 3D finite element analysis, integrated load analyses, monopile design, steel jacket design, fatigue analysis, design of offshore structures, industry software, and program languages (e.g. STAAD.Pro, SAP, ROBOT, SACS, SESAM, BLADED, SQL, Matlab, Python)

   
Strong knowledge of industry standards, offshore regulations, health & safety, and environmental legislation associated with offshore construction projects

   
Be highly experienced in interfacing with other discipline specialists (structural, geotechnical, coastal, electrical, mechanical, BIM, etc.) and familiar with offshore codes and standards (DNVGL, ISO, UFC, AISC, API, etc.)

   
Proven track record delivering large, complex, multidisciplinary projects and execution of works in an offshore environment

   
Familiarity with the US offshore wind industry, its players, and market outlook and relationships with offshore wind developers, contractors, suppliers, or utilities involved in the development of offshore wind projects in the US

   
Have an outgoing and customer-oriented attitude with the ability to build, and develop client relationships, and be a demonstrated and recognized Project Director and technical leader

   
Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering with Structural Focus

   
Professional Engineering Registration

  

  
 
  

   
 
   
Ideally, You’ll Also Have:

   
 
   

    
Advanced degree in structural or geotechnical engineering

    
Experience in the development of an offshore wind including program management functions (e.g. budget, schedule, procurement).

    
Familiarity and experience in the design of offshore floating structures

    
Leadership skills and the ability to identify suitable candidates to help grow our offshore wind practice.

    
SE Designation

   

  
 
  
Your most impactful mission in this role is to embrace living inclusion every day and enabling diversity and equality globally. For us, this means creating a culture of belonging where we all thrive by embracing all perspectives. An inclusive culture with many perspectives through diverse backgrounds allows us to leverage knowledge, leadership and connection to bring forth opportunity, creativity and growth.
 Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.
  
 At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Position Title: Blade Services Manager, Wind

Reports To:
 Project Director - Wind

Position located:
 Piedmont, SC or Remote

BHI Energy is seeking a highly motivated, detail oriented, well organized individual to assist the growth of BHI's Blade Services Division within our Wind group. This individual must have significant experience both with composite repair and utilization of access methods such as wire platforms, rope and/or ground based personnel lifts in Wind.

Responsible for technical direction of the Wind Energy Blade division to include program development, training/certification, procedure development and techniques/methods.

Job duties

The Blade Team Manager's primary function is to ensure that BHI Energy's Renewable business operates safely, smoothly and effectively in support of our client's needs. Other functions and responsibilities that can be expected from this position shall include but are not limited to:

Function as the Subject Matter Expert for BHI Energy with client in regards to operational and technical needs. Maintain continuous client contact and focus on relationship management.

Communicate with Site Supervisors and craft frequently to understand operational challenges and support requirements to ensure success of the contract within the assigned operational area.

Conduct periodic site visits to meet with BHI Energy personnel and site management.

Dedicated field support (training, work instructions, dispositions and customer support, equipment and tooling) to achieve high levels of quality and productivity

Ensure a strong commitment to safety as the number one core value.



Conducting periodic reviews of procedures, protocols and processes in an effort to identify improvement opportunities within the operation that will benefit BHI Energy and our client.

Provide strong leadership engagement with client and proactive posture regarding BHI performance.

Establish a strong relationship with customer contacts through demonstrating trust, integrity, and honesty in dealing with each client engagement.

Set positive standards and expectations with identified supervisors and within all BHI employees assigned.

Install a culture of continuous improvement and error free performance with all employees assigned.

Input for the operational budget focused on establishing cost savings and effectiveness Remain visible, available and approachable to BHI Energy employees supporting assigned operational area.

Support and foster a safety conscious work environment where all employees understand reporting options and opportunities for safety and work related concerns.

Review and understand all contracts established with client in support of assigned operational area. Ensure that site specific operations are in accordance with the contract and identified work scope.






Job Requirements:

7+ years' experience in Wind energy, blade manufacturing and/or blade field service and a minimum of 3 years in an operations role

Engineering Degree or Background preferred

Strong customer focus with product line experience

Demonstrated ability to influence others, collaborate effectively and drive change

Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain effective relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders

Capable to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment



Can effectively communicate (both verbally and in written form) with all levels of management, supervision and craft.

Knowledge of field deployment in support of periodic maintenance activities.

Capable of being the process owner utilizing continuous improvement and implementing best practices.

Effectively identifies key players and builds high performing teams.

Capable of effectively managing own time and time of other's.

Engages support from Labor Relations, HR, ECP, and Staffing when necessary.

Is able to identify talent in projects organization and develops that talent by making deliberate changes in assignments.

Able to influence others to improve project and contract outcomes and capable of providing input for a succession planning model that maintains a defense in depth for position evolutions.





About BHI Energy



BHI Energy is a broad umbrella organization with a complete service offering that covers all facets of Power Generation through the entire Electrical Delivery system. For over 40 years, our diverse services have been focused on multiple end markets, united by our level of service and quality, our unique partnership approach to our customer relationships, and our internal culture of how we interact with and support each other. To learn more about us, go to www.bhienergy.com.



BHI Energy provides competitive compensation & benefits, career advancement opportunities and a great work culture!

doc_title: US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead
doc_description:
Local Unit & Position Description

Do you want to come help lead decarbonization and the advancement of Renewable Energy?

Are you excited about working with a diverse, collaborative team at the world s largest renewable energy consultancy? Do you have a passion for permitting renewable energy projects, and furthering your professional development in a company that truly puts people first?

At DNV our organizational culture and how we collectively influence the world for future generations matters deeply to us. Our team works every day to increase the widespread deployment and operation of renewables to address climate change and positively impact society; endeavors to achieve our purpose through the success of our customers; and strives to be high-performing and innovative. Our approach reflects the equity, respect, and diversity we wish to see in the world.

DNV s Environmental and Permitting Services (EPS) team is growing rapidly, and we are seeking a US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead to help us provide comprehensive permitting services in Midwest US and the rest of the United States (US). You will be responsible for overseeing a team and leading project development and environmental and permitting activities, including the preparation of local, state, and federal renewable energy permit applications, associated environmental and social impact studies, stakeholder engagement sessions, and land use and zoning permit applications for renewable energy projects located in the Midwest and, as well as other regions within and outside of the US. You will also be engaged in leading proposal efforts, business development for wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen facilities across the US, as well as assisting with project due diligence activities.

Our Customers can choose any number of consultancies to execute on specific tasks. However, our EPS team strives to develop long-term partnerships with our Customers, acting as their trusted advisor from the early site selection stage through to operations. Our Customers are at the forefront of the energy transition. Our team is nimble, highly experienced, and driven by our mission to ensure renewable energy projects are safely and sustainably sited, permitted, and operated.

Our team

The EPS team is comprised of siting, environmental, and permitting specialists who work directly with our Customers to help identify and address project risks for terrestrial wind, offshore wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen projects. Our mission is to guide the sustainable, responsible growth of the renewables industry by providing innovative environmental and permitting expertise to support the greater good.

To facilitate this work, excellent written and oral communication skills are paramount. Broadly, our work falls into four categories:

  • Biological services, including field surveys, habitat conservation plans, corporate avian and bat protection plans, review of mitigation strategies, and associated permitting.
  • Permitting services, providing support for permitting at the federal, state/provincial, and local level for wind, solar, battery storage and hydrogen projects; including stakeholder engagement.
  • GIS services, including mapping, constraints reviews, radiocommunication surveys, and critical issues analyses.
  • Siting services, including layout optimization, acoustical measurements, noise impact assessments, shadow flicker studies, blade/ice throw assessments, glint and glare studies, and visual impact studies.

This is a Remote position

What You ll Do

  • Oversee a team of project analysts, biologists, and engineers to deliver projects within allocated time and budget. Perform technical checking and initial approval of all work products completed by project team.
  • Lead the preparation and submission of permit applications, coordination of environmental fieldwork, authoring of environmental reporting documentation including critical issues analyses, technical permitting studies and management plans, Phase I ESAs, environmental impact assessments and technical project proposals and, agency consultation and stakeholder engagement programs.
  • Provide people leadership, coaching, and quality control for a team of approximately five.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with Midwest regulatory agencies (and/or other US regions).
  • Stay informed of applicable regulatory frameworks and participate in regulatory discussions and feedback discussions related to renewable energy developments in the US.
  • Actively seek out practical and realistic business development opportunities in the US. Prepare proposals and bids and engage in facilitating innovative and new service offerings to anticipate/meet market needs.

Position Qualifications

What is Required

  • Bachelor s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • At least 5 years of environmental and/or permitting experience in the US, preferably in the renewable energy industry
  • Advanced knowledge of environmental assessment regulatory frameworks as applied to renewable energy (wind, solar, or battery storage)
  • Experience engaging with and contacts within the federal and state regulatory agencies such as the USFWS, local communities, and Tribes or First Nations
  • Demonstrated skills in people leadership (academic and/or professional experience); and
  • Demonstrated skills in project management, agency consultation, environmental analysis, and business development, including experience building and maintaining relationships with a client base
  • Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
  • We conduct pre-employment drug and background screening

What is Preferred

  • Master s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • 8+ years of relevant experience preferred
  • Experience leading winning proposal efforts for Customers in the renewable energy industry;
  • Capable of travelling to projects in development, construction, and operation sites in varying locations (10%-20% annual time); and
  • Comprehensive understanding of the Midwest wind, solar, and battery storage markets (or other US regions)
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) or other technical accreditation such P.Eng., P.Geo, P.Biol., etc

*Immigration-related employment benefits, for example visa sponsorship, are not available for this position*What We Offer

  • Generous paid time off (vacation, sick days, company holidays, personal days)
  • Multiple Medical and Dental benefit plans to choose from, Vision benefits
  • Spending accounts FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, company-seeded HSA
  • Special programs Employee Assistance Program, ID theft protection, and accident and critical illness options for you and your family
  • Employer-paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace
  • 401(k) with company match
  • Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits
  • Tuition assistance
  • Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities
  • Advancement opportunities

**Benefits may vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionHow We Do ItWe Care, We Dare, We Share

DNV is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially.

DNV is proud to announce being named one of Houston s best places to work in the 2022 Houston Business Journal Best Places to Work competition.

For more information

https://www.eeoc.gov/know-your-rights-workplace-discrimination-illegal-poster

Read more here

Diversity at DNV

Meet our Employees

About DNV

Careers in DNV

Please visit our website at www.dnv.com

As required by the various Pay Transparency laws, DNV provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado, California, Washington, or New York. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the states of Colorado, California, Washington, and New York only, the range of starting pay for this role is $100,000 - $145,000

Company & Business Area Description

DNV is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions.

We provide assurance to the entire energy value chain through our advisory, monitoring, verification, and certification services. As the world's leading resource of independent energy experts and technical advisors, we help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry. We are committed to realizing the goals of the Paris Agreement, and support all stakeholders to transition faster to a deeply decarbonized energy system.

doc_description:
Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.
 
 
Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

  
 
  
 
  
Your Impact:

  
 Here at Jacobs, we apply our expertise and knowledge as we look into the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference. If you want to join a company invested in you, your success and the global community - join us as our Offshore Wind Engineering Lead to help our communities achieve a net-zero future.
 
  
As a vital member of our team, you’ll be recognized as an industry leader and expert within Jacobs and spearhead our growing Offshore Wind practice. Primary focus will be on the US market, but you’ll be coordinating and working across multiple disciplines and regions to leverage Jacobs’ advisory, planning, permitting, and engineering expertise to strengthen our position in the offshore wind market. As the OSW Engineering Lead, you will help lead and build a multi-disciplinary team that can successfully deliver on the design and review of structures needed for offshore wind projects.
 
  
At Jacobs you’ll be instrumental in the growth and development of our Offshore Wind business strategy. You’ll contribute to our alternative energy wind projects/initiatives that have a significant impact upon our business. Your expertise in the design and construction of offshore structures will be critical in the delivery and positioning of Jacobs for upcoming offshore wind opportunities and programs.
 
  
Working together, we’ll help you grow and pursue what fulfills you so that we can make impacts on the future – big and small, global and local.
 
  
At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.
 
  
Here’s What You’ll Need:

  

   
 Substantial years of experience in structural dynamics, numerical modeling, 3D finite element analysis, integrated load analyses, monopile design, steel jacket design, fatigue analysis, design of offshore structures, industry software, and program languages (e.g. STAAD.Pro, SAP, ROBOT, SACS, SESAM, BLADED, SQL, Matlab, Python)

   
Strong knowledge of industry standards, offshore regulations, health & safety, and environmental legislation associated with offshore construction projects

   
Be highly experienced in interfacing with other discipline specialists (structural, geotechnical, coastal, electrical, mechanical, BIM, etc.) and familiar with offshore codes and standards (DNVGL, ISO, UFC, AISC, API, etc.)

   
Proven track record delivering large, complex, multidisciplinary projects and execution of works in an offshore environment

   
Familiarity with the US offshore wind industry, its players, and market outlook and relationships with offshore wind developers, contractors, suppliers, or utilities involved in the development of offshore wind projects in the US

   
Have an outgoing and customer-oriented attitude with the ability to build, and develop client relationships, and be a demonstrated and recognized Project Director and technical leader

   
Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering with Structural Focus

   
Professional Engineering Registration

  

  
 
  

   
 
   
Ideally, You’ll Also Have:

   
 
   

    
Advanced degree in structural or geotechnical engineering

    
Experience in the development of an offshore wind including program management functions (e.g. budget, schedule, procurement).

    
Familiarity and experience in the design of offshore floating structures

    
Leadership skills and the ability to identify suitable candidates to help grow our offshore wind practice.

    
SE Designation

   

  
 
  
Your most impactful mission in this role is to embrace living inclusion every day and enabling diversity and equality globally. For us, this means creating a culture of belonging where we all thrive by embracing all perspectives. An inclusive culture with many perspectives through diverse backgrounds allows us to leverage knowledge, leadership and connection to bring forth opportunity, creativity and growth.
 Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.
  
 At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Come join us at Keystone Tower systems!

      
 Keystone Tower System’s automated tower production brings modern manufacturing to the steel tower industry, dramatically increasing production rates and unlocking new possibilities for welded steel towers.

      
 We actively seek talented individuals dedicated to enabling low cost wind energy to join our rapidly growing Pampa team.

      
 Currently accepting applicants for an 
Engineering Technician
 for our manufacturing facility located in Pampa, TX!

      
 Engineering Technician:

      
 We are looking for a highly driven individual work along side our team of engineers and production staff. This person will work with the engineering team to maintain and improve machine operation. They will be required to work on projects alone or in a team environment. Additionally, they will…

      
 Job Duties

      

       
 Record and maintain data from machine operation

 System troubleshooting

Job Description Summary

All resources, and logistics required to perform services and maintenance activities on customers' site/property. These activities contribute to, maintain, repair and refurbish sold or existing products. Includes all types of maintenance service (preventive and remedial), manage maintenance facilities and field services engineering. Owns/influences budgets and operating plans. The role is guided by operating policy. Works with cross functional teams. The role has autonomy within the operational area or a segment within a larger business unit. The role may have a major impact on a small business unit or Family within a Function or P&L. High levels of evaluative judgment and operational acumen are required to achieve outcomes.

Job Description

About us:

GE’s Onshore Wind business has a total installed base of more than 50,000 wind turbines in more than 35 counties, with 100+ GW of global installed capacity. We harness increased onshore wind energy potential through a broad family of turbines that are uniquely suited for a variety of wind environments, including Cypress, GE’s most powerful onshore wind turbine, and GE’s 2MW platform, which has more than 20GW installed and in operation today. We are committed to our customers’ success in wind, offering a broad portfolio of products and services that make renewables the energy of choice for a cleaner future.

Why we come to work:

At GE Renewable Energy, our service teams keep our world moving. They’re adaptable, determined, and safety-focused, thriving in high-pressure situations. They’re the kind of people who dig deep for answers, work collaboratively with the right teams to drive solutions, and who sit back and smile when they know they have done a great job. As part of this team, you’ll be rewarded with autonomy and trust, a collaborative, supportive team, and the chance to be empowered and successful, every single day.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Create a safety culture that prioritizes safety above all else

Complete ownership of all blade related project management and execution programs for the N. American Services region

Lead a team with a focus on safety, quality, execution, and cost

Utilizing industry trends, create a strategy that allows for the N. American Services region to deliver on key customer needs

Develop and execute on a budget that aligns with business needs

Ability to clearly communicate business updates to EB+ leadership

Utilize the lean principles to deliver on continuous improvement efforts and ultimately eliminate waste throughout the business

Interaction with adjacent functions needed to solve issues. Has the ability to evaluate quality of information received and questions conflicting data for analysis.

Uses multiple internal and external resources outside of own function to help arrive at a decision.

Interprets simple internal and external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes, or services.

Manage the development of technical specifications for procurement and operations department personnel to outsource or insource work

Effectively work with internal & external customers to communicate current and future scopes of work Collaborate with inspection teams, engineering and site managers on inspection schedules and results

Coordinate Field Service personnel to ensure staff is trained and prepared to support safe operations

Develop a near-term, mid-term, and long-term strategy of department measures and processes

Clearly communicate site safety, productivity, schedules, budgets, and work scope issues (RCAs)

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university or college in Business, Operations Management or Project Management

Minimum of 4 years of experience in Operations or Field Services

Desired Characteristics:

Strong oral and written communication skills

Strong interpersonal and leadership skills

Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems.

Established project management skills

Prior experience in the field of wind energy or related services business

Understanding of Lean principles

Ability to coordinate several projects simultaneously

Effective problem identification and solution skills

Experience leading large teams of direct and indirect labor

GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

As a federal government contractor, GE may in the future be required to have U.S. employees fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Some GE customers currently have vaccination mandates that may apply to GE employees.

Salary: $100,000.00 - $135,000.00

Required experience for Wind Turbine Services Operations Manager: *



 
At least 5 years of relevant wind experience in a field service role.

 
At least 1 year in wind operations or management experience.

 
Understanding of logistics to support field operations in wind.

 
Experience recruiting, staffing, and building high performing teams.

 
Established connections with decision makers from Wind OEM’s and/or wind farm operators.

 
Effective written and oral communication abilities.

 
Effective time management.




*
Desired experience for Wind Turbine Services Operations Manager: *



 
Trainer certifications in Global Wind Organization is a plus.

 
Understanding of wind turbine blade production and engineering is a plus.

 
Spanish speaking is a plus.

 
Rope access experience is a plus.




*
Location for Wind Turbine Services Operations Manager: *



 
Houston, Texas

 
Corona, CA

 
Possibly remote




*
Essential functions for Wind Turbine Services Operations Manager: *
The Operations Support Manager’s over-arching purpose is ensuring that the business operates safely and effectively in support of our client’s needs. Duties and obligations that support that objective include but are not limited to:



 
Ensure a strong commitment to safety.

 
Establish a strong relationship with designated customer contacts by demonstrating transparency, integrity, and honesty in dealing with each assigned client.

 
Install a culture of continuous improvement and set high standards and expectations for our field personnel.

 
Oversight of operational and contract budgets with focus on establishing savings while maintaining or improving effectiveness

 
Conduct periodic site visits to:

 
Reinforce safety culture.

 
Improve customer relationship.

 
Garner feedback from field employees

 
Ensure field performance and behavior supports contract requirements and best practices with respect to safety, quality, and schedule.




*
Work environment for Wind Turbine Services Operations Manager: *
International Wind is a maintenance and repair service provider for the burgeoning commercial wind power generation industry. We specialize in providing repairs primarily in the field at customer locations (Wind farms). Our field workers are trained and are required to maintain certification for climbing, working at heights, confined space entry and specialty processes such as composite repair for blades.
Due to exceptional growth and future opportunity, we are seeking a detail oriented, well organized, and highly motivated individual to assist with Wind Operations. This person will provide day-to-day operations support for projects and customers under his/her purview to include work scheduling, training, logistics and management of personnel to ensure safe, smooth, and effective support for our client’s needs.


*
Required eligibility requirements for Wind Turbine Services Operations Manager: *



 
Clean background with no outstanding/pending charges.

 
Ability to pass a drug and alcohol test at time of hire and random.

 
Valid Driver’s License

*Work authorization for Wind Turbine Services Operations Manager:

About TPI 

 
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. 
 TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability. 

 
About the Role 

 
We are looking for an experienced, highly organized technical manager to lead production and development operations in our quickly growing, high-volume automotive composites manufacturing press hall area. The manager will be responsible for the technical oversight of all critical process equipment and the launching of new equipment. The electro-mechanical systems include programable fiber cutting systems, hydraulic presses, resin injection systems, robotic pick-n-place, CNC cutting and machining systems, and ancillary support equipment. The manager will develop capacity plans, build and manage department schedules, assess and manage resource needs. 

 
The manager will be responsible for managing their department and working with support operations to ensure EH&S standards, materials, labor, planning, maintenance, and quality support needs for operations are being met to satisfy customer and business expectations while ensuring compliance to our IATF / ISO certified QMS. 

 
If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role. 

 
To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee several operations at a time with excellent time management and interpersonal skills. 

 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities 

 

  
Assume ownership of press hall production process including meeting production deadlines and quality specifications. 

  
Troubleshoot and solve challenging integrated equipment systems, support equipment, tooling design, and processing problems. 

  
Lead the development, implementation, and sustaining of a robust TPM system to drive significant OEE sustained improvements with goal to meet >/= 85% 

  
Improve shop organization and production workflow utilizing 5S and lean initiatives. 

  
Ensure all needed and developed safeguards are in place and maintained in areas where autonomous operations are performed by equipment and robotic systems. 

  
Estimate labor resources and capacity requirements for product build schedule. 

  
Maintain daily Gemba meetings are supported and effective in driving communication and continual improvement 

  
Provide updates to senior management on status of operations. 

  
Provide day-to-day direction for subordinate team members. 

  
Provide leadership to maintain an engaged and motivated work force. 

 

 
Who we’re looking for: 

 

  
Four-year degree in technical field such as mechanical or industrial engineering, plus 5 years of experience in machine building/design; 5 years of production experience in automation; 3 years of management experience in production environments; or equivalent combination of education and experience. 

  
Experience leading lean initiatives including TPM, SMED, 5S, and Kaizen events 

  
Experience in automotive manufacturing environment with ISO and IATF standards certification. 

  
Experience in leading RCCA projects, FMEA’s, Control Plans, and Flow Plans 

  
Very strong computer skills, particularly with the MS Office suite. 

  
Knowledge of safety standards for a manufacturing environment. 

  
Substantial knowledge of manufacturing and assembly processes such as machining, grinding, CNC, hand assembly, fasteners, etc. 

 

 
Extra Skills & Abilities 

 

  
SolidWorks or comparable CAD experience. 

  
Experience with project management methods, practices and tools including scoping, facilitations, delegation, and risk management best practices. 

  
A strong machine maintenance background. 

  
Experience with the application of motion components and electric actuators. 

  
Experience with automation or manufacturing related equipment. 

  
Experience working within cross-functional teams to handle multiple priorities and meet scheduled milestones. 

  
Ability to accurately estimate the level of effort required to complete a project build on time and within budget. 

  
Desire and capability to coach and mentor direct reports and other project partners. 

  
Demonstrated ability to create drawing packages, electronic bills of materials and engineering change orders. 

 

 
Location 
 This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island.

Job Description Summary

As Product Manager in the Product Engineering team, you will lead development of new wind turbine blades, from initial idea to implementation in LM and non-LM factories, according to the LM Wind Power product development manual.



Furthermore, you will be responsible for full lifecycle product ownership; including product optimization and management of factory/field support.



Implementation and managing of product and customer related challenges will be done in close cooperation and with support from Regional functions in US, India and China.

Job Description

About us:

LM Wind Power, a GE Renewable Energy business is a world leading supplier of blades and service to the wind industry. The wind turbine industry is becoming increasingly complex, with radical progress made over the last few decades, providing great opportunities for professional development and a work environment that promotes initiative and creativity. If working in a company which creates state-of-the-art technology and processes attracts you, LM Wind Power has a career for you.

Why we come to work:

At GE Renewable Energy, our Project Managers work with integrity, great commitment, and incredible collaborative skills. Their projects can be global and complex, so they thrive under pressure and complicated management chains. While the work can be tough, the sense of pride they feel at the end result motivates our Project Managers to hang tough and focus on outcomes. Through your personal integrity and unparalleled organizational skills, you can work in a role that delivers an incredible sense of accomplishment, making a mark on the future of our world.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Develop and implement new blade models in LM and non-LM factories, adhering to customer requirements.

Project execution according to the agreed schedule, cost, budget, and product requirements.

Ensure commitment from internal stakeholders, working closely with cross-functional teams in accordance with LM tollgate process for NPI blades

Full product lifecycle ownership; including continuous improvement of existing products and managing factory/field issues.

Communicate project status, risk, and milestones to internal and external stakeholders.

Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Leads small projects with low risks and resource requirements.

Explains information; developing skills to bring team members to consensus around topics.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in mechanical engineering, aeronautical engineering, or equivalent).

Minimum 3 years of project management or product development experience.

Desired Characteristics:

Project management skills and proven ability to manage multiple priorities and work through ambiguity to deliver results.

Demonstrated leadership to successfully motivate and drive accountability for diverse teams through involvement, safety and collaboration in a global organization.

Experience with the interfaces between the customer, design engineering, and manufacturing.

Extensive knowledge of wind turbine blade designs, materials, manufacturing & operations.

Strong English language skills (verbal and writing).

Lean Six Sigma certification

GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

As a federal government contractor, GE may in the future be required to have U.S. employees fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Some GE customers currently have vaccination mandates that may apply to GE employees.

Yes

doc_title: Technical Customer Manager – Fixed Structures, Renewables and Ocean Structures (Americas)
doc_description:
Local Unit & Position Description: 
 

   Product Line Renewables & Ocean Structures builds and distributes engineering software. Our mission is to “empower the world’s professionals to accelerate the energy transition, and sustainable use of the ocean”, and we aim “to be the most trusted engineering and digitalization partner, bringing value through our customer experience focus”. Our portfolio of software products includes a combination of successful industry favorites like Sesam, Bladed, and Nauticus Machinery, and new products aiming for hypergrowth WindFarmer and SolarFarmer.
 

 

  
 Our Product Line is part of the DNV – Digital Solutions business area, built up of functional teams across a collaborative organization structure. The Renewables & Ocean Structures product line includes a product Centre where software is developed, a product management team, sales regions and a marketing and communications team. 
  
 This technically focused Sales support role will report to the Head of Regional Sales, as part of the regional commercial team.
 

 

  
 The 
  
Technical Customer Manager
 will work with both Account Managers and the Business Development team, being a highly visible client facing position, taking the technical lead, from early-stage client interaction, contract closing and through to the onboarding process, with the main focus being on the highly active Americas offshore wind sector.
  
 An engineering background will be essential for this role; however, a natural commercial aptitude will also be required to ensure the value is always at the forefront of client engagement.
 

 

 

  
 A natural outgoing personally and ability to engage clients at all levels of their organization is essential, along with the willingness to travel to be sat with the client.
 

 

  
 This role will be supported technically by the Product Line and Product Center. These knowledge centers are located globally, so ability to build these remote relationships will be essential to the success of this position. 
  
 This role can be equally as suited to a graduate with a few years of experience who is looking to accelerated professionally develop, as someone with an extensive career history – the balance of technical and commercial mindset are the key traits for this position.
  
 
  
 
  
What You’ll Do

 

 

  
 Work hand in hand with the commercial team, supporting the Account Management and Business Development, taking the technical lead in client discussions, also leading product demonstrations and workshops

  
 Be the technical go to person within the American market for fixed structures, interacting with the global Product Center / Product Line for second line technical support

  
 Be customer facing and be energized by this

  
 Have / gain the high-level technical knowledge for the fixed structures products within the Renewable and Ocean

  
 Structure portfolio and the associated domain background

  
 Have a commercial mindset, ensuring the technical value proposition is demonstrated at all times.

  
 Lead customer technical meeting, either independently or as joint meetings with commercial colleagues.

  
 Attend conferences, presenting technical papers / sit on technical panels

  
 Work closely with Product Marketing to provide regional market feedback, being the voice of the customer and providing constructive input into the product roadmaps

  
 Support our Customer Advisory Board and be the regional conduit

 
 Position Qualifications: 
 

  
 What is required

 

 

  
 5+ years of Industry experience in pre-sales management (or similar customer facing technical position)

  
 Bachelors Degree in Engineering related field

  
 Working as part of an integrated sales team

  
 Proactively build and maintain strong relationships, both externally and internally

  
 Have worked in a multi-cultural technical and commercial environment

  
 Courage to make qualified independent decisions and move forward

  
 Solution oriented and highly proactive

  
 Collaborative, both within immediate team and the wider business

  
 Excellent communication skills and ability to inspire people, developing strong relationships

  
 Ability to travel to where the customer is – primarily east and west coast US, occasionally LATAM

  
 Strong written and verbal English communication skills

  
 Pre-employment drug and background screening

 

 

  
 What is perferred

 

 

  
 Experience and domain knowledge of the renewables and/or offshore energy industries within the Americas market

  
 A working knowledge of DNV Renewable and Ocean Structures software portfolio (or competitor products) would be a distinct advantage

  
 A professional network within the offshore and / or wind sector

  
 Portuguese & Spanish Language

 

 

 

  
 **Immigration-related employment benefits, for example visa sponsorship, are not available for this position**
 

 

 

  
 What We Offer

 

 

  
 Generous Paid Time Off (Vacation, Company Holidays, Parental Leave, Sick, and Disability)

  
 Multiple Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefit Plans to choose from

  
 Spending Accounts – FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, Company-Seeded HSA

  
 401(K) with company match

  
 Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits

  
 Education reimbursement program

  
 Employer-Paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace

  
 Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities

 

 

   **Benefits may vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee election
 

 

 

  
 How We Do It

 

 

 
 We Care, We Dare, We Share

 

 

  
 DNV is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
 

 

 

  
 For more information
 

 

 

  
 https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/migrated_files/employers/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf
 

 

 

  
 DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially
 

 

 

  
 Read more here
 

 

 
 Diversity at DNV 

 
Meet our Employees

 
 About DNV

 
 Careers in DNV

 

 

  
 Please visit our website at www.dnv.com
 

 
 
 
 Company & Business Area Description: 
 

   DNV is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions.
 

 

 

  
 We are a world-leading provider of digital solutions and software applications with focus on the energy, maritime and healthcare markets. Our solutions are used worldwide to manage risk and performance for wind turbines, electric grids, pipelines, processing plants, offshore structures, ships, and more. Supported by our domain knowledge and Veracity assurance platform, we enable companies to digitize and manage business critical activities in a sustainable, cost-efficient, safe and secure way.

At Composites One our culture is founded on a clear set of Core Values that has at its core Respect, Teamwork, and Communication. Our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as one Team, respect each other in our daily interactions, and communicate effectively while doing the one thing that is critical to our success – taking care of our customers. Are you ready for a rewarding career? We are searching for a Warehouse Manager to join our Operations Team! Now is the time to move forward and make an impact! As a Warehouse Manager you will be responsible for the overall activity of the warehouse, including safety/risk management, Quality, RCCA, receiving, transportation (private fleet and 3rd party carriers), warehousing and equipment/building maintenance/repair operations, all in accordance with established Company and regulatory policies and procedures. In this role you will manage the process and performance involved in daily activities of the warehouse to achieve established operating income and ROA goals. How will you impact our organization as a Warehouse Manager on a daily basis? Develop and establish necessary staffing systems, processes and procedures to ensure consistent, accurate and timely customer order fulfillment. Investigate and establish root cause of shipping and receiving errors and implement corrective action plans. Build and maintain supplier partnerships; Works with suppliers to assure items are delivered to time and quality specifications. Work in conjunction with the regional Buyers and Supply Chain Managers to coordinate product movement, warehouse space requirements and stock rotation. Assist in developing plans for selling aged inventory in partnership with Sales team and regional Buyers. Monitor and approve all freight transactions, including review of freight adders on a semi-annual basis. Oversee the annual physical inventory process and regularly scheduled cycle counts. Develop systems, processes and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources, including effective material movement and logistics, while delivering value to our customers. Utilize third party rating tools, routing techniques and mapping tools that assist in making quality decision that minimize freight costs. Monitor the receipt, coordination and safety of goods coming through the warehouse using the Warehouse Management System. Ensure orders arrive and are dispatched on time to appropriate destinations and in expected quantities. Trace history of items to determine reasons for discrepancies between inventory and stock control records; recommend corrective actions to resolve discrepancies. Plan layout of warehouse and other storage areas, considering turnover, size, weight and related factors of items stored. Analyze records and recommend corrective action for reported non-usable, aged and excess stock. Review records for accuracy of information and compliance with established procedures, and to determine adequacy of inventory levels. Monitor and evaluate expectations and performance of warehouse and delivery staff through coaching and development opportunities. Promote a high level of customer focus and lead a Quality Managed warehouse environment; create an environment that encourages respect, teamwork, communication, customer satisfaction and productivity between team members and following the Integrity Service model. Communicate and ensure all requirements pertaining to warehousing/ material handling, safety and shipping are followed by staff. Required Skills and Qualifications: High School Diploma or GED Equivalent required. Associates Degree preferred. Minimum 5 years experience in a warehouse environment, including supervisory experience. Proven track record in a team development role. Experience with order picking, shipping, receiving, inventory counts, pick/pack. In-depth knowledge of FIFO, OSHA, Safety Awareness and HAZMAT shipping. Management experience within a Quality System such as ISO 9001 or similar strongly preferred. Forklift Certification strongly preferred. Must be proficient in MS Office; ability to learn and master internal systems required. Why should you join Composites One? CULTURE: This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of Respect, Teamwork, and Communication. INTEGRITY: The foundation of all strong relationships is TRUST. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and Team Members to build meaningful relationships! CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION: To remain successful, we must continuously improve and innovate. At Composites One, we value collaboration, and sharing ideas so that we can grow and drive continuous improvement and innovation together. Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve! About Us: Composites One LLC is the leading supplier of essential materials for Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, Consumer Recreation and Construction Composites Manufacturing. We have a global presence and operate 44 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each Team Member with respect and offers opportunities for growth and personal success. Learn more about us at compositesone.com! Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion At Composites One, all qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or other protected classification as defined by applicable law and regulation. ADA Accommodations Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please contact the ADA Coordinator by email at ADACoordinator@compositesone.com. Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Department: Manufacturing Employment


Type: Full-time, hourly Position


Title: Production Technician


Location: 58144 Old Portland Rd, Building B, Warren, OR 97053


Compensation: Starting pay $17 per hour, more with experience


About us: Since 1994, we've offered high-quality composite manufacturing, custom tooling, and prototyping services to various markets, including aerospace, transportation, wind energy, industrial, marine, automotive, and agriculture (to name a few).


We're a tight-knit team of hands-on tinkerers and out-of-the-box thinkers with a common goal: delivering timely, dynamic solutions. Our clients are global industry leaders who demand innovation, and we work hard to bring it.


What we’re looking for: A roll-up-your-sleeves and get-the-job-done-right kind of person. You know the ins and outs of what it takes and have a passion for continually learning to do it even better. You're capable of working with a diverse range of personalities and building productive working relationships with teammates. You can focus and work under pressure during tight deadlines with humor, tact, and professionalism. You enjoy the satisfaction of seeing a completed project and knowing that it was a job done well.


Never worked with composites before? It's similar to fiberglass! If you have experience in manufacturing of any kind, we still want to hear from you. We're looking for hard-working, honest people to join our team. We're willing to invest in training you if you're willing to take on new challenges with an open mind and a can-do attitude.


The Job: We encourage career development and actively promote from within. If you are looking for a role with tons of scope for progression, this could be it! As a Production Technician, you’ll be responsible for various activities involved in the manufacturing of composite parts and assemblies, including but not limited to:


- Material Prep/Kitting - Mold Prep - Composite Layup and Vacuum Bagging - Loading/Unloading of processing equipment - Hand Trim/Drill/Sanding - Paint/Bodywork prep


Minimum Skills: * Ability to complete necessary process documentation. * Ability to use simple measuring tools. * Ability and willingness to cross-train in any or all relevant skill areas.


Education: * High School Diploma or equivalent.


Physical Requirements * You must be capable of continuous standing and/or sitting when completing assigned tasks. * Physical movement includes bending, squatting, and reaching at or above shoulder level to retrieve supplies or move tooling and components. * Occasionally, your role may require you to lift up to 50 pounds. * Hand-eye coordination and finger dexterity are necessary to perform various repetitive process tasks. * We take safety protocols seriously. You must be able to wear and function while using protective safety gear as provided under company safety rules


The Extras We're a compassionate, family-friendly employer. We offer paid time off and medical and dental insurance. We also have an employee retirement plan with up to a 3% employer match. We encourage our employees to keep up with industry trends, such as advancements in equipment or materials. We offer reimbursement for approved training and educational opportunities to support your personal and career growth. For more information on CUG and photos of some of the cool stuff we've made, visit www.compositesuniversal.com.


Job Type: Full-time


Pay: From $17.00 per hour


Benefits:



 
401(k)

 
401(k) matching

 
Dental insurance

 
Health insurance

 
Life insurance

 
Paid time off

 
Vision insurance




Schedule:



 
8 hour shift

 
Monday to Friday




Work Location: One location

About Re:Build Manufacturing & Oribi

Oribi Manufacturing, located in Denver, CO, is a leader in the development and production of advanced thermoplastic composites. We utilize automation, robotics, and advanced materials to produce advanced composite parts for a wide range of industries, including sporting goods, defense, wind energy, automotive, marine, and others.

Re:Build Manufacturing is a rapidly growing family of industrial businesses combining enabling technologies, operational superiority, and strategic M&A to build America's next generation industrial company. At Re:Build we deploy deep expertise in operations management and technology to supercharge performance of our subsidiaries by implementing core technologies across industrial platforms in diverse growth markets. Our goal is to help revitalize the U.S. manufacturing base over the coming decades, creating substantial opportunities for our employees and the communities where we operate.

We leverage deep professional expertise and a candid, principled operating culture to drive differentiated outcomes for our customers, our employees, our communities and our investors. Ours is a fast-paced environment where individuals can stretch and be challenged with a wide variety of opportunities and projects. We empower and support our employees to pursue their fullest potential and provide meaningful avenues for personal and professional growth.


Who we are looking for

The Operations Manager will be responsible for high-level managerial and administrative functions of the day-to-day business operations including Production, Purchasing, Production Control / Planning, Maintenance, and Shipping/Receiving. The ideal candidate will form strategies to improve performance, procure material and resources efficiently, secure compliance, and implement best practices across all levels.

What you will get to do

  • Provides leadership, and management of employees to ensure effective selection, retention, development, disciplinary action, and performance management.
  • Leads and coordinates organization operation strategies and activities.
  • Collaborates in the development and implementation of organization policies, practices, procedures, and attainment of operating goals.
  • Reviews, analyzes, and prepares reports, records, and directives, and confers with managers/supervisors to obtain data required for planning activities, such as new commitments, the status of work in progress, and problems encountered.
  • Analyzes performance metrics and summarizes operational data.
  • Assigns, or delegates responsibility for, specified work or functional activities and disseminates policies and objectives to supervisors/staff.
  • Coordinates with other support departments such as Human Resources, Finance, Quality, Engineering, Program Management / Sales to ensure successful production operations.
  • Oversees Production, Purchasing, Production Control/Planning, Maintenance, Shipping and Receiving.
  • Determines labor needs to meet production goals.
  • Assists with budget preparation for the operations unit.
  • Coordinates with Engineering, Technology, and Business Development teams to determine pricing, timing, and NRE.

What you bring to the team

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Management, Business Administration, Technical field (e.g. Engineering), or related field required.
  • 6-10 years experience in a leadership role, preferably in a manufacturing environment.
  • Strong customer service orientation, interpersonal skills, and relationship-building abilities required.
  • Critical thinking, sound judgment, and the ability to appropriately handle confidential, sensitive information are required.
  • Excellent leadership, managerial and supervisory skills.
  • Extensive knowledge of operations and production management, including experience with Lean principles and practice, and ERP systems.
  • Ability to interpret financial data as needed to set production goals.
  • Ability to mentor and coach team members.
  • Proficiency in MS Office applications required.

Salary Range: $92,300 to $138,450

The BIG payoff

We are a company who is going to make a difference in the industries and the communities in which we choose to operate.

Every employee of Re:Build will share ownership in the company and will share in the financial rewards of the success we achieve together, at all levels of the company!

We want to work with people that reflect the communities in which we operate

Re:Build Manufacturing is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, marital status, parental status, cultural background, organizational level, work styles, tenure and life experiences. Or for any other reason.

Re:Build is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations.ta@ReBuildmanufacturing.com or you may call us at 617.909.6275.

Company Description

   

   

    
 ITW (NYSE: ITW) is a Fortune 200 global multi-industrial manufacturing leader with revenue totaling $14.5 billion in 2021.
