ITW has nearly 50,000 dedicated colleagues in operations around the world who thrive in the company’s unique decentralized and entrepreneurial culture.

    
 ITW is a great employer with a distinct culture that empowers our people to think and act like entrepreneurs within ITW’s strategic framework. This decentralized, entrepreneurial culture is one component of the powerful and highly differentiated ITW Business Model. Commitment to our core values, safety and our culture is a competitive advantage for the company, and we are committed to fully leveraging its strength.

    
 ITW Polymers Sealants North America, Inc. offers expanded sealants solutions to various industries and its key markets including construction (roofing, surfacing, metal building, and fenestration), aerospace composites and wind energy. Our brands with a proven history of success include ERSystems®, Permathane®, Tacky Tape®, STA’-PUT®, Pacific Polymers®, Acryl-R®, Miracle®, and Elastek®.

   

  

  

  

   

    
 Job Description

   

   

    
 POSITION SUMMARY:

    
 The Human Resources Manager is a business partner that will help drive strategic talent initiatives across our division. The HR Manager role is a hands-on and a collaborative role that requires great attention to detail and high level of confidentiality.

    
 Key Responsibilities:

    
 Enterprise Strategy & 80/20 Objectives

 Partnership with plant operations leadership team to support 80 focus areas

     
 Be able to effectively communicate and/or lead changes impacting the business

    

    
 Human Resource Management

    

     
 Effectively manage all areas of the HR function for your client groups from managing daily and tactical tasks to effectively leading the strategic elements such as workforce planning, morale/culture, change management and risk mitigation.

     
 Partner with Division HR Director for execution of annual talent management cycle

     
 Partner with operations leadership while assuming local management leadership role for plant operations

 Revise and/or create, implement, and effectively communicate human resource or people related processes and policies

     
 Interpret, report and manage compliance with the applicable state/country laws and regulation

     
 Travel approximately 25% to 40% to support the Norcross, GA and Rockland, MA plants

    

    
 Talent Acquisition

 Managerial courage to identify and coach managers and/or leaders in real time

     
 Manage performance review process for all employees, including performance issues of individuals and teams

    

    
 Employee Relations

 Partner, notify and/or elevate sensitive employee relations matters to Division HR Director and/or Corporate HR ensuring a shared risk approach

     
 Responsible for FMLA, STD and LTD administration, leveraging Corporate HR as needed

    

    
 Compensation & Benefits

    

     
 Coordinate compensation review process for promotions, merit increases and bonus plans

    

    
 SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:

    

     
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills are necessary, as well as the ability to build networks of contacts externally and internally

     
 Ability to link company/business objectives to HR strategies

     
 Must be able to exercise independent judgment, ability to work independently and function well in a team environment

     
 High level of intellectual curiosity with ability to find problems and provide solutions

     
 Strategic thinking with ability to accelerate and influence change

     
 Excellent time and project management capabilities, must have a sense of urgency, able to prioritize including the ability to manage competing priorities

    

   

  

  

  

   

    
 Qualifications

   

   

    
 EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

    
 Required

    

     
 Bachelor’s Degree

 Preferred

 7+ years of progressive HR Generalist experience, preferably with at least one previous leadership role

     
 Prior manufacturing experience

     
 Bilingual communication skills; English and Spanish

About TPI 
 TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. 

 
The Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) Manager is the key individual responsible for ensuring a safe and environmentally compliant organization. The fundamental task is to plan, direct, and implement environmental, health and safety programs to ensure a safe, healthy, accident-free and sustainable organization by performing the following duties personally or through subordinate team members. 

 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities 

 

  
Plans and implements EHS policies and procedures in compliance with local, state, and federal Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) rules and regulations. 

  
Plans and implements programs to train managers and employees in work site safety practices, fire prevention, and correct handling techniques for chemicals, equipment, and other materials. 

  
Leads air permit, hazardous waste, community right to know, and other applicable regulatory compliance activities including record keeping and reporting and reporting requirements. 

  
Prepares studies and analyses of industrial accident causes and hazards to health for use by company personnel and outside agencies. 

  
Inspects organization facilities to detect existing or potential safety and health hazards, determines corrective or preventative measures where indicated, and follows up to ensure measures have been implemented. 

  
Provides information, signs, posters, barriers, and other materials to warn of potential and actual safety hazards and to prevent access to hazardous conditions. 

  
Leads and trains others in the investigation of accidents and injuries and cooperates in the preparation of material and evidence for organization use in hearings, lawsuits, and insurance investigations. 

  
Oversees the administration of workers' compensation program, including working with the insurance carrier to reduce employee lost time. 

  
Prepares and arranges safety exhibits and material for display, promotional work, industry conferences, and exhibitions. 

  
Represents the organization in community or industry safety groups and programs. 

  
Maintains safety files and records. 

  
Directly supervises 1-2 employees within the EHS function. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. 

  
Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems. 

 

 
Who we’re looking for: 

 

  
Bachelor’s degree in Environmental (preferred) or related field (natural sciences, engineering, chemistry, or similar) and minimum of 7+ years work experience Safety/Environmental leadership experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. 

  
Demonstrated success in improving EHS performance and establishing best practices. 

  
Proven examples of effective communication and listening skills. 

  
Demonstrated team leadership skills. Experience in managing EHS programs. 

  
Passion and drive for environmental and safety compliance. 

  
Knowledge of environmental and OSHA regulations. 

  
Broad knowledge of workers’ compensation regulations and best practices. 

  
Ability to read and interpret technical documents and regulations. 

 

 
Location 
 This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren RI.

ABOUT SKYSPECS


At SkySpecs, our mission is to simplify renewable asset management so less can do more for the planet. SkySpecs is helping to make this possible by automating the operations and maintenance of wind farms using advanced robotics paired with our custom-built asset performance management software, Horizon.


SkySpecs launched the world's first completely autonomous blade inspection product in 2016 with a custom designed drone system. Since then, SkySpecs has inspected over 95,000 wind turbines in over 27 countries, becoming the world leader in understanding the health of turbine blades. Identifying issues with turbine blades is only the first step. In 2019 SkySpecs launched Horizon to be a platform for SkySpecs to offer a multi-layered solution for customers that includes: data collection, wind turbine blade engineering expertise, and a place for all stakeholders to collaborate to manage and analyze massive amounts of data, spot trends, and create plans for high-cost repair campaigns. In 2021, SkySpecs acquired two companies specializing in wind turbine drivetrain monitoring and financial management, further expanding our asset management portfolio. Ultimately, this will help reduce the cost and risk of operations for the industry.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

SkySpecs is seeking a Product Manager that will gain a deep working understanding of the SkySpecs' products and work with various stakeholders throughout the organization to coordinate various product activities. You will be tasked with helping SkySpecs take our autonomous inspection product to the next level to continue double-digit growth. The Product Manager role is a high-visibility role within the organization, and you will have the opportunity to work directly with customers to understand their needs, work with SkySpecs leadership on product strategy, work with Sales and Marketing to build go-to-market materials and to work with the technology teams to develop amazing software.

REQUIREMENTS

Product instincts that focus on the user and drive delivering value to the customer

3+ years in a software product management or product engineering role working on web-based applications

BA/BS in Business, Engineering, or another technical/analytical field

Expertise using business intelligence tools such as Tableau or Sisense to perform analysis on large datasets to drive business value

Demonstrated project management skills in development, implementation or technical analysis projects

Experience developing software requirements and communicating with development teams

Strong written, presentation, and communication skills to both internal and external stakeholders

Comfortable using SQL database tools to manage large datasets and manipulate data

Willingness to travel up to 25%

Based in the SkySpecs' Ann Arbor office

Renewable or wind energy asset management experience

Product design, user interface design, or software development experience

Pragmatic Marketing/Gartner marketing methodology experience

Startup experience

THE WORK

As a SkySpecs' Product Manager, your role is to build new products and features by combining existing ideas with new ideas from your experience and interactions with customers and prospects. You will need to have a deep technical understanding of the SkySpecs products, as well as a big-picture understanding of the challenges that face our customers and technologies needed to solve those challenges. You will:

Talk to customers as often as possible to better understand what they are doing, working on, and what challenges they have

Define product requirements and work with developers to design and build new features

Assist in QA of the software and documentation writing

Answer customer support questions and work with customers to find resolution on their issues

Work with Marketing to develop sales support materials, demos and use cases

Work with Sales to develop technical sales materials, inspection analysis materials, and demonstrations

Develop relationships with key customers and broaden adoption of our products within their companies

Work with the Solutions Delivery team to help deliver value to customers and improve internal products

PERKS YOU'LL RECEIVE

A great downtown Ann Arbor office with access to coffee, shopping, bars, restaurants, etc.

A fun, energetic, often zany workplace that is open and accepting of all interests

An open vacation policy (our policy is: Get your work done; be reliable; go above and beyond because you want to, and take rest and relaxation when you need it!).

A flexible work schedule and work environment

Health benefits

doc_title: Technical Business Development Manager, Renewables and Ocean Structures (N. America)
doc_description:
Local Unit & Position Description: 
 

   Product Line Renewables & Ocean Structures builds and distributes engineering software. Our mission is to “empower the world’s professionals to accelerate the energy transition, and sustainable use of the ocean”, and we aim “to be the most trusted engineering and digitalization partner, bringing value through our customer experience focus”. Our portfolio of software products includes a combination of successful industry favorites like Sesam, Bladed, and Nauticus Machinery, and new products aiming for hypergrowth WindFarmer and SolarFarmer.
 

 

 

  
 Our Product Line is part of the DNV – Digital Solutions business area, built up of functional teams across a collaborative organization structure. The Renewables & Ocean Structures product line includes a product Centre where software is developed, a product management team, sales regions and a marketing and communications team. 
  
 This technically focused Business Development role will report to the Head of Business Development, Americas Region as part of the regional commercial team.
  
 
  
 The 
  
Technical Business Development Manager
 will work with both the Business Development team and Account Managers, being a highly visible client facing position, taking the technical lead, from early-stage client interaction, contract closing and through to the onboarding process within the highly active N. American offshore wind sector.
  
 An engineering background will be essential for this role; however, a natural commercial aptitude will also be required to ensure the value is always at the forefront of client engagement.
 

 

 

  
 A natural outgoing personally and ability to engage clients at all levels of their organization is essential, along with the willingness to travel to be sat with the client.
 

 

  
 This role will be supported technically by the Product Line and Product Center. These knowledge centers are located globally, so ability to build these remote relationships will be essential to the success of this position. 
  
 This role can be equally as suited to a graduate with a few years of experience who is looking to professionally develop, as someone with an extensive career history – the balance of technical and commercial mindset are the key traits for this position.
 

 

  
 What You’ll Do

 

 

  
 Work hand in hand with the Business Development team, also supporting the Account Management team, taking the technical lead in client discussions, also leading product demonstrations and workshops

  
 Be the technical go to person within the N. American market, interacting with the global Product Center / Product Line for second line technical support

  
 Be customer facing and be energized by this

  
 Have / gain the high-level technical knowledge for all products within the Renewable and Ocean Structure portfolio

  
 Have a commercial mindset, ensuring the technical value proposition is demonstrated at all times

  
 Lead customer technical meeting, either independently or as joint meetings with Business Development Managers/Account Managers

  
 Attend conferences, presenting technical papers / sit on technical panels

  
 Work closely with Product Marketing to provide regional market feedback, being the voice of the customer and providing constructive input into the product roadmaps

  
 Support our Customer Advisory Board and be the regional conduit

 
 Position Qualifications: 
 

  
 What is required

 

 

  
 3+ years industry experience in pre-sales management (or similar customer facing technical position)

  
 Bachelors Degree in Engineering related field

  
 Working as part of an integrated sales team

  
 Proactively build and maintain strong relationships, both externally and internally

  
 Have worked in a multi-cultural technical and commercial environment

  
 Courage to make qualified independent decisions and move forward

  
 Solution oriented and highly proactive

  
 Collaborative, both within immediate team and the wider business

  
 Excellent communication skills and ability to inspire people, developing strong relationships

  
 Willingness to travel to where the customer is – primarily east and west coast US

  
 Strong written and verbal English communication skills

  
 Pre-employment drug and background screening

 

 

  
 What is preferred

 

 

  
 Experience and domain knowledge of the renewables and/or offshore energy industries within the N American market

  
 A working knowledge of DNV Renewable and Ocean Structures software portfolio (or competitor products) would be a distinct advantage

  
 A professional network within the offshore and / or wind sector; this may be from a substructure design / developer / OEM / software background

  
 Spanish or Portuguese fluency

  
 MBA Degree

 

 

  
 **Immigration-related employment benefits, for example visa sponsorship, are not available for this position**
 

 

 

  
 What We Offer

 

 

  
 Generous Paid Time Off (Vacation, Company Holidays, Parental Leave, Sick, and Disability)

  
 Multiple Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefit Plans to choose from

  
 Spending Accounts – FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, Company-Seeded HSA

  
 401(K) with company match

  
 Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits

  
 Education reimbursement program

  
 Employer-Paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace

  
 Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities

 

 

   **Benefits may vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee election
 

 

 

  
 How We Do It

 

 

 
 We Care, We Dare, We Share

 

 

  
 DNV is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
 

 

 

  
 For more information:
 

 

 

  
 https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/migrated_files/employers/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf
 

 

 

  
 DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially
 

 

 

  
 Read more here
 

 

 
 Diversity at DNV 

 
Meet our Employees

 
 About DNV

 
 Careers in DNV

 

 
 Please visit our website at www.dnv.com
 Company & Business Area Description: 
 

   DNV is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions.
 

 

 

  
 We are a world-leading provider of digital solutions and software applications with focus on the energy, maritime and healthcare markets. Our solutions are used worldwide to manage risk and performance for wind turbines, electric grids, pipelines, processing plants, offshore structures, ships, and more. Supported by our domain knowledge and Veracity assurance platform, we enable companies to digitize and manage business critical activities in a sustainable, cost-efficient, safe and secure way.

Job Description Summary
 We are looking for an experienced Project Manager to join our Certification, Validation, & Compliance (CVC) function within LM Engineering & Technologies. You will be reporting to Director of RETL Program Office. 
 
 
 
 LM’s CVC function operates some of the most advanced accredited full scale rotor blade and rotor test rigs in the industry and holds an IEC RETL (Renewable Energy Test Lab) approval for rotor blade testing. LM designs, manufactures, validates, and certifies over a dozen products early utilizing its internal accredited test rigs and external test centers.
 
 
 
 You will organize, plan, and oversee the execution of full-scale rotor blade test & certification projects within CVC performed by external suppliers mainly in the USA, by executing effective project management & execution of business asks of the project milestones. This includes coordination of activities between blade design engineering, test engineering and the Test Laboratory, and communicate progress and timelines to stakeholders.
 
 
 
 You ensure availability and organize the use of external test capacity mainly with our American based suppliers. 
 
 
 
 We believe in technology, problem solving, and technical solutions being applied to our products. Having a robust project management and execution of our committed milestones is key to our success. You are a strong project manager and business execution individual with personal drive and are process oriented with excellent problem-solving skills in project management.
 

 
 Job Description

 
 About us:

 
 LM Wind Power, a GE Renewable Energy business is a world leading supplier of blades and service to the wind industry. The wind turbine industry is becoming increasingly complex, with radical progress made over the last few decades, providing great opportunities for professional development and a work environment that promotes initiative and creativity. If working in a company which creates state-of-the-art technology and processes attracts you, LM Wind Power has a career for you.

 

 
 Why we come to work:

 
 At GE Renewable Energy, our Project Managers work with integrity, great commitment, and incredible collaborative skills. Their projects can be global and complex, so they thrive under pressure and complicated management chains. While the work can be tough, the sense of pride they feel at the end result motivates our Project Managers to hang tough and focus on outcomes. Through your personal integrity and unparalleled organizational skills, you can work in a role that delivers an incredible sense of accomplishment, making a mark on the future of our world.

 

 
 Essential Responsibilities:

 
 As Project manager in CVC, RETL Program Office you are responsible for project management and execution of full-scale rotor blade test programs with external suppliers, to the agreed time, cost, and quality. 

 

 
You will be responsible for following scopes:

 

  
 Execution of Project Management for Full scale test and validation

  
 Responsible to manage, plan, execute timely, at cost, quality & safe delivery of full-scale test.

  
 Development of partnership, capacity, & strategic initiatives to ensure LM’s leadership in validation, certification, and compliance across global test centers.

  
 Execute testing contracts with suppliers, within the defined quality, budget, and time.

  
 Secure and support delivery of the asked outcome from internal validation centers or externals and capacity management

  
 Foster an effective close working relationships with product engineering project managers and leadership to deliver customer’s commitments.

  
 Ensure a robust risk control, time follow up, and budget for the test programs.

  
 Secure satisfaction of the customer and stakeholders of the project. Communication with customers, internally & externally.

  
 Full ownership and responsibility for leading projects with teams and stakeholders located across the globe and time zones, executing & managing deliverables until successfully implemented with proven outcome.

  
 Equal accountability with rest of CVC function in delivering the expected outcome of the programs. 

 

 

 
Required Qualifications: 

 

  
Bachelor's degree in engineering, industrial, manufacturing, or similar project management.

  
 Minimum of 5 years of proven expertise in project management, executing industrial projects.

 

 

 
 Desired Qualifications:

 

  
 Strong hands-on operational experience and understanding of project management principles.

  
 Strong working knowledge of data analysis and performance/operations metrics.

  
 Strong operational project expertise with exposure to direct customer and manufacturing.

  
 Structured problem-solving techniques, and execution for on time delivery.

  
 Ability to assess operational tradeoffs, effectively assess project risk, and optimize execution.

  
 Can communicate (English) your results in a clear and convincing manner.

  
 Proactive, Persistent, and consequent in actions.

  
 Good communication and interpersonal skills, and can collaborate with global team members across cultural boundaries effectively

  
 Able to influence others and lead initiatives.

  
 Manage work with integrity and build and maintain strong working relationships with customers and third parties.

  
 Strive on driving improvement and change, and you enjoy a good laugh with colleagues.

  
 Experience with LEAN tools such as Kaizen, Kanban, and Value stream mapping

  
 Experience with MS Project

  
 Project Management Certificate

  
 Experience with site management in international environments

 

 

 
 Additional Information

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        
 GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

       

      

     

    

   

  

 

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        
 GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable). 

       

      

     

    

   

  

 

 

 
As a federal government contractor, GE may in the future be required to have U.S. employees fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Some GE customers currently have vaccination mandates that may apply to GE employees.

doc_title: Business Development / Commercialization Manager for Floating Offshore Wind
doc_company: Advanced Structures and Composites Center at UMaine
doc_description:
University of Maine's Advanced Structures and Composites Center is seeking a Business Development / Commercialization Manager for Floating Offshore Wind Technologies


Our selected candidate will work hand in hand with our Executive Director and Chief Engineer, Offshore Wind Engineering to manage, execute, and advance business opportunities for the University of Maine’s developed floating offshore wind related technologies and technical services.


This position requires excellent communication, technical competence, and business skills to effectively advance the use of UMaine offshore wind technology to end users.


The Advanced Structures and Composites Center (ASCC)
 is a world-leading, interdisciplinary center for research, education, and economic development encompassing material sciences, advanced manufacturing and engineering of composites and structures. Housed in a 100,000ft2 ISO-17025 accredited facility, the ASCC has been recognized nationally and internationally for cutting edge research programs leading and impacting new industries including offshore wind and marine energy, civil infrastructure, bio-based large-scale 3D printing, soldier protection systems and innovative defense- related applications. The ASCC is the largest university-based research Center in Maine, and one of the fastest growing research laboratories in the world, with research revenue growth of 5X in the past 5 years. Facility has expanded to include 13 integrated laboratories with more than 400 full and part time personnel, including faculty, staff and students. Since its founding in 1996 with support from the National Science Foundation, the Center has financially sponsored more than 2,600 students, received 70 patents, received over 26,000 visitors 
,
 created 14 spinoff companies through licensing of patents or trade secrets, and received more than 40 national global awards for research excellence.


The ASCC’s 2020 Strategic Plan, called GEM, focuses the Center’s work on Green
Energy and Materials development. Through GEM, the Center is at the forefront of major new sustainability industries in the including U.S.Floating offshore wind technology developed at the ASCC led to a $100 million investment by global energy heavyweights Diamond Offshore Wind and RWE Renewables, and $50 million investment from the US DOE, to launch the first full- scale floating offshore wind project off the Maine coast.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 



 
Identify business development opportunities of the floating offshore wind related technologies

 
Prepares technical and sales information

 
Develops and executes marketing strategies

 
Collaborates with management related to commercialization efforts within the program.

 
Participates in providing weekly, quarterly and monthly progress reports to the program manager as well as to clients and sponsors

 
Supports ASCC program milestones communicating with potential industrial contacts and partners, scheduling meetings, maintaining communication, developing agendas, executing and preparing related reports, detailed technical presentations for program deliverables.

 
Coordinating technical information packages working with a team and ensuring client satisfaction

 
Maintains records of IP portfolio and interfaces with UMaine commercialization office

 
Maintains up to date technology technical and sales packages for use with customer engagement.

 
Acts a primary interface with new business opportunities and manages responses/ interaction

 
Provides and reviews monthly progress reports to the program manager as well as to clients and sponsors

 
Works directly with clients of interest to develop the use case for technologies, scopes of work (SOW) and budgets for new projects.

 
Instructs and advises professional and classified staff as well as undergraduate students referencing the advancement of offshore wind technologies and technical services.

 
Supports ASCC Management team discussions relating to future strategy through industry contacts and keeping abreast with technological developments in the industry.

 
Supports development of presentations for reporting and communications purposes.

 
Executes the development of meetings, workshops and conferences conducted by the UM ASCC.

 
Advises and assists technical and business staff to execute work

 
Student intern supervision




Perform other reasonably related duties as assigned.


Knowledge & Skill Qualifications: 



 
M.S. in related Science/Engineering field, Ph.D. preferred – Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Ocean or Wind Engineering, with 5-10 years of relevant experience in a professional or academic research environment or an equivalent combination of education and experience necessary to complete the position.

 
Experience in business development relevant to Engineering Research and Development.

 
Excellent oral and written communication skills required.

 
Ability to synthesize technical information and relay content to customers.

 
Ability to lead technical teams to deliver information to customers on time.

 
Experience developing and presenting technical and business sales proposals.

 
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and meet constant deadlines required.

 
Demonstrated ability to interact with industry members required.

 
Project management experience required.

 
US Person

About GEV


GEV Wind Power is a leading, independent service provider for wind turbine maintenance services. Strategy



 
Establishes performance metrics for measurement, comparison, or evaluation of factors affecting the supply chain.

 
Maintains required quantity of supplies and materials to optimize field operations.

 
Develops policies to increase efficiency throughout the supply chain while ensuring quality and safety; implements subsequent changes to processes.

 
Identifies optimal shipment and transportation routes with attention to consolidation of warehousing and distribution.

 
Assesses the need for material-handling equipment and staffing; makes recommendations to ensure efficient loading, unloading, movement, and storage of materials.

 
Adopts 5S principles for warehousing organization

 
Monitors the performance of suppliers, assessing their ability to meet quality and delivery requirements; identifies and qualifies new suppliers in collaboration with other departments.




Process



 
Develops and maintains detailed inventories of materials and supplies located in the company and at work sites.

People

Manages warehouse personnel full-time and temporary employees

 
Supports the adoption of Group warehousing IT systems

 
Promotes the Groups Core Principles




Financial



 
Negotiates prices for equipment, materials and delivery with suppliers, vendors, and/or shipping companies.

 
Negotiate contracts with key suppliers including quantity discounts and establish timelines, to maximize company margins





 
Establish and oversee internal budgets with the company and external budgets with the client

About TPI
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. The Production Manager holds direct management responsibility for plant manufacturing operations on all production shifts. The main focus is to drive performance in the manufacturing processes through continuous improvement to deliver and sustain profitable growth. The fundamental task is to directly lead and manage the operation of the value stream, develop strategy, and provide direct supervision of Production Leaders, and indirect supervision of Team Leaders and Production Associates.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Directs all activities related to operations and production in accordance with the business plan and the strategic goals of the company and business unit.

 
Collaborates with colleagues to achieve safety and environmental performance objectives.

 
Collaborates with the plant leadership to set short- and long-term production goals for the site.

 
Directs and manages the overall production plan for the operation.

 
Collaborates with functional/support managers on the determination of materials, space, equipment and personnel needs as well as the development and implementation of processes, procedures, assignment and execution of functional responsibilities, and determination of budget and costs constraints.

 
Communicates the company's strategic goals and vision for site.

 
Evaluates performance against production goals and adjusts allocations of resources (e.g., personnel, equipment, materials) as needed to optimize quality and amount of equipment, machinery and components produced, market share of customers, quality of services provided, and cost-efficiency of operations.

 
Reviews and analyzes reports of key business performance data, collaborates with management team on operations, and maintains knowledge of current market trends and best practices for region and industry.

 
Engages the team in supervising day-to-day operations.

 
Provides strategic guidance and resources to troubleshoot highly complex issues related to departmental operations and customer service.

 
Supports or leads Opex/Lean improvement projects and acts as the liaison between OpEx personnel and their respective groups.

 
Develops and leads the implementation of operational initiatives in support of Lean Six-Sigma manufacturing (e.g., department utilization improvement, process capability enhancement, customer satisfaction, employee involvement).

 
Suggests changes in working conditions and use of equipment to increase efficiency.

 
Sets and communicates standards, deploys resources, and achieves clear and measurable performance expectations for the operation.

 
Trains and ensures all assigned employees are aware of and comply with company, government, and customer policies, procedures, and regulations.

 
Works with subordinate managers and supervisors to maintain a positive, motivated work force.

BA or BS degree in a technical discipline; and 8 to 12 years of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 
Previous experience managing a team of first-line supervisors

 
Ability to work both independently and within a team, generating results with general/minimal guidance from management.

 
Green Belt Certification preferred.

Must be flexible, innovative and comfortable in setting own priorities

 
Polished presentation, business acumen and facilitation skills

Change Agent experience

 About the position:
 
 
 Our 
Crane Operator/Terminal Operator
 is primarily responsible for operating vessel cranes during bulk discharges and, secondarily, to assist in the maintenance and repair of the conveyor system. Work hours/shifts will vary as circumstances dictate and overtime is frequently available but not guaranteed. Work is primarily outdoors in a maritime environment 24 hours a day, 365 days per year. Some travel to other Sprague facilities will be required.
 
 
 Your duties and responsibilities can include, but are not limited to any of the following:
 
 
 
  
Operate bulk vessel cranes (12 hour shifts) for duration of discharge.
 
  
On completion of discharge will be responsible for clean-up/wash down of entire conveyor system.
 
  
Regular travel will be required to other bulk terminals to operate bulk vessel cranes as needed.
 
  
When not otherwise employed will be responsible for assisting with conveyor maintenance and repairs.
 
  
Ability to pass rigger / signalman course is necessary.
 
  
Will also be trained in cement silo truck loading operations and responsible for operations if silos reactivated.
 
  
Possible operation of large construction equipment once trained (loader, bulldozer, skid steer, forklift).
 
  
Assist with mooring vessels.
 
  
Assist with liquid cargo operations.
 
  
Ability to work at heights in adherence with company policies.
 
  
Participate in oil spill response drills.
 
  
Welding skills helpful but not required.
 
  
Possible operation of Oxy/Acetylene torch once trained.
 
  
Available/Receptive to respond to afterhours maintenance issues.
 
  
Other duties as required.
 
 
 
 
Education / Experience / Skill Requirements:
 
 
 
  
Prior crane operation experience a plus but not required
 
  
High school diploma or equivalent
 
  
Minimum of 2 years experience as a general laborer
 
  
Knowledge of basic math
 
  
Mechanical aptitude
 
  
Receptive to and available for training opportunities outside the workplace
 
  
Good computer skills
 
  
Valid driver’s license
 
  
Ability to obtain a TWIC
 
  
Good verbal and written communication skills
 
 
 
 
Physical activity/strength requirements are demanding and may include:
 
 
 
  
Standing up to 75% of the day
 
  
Lifting up to 75 lbs. (i.e. steel parts, spouts)
 
  
Pulling up to 75 lb. capacity (i.e. mooring lines)
 
  
Extended climbing (i.e. tank ladders/stairs/ramps/conveyors)
 
  
Ability to work in an outdoor, maritime environment in a variety of shifts
 
  
Applicant must possess the ability to work in a safe manner and maintain a constant state of alertness as the nature of work performed within our terminal operations create conditions where a momentary lack of concentration or alertness can lead to catastrophic results.

 

 
 
 
 
 
 We want to hear from you!
 
 
 Do you like to solve problems and consider yourself forward thinking? Identify staff vacancies and recruit, interview and select applicants.

Represent organization at personnel-related hearings and investigations.

 
Provide current and prospective associates with information about policies, job duties, working conditions, wages, opportunities for promotion, and associate benefits.

Conduct exit interviews to identify reasons for associate exits.

 
Oversee the evaluation, classification and rating of occupations and job positions.

 
Study legislation recent legal developments to assess industry trends.

Contract with vendors to provide associate services, such as food service, transportation, or relocation service.

Adhere to and represent the company's values and behaviors as defined by the TPI Mission and Core Values and EHS policies, while reinforcing leadership and individual associates’ responsibility for EHS.

Position Duties and Responsibilities



 
Conducts needs analysis studies and confers with managers and supervisors to determine training needs; supports skills assessment activities.

Formulates training policies, programs, and schedules, based on knowledge of identified training needs, company production processes, business systems, or changes in products, procedures, or services.

Graco manufactures and markets premium equipment to move, measure, control, dispense and spray a wide variety of fluid and powder materials. What does that mean? Well, we pump peanut butter into your jar, and the oil in your car. We glue the soles of your shoes, the glass in your windows and the screen on your phone. We spray the finish on your vehicle, coatings on your pills, the paint on your house and texture on your walls. Graco is part of your daily life.

Graco has excellent opportunities available to individuals who want to be part of fast-moving, growing company – especially candidates committed to quality, innovation and solving customer problems. Graco was proud to be named a Best Place to Work in Manufacturing and Production by Fortune Magazine in 2016, 2018, 2019 and 2021.

Job Purpose:

To support the Strategic Business Unit and the Manufacturing Cell and apply coursework to real-world applications as a Manufacturing Engineer Intern. Position involves providing ideas, inputs and analysis as a project team member.

Graco is a global leader in the design, development and manufacture of highly-engineered systems for numerous industrial and commercial applications. This position supports our Lubrication Equipment Division (LED) in Anoka, MN. At LED, Industrial Lubrication products are used in wind energy, general manufacturing and steel and mining industries ( http://bit.ly/1jTCVMI ). Petroleum Management products control fluids traditionally used for servicing vehicles, including pumps, tanks, hose reels, and meters ( http:// bit.ly/ 1krX8Tf ).

The Graco Co-Op Program is designed for students who seek a culture of innovation, quality, and A+ customer service. At Graco, you will have the opportunity to grow knowledge of the industry, develop solutions to real business challenges, and make important connections for the future. During the Co-Op, you will work on projects that align with the needs of the business that allow you to have a hand in key company initiatives. Throughout your time with us, you will be invited to attend educational and social events and will complete a final presentation on your internship experience.

Essential Duties:

Planning, executing and reporting of priorities including man-hour estimates, reacting to changing priorities, and record-keeping and reporting.

Providing general production support for machining and/or assembly area as needed:

Participate in the evaluation of upgrades for machining or assembly.

Troubleshoot issues (quality, efficiency, etc.) on assembly line or machine.

Weigh in on situations that need technical assistance.

Participate in hands-on problem solving and resolution.

Report and facilitate correction of out-of-specification conditions.

Determining the proper processes:

Review, analyzing standards and operation layouts and make suggestions for change.

Assist in the selection of and implementation of tooling and fixtures for machining and/or assembly job.

Participate in capital equipment justification as needed.

Participate in the planning and implementation of preventive and corrective actions for reducing scrap, rework and down time.

Research and suggest ideas for new technology.

Essential Qualifications:

Currently enrolled and pursuing a Mechanical or Manufacturing Engineer degree from an accredited university

Someone entering junior or senior year preferred

Good written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills are necessary in order to act as a liaison between engineering, production, marketing, purchasing, and members of the manufacturing team.

Work as a team player

Good mechanical aptitude

Proven Quality. Leading Technology. Launch your career with Graco!

Graco offers attractive compensation, benefits and career development opportunities. Graco’s comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, stock purchase plan, 401(k), tuition reimbursement and more.

In this role you will lead the coaching and development of the customer service team across multiple locations to drive continuous improvement in their overall performance. How will you impact our organization as a Customer Service Manager on a daily basis? Lead, manage, and motivate the customer service team through daily service interactions, including allocation of workload. Drive and facilitate the order fulfillment process in a manner that creates customer intimacy. Build and maintain positive, effective relationships with customers and help the CSR team to foster these relationships. Serve as an interdepartmental liaison between customer service, warehouse, delivery, sales, and purchasing in order to resolve customer-related issues and enhance organizational efficiency. Develop, refine, and implement customer service procedures and policies as needed. Assist DCM(s) with strategic planning and resource allocation. Identify opportunities for improvement and implements process improvements for our Customer Service Team. Ensure that standard operating procedures and established company guidelines are being followed consistently. Conduct routine Customer visits based upon business needs. Work closely with DCM on annual budgets. Leadership and Communications Skills: Responsible for hiring and training CSR staff and identifying developmental opportunities. Provide motivational and developmental leadership to the CSR staff on a daily basis to enhance overall team performance, conducts semi-annual performance reviews, and writes and delivers annual performance reviews. Create performance objectives/goals and applicable training plans, including performance measurement. Regularly monitor the interaction between CSR’s and customers to ensure a congruent approach with Stellar Service techniques provides direct feedback and outlines recommendations for improvement as necessary. Foster a continuous improvement environment, establishing, communicating, and provides training on standard operating procedures to improve the efficiency and overall performance of the Customer Service team, while enhancing the customer experience. Participates in all DC Quality/ROM/Safety Audits. Communicate a strong sense of urgency in creative problem solving and getting work done. Ensure time, resources and actions of the CSR Team is focused on priorities that contribute to meeting customer needs and business goals and objectives. Work to create an environment that values and rewards drive, initiative and achievement of results. Able to effectively manage employees and Teams including ability to mentor and guide the CSR Team to increase skill level, morale and efficiency. Able to delegate responsibility and authority to maximize use of employees’ skills. Required Skills and Qualifications: A minimum three years of supervisory experience. A minimum of seven years of customer service experience in a non-retail environment. Proven team development skills and management experience within a Quality Management system such as ISO 9001 or a similar system is a plus. High school diploma, GED, or equivalent is required. Bachelors Degree in Business, or related field, strongly preferred. SAP or other ERP systems experience a plus. Occasional travel, up to 10%. Why should you join Composites One? CULTURE: This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of Respect, Teamwork, and Communication. INTEGRITY: The foundation of all strong relationships is TRUST. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and Team Members to build meaningful relationships! CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION: To remain successful, we must continuously improve and innovate. At Composites One, we value collaboration, and sharing ideas so that we can grow and drive continuous improvement and innovation together. Click here to learn more about our benefits! Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve! About Us: Composites One LLC is the leading supplier of essential materials for Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, Consumer Recreation and Construction Composites Manufacturing. We have a global presence and operate 44 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each Team Member with respect and offers opportunities for growth and personal success. Requisition ID: 36191 Job Location(s): Van Wert, OH, US Job Description This position will involve the set-up, gauging, prove out programs, and operate machine tools to perform a series of progressive machining operations on repetitive work to exacting tolerances. Actively support and strive to meet the strategic goals set by yourself, the facility and Danfoss. This is a 2nd Shift position and is located in Van Wert, Ohio. New Hires may be required to train on 1st Shift which may take several weeks depending on the position and how quickly someone can meet the Individual Training Standards before being permanently assigned FT to this shift. Job Responsibilities Must be able to learn, apply, and retain new techniques, concepts and procedures required for continuously improving products, processes, services, deliveries, and overall quality Ability to read and understand blueprints, control plans, routers, job instructions and measurement tools Must meet or exceed all quality standards set by the customers and individual Value Stream. Must also maintain the quality standards defined for the entire facility Maintain flexibility to be able to move from work area to work area to meet the delivery expectations of the customers and the productivity goals for the plant. Able to work efficiently to establish standards without constant supervision Always promotes cooperation and “team oriented” work environment under the direction of the leadership team Creates/maintains a safe work environment and practices safety for himself and others at all times Must maintain a clean and well-organized work environment and support our 5S program Work from programming, operational data, setup instructions defining and coding tool arrangements, fixtures, and material clamping methods Setup machine calibration and console settings for operations such as boring, milling, drilling, facing, threading, and occasional profiling and contouring Operate Coordinate Measurement Machines (CMM) to verify part quality Employee is responsible for maintaining oils, coolant levels and all filter changes on the machines Ability to multitask as it includes: operating overhead cranes, large band saws, cutting and stenciling various sizes of bar stock and delivering stock to the individual machines Background & Skills Basic Qualifications: Ability to work in a fast paced/demanding and rapidly growing Manufacturing work environment Must be able to lift 50 pound cartons consistently High School Degree / GED Preferred Qualifications: Blueprint reading including Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerance (GD&T) Basic math skills (measurement conversion, addition/subtraction, decimals/fractions) Gauging concepts and techniques (calipers, high gages, micrometers, profiometer, roundness gauges, plug gages, air gages, dial depth gages, etc.) At least two (2) years’ experience operating manual, NC and/or CNC machine tools with experience in jobs setups requiring tooling and fixturing changes Danfoss – Engineering Tomorrow At Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways - driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees. Following our founder’s mindset “action speaks louder than words”, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030. Danfoss is an EO employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category. Danfoss engineers solutions that increase machine productivity, reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and enable electrification. Our solutions are used in such areas as refrigeration, air conditioning, heating, power conversion, motor control, industrial machinery, automotive, marine, and off- and on-highway equipment. We also provide solutions for renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, as well as district-energy infrastructure for cities. Our innovative engineering dates back to 1933. Description:

Keystone Engineering Inc. is a multi-disciplinary engineering company in the energy sector that is looking to expand its team even more. Keystone has been in the offshore business for over 30 years and more than half of that time has been involved in the Offshore Wind industry. We have provided engineering support and feasibility studies for offshore wind projects globally. Keystone was the foundation designer for Block Island Windfarm and provided fabrication support, loadout design, transportation analysis of blades, on-site engineering, and construction support for the project as well. Keystone s past and current project portfolio cover a wide range of foundation types (monopile, tripods, IBGS, suction buckets, GBS) and offshore substations.

Keystone Engineering is currently seeking an ambitious Technical Project Manager to join our Renewable Energies team. You will get to work on a wide variety of renewable energy projects from offshore wind to bio-fuel and carbon capture.

Position Type: Full-time

Location: Remote

Work Environment/Physical Demands: Office/Sedentary

Travel Requirements: Occasional site visits required.

Responsibilities:

  • The Technical Project Manager provides leadership to the offshore wind team.
  • Ensures project meets industry engineering standards and safety regulations.
  • Utilizes background in offshore/onshore wind energy in day-to-day projects.
  • Coordinate with clients and third parties regarding project scope, status, and technical interface issues.
  • Visit client sites to evaluate the site, project requirements, and conditions.
  • Provide concise, factual project solutions, allowing effective construction/installation.
  • Work effectively within established budgets and deadlines.
  • Identify various issues within projects, lead the development of solutions, and ensure solutions are implemented.
  • Prepare and reviews technical reports, models and drawings.
  • Understand project performance metrics and follow projects through completion.
  • Main point of contact for our clients and responsible for the preparation of our deliverables within the expected timeline, budget, and quality.

Requirements:

  • M.S. or Ph.D. in Engineering from an ABET-accredited program.
  • 5-10+ years experience in Energy and Offshore/Onshore Wind.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Self-motivated, organized, and solution advocate.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. for any employer.

Experience Preferred:

  • P.E. License and NCEES records holder.
  • Technical side background with some client-facing experience.

About TPI
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI Transportation also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.
TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.
About the Role
The Program Manager is responsible for all aspects of assigned automotive prototype, development, and production programs coordinating with business development, engineering, finance, quality, supply chain and operations teams. The work is complex, difficult in character, and requires independent problem solving with general direction and guidance from corporate and business unit strategy. Superior leadership and communication abilities are required to manage multiple programs simultaneously. Work requires program leadership responsibility for critical programs based on strategic importance.
To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee multiple programs and project teams using excellent time management and interpersonal skills.
If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role.
**
**
Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Responsible for overall program timing and delivery – technical, quality, and cost/budget.
  • Provides expert tactical leadership in coordinating, facilitating, motivating, and directing efforts of cross-functional program teams including individuals from
  • Engineering, Business Development, Product Development, Quality, Supply Chain, and Manufacturing.
  • Ensures efficient use of team and resources within budget.
  • Gains support for and develops program objectives and deliverables. Ensures full team participation and that all groups involved understand all the demands for the successful launch of a program. Objectives include timing, engineering support, cost, quality, and delivery. Ensures customer and Company requirements are met.
  • Ensures that the profitability of the program is maximized throughout the program launch.
  • Leads the communication of all issues and responsibilities both within the Company and to the customer and ensures that technical and tactical objectives are clearly documented and cascaded to each functional area.
  • Works with internal and external resources to maintain strong customer relationships with dedication to customer program schedules.
  • Demonstrates expertise, in all customer systems as required, to support programs in launch. Ensures countermeasures are initiated to correct unfavorable variances by communicating alternative measures to the customer, which may be used to solve engineering problems. Ensures the success of the future production of the programs in the launch phase.
  • Documents and monitors program objectives per PMP by mean of open issue lists, milestone reviews, and launch (manufacturing) readiness reviews. Demonstrates expertise in all systems required for launching programs.
  • Participates in continuous improvement efforts of PDP/PMP processes to support product launches.
  • Performs other duties as necessary for completion of projects and achievement of goals.

Who we’re looking for:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Business Administration or equivalent with a minimum of five years’ experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience in the automotive industry is preferred.
  • Leadership abilities in managing multiple programs to meet goals (quality, cost and delivery of programs) from concept through launch in coordination with internal and external contacts.
  • Organizational, project management, and leadership skills to prioritize, coordinate projects, manage conflicting needs based on strategic importance, and deal with many issues at one time.
  • Ability to work on long-term assignments, broad in nature, using a high level of originality and ingenuity. Must be self-motivated and able to develop long-term technical strategies/plans to meet future business needs and growth opportunities.
  • Financial skills to prepare budgets, develop and understand financial aspects of program deliverables.
  • Ability to lead and motivate others through support, training, etc. towards organizational goals.
  • Ability to thoroughly research, recommend, and oversee implementation of new products, materials, processes, etc. and present information to support product launches.
  • Ability and willingness to travel domestically up to 30%.

Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island. Relocation benefits to the greater Providence RI are available.
Location: 373 Market Street, Warren, RI 02885

VIKOR is currently looking to add to its team of dedicated individuals with a full-time Hydrovac Operator in Pleasant Grove, UT. As a Hydrovac Operator, you will install underground utilities for power, fiber, and communications sites around the Midwest and Mountain states. ‍

The VIKOR Culture

Job Description
The Training Manager – US Field Service is responsible for leading the training function through planning, coordination, and direction of training and programs by performing their duties personally and through coordination with cross-functional resources. The selected individual will hold a key role helping our US services business to grow and be successful meeting our business objectives and exceeding our customers’ expectations. The successful candidate will have proven experience building and managing safety, technical, and leadership training programs successfully within a geographically dispersed service delivery organization. If this describes you, you are invited to apply to this opportunity.
Position Duties and Responsibilities



 
Conducts needs analysis studies and confers with managers and supervisors to determine training needs; supports skills assessment activities.

 
Compiles data and analyzes past and current year training requirements to prepare budgets and justify funds requested.

 
Formulates training policies, programs, and schedules, based on knowledge of identified training needs, company production processes, business systems, or changes in products, procedures, or services.

 
Selects appropriate instructional procedures or methods such as individual training, group instruction, self-study, lectures, demonstrations, simulation exercises, role play, and computer-based training.

 
Organizes and develops training manuals, reference library, testing and evaluation procedures, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.

 
Trains assigned instructors and supervisory personnel in effective techniques for training, such as new employees' orientation, on-the-job training, health and safety practices, management development, and adaptations to changes in policies, procedures, and technologies.

 
Researches and selects outside consultants and trainers to conduct training in specific topics.

 
Maintains records and prepares statistical reports to on training hours; monitors progress of trainees.

 
Coordinates established training courses with technical and professional courses offered by community schools.

 
Screens, tests, counsels, and recommends employees for participation in internal or external educational and training programs.

 
Drafts applications and proposals to submit to fund granting authorities such as government and foundations.

 
Other duties assigned as required.




Supervisory Responsibilities
Manages subordinate staff who train field service technicians directly. Responsible for the direction, coordination, and evaluation of the individuals in the training department. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
Who We’re Looking For: 



 
Bachelor's Degree in Communication, Education, Business Administration or equivalent with a minimum of five years’ experience in training and development; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 
Thorough understanding of training processes, methods, and techniques.

 
Experience developing yearly training plans and materials for various departments.

 
Ability to effectively organize and manage multiple training initiatives simultaneously.

 
Knowledge of learning management systems, instructional design and e-learning platforms.

 
Time management, public speaking, problem-solving, and both verbal and written communication skills.

 
Previous experience working with composites is a plus.

 
Highly computer literate with proficiency in MS Office and related business and communication tools.

 
Exceptional organization, leadership, and interpersonal skills.

 
Ability to work with a team and have attention to detail.




Location
This position is an on-site position at our location in Newton, IA.


Location: 4800 Avenida Creel, Des Moines, IA


Job Type: Full-time

Sprague is passionate about delivering the diverse products and programs that warm, power and move the world. We keep homes warm through Northeastern winters and hospitals cool through summer. We help small businesses focus on serving their communities, and our renewable fuels keep our country’s infrastructure running. From importing wind energy components to deploying leading-edge solar technology to help power terminal facilities, we are committed to continually evolving to meet our customers’ changing energy needs.
 
 
 What we offer:
 
 
 
  
Pay $28.00/hr
 
  
Traditional and Roth 401(k) plans with employer match
 
  
Defined Contribution Plan with an automatic 5% contribution from Sprague
 
  
Tuition reimbursement up to $6500
 
  
On the job training
 
  
Paid Volunteer Time
 
  
Choice of Health Plans to fit your individual need
 
  
Gym membership

 

 
 
 
Sprague values innovation, safety, integrity and people. We know that our people are what set us apart from our competition, and we work hard to make sure each employee across our 20+ locations knows how important they are to our organization. We recently surveyed our employees to ask them their favorite part of the job. Unanimously, they answered with "the people I work with." You are part of a team and a family at Sprague, and everyone works together to ensure the success of both the company and the individual.
 
 
 And in addition to great coworkers, you’ll enjoy perks like medical benefits and retirement contributions that 
start on your first day.
 Do you like to get involved where you work? Sprague has a range of committees to support varying initiatives (Sustainability, Charitable, Scholarship, etc.). Sprague is a place that cares about its employees, its community, and about creating a place where people want to come to work every day.
 
 
 Job Summary / General Purpose:
 
 
 The primary responsibility of the successful candidate will be in assisting during the loading and offloading of marine cargo vessels. When not engaged in that activity work will be assigned with both our maintenance and operations teams.
 
 
 As a valued crew member, the 
Terminal Operator/Crane Operator
 at our Searsport, ME, will work in a team environment with leadership to optimize efficiency while focusing on safety every shift. We are looking for a terminal operator/crane operator capable of a wide range of duties at an oil tank farm/bulk handling facility. A variety of skills/specialization may be utilized, some of which may require licensure or certification. Work hours primarily are Monday through Friday and often require weekends and nights to help handle our busy operations. Overtime is frequently available, though not guaranteed, and often required. Work is primarily performed outdoors, and the terminal operator will work with the maintenance team and the operations team in a maritime environment 24 hours a day, 365 days per year. Regular travel to other Sprague terminals will be required.
 
 
 Major Duties / Responsibilities:
 
 
 
  
Ability to operate vessel crane and assist with loading/offloading marine cargo vessels - primary position
 
  
Operation of construction equipment (ex: skid steer, pay-loader, forklift, hopper, etc.)
 
  
Valve alignment, piping skills, pump skills, and construction skills
 
  
Pump And Motor maintenance and PM’s
 
  
Insulating and Pipe installation
 
  
Hydraulics and Fittings
 
  
General heavy equipment and vehicle maintenance
 
  
Assist with mooring vessels
 
  
Assist with offloading of liquid and bulk cargo vessels
 
  
Ability to obtain Rigging, Signalmen, and Heavy Lift certifications
 
  
Assist with maintenance of grounds, buildings and/or equipment
 
  
Participate in oil spill response drills
 
  
Welding/Fabrication (with suitable training/certification as required)
 
  
Travel to other Sprague facilities will be required
 
  
Other duties as required
 
 
 
 
Education / Experience / Skill Requirements
 
 
 
  
Knowledge of basic math
 
  
Basic computer knowledge
 
  
Mechanical aptitude
 
  
Valid driver's license
 
  
Good verbal and written communication skills
 
  
Travel to other Sprague facilities may be required
 
  
High school diploma or equivalent
 
  
Previous experience as a general laborer preferred
 
  
Previous experience operating heavy equipment a plus
 
  
Specialized licensure in certain areas a plus (i.e. PIC qualification, equipment operator certification)
 
  
Operator must be able to be trained and become proficient in the operation of cargo handling equipment including vessel cranes, hopper, skidsteers, forklifts,and other various pieces of equipment.

 

 
 
 
 
 
 Physical activity/strength requirements are demanding and may include:
 
 
 
  
Standing up to 75% of the day
 
  
Lifting up to 75 lbs. (i.e. steel parts, spouts)
 
  
Carrying up to 50 lbs. (i.e. oil, parts, tools)
 
  
Pulling up to 75 lb. capacity (i.e. mooring lines)
 
  
Extended climbing (i.e. tank ladders/stairs/ramps)
 
 
 
 
Incumbent must possess the ability to work in a safe manner and maintain a constant state of alertness as the nature of work performed within our terminal operations create conditions where a momentary lack of concentration or alertness can lead to catastrophic results.
 
 
 Come join us to learn why we are consistently celebrating 20-, 30-, and even 40-year anniversaries here at Sprague!

The Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) Manager is the key individual responsible for ensuring a safe and environmentally compliant organization. The fundamental task is to plan, direct, and implement environmental, health and safety programs to ensure a safe, healthy, accident-free and sustainable organization by performing the following duties personally or through subordinate team members.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Plans and implements EHS policies and procedures in compliance with local, state, and federal Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) rules and regulations.

 
Plans and implements programs to train managers and employees in work site safety practices, fire prevention, and correct handling techniques for chemicals, equipment, and other materials.

 
Leads air permit, hazardous waste, community right to know, and other applicable regulatory compliance activities including record keeping and reporting and reporting requirements.

 
Prepares studies and analyses of industrial accident causes and hazards to health for use by company personnel and outside agencies.

 
Inspects organization facilities to detect existing or potential safety and health hazards, determines corrective or preventative measures where indicated, and follows up to ensure measures have been implemented.

 
Provides information, signs, posters, barriers, and other materials to warn of potential and actual safety hazards and to prevent access to hazardous conditions.

 
Leads and trains others in the investigation of accidents and injuries and cooperates in the preparation of material and evidence for organization use in hearings, lawsuits, and insurance investigations.

 
Oversees the administration of workers' compensation program, including working with the insurance carrier to reduce employee lost time.

 
Prepares and arranges safety exhibits and material for display, promotional work, industry conferences, and exhibitions.

 
Represents the organization in community or industry safety groups and programs.

 
Maintains safety files and records.

 
Directly supervises 1-2 employees within the EHS function. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws.

 
Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.




Who we’re looking for: 



 
Bachelor’s degree in Environmental (preferred) or related field (natural sciences, engineering, chemistry, or similar) and minimum of 7+ years work experience Safety/Environmental leadership experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 
Demonstrated success in improving EHS performance and establishing best practices.

 
Proven examples of effective communication and listening skills.

 
Demonstrated team leadership skills. Experience in managing EHS programs.

 
Passion and drive for environmental and safety compliance.

 
Knowledge of environmental and OSHA regulations.

 
Broad knowledge of workers’ compensation regulations and best practices.

 
Ability to read and interpret technical documents and regulations.

Responsible for Safety

Because of the nature of the work at VIKOR, we are dedicated to and obsessed with safety. That means all of our employees are, too. If you join the VIKOR team, you will be expected to follow all the safety and regulatory policies and procedures put in place by VIKOR and OSHA in order for all team members to feel confident and protected during the workday. This includes attending the daily safety meetings, maintaining a clean driving record and frequently inspecting trucks and equipment.

The VIKOR Culture

We believe people do their best work when they feel heard and supported. That is why we strive to live out our values of UNITY, DEDICATION and ELEVATION every day. Our employees experience an environment centered on respect, allowing them to perform at their highest level.

VIKOR specializes in commercial tower construction, maintenance, and service work for the wireless, utility, and wind energy industries. With offices in Sioux Falls, SD; Rapid City, SD; Pleasant Grove, UT; Denver, CO; Phoenix, AZ; Sebree, KY; and Bismarck, ND our geographic footprint spans from the Great Plains to the Mountain States.

Operations Manager – Large Correctives - Wind


Responsibilities


Director of Operations – Wind, Large Correctives performs all operations oversight of our specialized operations, including the replacement of major wind turbine components such as blades, gearboxes, generators, pitch bearings and hubs.


Core responsibilities include: 



 
Schedule daily tasks and milestones of component exchange teams.

 
Interface with the customers and uphold all United Renewables standards.





 
Comply with all company and government safety regulations and guidelines.

 
DOT Compliance and management.

 
Reports to VP of Operations.

 
Complete all company required training in a satisfactory manner and time frame.

 
Travel as required to support teams, QA/AC, customer interactions.




*



 
Project Management:





 
At least 4 years’ experience as a Project Manager for similar projects

 
History of application of Project Management processes

 
Basic understanding and application of contract commercial terms.

 
Proficient understanding of Project Controls.

 
Knowledge and application of Financial Management.

 
Thorough understanding of development, construction, design, operations, contract management with emphasis on power industry projects preferred.

 
Knowledge of Wind Projects preferred

 
Team Leadership:

 
Able to lead small teams across multiple groups

 
Able to work with minimal supervision and direction

 
History of working collaboratively at multiple levels of an organization

 
Able to grow relationships and foster a collaborative team environment

 
Able to tailor project management processes and optimize risk responses based on individual project conditions

 
Embrace adaptability, resiliency, and innovation

 
Possess advanced oral and written communication skills

 
Schedule and track upcoming jobs and coordinate accordingly.

 
Schedule teams/technicians for time off rotations ensuring appropriate support staff is present for each job.
