 #LI-Remote - This is a remote position

ABOUT THE NORDEX GROUP


The manufacture of wind energy plants in the on-shore segment has been our core competence and passion for around 35 years. With more than 37 GW installed capacity worldwide, our turbines supply sustainable energy to more than 80% of the global energy market and we are one of the largest companies in the wind industry. National subsidiaries in more than 30 markets and production facilities in Germany, Spain, Brazil, the USA, Mexico and India offer our more than 8,500 employees the opportunity for international and intercultural cooperation.



We are growing and together driving forward the expansion of alternative energies worldwide - if you wish, from now on with you. Join the #TeamNordex


Project Manager, Blades

REQUISITION ID: 2757

LOCATION:
West Branch, IA, US Chicago, IL, US

DEPARTMENT: Service

Do you want to be part of an agile team where colleagueship truly matters?

As a global company, we interact with a variety of people and cultures. Integrity, Respect, Colleagueship and Ownership are the unifying force for all departments and regions around the world. It’s the individual that defines the team. And it’s the team that makes the difference. Join the #TEAMNORDEX and shape the future of energy with us.


As Services Project Manager, you will be responsible for managing any Special Project designated within the Services Department.


Special Projects are considered, Retrofits Campaigns, Site Support, and Major Corrective campaigns.


This position includes Cost Forecast and Control, Resources management, Materials Coordination, Scheduling, and Monitoring of any activity related to the Project.




Location

Nordex USA, Inc. is located in Chicago, Illinois, or West Branch, Iowa


Regular traveling throughout the United States.




Responsibilities:


Project planning, estimating, and executing individual US projects.

Budget Forecast and Cost Control. Profit and loss responsibility.

Prepares budget, cost allocation, and control of special projects; maintenances, inspections, retrofits, large component exchanges, and repairs


Prepares plans and schedule resources for Technical management projects as well as large component exchanges and repairs.

Negotiates cost of equipment, tooling, and subcontractor agreements.

Coordinates logistics/mobilization of necessary specialized tooling and equipment for maintenance and repair activities at the site.

Cost and budget compliance with the individual project reporting and claim management.


Subcontractors quotes Request / Negotiation.


Coordination and implementation of technical solutions in cooperation with the Engineering and Supply Management department.

Perform pertinent operational and departmental tasks as required.


Perform other related duties as required or assigned.

Follow standard Nordex Project Management processes


Visit project sites, suppliers, and international support groups to facilitate successful completion of job duties; TRAVEL Requirements about 25%.




Specific Responsibilities:


Coordination and implementation of technical solutions (retrofits).


Manage costs, monitor and validate contractor invoices.


Coordination and execution of all major correctives within the Services Department


Supervise and coordinate resources on-site during a project.


Communicate project status to Site Managers to facilitate customer communications.




Requirements:


Degree in technical or engineering field, or 5+ years of equivalent experience.


Experience in the Wind Turbines Blade field, structural repairs of 3+ years.


Must demonstrate understanding of international and domestic supplier relations Strong interpersonal, organizational, and intercultural skills.


Basic knowledge and appreciation for the technical, commercial, and political aspects driving the wind industry.

Computer skills to include MS Office.


Must possess a thorough knowledge of service processes (Operations, Maintenance, Customer Responsiveness, and Engineering) and quality assurance principles.


Highly motivated and business orientated.


Capable of working independently.

Demonstrated ability to organize/prioritize work, meet deadlines, and prepare plans and reports.


Demonstrated ability to manage several activities/projects at once, organize/prioritize work, meet deadlines, and prepare plans and reports


Proficiency in Spanish is preferred


Travel to project sites required (25% travel).




We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We will consider applicants for this position without regard to any category protected by applicable federal, state or local law, including but not limited to: race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status or uniformed service member status.






Nearest Major Market: 
Cedar Rapids



Nearest Secondary Market: 
Iowa City

International Wind
 is a maintenance and repair service provider for the burgeoning commercial wind power generation industry. We specialize in providing repairs primarily in the field at customer locations (Wind farms). Our field workers are trained and are required to maintain certification for climbing, working at heights, confined space entry and specialty processes such as composite repair for blades.
Due to exceptional growth and future opportunity, we are seeking a detail oriented, well organized, and highly motivated individual to assist with Wind Operations. This person will provide day-to-day operations support for projects and customers under his/her purview to include work scheduling, training, logistics and management of personnel to ensure safe, smooth, and effective support for our client’s needs.


*
Job duties*
The Operations Support Manager’s over-arching purpose is ensuring that the business operates safely and effectively in support of our client’s needs. Duties and obligations that support that objective include but are not limited to:



 
Ensure a strong commitment to safety

 
Establish safety as our first core value

 
Foster a safety conscious work environment where all employees understand reporting options and are empowered to improve our safety culture

 
Ensure everyone understands they have the power to stop work when circumstances lead to uncertainty





 
Establish a strong relationship with designated customer contacts by demonstrating transparency, integrity, and honesty in dealing with each assigned client

 
Function as the single point of contact maintaining continuous client contact to build and/or strengthen the relationship

 
Deliver strong and frequent leadership engagement with assigned clients to ensure we understand and can deliver on their needs

 
Present a proactive posture regarding our performance – except and react promptly





 
Install a culture of continuous improvement and set high standards and expectations for our field personnel

 
Conducting periodic reviews of procedures and processes to identify improvement opportunities within the operation of the business

 
Communicate with field personnel frequently to understand operational challenges and support requirements to help ensure successful execution of contracted work

 
Remain available and approachable to our field employees





 
Oversight of operational and contract budgets with focus on establishing savings while maintaining or improving effectiveness

 
Understand all contracts associated with assigned clients

 
Ensure that operational plans support execution of the contract and identified work scope

 
Diligently enforce best practices with respect to spend for items such as vehicles, travel, hotel, materials, and contracted services





 
Conduct periodic site visits to:

 
Reinforce safety culture

 
Improve customer relationship

 
Garner feedback from field employees and

 
Ensure field performance and behavior supports contract requirements and best practices with respect to safety, quality, and schedule




*
Job Requirements: *



 
5 years of relevant Wind experience with at least 1 in an operations role preferred

 
Field Service experience in support of periodic maintenance activities including logistics for mobilization and demobilization

 
Experience with recruiting and staffing highly desirable

 
Can quickly identify key resources and build high performing teams

 
capable of providing input for a succession planning model that maintains a defense in depth for position evolutions.





 
Effective communication – written and verbal – with both management and craft

 
Ensure transparent communication regarding status, planning and expected outcome

 
Influence others (internal and external) to improve project outcomes





 
Effectively manages his/her time and that of other’s

 
Experience and/or active certifications as a trainer for GWO and/or ENSA a plus

 
Desire a candidate with established ties to Wind Industry management. OEM and Wind Farm connections desired in both USA and Europe

 
Understanding of wind turbine blade production/engineering principles highly considered

 
Rope Access experience highly desired

 
Existing certification to provide training in support of certification to Global Wind Organization (GWO) standards




Job Type: Full-time


Pay: $100,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year


Benefits:



 
401(k)

 
Dental insurance

 
Health insurance

 
Paid time off

 
Vision insurance




Schedule:



 
10 hour shift

 
12 hour shift

 
8 hour shift

 
Day shift

 
Holidays

 
Monday to Friday

 
Night shift

 
On call

 
Weekend availability




Work Location: Hybrid remote

ABOUT SKYSPECS


SkySpecs envisions a world where wind energy is the most affordable form of electricity and therefore ubiquitous around the world. SkySpecs is helping to make this possible by automating the operations and maintenance of wind farms using advanced robotics paired with our custom-built asset performance management software, Horizon.


SkySpecs launched the world's first completely autonomous blade inspection product in 2016 with a custom designed drone system. Since then, SkySpecs has inspected over 25,000 wind turbines in over 15+ countries, becoming the world leader in understanding the health of turbine blades. Identifying issues with turbine blades is only the first step. In 2019 SkySpecs launched Horizon to be a platform for SkySpecs to offer a multi-layered solution for customers that includes: data collection, wind turbine blade engineering expertise, and a place for all stakeholders to collaborate to manage and analyze massive amounts of data, spot trends, and create plans for high-cost repair campaigns. Ultimately, this will help reduce the cost and risk of operations for the industry.

WHAT WILL I BE GETTING MYSELF INTO?


As an Engineering Manager, you will help the now ~15 engineers who build our Horizon web application be the best team they can be.


This team has grown rapidly, up from ~5 at the beginning of 2021. The team is comprised of software veterans across the whole stack, averaging over 10-years of experience building impressive web applications. With this team's growth and seniority, we need someone who will care for their growth as individuals, for the health and velocity of the team as a whole, and that their strengths and interests be effectively aligned to the business' needs.


Some highlights for your coming year could include:


Operating an annual 360-degree performance feedback across ~25 reviewers.

Setting growth plans for each engineer and helping coach them on their journey.

Refining team composition, roles, processes, and tools to achieve a high bar of project throughput and satisfaction.

Identifying gaps in the team and hiring to fill them.


IN A GIVEN WEEK, YOU WILL:


Engage in 1x1s, retros, sprint meetings, and ad hoc discussions to provide effective communication pathways among the team.

Provide caring and challenging feedback to help individuals grow.

Ensure that project teams (Pods) are staffed effectively.

Facilitate the creation of, adoption of, and adherence to effective team processes like knowledge storage, work tracking, communication channels, etc.

Be an ambassador for your team with other parts of the SkySpecs organization (product management, leadership, sales, etc.), helping ensure both sides interact effectively.

Define job descriptions, interview, hire, and onboard new team members.

Simply 'be there' for your team and the individuals that comprise it when they need you.


MUST HAVES:


3+ years experience in a similar Software Development leadership position/s.

Hands-on experience building modern web software applications.

Note: You will likely be asked to write a small amount of code early in your tenure in order to better understand the team and their needs.

Deep empathy for the people on your team and their experience with it.

Experience with agile-ish development processes.

Direct experience building modern web applications.

Experience hiring and building teams.

Excellent communication (oral and written) skills.

Exhibits team values (see below).

PERKS YOU'LL RECEIVE:


A great downtown Ann Arbor office with access to coffee, shopping, bars, restaurants, etc.

A fun, energetic, often zany workplace that is open and accepting of all interests

An open vacation policy (our policy is: Get your work done; be reliable; go above and beyond because you want to, and take rest and relaxation when you need it!).

A flexible work schedule and work environment

Health benefits

At Composites One our culture is founded on a clear set of Core Values that has at its core 
Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.
 Our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as one Team, respect each other in our daily interactions, and communicate effectively while doing the one thing that is critical to our success – taking care of our customers. 

 
Are you ready for a rewarding career?
 
 
 We are searching for a Distribution Center Operations Manager to join our growing Team!
 
 
 
 
Now is the time to move forward and make an impact!
 
 
 As a 
DC Operations Manager
 you will be responsible for the managerial oversight of the operational function of multiple distribution centers, including 
customer service, safety/risk management
, 
receiving, transportation
, 
warehousing, equipment/building maintenance/repair operations
 and 
office/business administration tasks. 
In this role you will adhere to and promote Company values by performing duties in a manner that is consistent with being a team leader and supports the continued growth of the company.
 
 
 How 
will you impact our organization as an DC Operations Manager on a daily basis?
 
 
 
  
Support, manage and analyze DC customer service functions to continuously improve all levels of customer satisfaction.
 
  
Serve as liaison between the Customer Service, Warehouse and Sales Team to resolve issues and maintain focus on the customer.
 
  
Analyze and manage warehouse and delivery functions to continuously improve the efficiency levels and safety.
 
  
Oversee and manage the daily operations of the DC to achieve specific operating income and ROA goals.
 
  
Monitor and approve all freight transactions, including review of freight adders on a semi-annual basis in partnership with Supply Chain Managers.
 
  
Develop systems, processes and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources, including effective material movement and logistics, while delivering value to our customers.
 
  
Review monthly financial statements and investigates variances against budget; identifies areas for improvement in efficiency and cost reductions.
 
  
Implement best practices as they relate to manufactured goods such as slitting, material repackaging and quick tint operations.
 
  
Responsible for risk management at the DC level.
 
 
 
 
Leadership and Communications Skills:
 
 
 
  
Monitor and evaluate expectations and performance of DC staff through coaching and development opportunities.
 
  
Facilitate the hiring process of DC staff and long term planning for staffing requirements.
 
  
Provide motivational and developmental leadership to DC staff on a daily basis; conduct semi-annual performance reviews for direct reports.
 
  
Establish performance objectives and training plans; conducts strategic planning for the facility.
 
  
Create a safe and compliant work environment by providing adequate safety training; conduct monthly safety meetings and complete training as determined by HSE.
 
 
 
 
Required Skills and Qualifications:
 
 
 
  
A minimum 5 years of supervisory experience.
 
  
Progressively responsible experience in supply chain, distribution, warehouse and/or logistics sectors in the manufacturing or distribution industry.
 
  
Experience in the Composites industry is preferred.
 
  
Experience in Quality Assurance is strongly preferred.
 
  
Experience in Aerospace is strongly preferred.
 
  
High school diploma, GED, or Equivalent is required.
 
  
Bachelors Degree in Business, or related field, strongly preferred.
 
  
Occasional travel, up to 10%.
 
 

 

  Why should you join Composites One?
 
 
 

  
CULTURE:
 This is a great place to work! We are deeply committed to cultivating an environment of Respect, Teamwork, and Communication.
 
  
INTEGRITY:
 The foundation of all strong relationships is TRUST. We strive to act with integrity and honesty in all interactions with our customers, suppliers, and Team Members to build meaningful relationships!
 
  
CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND INNOVATION:
 To remain successful, we must continuously improve and innovate. At Composites One, we value collaboration, and sharing ideas so that we can grow and drive continuous improvement and innovation together.
 
 
 
 
Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve!

 
 
 
 
 
 About Us:
 
 

  
 Composites One LLC
 is the leading supplier of essential materials for 
  
Wind Energy, Aerospace, Defense, Consumer Recreation 
and
  
 Construction Composites Manufacturing. 
We have a global presence and operate 44 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each Team Member with respect and 
  
offers opportunities for growth and personal success.

 
 
 
 
 

  
Learn more about us at compositesone.com!

Are you ready for a rewarding career? We are searching for a Warehouse Manager to join our Operations Team! Now is the time to move forward and make an impact! As a Warehouse Manager you will be responsible for the overall activity of the warehouse, including safety/risk management, Quality, RCCA, receiving, transportation (private fleet and 3rd party carriers), warehousing and equipment/building maintenance/repair operations, all in accordance with established Company and regulatory policies and procedures. In this role you will manage the process and performance involved in daily activities of the warehouse to achieve established operating income and ROA goals. How will you impact our organization as a Warehouse Manager on a daily basis? Develop and establish necessary staffing systems, processes and procedures to ensure consistent, accurate and timely customer order fulfillment. Investigate and establish root cause of shipping and receiving errors and implement corrective action plans. Build and maintain supplier partnerships; Works with suppliers to assure items are delivered to time and quality specifications. Work in conjunction with the regional Buyers and Supply Chain Managers to coordinate product movement, warehouse space requirements and stock rotation. Assist in developing plans for selling aged inventory in partnership with Sales team and regional Buyers. Monitor and approve all freight transactions, including review of freight adders on a semi-annual basis. Oversee the annual physical inventory process and regularly scheduled cycle counts. Develop systems, processes and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources, including effective material movement and logistics, while delivering value to our customers. Utilize third party rating tools, routing techniques and mapping tools that assist in making quality decision that minimize freight costs. Monitor the receipt, coordination and safety of goods coming through the warehouse using the Warehouse Management System. Ensure orders arrive and are dispatched on time to appropriate destinations and in expected quantities. Trace history of items to determine reasons for discrepancies between inventory and stock control records; recommend corrective actions to resolve discrepancies. Plan layout of warehouse and other storage areas, considering turnover, size, weight and related factors of items stored. Analyze records and recommend corrective action for reported non-usable, aged and excess stock. Review records for accuracy of information and compliance with established procedures, and to determine adequacy of inventory levels. Monitor and evaluate expectations and performance of warehouse and delivery staff through coaching and development opportunities. Promote a high level of customer focus and lead a Quality Managed warehouse environment; create an environment that encourages respect, teamwork, communication, customer satisfaction and productivity between team members and following the Integrity Service model. Communicate and ensure all requirements pertaining to warehousing/ material handling, safety and shipping are followed by staff. Required Skills and Qualifications: High School Diploma or GED Equivalent required. Associates Degree preferred. Minimum 5 years experience in a warehouse environment, including supervisory experience. Proven track record in a team development role. Experience with order picking, shipping, receiving, inventory counts, pick/pack. In-depth knowledge of FIFO, OSHA, Safety Awareness and HAZMAT shipping. Management experience within a Quality System such as ISO 9001 or similar strongly preferred. Forklift Certification strongly preferred. Must be proficient in MS Office; ability to learn and master internal systems required. Compensation Range for this role: 82K - 87K per year. All compensation offers are based on skill set, experience, and geographic location of the applicant as relevant to the role. Why should you join Composites One? Join us in creating a brighter future for the customers we serve! doc_title: US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead
doc_description:
Local Unit & Position Description

Do you want to come help lead decarbonization and the advancement of Renewable Energy?

Are you excited about working with a diverse, collaborative team at the world s largest renewable energy consultancy? Do you have a passion for permitting renewable energy projects, and furthering your professional development in a company that truly puts people first?

At DNV our organizational culture and how we collectively influence the world for future generations matters deeply to us. Our team works every day to increase the widespread deployment and operation of renewables to address climate change and positively impact society; endeavors to achieve our purpose through the success of our customers; and strives to be high-performing and innovative. Our approach reflects the equity, respect, and diversity we wish to see in the world.

DNV s Environmental and Permitting Services (EPS) team is growing rapidly, and we are seeking a US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead to help us provide comprehensive permitting services in Midwest US and the rest of the United States (US). You will be responsible for overseeing a team and leading project development and environmental and permitting activities, including the preparation of local, state, and federal renewable energy permit applications, associated environmental and social impact studies, stakeholder engagement sessions, and land use and zoning permit applications for renewable energy projects located in the Midwest and, as well as other regions within and outside of the US. You will also be engaged in leading proposal efforts, business development for wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen facilities across the US, as well as assisting with project due diligence activities.

Our Customers can choose any number of consultancies to execute on specific tasks. However, our EPS team strives to develop long-term partnerships with our Customers, acting as their trusted advisor from the early site selection stage through to operations. Our Customers are at the forefront of the energy transition. Our team is nimble, highly experienced, and driven by our mission to ensure renewable energy projects are safely and sustainably sited, permitted, and operated.

Our team

The EPS team is comprised of siting, environmental, and permitting specialists who work directly with our Customers to help identify and address project risks for terrestrial wind, offshore wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen projects. Our mission is to guide the sustainable, responsible growth of the renewables industry by providing innovative environmental and permitting expertise to support the greater good.

To facilitate this work, excellent written and oral communication skills are paramount. Broadly, our work falls into four categories:

  • Biological services, including field surveys, habitat conservation plans, corporate avian and bat protection plans, review of mitigation strategies, and associated permitting.
  • Permitting services, providing support for permitting at the federal, state/provincial, and local level for wind, solar, battery storage and hydrogen projects; including stakeholder engagement.
  • GIS services, including mapping, constraints reviews, radiocommunication surveys, and critical issues analyses.
  • Siting services, including layout optimization, acoustical measurements, noise impact assessments, shadow flicker studies, blade/ice throw assessments, glint and glare studies, and visual impact studies.

This is a Remote position

What You ll Do

  • Oversee a team of project analysts, biologists, and engineers to deliver projects within allocated time and budget. Perform technical checking and initial approval of all work products completed by project team.
  • Lead the preparation and submission of permit applications, coordination of environmental fieldwork, authoring of environmental reporting documentation including critical issues analyses, technical permitting studies and management plans, Phase I ESAs, environmental impact assessments and technical project proposals and, agency consultation and stakeholder engagement programs.
  • Provide people leadership, coaching, and quality control for a team of approximately five.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with Midwest regulatory agencies (and/or other US regions).
  • Stay informed of applicable regulatory frameworks and participate in regulatory discussions and feedback discussions related to renewable energy developments in the US.
  • Actively seek out practical and realistic business development opportunities in the US. Prepare proposals and bids and engage in facilitating innovative and new service offerings to anticipate/meet market needs.

Position Qualifications

What is Required

  • Bachelor s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • At least 5 years of environmental and/or permitting experience in the US, preferably in the renewable energy industry
  • Advanced knowledge of environmental assessment regulatory frameworks as applied to renewable energy (wind, solar, or battery storage)
  • Experience engaging with and contacts within the federal and state regulatory agencies such as the USFWS, local communities, and Tribes or First Nations
  • Demonstrated skills in people leadership (academic and/or professional experience); and
  • Demonstrated skills in project management, agency consultation, environmental analysis, and business development, including experience building and maintaining relationships with a client base
  • Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
  • We conduct pre-employment drug and background screening

What is Preferred

  • Master s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • 8+ years of relevant experience preferred
  • Experience leading winning proposal efforts for Customers in the renewable energy industry;
  • Capable of travelling to projects in development, construction, and operation sites in varying locations (10%-20% annual time); and
  • Comprehensive understanding of the Midwest wind, solar, and battery storage markets (or other US regions)
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) or other technical accreditation such P.Eng., P.Geo, P.Biol., etc

*Immigration-related employment benefits, for example visa sponsorship, are not available for this position*What We Offer

  • Generous paid time off (vacation, sick days, company holidays, personal days)
  • Multiple Medical and Dental benefit plans to choose from, Vision benefits
  • Spending accounts FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, company-seeded HSA
  • Special programs Employee Assistance Program, ID theft protection, and accident and critical illness options for you and your family
  • Employer-paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace
  • 401(k) with company match
  • Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits
  • Tuition assistance
  • Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities
  • Advancement opportunities

**Benefits may vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionHow We Do ItWe Care, We Dare, We Share

DNV is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially.

DNV is proud to announce being named one of Houston s best places to work in the 2022 Houston Business Journal Best Places to Work competition.

For more information

https://www.eeoc.gov/know-your-rights-workplace-discrimination-illegal-poster

Read more here

Diversity at DNV

Meet our Employees

About DNV

Careers in DNV

Please visit our website at www.dnv.com

As required by the various Pay Transparency laws, DNV provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado, California, Washington, or New York. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the states of Colorado, California, Washington, and New York only, the range of starting pay for this role is $100,000 - $145,000

Company & Business Area Description

DNV is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions.

We provide assurance to the entire energy value chain through our advisory, monitoring, verification, and certification services. As the world's leading resource of independent energy experts and technical advisors, we help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry. We are committed to realizing the goals of the Paris Agreement, and support all stakeholders to transition faster to a deeply decarbonized energy system.

doc_description:
About TPI
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Automotive and Wind Energy industries. TPI Automotive also provides a full range of services that complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.
TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.
About the Role
The Project Manager leads project activities related to key projects by ensuring that projects are executed with robust planning and risk mitigation and delivered on schedule, within budget and cost targets. The Project Manager uses common processes and standard implementation of metrics across key projects to keep projects on track and to keep stakeholders, including operational managers, program managers, business development, and senior leadership informed on project status and progress.
To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee multiple projects and teams using excellent time management and interpersonal skills.
If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Tracks and monitors the overall project status for key projects

 
Leads stage project review meetings utilizing APQP process

 
Ensures that the projects are meeting cost and schedule targets and following common processes and standards

 
Develops and utilizes project timelines for project tasks and ensure target dates are met for multiple projects

 
Interfaces with the Business Development organization during the early phases of the project

 
Coordinates cadence of status reporting with key stakeholders and customers

 
Engages proactively with stakeholders on the respective levels of their organizations to ensure alignment of expectations and continuous improvement of customer satisfaction

 
Provides performance monitoring, information and reporting; helps diagnose root cause of problems and mitigate risks

 
Ensures teams are taking corrective action as necessary to deliver complete scope, desired quality and timeliness of projects

 
Creates and promotes a culture of collaboration, team-work and fun while delivering to or exceeding expectations




Who we’re looking for:



 
BA/BS in finance, business, or engineering related field of study and 5 years relevant large-scale project management experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience

 
Previous manufacturing industry experience required

 
Previous automotive industry experience including APQP preferred

 
Project Management Certification (PMP) preferred

 
In-depth knowledge of project management methodologies, tools & techniques

 
Bias for action to get things done

 
Ability to deliver effective presentations to executive management

 
Ability to creatively operationalize concepts and strategies that may be new and maturing in details and structure

 
Structured, detail orientation

 
Independent thinker and problem-solver; comfortable working in changing operational organizational environment

 
Strong leadership, mentoring, organizational and communication skills

 
Strong ability to collaborate with internal customers, senior leadership and project managers

 
Ability to travel up to 50%, including internationally




Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island.


Location: 373 Market Street, Warren, RI 02885


Job Type: Full-time

TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.
TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.


About the Role


We are looking for an experienced, highly organized technical manager to lead production and development operations in our quickly growing, high-volume automotive composites manufacturing press hall area. The manager will be responsible for the technical oversight of all critical process equipment and the launching of new equipment. The electro-mechanical systems include programable fiber cutting systems, hydraulic presses, resin injection systems, robotic pick-n-place, CNC cutting and machining systems, and ancillary support equipment. The manager will develop capacity plans, build and manage department schedules, assess and manage resource needs.


The manager will be responsible for managing their department and working with support operations to ensure EH&S standards, materials, labor, planning, maintenance, and quality support needs for operations are being met to satisfy customer and business expectations while ensuring compliance to our IATF / ISO certified QMS.


If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role.


To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee several operations at a time with excellent time management and interpersonal skills.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Assume ownership of press hall production process including meeting production deadlines and quality specifications.

 
Troubleshoot and solve challenging integrated equipment systems, support equipment, tooling design, and processing problems.

 
Lead the development, implementation, and sustaining of a robust TPM system to drive significant OEE sustained improvements with goal to meet >/= 85%

 
Improve shop organization and production workflow utilizing 5S and lean initiatives.

 
Ensure all needed and developed safeguards are in place and maintained in areas where autonomous operations are performed by equipment and robotic systems.

 
Estimate labor resources and capacity requirements for product build schedule.

 
Maintain daily Gemba meetings are supported and effective in driving communication and continual improvement

 
Provide updates to senior management on status of operations.

 
Provide day-to-day direction for subordinate team members.

 
Provide leadership to maintain an engaged and motivated work force.




Who we’re looking for: 



 
Four-year degree in technical field such as mechanical or industrial engineering, plus 5 years of experience in machine building/design; 5 years of production experience in automation; 3 years of management experience in production environments; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 
Experience leading lean initiatives including TPM, SMED, 5S, and Kaizen events

 
Experience in automotive manufacturing environment with ISO and IATF standards certification.

 
Experience in leading RCCA projects, FMEA’s, Control Plans, and Flow Plans

 
Very strong computer skills, particularly with the MS Office suite.

 
Knowledge of safety standards for a manufacturing environment.

 
Substantial knowledge of manufacturing and assembly processes such as machining, grinding, CNC, hand assembly, fasteners, etc.




Extra Skills & Abilities



 
SolidWorks or comparable CAD experience.

 
Experience with project management methods, practices and tools including scoping, facilitations, delegation, and risk management best practices.

 
A strong machine maintenance background.

 
Experience with the application of motion components and electric actuators.

 
Experience with automation or manufacturing related equipment.

 
Experience working within cross-functional teams to handle multiple priorities and meet scheduled milestones.

 
Ability to accurately estimate the level of effort required to complete a project build on time and within budget.

 
Desire and capability to coach and mentor direct reports and other project partners.

 
Demonstrated ability to create drawing packages, electronic bills of materials and engineering change orders.




Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island.

Monday to Friday

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.
 
 
Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

  
 
  
 
  
Your Impact:

  
 Here at Jacobs, we apply our expertise and knowledge as we look into the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference. If you want to join a company invested in you, your success and the global community - join us as our Offshore Wind Engineering Lead to help our communities achieve a net-zero future.
 
  
As a vital member of our team, you’ll be recognized as an industry leader and expert within Jacobs and spearhead our growing Offshore Wind practice. Primary focus will be on the US market, but you’ll be coordinating and working across multiple disciplines and regions to leverage Jacobs’ advisory, planning, permitting, and engineering expertise to strengthen our position in the offshore wind market. As the OSW Engineering Lead, you will help lead and build a multi-disciplinary team that can successfully deliver on the design and review of structures needed for offshore wind projects.
 
  
At Jacobs you’ll be instrumental in the growth and development of our Offshore Wind business strategy. You’ll contribute to our alternative energy wind projects/initiatives that have a significant impact upon our business. Your expertise in the design and construction of offshore structures will be critical in the delivery and positioning of Jacobs for upcoming offshore wind opportunities and programs.
 
  
Working together, we’ll help you grow and pursue what fulfills you so that we can make impacts on the future – big and small, global and local.
 
  
At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.
 
  
Here’s What You’ll Need:

  

   
 Substantial years of experience in structural dynamics, numerical modeling, 3D finite element analysis, integrated load analyses, monopile design, steel jacket design, fatigue analysis, design of offshore structures, industry software, and program languages (e.g. STAAD.Pro, SAP, ROBOT, SACS, SESAM, BLADED, SQL, Matlab, Python)

   
Strong knowledge of industry standards, offshore regulations, health & safety, and environmental legislation associated with offshore construction projects

   
Be highly experienced in interfacing with other discipline specialists (structural, geotechnical, coastal, electrical, mechanical, BIM, etc.) and familiar with offshore codes and standards (DNVGL, ISO, UFC, AISC, API, etc.)

   
Proven track record delivering large, complex, multidisciplinary projects and execution of works in an offshore environment

   
Familiarity with the US offshore wind industry, its players, and market outlook and relationships with offshore wind developers, contractors, suppliers, or utilities involved in the development of offshore wind projects in the US

   
Have an outgoing and customer-oriented attitude with the ability to build, and develop client relationships, and be a demonstrated and recognized Project Director and technical leader

   
Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering with Structural Focus

   
Professional Engineering Registration

  

  
 
  

   
 
   
Ideally, You’ll Also Have:

   
 
   

    
Advanced degree in structural or geotechnical engineering

    
Experience in the development of an offshore wind including program management functions (e.g. budget, schedule, procurement).

    
Familiarity and experience in the design of offshore floating structures

    
Leadership skills and the ability to identify suitable candidates to help grow our offshore wind practice.

About TPI 

 
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI Transportation also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.
 

 
 TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.
 

 
 
About the Role 

 
We are seeking an experienced and accomplished manufacturing quality professional to support the site through a period of exciting growth in our automotive products manufacturing operation division. 

 
The Quality Manager plans and directs quality management activities for the Rhode Island manufacturing site, focusing on production and product quality and quality management systems implementation and management. Supervises quality control and quality engineering staff in the implementation of TPI’s quality policy, procedures, and plans. 

 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities 

 

  
Leads quality control, quality engineering, and quality systems activities through a broad-based understanding of business management. 

  
Establishes quality plans and directs activities of assigned staff. 

  
Supervises Quality Department personnel. 

  
Serves as primary contact for customer issues. 

  
Owns the following processes: 
   

    
Internal audits (QM should be a trained lead auditor) 

    
Customer Feedback 

    
Monitor and Measure (Quality related) 

    
CAPA and Nonconforming Material (MRB) 

    
ISO certification and maintenance 

   

  
Trains team members on quality related subjects, procedures, work instructions. 

  
Provides input for yearly budgets for quality. 

  
Writes team member annual performance reviews. 

  
Coordinates quality related matters with other departments, promoting teamwork and continuous improvement in the process. 

 

 
Who we’re looking for: 

 

  
B.S. degree in engineering (mechanical, chemical, industrial), and at least 5 years of manufacturing management experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. 

  
Previous automotive manufacturing quality experience. 

  
Formal training in the field of quality (ISO, TQM, IATF, Auditing) and business management. 

  
Computer proficiency including MS Office, and Minitab. 

  
Familiarity with Statistical Process Control (SPC). 

  
Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and specifications. 

  
Knowledge of metrology (calibration) systems. 

  
Ability to communicate clearly, both in writing and verbally, with people at all levels. 

  
Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing principles 

  
IATF or TS lead auditor experience preferred. 

 

 
Location 

 
This position is on site at our automotive composites manufacturing site in Warren, Rhode Island.
 

 
 
Our Mission 
is to deliver innovative and sustainable solutions to decarbonize and electrify the world by expanding the adoption of renewable energy. We accomplish this by cultivating an inclusive culture that attracts, develops, excites, and retains exceptional talent. 

 
Additional Information 
 TPI Composites, Inc. offer competitive compensation and benefits, including but not limited to, health and dental insurance, 401(k) plan with company match, and paid vacation plans. 

 
TPI Composites, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Background check and drug test required. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job Description Summary

Inspect, plan and repair wind turbine blades, fill in for Service Supervisor and ensure EHS compliance within the team.

Job Description

About us:

LM Wind Power, a GE Renewable Energy business is a world leading supplier of blades and service to the wind industry. The wind turbine industry is becoming increasingly complex, with radical progress made over the last few decades, providing great opportunities for professional development and a work environment that promotes initiative and creativity. If working in a company which creates state-of-the-art technology and processes attracts you, LM Wind Power has a career for you.

Why we come to work:

At GE Renewable Energy, our service teams keep our world moving. They’re adaptable, determined, and safety-focused, thriving in high-pressure situations. They’re the kind of people who dig deep for answers, work collaboratively with the right teams to drive

solutions, and who sit back and smile when they know they have done a great job. As part of this team, you’ll be rewarded with autonomy and trust, a collaborative, supportive team, and the chance to be empowered and successful, every single day

Role Summary/Purpose:

The Lead Service Technician role will complete field and workshop based work as required. The role provides on site technical direction, hands on service, and leadership during installation and maintenance of customer owned blades and components. The Lead Tech will also ensure EHS compliance within the team. The role will also fill in for the Service Supervisor on an as needed basis.

Essential Responsibilities:

Prepare job planning documents that define the scope of work to be performed through engineering instructions, drawings, and process instructions. Be responsible for ensuring the team is performing daily/weekly/monthly inspections on tools, equipment, and PPE.

Travel to job sites

Perform blade repairs according to the specified instructions.

Prepare applicable service documentation including details of repairs.

Perform inspections and communicate with LM Wind Power staff appropriately.

Communicate with customers regarding service work

Ensure site rules, regulations and procedures are being followed at all times.

Fill in for Service Supervisor when absent

Act as point of contact for EHS issues

Enter any information required in Gensuite and support incident follow up

Company Description
  
 ITW (NYSE: ITW) is a Fortune 200 global multi-industrial manufacturing leader with revenue totaling $14.5 billion in 2021. The company’s seven industry-leading segments leverage the unique ITW Business Model to drive solid growth with best-in-class margins and returns in markets where highly innovative, customer-focused solutions are required. ITW has nearly 50,000 dedicated colleagues in operations around the world who thrive in the company’s unique decentralized and entrepreneurial culture.

  
 ITW is a great employer with a distinct culture that empowers our people to think and act like entrepreneurs within ITW’s strategic framework. This decentralized, entrepreneurial culture is one component of the powerful and highly differentiated ITW Business Model. Commitment to our core values, safety and our culture is a competitive advantage for the company, and we are committed to fully leveraging its strength.

  
 ITW Polymers Sealants North America, Inc. offers expanded sealants solutions to various industries and its key markets including construction (roofing, surfacing, metal building, and fenestration), aerospace composites and wind energy. Our brands with a proven history of success include ERSystems®, Permathane®, Tacky Tape®, STA’-PUT®, Pacific Polymers®, Acryl-R®, Miracle®, and Elastek®.

 
 
 
 
 

  Job Description
  
 POSITION SUMMARY:

  
 The Human Resources Manager is a business partner that will help drive strategic talent initiatives across our division. The HR Manager role is a hands-on and a collaborative role that requires great attention to detail and high level of confidentiality.

  
 Key Responsibilities:

  
 Enterprise Strategy & 80/20 Objectives

  

   
 Establish competency, leadership and credibility necessary to be a partner and key contributor while delivering great results within HR and the sites you support

   
 Develop an understanding of the ITW Business Model with the ability to implement meaningful change based on business unit and division strategic priorities

   
 Partnership with plant operations leadership team to support 80 focus areas

   
 Be able to effectively communicate and/or lead changes impacting the business

  

  
 Human Resource Management

  

   
 Effectively manage all areas of the HR function for your client groups from managing daily and tactical tasks to effectively leading the strategic elements such as workforce planning, morale/culture, change management and risk mitigation.

   
 Partner with Division HR Director for execution of annual talent management cycle

   
 Partner with operations leadership while assuming local management leadership role for plant operations

   
 Initiate, support and drive change, as needed throughout the business

   
 Revise and/or create, implement, and effectively communicate human resource or people related processes and policies

   
 Interpret, report and manage compliance with the applicable state/country laws and regulation

   
 Travel approximately 25% to 40% to support the Norcross, GA and Rockland, MA plants

  

  
 Talent Acquisition

  

   
 Engage with local and division leadership regarding employee needs within plant and division

   
 Execute division recruitment process; partner with managers and lead all phases of the recruitment process

   
 Develop recruitment strategies for exempt and non-exempt roles

   
 Proactive and regular review of non-exempt workforce planning needs to ensure staffing levels meet production needs

  

  
 Training & Development

  

   
 Manage the identification and development of "High Potential" employees, working with management and corporate leaders for intentional development

   
 Identify, design and deliver training and mentoring programs that promote employee development and engagement

   
 Managerial courage to identify and coach managers and/or leaders in real time

   
 Manage performance review process for all employees, including performance issues of individuals and teams

  

  
 Employee Relations

  

   
 Facilitate, counsel and coach employees and managers to resolution regarding employee relations

   
 Partner, notify and/or elevate sensitive employee relations matters to Division HR Director and/or Corporate HR ensuring a shared risk approach

   
 Responsible for FMLA, STD and LTD administration, leveraging Corporate HR as needed

  

  
 Compensation & Benefits

  

   
 Coordinate compensation review process for promotions, merit increases and bonus plans

  

  
 SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:

  

   
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills are necessary, as well as the ability to build networks of contacts externally and internally

   
 Ability to link company/business objectives to HR strategies

   
 Must be able to exercise independent judgment, ability to work independently and function well in a team environment

   
 High level of intellectual curiosity with ability to find problems and provide solutions

   
 Strategic thinking with ability to accelerate and influence change

   
 Excellent time and project management capabilities, must have a sense of urgency, able to prioritize including the ability to manage competing priorities

  

 
 
 
 
 

  Qualifications
  
 EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  
 Required

  

   
 Bachelor’s Degree

   
 Minimum of 5 years of progressive HR Generalist experience

  

  
 Preferred

  

   
 Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or an HR-related field

   
 7+ years of progressive HR Generalist experience, preferably with at least one previous leadership role

   
 Prior manufacturing experience

   
 Bilingual communication skills; English and Spanish

e required of the position.

  
 Additional Information
  
 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

  

  
 ITW is an equal opportunity employer. We value our colleagues’ unique perspectives, experiences and ideas and create workplaces where everyone can develop their careers and perform to their full potential.

  
 As an equal employment opportunity employer, ITW is committed to equal employment opportunity and fair treatment for employees, beginning with the hiring process and continuing through all aspects of the employment relationship.

  
 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Who We Are

Johns Manville is a leading manufacturer and marketer of premium-quality insulation and commercial roofing, along with glass fibers and nonwovens for commercial, industrial and residential applications. Our products are used in a wide variety of industries including building products, aerospace, automotive and transportation, filtration, commercial interiors, waterproofing and wind energy.

A proud member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies, we serve customers in more than 80 countries around the globe. We are committed to delivering positive and powerful experiences, because we are successful only when our employees and customers thrive. We are passionate, we care about people, we perform at a superior level, and we protect others and our environments.

Maintenance Technician will be someone who thrives in a fast-paced plant environment and enjoys being part of a team. In this role, you will perform mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, pneumatic and electronic and preventative maintenance on all required equipment to maximize productivity while maintaining safety and quality standards. The Maintenance Technician / Maintenance Mechanic works in partnership with all departments as a part of a key service group to the organization. The facility is one of the top performers in the division supplying material all over the United States which translates to JOB SECURITY. Being part of the Berkshire Hathaway Family means GREAT BENEFITS. The Johns Manville Bremen facility has one of the best SAFETY records within the company.

The Maintenance Technician will work 2nd shift hours of 2pm-10pm.

Starting Rate : $30.90- $34.26 hour plus shift differential.

Your Day to Day:

  • Follow all Johns Manville safety and environmental procedures and policies.
  • Attend plant safety and training meetings as scheduled.
  • Follow Job Safety Analysis (JSA's), uses safe work practices, and reports hazardous conditions at all times. Wear protective clothing & equipment as required.
  • Develop JSA’s for new tasks and review JSA’s annually.
  • Demonstrate ability to train coworkers about various systems in the plant.
  • Perform routine and non-routine maintenance activities of mechanical and electrical systems.
  • Develop and modify preventive maintenance plans for new and modified equipment.
  • Display advanced working knowledge of electrical (single phase and 3 phase), of plant power distribution systems, mechanical, hydraulics, and pneumatics systems.
  • Install and repair electrical conduit and cable, including connections, controls, grounding, etc.
  • Work from electrical and mechanical schematics to troubleshoot or install new or modify existing equipment.
  • Perform voltmeter, ammeter, wattmeter, and other electrical measurements.
  • Inspect equipment and reports on defective part and unsatisfactory conditions to further preventative maintenance program. Provide solutions to improve the efficiency of the equipment.
  • Maintain, adjust, service and lubricate equipment keeping it in good operating conditions with respect to proper aligning, functioning and lubrication of parts.
  • Participate in continuous improvement and Root Cause Corrective Action (RCCA) teams.
  • Assist co-workers as directed.
  • Perform and complete other work as assigned by supervisor.
  • Provides feedback and solutions to leadership on critical equipment issues pertaining to safety or operational capabilities
  • Display flexible outlook toward change management, working on cross-functional teams, training for the use of new tools and methodologies, and willingness and ability to obtain operating knowledge of all production equipment.
  • Participate in daily housekeeping efforts. Ensure job site is consistently clean after every job and clean maintenance shop after every shift.

What You Bring to the Team:

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • 5+ years multi-craft maintenance experience in an industrial/manufacturing environment
  • Strong commitment to safety
  • Ability to work well with others
  • Strong problem-solving capabilities
  • Excellent interpersonal and communications skills
  • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
  • Intermediate computer skills
  • Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot and handle multiple priorities and projects
  • Ability to disassemble, diagnose, repair, and perform preventative repair measures on mechanical equipment including, but not limited to: pumps, gearboxes, reducers, couplings, seals, rotating elements, blowers, fans, hydraulic units, valves, chillers, and compressors
  • Demonstrate advanced Mechanical aptitude, including pipe fitting, fabricating
  • Knowledge of use of hand tools and power tools
  • Knowledge of shop machinery, including hydraulic press, mill & drill press, lathe, and saw(s) (band & Chop)
  • Intermediate knowledge of building lighting systems
  • Intermediate knowledge of AC/heating systems
  • Intermediate knowledge of building fire alarm systems
  • Advanced knowledge of Lock, Tag, Clear, and Try program
  • Intermediate knowledge of PLC troubleshooting
  • Intermediate knowledge of VFD troubleshooting
  • Display advanced understanding of 480V system to include arc-flash training and safe working practices per NFPA 70E
  • Ability to provide troubleshooting and diagnosis on process heating and cooling equipment
  • Ability to consistently make appropriate decisions while being flexible with regard to work assignments and priorities.
  • Local travel for training purposes

Physical Requirements:

The physical requirements of this position are: (these requirements are typical for most of our manufacturing roles)

  • The ability to stand for extended periods
  • The ability to manually lift, push or pull at least 50 pounds safely and with proper body mechanics, sometimes while in awkward positions.
  • Use of hands (repetitive motion, grabbing, feeling, sensing, pulling)
  • The ability to work safely in a fast-paced, sometimes stressful work environment
  • The ability to safely and effectively work in an often-dusty work environment that experiences a broad range of temperatures (very hot to very cold).
  • The ability to withstand the rigors of working a 12(or 8)-hour rotating shift schedule.
  • The ability to bend, stoop or kneel repetitively

Incumbent must be physically able to perform essential job functions. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.

Please Keep in Mind

If you do not meet 100% of these requirements, we at JM want to hear from you. So, if you are interested in the role, we encourage you to apply so we can learn how your skills and talents can contribute to our team.

Benefits

Johns Manville (JM) offers a wide range of benefits to employees. Some are subsidized by the company and others are fully employee-paid. Health benefits include a choice of comprehensive medical plans, a dental plan, vision plan, wellness program and critical illness insurance. JM sponsors a 401(k) plan which includes a sizeable company match. JM offers paid vacation and also provides paid sick and parental leave for eligible employees.

Additionally, Johns Manville provides basic life Insurance, short-term and long-term disability coverage, an employee assistance program, and business travel accident coverage. Supplemental life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment insurance are available as well. The company also offers a variety of tax saving accounts; health spending account, traditional flexible spending account, and a dependent care spending account. JM also offers a tuition reimbursement program for undergraduate and certain graduate programs.

Diversity & Inclusion

Johns Manville believes diversity and inclusion in our workplace is critical for the long-term success of our company. We are committed to retaining, developing and attracting a diverse workforce that fosters an inclusive work environment in which all employees are treated with dignity and respect. This is the right thing to do for our employees, our company and our communities. Our D&I council is composed of employees from locations across North American & Europe who meet regularly and work to promote and foster an environment of inclusion. Born from our D&I council is our network of employee resource groups (ERGs) that are focused on supporting diverse communities in the workplace. Review more about our diversity & inclusion initiatives on JM’s Career page.

Incumbent must be physically able to perform essential job functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $30.00 - $34.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Work Location: In person

Overview


Avangrid Renewables, a subsidiary of AVANGRID, Inc. (NYSE: AGR), is a leading developer, owner, and operator of renewable energy facilities in the United States with an eight-gigawatt portfolio of onshore wind and solar projects across 22 states. Avangrid Renewables’ offshore wind business is pioneering this new industry with a development pipeline of five gigawatts off the East Coast. Our offshore portfolio consists of our 50% ownership in the first-in-the-nation Vineyard Wind 1 project, which will deliver 800 MW of clean energy into Massachusetts starting in 2023. Additionally, Avangrid Renewables owns 100% of Park City Wind, an 804 MW project to serve the state of Connecticut and Commonwealth Wind, a project that will deliver up to 1200 MW to Massachusetts. Finally, Avangrid Renewables owns 100% of Kitty Hawk Offshore Wind that has the potential to deliver 2,500 MW of clean energy into Virginia and North Carolina. The company will also actively pursue additional lease areas in the Atlantic and Pacific Coasts and the Gulf of Mexico.

We aspire to be the employer of choice by providing purposeful and challenging work revolutionizing the renewable energy industry in the United States. This role will support the senior management team that is developing, constructing and operating large scale offshore wind projects which will provide affordable, clean energy and will have a transformational impact on local communities. Avangrid Renewables’ offshore business is located in Boston, Massachusetts.

Purpose


The Manager – OSW (Offshore Wind) WTG (Wind Turbine Generator) Engineering role is focused on assisting with the delivery of operational requirements in the US Offshore business. Working with Contractors and multiple departments within Offshore Operations and Commercial Services to ensure that Avangrid’s long term asset value and production revenue is maximized. The role will be focused on supporting the wind turbine equipment in Avangrid’s Offshore wind projects and will interface with the wind turbine OEMs and O&M service providers. This position is based in Boston, MA, on a Hybrid schedule.

Belonging to the Offshore Operations Team the Manager – OSW WTG Engineering will be responsible for defining and implementing robust and cost-effective engineering strategies for the operational requirements including management of contractors and associated interfaces, and ensuring quality, best practices and excellent H&SE performance are applied.

The Manager – OSW WTG Engineering will also be responsible for building and leading the WTG engineering team. This team will support the various projects in all matters related to WTG and will also liaise with the wider O&M Global teams for implementing lessons learned from Iberdrola’s group’s projects into the US projects and exchanging best practices.

The Manager – WTG Engineering is responsible for providing high quality and consistent service across offshore projects within Avangrid.

The individual will be working as part of a global business with activities in many countries across US, UK, and the rest of the world. The position may require travel to various locations.

Offshore industry is still relatively immature, and a key focus is on driving down cost. This role will play a large part in developing initiatives to reduce the cost of service during the operational phase.

Responsibilities


  • Delivery of robust and cost-effective engineering strategies for the operational requirements, providing engineering support, assistance and recommendations to ensure delivery within time, to budget and quality following industry best practice and observing the maximum respect for Health, Safety and the Environment to ensure regulatory and legal compliance’
  • Manage WTG engineering team, develop talent, and provide mentorship to junior engineers
  • Implement offshore standards, procedures, tools, best practices, and quality requirements.
  • Develop technical specifications for maintenance agreements.
  • Developing HSE strategies for operations and ensuring a high standard of health and safety awareness is maintained.
  • Provide advice on operational solutions / risk levels affecting technical integrity or asset performance to Principal Project Managers to ensure that cost effective solutions are identified, fully evaluated and the risk profile is fully understood.
  • Make technical recommendations to Project Managers based on the condition of the assets, production, and other KPIs.
  • Support the coordination of EPC interfaces and Project Services Engineering Team to ensure the operational requirements are identified, fully evaluated, and actioned during project execution.
  • Liaise with the other Global Offshore Business Hub Engineering teams ensuring lessons learned and best practices are capture and shared across the different Offshore Projects.
  • Deliver technical due diligence to the handover from construction and the transition through end of warranty of offshore wind assets.
  • Ensure that all assessment, advice, and recommendations are fully documented in accordance with all internal procedures and industry best practice, and that sufficient technical and commercial due diligence (whether internal or external) exists to support those business decisions.

Competencies

  • Be a role model
  • Be agile
  • Collaborate and Share
  • Develop Self & Others
  • Empower to grow
  • Focus to achieve results
  • Technical Skills

Skills and Requirements


  • Degree in engineering, math, physics, or other technical discipline
  • Postgraduate experience, preferable in operation of wind turbines
  • Some experience with offshore wind operations preferred.
  • Experience of renewables / power generation industry preferred.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Developed report writing and presentation skills and ability to summarize parameters and drivers impacting the scope of works.
  • Good organizational and operational skills with the ability to link this awareness to technical judgement and decision making.
  • Good planning and analysis skills with the ability to look forward and anticipate problems and thereafter plan and implement mitigating solutions to negate the effect of such problems.
  • Ability to support the management of a scope of works which require interface and coordination. Advice on the impact of technical/ specialist risks and issues and the viability of solutions recommended.
  • Experience and understanding of technical due diligence.
  • Problem solving – dealing with conflicting requirements
  • Tenacity, persistence, and determination to succeed in overcoming obstacles.
  • High capacity for change.
  • Experience of working in teams involved in large projects in international environments.
  • Pro-active and diligent approach.
  • Sound relationship management skills and confidence working with senior colleagues.
  • Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
  • Analyze technical/ specialist risks and issues and the viability of solutions recommended.
  • Computer literacy, with a good working knowledge of Microsoft Office components especially Excel and database packages, e.g., Microsoft Access, and programming languages as well as an ability to deal with new software.
  • Eligible to work in the US
  • Flexible to travel around the US and overseas
  • Ability to climb 100-meter steel towers on a regular basis to perform engineering inspections of wind turbines
  • Ability to occasionally lift items weighing up to 50 pounds.
  • Ability to complete GWO basic safety and sea survival training

Our Selection Process

#LI-CH1

Mobility Information

Please note that any applicant who is not a citizen of the country of the vacancy will be subject to compliance with the applicable immigration requirements to legally work in that country

Avangrid employees may be assigned a system emergency role and in the event of a system emergency, may be required to work outside of their regular schedule/job duties. This is applicable to employees that will work in Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, and New York within AVANGRD Network and Corporate functions. This does not include those that will work for Avangrid Renewables

Unit Drop Forge Co., Inc. 
is a privately-held heavy manufacturing company. On one hand, it's the kind of gritty, old-school heavy metal manufacturing plant that's pretty rare these days. But on the other hand, it's a high-tech, leading-edge manufacturer with sophisticated engineering and CNC machining capabilities.

Located in West Allis, Wisconsin, Unit Drop Forge is a world class manufacturer of custom designed closed-die forged steel components. We have been producing exceptional quality parts for a wide variety of markets such as: Construction, Off-Highway, Mining, Railroad, Wind Energy, Oil Field, Compressors, Forestry and Defense.




We can't offer a sign-on bonus, but what the UDF Team does offer is
 a culture of mutual trust, respect, and accountability. Called a great place to work for generations, many employees have spent their entire careers with us.
