Our solutions are used in such areas as refrigeration, air conditioning, heating, power conversion, motor control, industrial machinery, automotive, marine, and off- and on-highway equipment. We also provide solutions for renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, as well as district-energy infrastructure for cities.

Our innovative engineering dates back to 1933. Danfoss is family-owned, employing more than 42.000 people, serving customers in more than 100 countries through a global footprint of 95 factories.

Who We Are
Johns Manville is a leading manufacturer and marketer of premium-quality insulation and commercial roofing, along with glass fibers and nonwovens for commercial, industrial and residential applications. Our products are used in a wide variety of industries including building products, aerospace, automotive and transportation, filtration, commercial interiors, waterproofing and wind energy.
A proud member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies, we serve customers in more than 80 countries around the globe. We are committed to delivering positive and powerful experiences, because we are successful only when our employees and customers thrive. We are passionate, we care about people, we perform at a superior level, and we protect others and our environments.
The base hourly rate for this position is $28.98
The purpose of the Maintenance Technician's role is to perform routine and non-routine maintenance on production and facility equipment to support production of EPDM roofing material.
This position is responsible for communicating and supporting JM core values and delivering the JM experience. This position is also responsible for meeting facility targets for safety, productivity and machine uptime. This role will conduct effective problem solving and troubleshoot processes in order to develop corrective actions.
Your Day to Day
  • Follow all Johns Manville safety and environmental procedures and policies.
  • Attend plant safety and training meetings as scheduled.
  • Follow Job Safety Analysis (JSA's), uses safe work practices, and reports hazardous conditions at all times. Wear protective clothing & equipment as required.
  • Develop JSA's for new tasks and review JSA's annually.
  • Perform routine and non-routine maintenance activities of mechanical and electrical systems.
  • Display working knowledge of electrical (single phase and 3 phase), mechanical, hydraulics, and pneumatics systems.
  • Install and repair electrical conduit and cable, including connections, controls, grounding, etc.
  • Work from electrical and mechanical schematics to troubleshoot or install new or modify existing equipment.
  • Perform voltmeter, ammeter, wattmeter, and other electrical measurements.
  • Inspect equipment and reports on defective part and unsatisfactory conditions to further preventative maintenance program.
  • Maintain, adjust, service and lubricate equipment keeping it in good operating conditions with respect to proper aligning, functioning and lubrication of parts.
  • Participate in continuous improvement and Root Cause Corrective Action (RCCA) teams.
  • Assist co-workers as directed.
  • Perform and complete other work as assigned by supervisor.
  • Provides feedback to leadership on critical equipment issues pertaining to safety or operational capabilities
  • Display flexible outlook toward change management, working on cross-functional teams, training for the use of new tools and methodologies, and willingness and ability to obtain operating knowledge of all production equipment.
  • Participate in daily housekeeping efforts. Ensure job site is consistently clean after every job and clean maintenance shop after every shift.
  • May be required to perform other related duties as assigned
What You Bring to the Team
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • 3-5 years multi-craft maintenance experience
  • Strong commitment to safety
  • Ability to work with others
  • Strong problem-solving capabilities
  • Excellent interpersonal and communications skills
  • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
  • Intermediate computer skills
  • Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot and handle multiple priorities and projects
  • Ability to disassemble, diagnose, repair, and perform preventative repair measures on mechanical equipment including, but not limited to: pumps, gearboxes, reducers, couplings, seals, rotating elements, blowers, fans, hydraulic units, valves, and compressors
  • Demonstrate Basic Mechanical aptitude, including pipe fitting, fabricating
  • Knowledge of use of hand tools and power tools
  • Knowledge of shop machinery, including hydraulic press, mill & drill press, and saw(s) (band & Chop)
  • General knowledge of building lighting systems
  • General knowledge of AC/heating systems
  • General knowledge of building fire alarm systems
  • General knowledge of Lock, Tag, Clear, and Try program
  • General knowledge of PLC, including troubleshooting skills
  • General knowledge of VFD, including troubleshooting skills
  • Display understanding of 480V system to include arc-flash training and safe working practices per NFPA 70E
  • Ability to provide troubleshooting and diagnosis on process heating and cooling equipment
  • Ability to consistently make appropriate decisions while being flexible with regard to work assignments and priorities.
  • No travel required
Preferred Requirements
  • Associate's degree in related technical area
  • Strong troubleshooting and Root Cause Corrective Action (RCCA) skillsets.
  • SAP experience.
  • Equipment predictive/preventative reliability experience.
Physical Requirements
    • Work environment is typical of a manufacturing facility: May be exposed to environmental conditions of cold, heat, high noise levels, moving mechanical parts, heights, dust/mist/gas/fumes, extensive walking or climbing, bending, reaching, etc.
  • Ability to work overtime as required, including shifts of 12 hours.
  • May be required to lift, carry, push or pull up to and including 50 pounds
Incumbent must be physically able to perform essential job functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.
Please Keep in Mind
If you do not meet 100% of these requirements, we at JM want to hear from you. So, if you are interested in the role, we encourage you to apply so we can learn how your skills and talents can contribute to our team.
Benefits
Johns Manville (JM) offers a wide range of benefits to employees. Some are subsidized by the company and others are fully employee-paid. Health benefits include a choice of comprehensive medical plans, a dental plan, vision plan, wellness program and critical illness insurance. JM sponsors a 401(k) plan which includes a sizeable company match. JM offers paid vacation and also provides paid sick and parental leave for eligible employees.
Additionally, Johns Manville provides basic life Insurance, short-term and long-term disability coverage, an employee assistance program, and business travel accident coverage. Supplemental life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment insurance are available as well. The company also offers a variety of tax saving accounts; health spending account, traditional flexible spending account, and a dependent care spending account. JM also offers a tuition reimbursement program for undergraduate and certain graduate programs.
Diversity & Inclusion
Johns Manville believes diversity and inclusion in our workplace is critical for the long-term success of our company. We are committed to retaining, developing and attracting a diverse workforce that fosters an inclusive work environment in which all employees are treated with dignity and respect. This is the right thing to do for our employees, our company and our communities. Our D&I council is composed of employees from locations across North American & Europe who meet regularly and work to promote and foster an environment of inclusion. Born from our D&I council is our network of employee resource groups (ERGs) that are focused on supporting diverse communities in the workplace. Review more about our diversity & inclusion initiatives on JM’s Career page.
Incumbent must be physically able to perform essential job functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Job Description

Summary

This position will involve the set-up, gauging, prove out programs, and operate machine tools to perform a series of progressive machining operations on repetitive work to exacting tolerances. Actively support and strive to meet the strategic goals set by yourself, the facility and Danfoss. This is a 2nd Shift position and is located in Van Wert, Ohio.

Job Responsibilities

  • Must be able to learn, apply, and retain new techniques, concepts and procedures required for continuously improving products, processes, services, deliveries, and overall quality
  • Ability to read and understand blueprints, control plans, routers, job instructions and measurement tools
  • Must meet or exceed all quality standards set by the customers and individual Value Stream. Must also maintain the quality standards defined for the entire facility
  • Maintain flexibility to be able to move from work area to work area to meet the delivery expectations of the customers and the productivity goals for the plant. Able to work efficiently to establish standards without constant supervision
  • Always promotes cooperation and “team oriented” work environment under the direction of the leadership team
  • Creates/maintains a safe work environment and practices safety for himself and others at all times

  • Ability to multitask as it includes: operating overhead cranes, large band saws, cutting and stenciling various sizes of bar stock and delivering stock to the individual machines

Background & Skills

  • At least two (2) years’ experience operating manual, NC and/or CNC machine tools with experience in jobs setups requiring tooling and fixturing changes

Graco manufactures and markets premium equipment to move, measure, control, dispense and spray a wide variety of fluid and powder materials. What does that mean? Well, we pump peanut butter into your jar, and the oil in your car. We glue the soles of your shoes, the glass in your windows and the screen on your phone. We spray the finish on your vehicle, coatings on your pills, the paint on your house and texture on your walls. Graco is part of your daily life.

Graco has excellent opportunities available to individuals who want to be part of fast-moving, growing company – especially candidates committed to quality, innovation and solving customer problems. Graco was proud to be named a Best Place to Work in Manufacturing and Production by Fortune Magazine in 2016, 2018, 2019 and 2021.

Job Purpose

In this role, you will work closely with product owners, design engineering and technical support to test, implement and deploy solutions to expand and maintain our product framework. Duties range from leading and contributing on product development efforts to diagnosing and troubleshooting escalated technical issues.

Graco is a global leader in the design, development and manufacture of highly-engineered systems for numerous industrial and commercial applications. This position supports our Lubrication Equipment Division (LED) in Anoka, MN. At LED, Industrial Lubrication products are used in wind energy, general manufacturing and steel and mining industries ( http://bit.ly/1jTCVMI ). Petroleum Management products control fluids traditionally used for servicing vehicles, including pumps, tanks, hose reels, and meters ( http:// bit.ly/ 1krX8Tf ).

Essential Duties

Perform software engineering tasks in the development of new products:

Participate in development of Product Specification

Produce conceptual designs

Guide development process to produce practical designs

Create software code

Assist with system tests per plan to produce defect-free software

Provide analysis of design to applicable standards

Review instruction manuals and product literature

Define and lead prototype development and lab and field tests

Work with manufacturing on process development

Conduct design reviews, safety reviews

Leader of small new product development projects as required.

Complete project feasibility and Pre-Prod authorizations

Create and maintain project schedules

Manage project to meet schedules, including:

Working with other team members to ensure satisfactory completion of all steps in development process

Identification and communication of threats to schedule to appropriate management

Work effectively in a team environment

Participate in release-for-sale activities

Provide periodic oral and written reports of project status

Participate in identification of new product opportunities for Graco by:

Recognizing customer product needs

Evaluating Graco and competitive products

Proposing and developing proper technology to fulfill customer needs

Direct and perform standard product support activities such as:

Troubleshooting product problems in manufacturing, lab or customer sites

Initiating corrective action activities

Learn, participate in development, and apply knowledge of:

Developments in technical field by staying abreast of developments to maintain technical knowledge

Graco product line

Operational systems

Graco and industry design standards

Graco Quality Management System

Graco customer applications and requirements

Emerging trends in our customers' markets

Other duties as assigned

Position Requirements

Education:

BS in Computer Science or related field

Experience:

Minimum of 2 years work related experience

Technical Skills:

Ability to implement, test and troubleshoot software updates

Java, Python, C# programming language expertise

Proven ability to produce executable code per design and quality standards

Prior hands-on experience with SQL, Linux OS, Spring and RESTful APIs a plus

Ability to research, diagnose and respond to escalated customer issues

Customer Support Skills:

Ability to learn new technologies quickly and discuss concepts with less technical customers and colleagues

Ability to solve challenging problems by combining input from multiple sources and forming your own solution

Excellent communication (oral and written) skills

Experience providing technical support to external customers and representing the company

Job Description Summary
 You will be part of the Project Management Office (PMO)—Marshalling Harbor department—in a cross-functional role which manages the various component preassembly functions at the New Bedford Marine Commerce Terminal, reporting directly to the Deputy Hub Manager. You may also be required to cover additional missions for the PMO to support the project.
 
 
 
 The Tower Preassembly Manager is responsible for overseeing and ensuring the full scope of Mechanical and Electrical/Preassembly operations of the Vineyard Wind 1 Project. The Tower Preassembly Manager is responsible for the management of the full tower erection on the quayside, ensuring they are carried out with good workmanship in accordance with project requirements/schedule, contractor procedures and strict compliance to EHS regulations and QA/QC policy.
 
 
 
 You will demonstrate excellent communication, proactivity, and in-depth knowledge in the field of Mechanical and Electrical completion/construction. The successful candidate will also be expected to follow and enforce GE’s Quality Management System for the Project.
 
 
 
 The position will be based in New Bedford, MA for the Vineyard Wind 1 Project.
 

 
 Job Description

 
 Roles and Responsibilities

 

 

  
 Tower section(T1/T2/T3) lifting operation including Upending of tower sections

  
 Assembly of tower section to erect the full tower on their respective foundation

  
 Installation and termination of cables inside the tower

  
 Customization activities when necessary

  
 Preparation of the full tower for load-out to the feeder barge

  
 Manage all preassembly activities of the main WTG components within the Hub including activities such as heavy lifting, component handling and preservation, operation method reviews, and mechanical and electrical completion works to achieve Customer & GE OFW goals and objectives

  
 Measure the on-time delivery of tower pre-assembly and loadout activities

  
 Verify that the work tasks are performed safely and in accordance with the approved procedure(s)

  
 Oversee the development of all Tower pre-assembly method statements and lift plans

  
 Manage all technical aspects of tower preassembly activities including all SIMOPS/COMOPS activities if necessary.

  
 Ensure all required equipment is mobilized and operational, including main components (nacelles, towers, and blades)

  
 Manage barge loadouts and backloading activities on quayside

  
 Ensure preassembly activities completed in time to meet internal targets and key loadout dates

  
 Support the issuing of Mechanical & Electrical certificates to make sure the tower is preassembled according to the schedule and quality procedure

  
 Ensure that highest level of Environmental, Health & Safety (EHS) standards are enforced and applied

  
 Sign work permits prior to start of lifting or preassembly activities

  
 Ensure that all EHS requirements are met prior to launch of operation. Ensure that documentation is in order and available (work permit, lift plans, Method Statements & Risk Assessment including all certificates as required)

  
 Troubleshooting and management of punch lists

  
 Ensure Toolbox Talks with the Marshalling Hub subcontractor are completed on each day of operations. Oversee toolbox talks and/or pre-lift meetings prior to the start of any preassembly operations

  
 Confirm with the Marshalling Hub subcontractor that Tooling, Material and PPE used for the operation is available, incl. certificate (when applicable)

  
 Interface with the warehouse team daily

  
 Management of offshore and onshore preassembly kits for bolting, tooling, and M&E equipment

  
 Confirm with Hub subcontractor that personnel have acquired the appropriate levels of training and certification for their respective tasks

  
 Monitor operations performed by the subcontractor on WTG components during Storage, Preservation, Preassembly and Loadout.

  
 Collect all required documentation provided by the subcontractor at the end of the operation and update system accordingly.

  
 Share any EHS, non-conformance or damage reports with the EHS or Quality team.

  
 Capture and escalate all changes in scope, schedule. Advise of any major issues, especially those affecting EHS, or schedule aspects of the contract to the Deputy Hub Manager

  
 Work on the Vineyard Wind 1 Marshalling Hub daily

  
 Undertake other tasks as may be requested by the PMO.

 

 

 
 Required Qualifications

 

  
 Bachelor's Degree

  
 Minimum of 8 years of experience managing Mechanical/Electrical/Construction activities

 

 

 
 Desired Characteristics

 

  
 Proven experience working on complex construction projects and schedule management

  
 Experience working on wind projects would be advantageous but is not a prerequisite

  
 Open to working with multinational people and team of diverse backgrounds and a subcontractor workforce made up of union and non-union personnel

  
 Knowledge & understanding of Heavy lifting activities and associated EHS requirements

  
 Strong experience managing Mechanical and Electrical activities

  
 Familiar with OSHA and standard site safety regulations

  
 Proven experience with subcontractor management

  
 Passionate and motivated

  
 Excellent ability to communicate at all levels

  
 Good inter-personal skills to bridge between customer representatives and various subcontractors working on site

  
 Ability to negotiate with different stakeholders

  
 Good English and excellent PC and Microsoft Office computer skills

Inductive Reasoning – The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events)

Company Description

ITW (NYSE: ITW) is a Fortune 200 global multi-industrial manufacturing leader with revenue totaling $12.6 billion in 2020. The company’s seven industry-leading segments leverage the unique ITW Business Model to drive solid growth with best-in-class margins and returns in markets where highly innovative, customer-focused solutions are required. ITW has nearly 50,000 dedicated colleagues in operations around the world who thrive in the company’s unique decentralized and entrepreneurial culture.

ITW is a great employer with a distinct culture that empowers our people to think and act like entrepreneurs within ITW’s strategic framework. This decentralized, entrepreneurial culture is one component of the powerful and highly differentiated ITW Business Model. Commitment to our core values, safety and our culture is a competitive advantage for the company, and we are committed to fully leveraging its strength.

ITW Polymers Sealants North America, Inc. offers expanded sealants solutions to various industries and its key markets including construction (roofing, surfacing, metal building, and fenestration), aerospace composites and wind energy. Our brands with a proven history of success include ERSystems®, Permathane®, Tacky Tape®, STA’-PUT®, Pacific Polymers®, Acryl-R®, Miracle®, and Elastek®.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Human Resources Manager is a business partner that will help drive strategic talent initiatives across our division. The Human Resources Manager role is a hands-on and collaborative role that requires great attention to detail and a high level of confidentiality.

Key Responsibilities:

Enterprise Strategy & 80/20 Objectives

Establish competency, leadership, and credibility necessary to be a partner and key contributor while delivering great results within HR and the sites you support

Develop an understanding of the ITW Business Model with the ability to implement meaningful change based on business unit and division strategic priorities

Partner with plant operations leadership team to support 80 focus areas

Be able to effectively communicate and/or lead changes impacting the business

Human Resource Management

Effectively manage all areas of the HR function for your client groups from managing daily and tactical tasks to effectively leading the strategic elements such as workforce planning, morale/culture, change management, and risk mitigation.

Partner with Division HR Director for execution of the annual talent management cycle

Partner with operations leadership while assuming a local management leadership role for plant operations

Initiate, support, and drive change as needed throughout the business

Interpret, report, and manage compliance with the applicable state/country laws and regulation

Talent Acquisition

Engage with local and division leadership regarding employee needs within plants and across the division

Execute division recruitment process; partner with managers and lead all phases of the recruitment process

Develop recruitment strategies for exempt and non-exempt roles

Proactive and regular review of non-exempt workforce planning needs to ensure staffing levels meet production needs

Training & Development

Manage the identification and development of "High Potential" employees, working with management and corporate leaders for intentional development

Identify, design, and deliver training and mentoring programs that promote employee development and engagement

Manage performance review process for all employees, including performance issues of individuals and teams

Employee Relations

Facilitate, counsel, and coach employees and managers to a resolution regarding employee relations

Partner, notify and/or elevate sensitive employee relations matters to Division HR Director and/or Corporate HR, ensuring a shared risk approach

Responsible for FMLA, STD and LTD administration, leveraging Corporate HR as needed

Compensation & Benefits

Coordinate compensation review process for promotions, merit increases and bonus plans

SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:

Excellent written and verbal communication skills are necessary, as well as the ability to build networks of contacts externally and internally

 Ability to link company/business objectives to HR strategies

Must be able to exercise independent judgment, ability to work independently and function well in a team environment

High level of intellectual curiosity with ability to find problems and provide solutions

Strategic thinking with the ability to accelerate and influence change

Excellent time and project management capabilities, must have a sense of urgency, able to prioritize including the ability to manage competing priorities




Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Required

Bachelor’s Degree

Minimum of 5 years of progressive HR generalist experience

Preferred

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or an HR-related field

7+ years of progressive HR Generalist experience, preferably with at least one previous leadership role

Prior manufacturing experience

Bilingual English/Spanish

Experience with third-party recruiting tools such as LinkedIn Recruiter

Sprague is passionate about delivering the diverse products and programs that warm, power and move the world. We keep homes warm through Northeastern winters and hospitals cool through summer. TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.
TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.


About the Role


We are looking for an experienced, highly organized technical manager to lead production and development operations in our quickly growing, high-volume automotive composites manufacturing press hall area. The manager will be responsible for the technical oversight of all critical process equipment and the launching of new equipment. The electro-mechanical systems include programable fiber cutting systems, hydraulic presses, resin injection systems, robotic pick-n-place, CNC cutting and machining systems, and ancillary support equipment. The manager will develop capacity plans, build and manage department schedules, assess and manage resource needs.


The manager will be responsible for managing their department and working with support operations to ensure EH&S standards, materials, labor, planning, maintenance, and quality support needs for operations are being met to satisfy customer and business expectations while ensuring compliance to our IATF / ISO certified QMS.


If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role.


To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee several operations at a time with excellent time management and interpersonal skills.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Assume ownership of press hall production process including meeting production deadlines and quality specifications.

 
Troubleshoot and solve challenging integrated equipment systems, support equipment, tooling design, and processing problems.

 
Lead the development, implementation, and sustaining of a robust TPM system to drive significant OEE sustained improvements with goal to meet >/= 85%

 
Improve shop organization and production workflow utilizing 5S and lean initiatives.

 
Ensure all needed and developed safeguards are in place and maintained in areas where autonomous operations are performed by equipment and robotic systems.

 
Estimate labor resources and capacity requirements for product build schedule.

 
Maintain daily Gemba meetings are supported and effective in driving communication and continual improvement

 
Provide updates to senior management on status of operations.

 
Provide day-to-day direction for subordinate team members.

 
Provide leadership to maintain an engaged and motivated work force.




Who we’re looking for: 



 
Four-year degree in technical field such as mechanical or industrial engineering, plus 5 years of experience in machine building/design; 5 years of production experience in automation; 3 years of management experience in production environments; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 
Experience leading lean initiatives including TPM, SMED, 5S, and Kaizen events

 
Experience in automotive manufacturing environment with ISO and IATF standards certification.

 
Experience in leading RCCA projects, FMEA’s, Control Plans, and Flow Plans

 
Very strong computer skills, particularly with the MS Office suite.

 
Knowledge of safety standards for a manufacturing environment.

 
Substantial knowledge of manufacturing and assembly processes such as machining, grinding, CNC, hand assembly, fasteners, etc.




Extra Skills & Abilities



 
SolidWorks or comparable CAD experience.

 
Experience with project management methods, practices and tools including scoping, facilitations, delegation, and risk management best practices.

 
A strong machine maintenance background.

 
Experience with the application of motion components and electric actuators.

 
Experience with automation or manufacturing related equipment.

 
Experience working within cross-functional teams to handle multiple priorities and meet scheduled milestones.

 
Ability to accurately estimate the level of effort required to complete a project build on time and within budget.

 
Desire and capability to coach and mentor direct reports and other project partners.

 
Demonstrated ability to create drawing packages, electronic bills of materials and engineering change orders.




Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island.

Department: Manufacturing Employment


Type: Full-time, hourly Position


Title: Production Technician


Location: 58144 Old Portland Rd, Building B, Warren, OR 97053


Compensation: Starting pay $17 per hour, more with experience


About us: Since 1994, we've offered high-quality composite manufacturing, custom tooling, and prototyping services to various markets, including aerospace, transportation, wind energy, industrial, marine, automotive, and agriculture (to name a few).


We're a tight-knit team of hands-on tinkerers and out-of-the-box thinkers with a common goal: delivering timely, dynamic solutions. Our clients are global industry leaders who demand innovation, and we work hard to bring it.


What we’re looking for: A roll-up-your-sleeves and get-the-job-done-right kind of person. You know the ins and outs of what it takes and have a passion for continually learning to do it even better. You're capable of working with a diverse range of personalities and building productive working relationships with teammates. You can focus and work under pressure during tight deadlines with humor, tact, and professionalism. You enjoy the satisfaction of seeing a completed project and knowing that it was a job done well.


Never worked with composites before? It's similar to fiberglass! If you have experience in manufacturing of any kind, we still want to hear from you. We're looking for hard-working, honest people to join our team. We're willing to invest in training you if you're willing to take on new challenges with an open mind and a can-do attitude.


The Job: We encourage career development and actively promote from within. If you are looking for a role with tons of scope for progression, this could be it! As a Production Technician, you’ll be responsible for various activities involved in the manufacturing of composite parts and assemblies, including but not limited to:


- Material Prep/Kitting - Mold Prep - Composite Layup and Vacuum Bagging - Loading/Unloading of processing equipment - Hand Trim/Drill/Sanding - Paint/Bodywork prep


Minimum Skills: * Ability to complete necessary process documentation. * Ability to use simple measuring tools. * Ability and willingness to cross-train in any or all relevant skill areas.


Education: * High School Diploma or equivalent.


Physical Requirements * You must be capable of continuous standing and/or sitting when completing assigned tasks. * Physical movement includes bending, squatting, and reaching at or above shoulder level to retrieve supplies or move tooling and components. * Occasionally, your role may require you to lift up to 50 pounds. * Hand-eye coordination and finger dexterity are necessary to perform various repetitive process tasks. * We take safety protocols seriously. You must be able to wear and function while using protective safety gear as provided under company safety rules


The Extras We're a compassionate, family-friendly employer. We offer paid time off and medical and dental insurance. We also have an employee retirement plan with up to a 3% employer match. We offer reimbursement for approved training and educational opportunities to support your personal and career growth. Sprague is passionate about delivering the diverse products and programs that warm, power and move the world. We keep homes warm through Northeastern winters and hospitals cool through summer. From importing wind energy components to deploying leading-edge solar technology to help power terminal facilities, we are committed to continually evolving to meet our customers’ changing energy needs.
Our 
Crane Operator/Terminal Operator
 is primarily responsible for operating vessel cranes during bulk discharges and, secondarily, to assist in the maintenance and repair of the conveyor system. Work hours/shifts will vary as circumstances dictate and overtime is frequently available but not guaranteed. Work is primarily outdoors in a maritime environment 24 hours a day, 365 days per year. Some travel to other Sprague facilities will be required.
Your duties and responsibilities can include, but are not limited to any of the following: 
Operate bulk vessel cranes (12 hour shifts) for duration of discharge.
On completion of discharge will be responsible for clean-up/wash down of entire conveyor system.
Will be required to travel to other bulk terminals to operate bulk vessel cranes as needed.
When not otherwise employed will be responsible for assisting with conveyor maintenance and repairs.
Will also be trained in cement silo operations and responsible for operations if silos reactivated.
Possible operation of large construction equipment once trained(loader, bulldozer, skid steer, forklift)
Assist with mooring vessels
Assist with liquid cargo operations
Ability to work at heights in adherence with company policies
Participate in oil spill response drills
Welding skills helpful but not required
Possible operation of Oxy/Acetylene torch once trained
Available/Receptive to respond to afterhours maintenance issues
Other duties as required
Education / Experience / Skill Requirements: 
Prior crane operation experience a plus but not required
High school diploma or equivalent
Minimum of 2 years experience as a general laborer
Knowledge of basic math
Mechanical aptitude
Receptive to and available for training opportunities outside the workplace
Good computer skills
Valid driver’s license
Ability to obtain a TWIC
Good verbal and written communication skills
Physical activity/strength requirements are demanding and may include: 
Standing up to 75% of the day
Lifting up to 75 lbs. (i.e. steel parts, spouts)
Pulling up to 75 lb. capacity (i.e. mooring lines)
Extended climbing (i.e. tank ladders/stairs/ramps/conveyors)
Ability to work in an outdoor, maritime environment in a variety of shifts
Incumbent must possess the ability to work in a safe manner and maintain a constant state of alertness as the nature of work performed within our terminal operations create conditions where a momentary lack of concentration or alertness can lead to catastrophic results.

 Project Director - Wind

BHI Energy is seeking a highly motivated, detail oriented, well organized individual to assist the growth of BHI's Blade Services Division within our Wind group. This individual must have significant experience both with composite repair and utilization of access methods such as wire platforms, rope and/or ground based personnel lifts in Wind.

Responsible for technical direction of the Wind Energy Blade division to include program development, training/certification, procedure development and techniques/methods.

Job duties

The Blade Team Manager's primary function is to ensure that BHI Energy's Renewable business operates safely, smoothly and effectively in support of our client's needs. Other functions and responsibilities that can be expected from this position shall include but are not limited to:

Function as the Subject Matter Expert for BHI Energy with client in regards to operational and technical needs. Maintain continuous client contact and focus on relationship management.

Communicate with Site Supervisors and craft frequently to understand operational challenges and support requirements to ensure success of the contract within the assigned operational area.

Conduct periodic site visits to meet with BHI Energy personnel and site management.

Dedicated field support (training, work instructions, dispositions and customer support, equipment and tooling) to achieve high levels of quality and productivity

Ensure a strong commitment to safety as the number one core value.



Conducting periodic reviews of procedures, protocols and processes in an effort to identify improvement opportunities within the operation that will benefit BHI Energy and our client.

Provide strong leadership engagement with client and proactive posture regarding BHI performance.

Establish a strong relationship with customer contacts through demonstrating trust, integrity, and honesty in dealing with each client engagement.

Set positive standards and expectations with identified supervisors and within all BHI employees assigned.

Install a culture of continuous improvement and error free performance with all employees assigned.

Input for the operational budget focused on establishing cost savings and effectiveness Remain visible, available and approachable to BHI Energy employees supporting assigned operational area.

Support and foster a safety conscious work environment where all employees understand reporting options and opportunities for safety and work related concerns.

Review and understand all contracts established with client in support of assigned operational area. Ensure that site specific operations are in accordance with the contract and identified work scope.






Job Requirements:

7+ years' experience in Wind energy, blade manufacturing and/or blade field service and a minimum of 3 years in an operations role

Engineering Degree or Background preferred

Strong customer focus with product line experience

Demonstrated ability to influence others, collaborate effectively and drive change

Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain effective relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders

Capable to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment



Can effectively communicate (both verbally and in written form) with all levels of management, supervision and craft.

Knowledge of field deployment in support of periodic maintenance activities.

Capable of being the process owner utilizing continuous improvement and implementing best practices.

Effectively identifies key players and builds high performing teams.

Capable of effectively managing own time and time of other's.

Engages support from Labor Relations, HR, ECP, and Staffing when necessary.

Is able to identify talent in projects organization and develops that talent by making deliberate changes in assignments.

Able to influence others to improve project and contract outcomes and capable of providing input for a succession planning model that maintains a defense in depth for position evolutions.

Overview


Avangrid Renewables, a subsidiary of AVANGRID, Inc. (NYSE: AGR), is a leading developer, owner, and operator of renewable energy facilities in the United States with an eight-gigawatt portfolio of onshore wind and solar projects across 22 states. Avangrid Renewables’ offshore wind business is pioneering this new industry with a development pipeline of five gigawatts off the East Coast. Our offshore portfolio consists of our 50% ownership in the first-in-the-nation Vineyard Wind 1 project, which will deliver 800 MW of clean energy into Massachusetts starting in 2023. Additionally, Avangrid Renewables owns 100% of Park City Wind, an 804 MW project to serve the state of Connecticut and Commonwealth Wind, a project that will deliver up to 1200 MW to Massachusetts. Finally, Avangrid Renewables owns 100% of Kitty Hawk Offshore Wind that has the potential to deliver 2,500 MW of clean energy into Virginia and North Carolina. The company will also actively pursue additional lease areas in the Atlantic and Pacific Coasts and the Gulf of Mexico.

We aspire to be the employer of choice by providing purposeful and challenging work revolutionizing the renewable energy industry in the United States. This role will support the senior management team that is developing, constructing and operating large scale offshore wind projects which will provide affordable, clean energy and will have a transformational impact on local communities. Avangrid Renewables’ offshore business is located in Boston, Massachusetts.

Purpose


The Manager – OSW (Offshore Wind) WTG (Wind Turbine Generator) Engineering role is focused on assisting with the delivery of operational requirements in the US Offshore business. Working with Contractors and multiple departments within Offshore Operations and Commercial Services to ensure that Avangrid’s long term asset value and production revenue is maximized. The role will be focused on supporting the wind turbine equipment in Avangrid’s Offshore wind projects and will interface with the wind turbine OEMs and O&M service providers. This position is based in Boston, MA, on a Hybrid schedule.

Belonging to the Offshore Operations Team the Manager – OSW WTG Engineering will be responsible for defining and implementing robust and cost-effective engineering strategies for the operational requirements including management of contractors and associated interfaces, and ensuring quality, best practices and excellent H&SE performance are applied.

The Manager – OSW WTG Engineering will also be responsible for building and leading the WTG engineering team. This team will support the various projects in all matters related to WTG and will also liaise with the wider O&M Global teams for implementing lessons learned from Iberdrola’s group’s projects into the US projects and exchanging best practices.

The Manager – WTG Engineering is responsible for providing high quality and consistent service across offshore projects within Avangrid.

The individual will be working as part of a global business with activities in many countries across US, UK, and the rest of the world. The position may require travel to various locations.

Offshore industry is still relatively immature, and a key focus is on driving down cost. This role will play a large part in developing initiatives to reduce the cost of service during the operational phase.

Responsibilities


  • Delivery of robust and cost-effective engineering strategies for the operational requirements, providing engineering support, assistance and recommendations to ensure delivery within time, to budget and quality following industry best practice and observing the maximum respect for Health, Safety and the Environment to ensure regulatory and legal compliance’
  • Manage WTG engineering team, develop talent, and provide mentorship to junior engineers
  • Implement offshore standards, procedures, tools, best practices, and quality requirements.
  • Develop technical specifications for maintenance agreements.
  • Developing HSE strategies for operations and ensuring a high standard of health and safety awareness is maintained.
  • Provide advice on operational solutions / risk levels affecting technical integrity or asset performance to Principal Project Managers to ensure that cost effective solutions are identified, fully evaluated and the risk profile is fully understood.
  • Make technical recommendations to Project Managers based on the condition of the assets, production, and other KPIs.
  • Support the coordination of EPC interfaces and Project Services Engineering Team to ensure the operational requirements are identified, fully evaluated, and actioned during project execution.
  • Liaise with the other Global Offshore Business Hub Engineering teams ensuring lessons learned and best practices are capture and shared across the different Offshore Projects.
  • Deliver technical due diligence to the handover from construction and the transition through end of warranty of offshore wind assets.
  • Ensure that all assessment, advice, and recommendations are fully documented in accordance with all internal procedures and industry best practice, and that sufficient technical and commercial due diligence (whether internal or external) exists to support those business decisions.

Competencies

  • Be a role model
  • Be agile
  • Collaborate and Share
  • Develop Self & Others
  • Empower to grow
  • Focus to achieve results
  • Technical Skills

Skills and Requirements


  • Degree in engineering, math, physics, or other technical discipline
  • Postgraduate experience, preferable in operation of wind turbines
  • Some experience with offshore wind operations preferred.
  • Experience of renewables / power generation industry preferred.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Developed report writing and presentation skills and ability to summarize parameters and drivers impacting the scope of works.
  • Good organizational and operational skills with the ability to link this awareness to technical judgement and decision making.
  • Good planning and analysis skills with the ability to look forward and anticipate problems and thereafter plan and implement mitigating solutions to negate the effect of such problems.
  • Ability to support the management of a scope of works which require interface and coordination. Advice on the impact of technical/ specialist risks and issues and the viability of solutions recommended.
  • Experience and understanding of technical due diligence.
  • Problem solving – dealing with conflicting requirements
  • Tenacity, persistence, and determination to succeed in overcoming obstacles.
  • High capacity for change.
  • Experience of working in teams involved in large projects in international environments.
  • Pro-active and diligent approach.
  • Sound relationship management skills and confidence working with senior colleagues.
  • Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
  • Analyze technical/ specialist risks and issues and the viability of solutions recommended.
  • Computer literacy, with a good working knowledge of Microsoft Office components especially Excel and database packages, e.g., Microsoft Access, and programming languages as well as an ability to deal with new software.
  • Eligible to work in the US
  • Flexible to travel around the US and overseas
  • Ability to climb 100-meter steel towers on a regular basis to perform engineering inspections of wind turbines
  • Ability to occasionally lift items weighing up to 50 pounds.
  • Ability to complete GWO basic safety and sea survival training

 In addition to great coworkers, you’ll enjoy perks like medical benefits and retirement contributions that 
start on your first day
. Do you like to get involved where you work? Is giving back important to you? It’s important to us, too! 
Sprague donates back
 to the communities in which we live and work every year and provides opportunities for employees to support the charity of the week. Sprague has a range of committees to support varying initiatives (Sustainability, Charitable, Scholarship, Innovation, etc.). Sprague is a place that 
cares about
 
its employees, 
its
 community
, and about creating a place where people want to come to work every day.

 
 
 
 
 
 About the position:
 
 
 Our 
Crane Operator/Terminal Operator
 is primarily responsible for operating vessel cranes during bulk discharges and, secondarily, to assist in the maintenance and repair of the conveyor system. Work hours/shifts will vary as circumstances dictate and overtime is frequently available but not guaranteed. Work is primarily outdoors in a maritime environment 24 hours a day, 365 days per year. Some travel to other Sprague facilities will be required.
 
 
 Your duties and responsibilities can include, but are not limited to any of the following:
 
 
 
  
Operate bulk vessel cranes (12 hour shifts) for duration of discharge.
 
  
On completion of discharge will be responsible for clean-up/wash down of entire conveyor system.
 
  
Regular travel will be required to other bulk terminals to operate bulk vessel cranes as needed.
 
  
When not otherwise employed will be responsible for assisting with conveyor maintenance and repairs.
 
  
Ability to pass rigger / signalman course is necessary.
 
  
Will also be trained in cement silo truck loading operations and responsible for operations if silos reactivated.
 
  
Possible operation of large construction equipment once trained (loader, bulldozer, skid steer, forklift).
 
  
Assist with mooring vessels.
 
  
Assist with liquid cargo operations.
 
  
Ability to work at heights in adherence with company policies.
 
  
Participate in oil spill response drills.
 
  
Welding skills helpful but not required.
 
  
Possible operation of Oxy/Acetylene torch once trained.
 
  
Available/Receptive to respond to afterhours maintenance issues.
 
  
Other duties as required.
 
 
 
 
Education / Experience / Skill Requirements:
 
 
 
  
Prior crane operation experience a plus but not required
 
  
High school diploma or equivalent
 
  
Minimum of 2 years experience as a general laborer
 
  
Knowledge of basic math
 
  
Mechanical aptitude
 
  
Receptive to and available for training opportunities outside the workplace
 
  
Good computer skills
 
  
Valid driver’s license
 
  
Ability to obtain a TWIC
 
  
Good verbal and written communication skills
 
 
 
 
Physical activity/strength requirements are demanding and may include:
 
 
 
  
Standing up to 75% of the day
 
  
Lifting up to 75 lbs. (i.e. steel parts, spouts)
 
  
Pulling up to 75 lb. capacity (i.e. mooring lines)
 
  
Extended climbing (i.e. tank ladders/stairs/ramps/conveyors)
 
  
Ability to work in an outdoor, maritime environment in a variety of shifts
 
  
Applicant must possess the ability to work in a safe manner and maintain a constant state of alertness as the nature of work performed within our terminal operations create conditions where a momentary lack of concentration or alertness can lead to catastrophic results.

 

 
 
 
 
 
 We want to hear from you!
 
 
 Do you like to solve problems and consider yourself forward thinking? If you are looking for a place where you can learn a lot about the energy industry while constantly challenging yourself, then Sprague is your place. Sprague employees are dedicated and driven, and we constantly strive to be the best in the industry. We work best as a team, knowing that collaboration leads to innovation and the best customer experience. As a company that has continued to evolve with the energy industry for the last 150 years, we are looking for hardworking employees to join us as we remain at the forefront of the industry.
 
 
 Come join us to learn why we are consistently celebrating 20-, 30-, and even 40-year anniversaries here at Sprague! 

 
Sprague is an EEO/AA employer. We strongly encourage minorities, females, Vets and individuals with disabilities to apply.

Job Description Summary

Inspect, plan and repair wind turbine blades, fill in for Service Supervisor and ensure EHS compliance within the team.

Job Description

About us:

LM Wind Power, a GE Renewable Energy business is a world leading supplier of blades and service to the wind industry. The wind turbine industry is becoming increasingly complex, with radical progress made over the last few decades, providing great opportunities for professional development and a work environment that promotes initiative and creativity. If working in a company which creates state-of-the-art technology and processes attracts you, LM Wind Power has a career for you.

Why we come to work:

At GE Renewable Energy, our service teams keep our world moving. They’re adaptable, determined, and safety-focused, thriving in high-pressure situations. They’re the kind of people who dig deep for answers, work collaboratively with the right teams to drive

solutions, and who sit back and smile when they know they have done a great job. As part of this team, you’ll be rewarded with autonomy and trust, a collaborative, supportive team, and the chance to be empowered and successful, every single day

Role Summary/Purpose:

The Lead Service Technician role will complete field and workshop based work as required. The role provides on site technical direction, hands on service, and leadership during installation and maintenance of customer owned blades and components. The Lead Tech will also ensure EHS compliance within the team. The role will also fill in for the Service Supervisor on an as needed basis.

Essential Responsibilities:

Prepare job planning documents that define the scope of work to be performed through engineering instructions, drawings, and process instructions. Be responsible for ensuring the team is performing daily/weekly/monthly inspections on tools, equipment, and PPE.

Travel to job sites

Perform blade repairs according to the specified instructions.

Prepare applicable service documentation including details of repairs.

Perform inspections and communicate with LM Wind Power staff appropriately.

Communicate with customers regarding service work

Ensure site rules, regulations and procedures are being followed at all times.

Fill in for Service Supervisor when absent

Act as point of contact for EHS issues

Enter any information required in Gensuite and support incident follow up

Ensure inspections are completed

Arrange and execute quarterly drills

Maintain confined space documents

Plan and execute safety trainings to team

Identify, locate and adhere to the “LM Quality Policy”

Must wear the appropriate PPE and follow all health and safety instructions and dispose of chemicals appropriately.

Clean around work area throughout the day to maintain 5S.

Any other function as determined by the company

Qualifications/Requirements:

High School Diploma or GED required

Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience

Desired Characteristics:

Safety training

Previous manufacturing experience preferred

Previous composite materials experience preferred

Proven experience in leading field service team;

Strong communication and computer skills

Must be able to work at heights 250 feet above ground

Must be able to travel domestic and international for long periods of time

Must be able to climb and remain standing for extended periods of time

Must be able to work outside in a variety of weather conditions

Ability to work alone or as part of a team

Additional Information

GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

As a federal government contractor, GE may in the future be required to have U.S. employees fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Some GE customers currently have vaccination mandates that may apply to GE employees.

Requisition ID: 26371
Job Location(s): Van Wert, OH, US

Job Description

This position will involve the set-up, gauging, prove out programs, and operate machine tools to perform a series of progressive machining operations on repetitive work to exacting tolerances. Actively support and strive to meet the strategic goals set by yourself, the facility and Danfoss. This position is a 3rd Shift position at our Van Wert location.

Job Responsibilities

  • Must be able to learn, apply and retain new techniques, concepts and procedures required for continuously improving products, processes, services, deliveries and overall quality
  • Ability to read and understand blueprints, control plans, routers, job instructions and measurement tools
  • Must meet or exceed all quality standards set by the customers and individual Value Stream. Must also maintain the quality standards defined for the entire facility
  • Maintain flexibility to be able to move from work area to work area to meet the delivery expectations of the customers and the productivity goals for the plant. Able to work efficiently to establish standards without constant supervision
  • Always promotes cooperation and “team oriented” work environment under the direction of the leadership team
  • Creates/maintains a safe work environment and practices safety for himself and others at all times
  • Must maintain a clean and well-organized work environment and support our 5S program
  • Work from programming, operational data, setup instructions defining and coding tool arrangements, fixtures, and material clamping methods
  • Setup machine calibration and console settings for operations such as boring, milling, drilling, facing, threading, and occasional profiling and contouring
  • Operate Coordinate Measurement Machines (CMM) to verify part quality
  • Employee is responsible for maintaining oils, coolant levels and all filter changes on the machines
  • Ability to multitask as it includes: operating overhead cranes, large band saws, cutting and stenciling various sizes of bar stock and delivering stock to the individual machines

Background & Skills

Basic Qualifications:

  • Ability to work in a fast paced/demanding and rapidly growing Manufacturing work environment
  • Must be able to lift 50 pound cartons consistently

Preferred Qualifications:

  • High School Degree
  • Blueprint reading including Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerance (GD&T)
  • Basic math skills (measurement conversion, addition/subtraction, decimals/fractions)
  • Gauging concepts and techniques (calipers, high gages, micrometers, profiometer, roundness gauges, plug gages, air gages, dial depth gages, etc.)
  • At least 2 years’ experience operating manual, NC and/or CNC machine tools with experience in jobs setups requiring tooling and fixturing changes

Danfoss – Engineering Tomorrow

At Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways – driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees.


Following our founder’s mindset ‘action speaks louder than words’, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030.


Danfoss is an EO employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.


Danfoss engineers solutions that increase machine productivity, reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and enable electrification.

Our solutions are used in such areas as refrigeration, air conditioning, heating, power conversion, motor control, industrial machinery, automotive, marine, and off- and on-highway equipment. We also provide solutions for renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, as well as district-energy infrastructure for cities.

Our innovative engineering dates back to 1933. Danfoss is family-owned, employing more than 42.000 people, serving customers in more than 100 countries through a global footprint of 95 factories.

 Substantial years of experience in structural dynamics, numerical modeling, 3D finite element analysis, integrated load analyses, monopile design, steel jacket design, fatigue analysis, design of offshore structures, industry software, and program languages (e.g. STAAD.Pro, SAP, ROBOT, SACS, SESAM, BLADED, SQL, Matlab, Python)

Proven track record delivering large, complex, multidisciplinary projects and execution of works in an offshore environment

Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering with Structural Focus

   
Professional Engineering Registration

Leadership skills and the ability to identify suitable candidates to help grow our offshore wind practice.

About Vestas
 Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We specialize in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.
 Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than our competitors in the renewable energy arena. We consider ourselves forerunners within the industry, as Vestas continuously aims to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 145 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, Vestas has an unmatched history demonstrating our expertise within the field.
 With 29,000 employees globally, Vestas is a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.
 Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives, and gives everyone equal access to opportunity.
 To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.
 

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        

          Job Description
        

       

      

     

    

   

  

 

 

 

   Position Overview:
 

 

   As an Offshore Wind Turbine Generator (WTG) Manager, you will lead the technical efforts related to the wind turbine generators to be installed in multiple offshore wind projects. Such technical efforts will include evaluation of turbine supply offers, review of turbine supply contracts, coordinating WTG interfaces with foundation structures, assisting with WTG installation engineering, and coordinating commissioning activities for utility-scale offshore wind projects in Invenergy’s target markets throughout the world.
 

 

 

   Responsibilities:
 

 

  
 Technical & turbine technology
   

    
 Manage the technical efforts related to wind turbine generators across the organization for the offshore engineering team and offshore wind projects

    
 Work in collaboration with the Offshore Structural Manager, Offshore EYA & Siting Engineering Manager and Offshore Electrical Engineering Manager to optimize the layout for the wind turbines and inter-array cables

    
 Manage Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs), working in close collaboration with the procurement team, to manage the technical interface between OEMs and contractors

    
 Manage technical engineering consultants and contractors specialized in the installation of WTGs for offshore projects

    
 Maintain working knowledge of offshore wind turbine technology and affiliated technical and market trends

    
 Work with OEMs to optimize equipment selection for projects as it relates to power curves, operational modes, mechanical suitability considerations, and curtailment strategies

    
 Work with OEMs to identify, coordinate and improve control and logic architecture for the offshore wind farm

    
 Scale turbines model to for future project modeling (turbine dimensions, power curves, and foundation loads) plus benchmarking with consultants

    
 Work with OEMs on turbine site suitability and site-specific power curves

    
 Work with procurement team to determine best turbine options for each site

    
 Liaising with third party contractors to understand best construction methodologies and installation processes for the selected turbines

    
 Work with OEMs to understand operations and maintenance requirements during the O&M phase

    
 Collaborate in the design efforts for the inter-array and export cables designs for offshore wind farms, depending on the needs for the WTGs

    
 Prepare and supervise technical documentation for requisitions and solicitations to be used with OEMs, contractors and other third parties

    
 Liaise with OEMs, technologists, and manufacturers, to adapt designs according to the best industry practices and most recent design trends and products

    
 Coordinate loads and other required inputs from the OEMs to size foundations for WTGs and design the complete offshore wind farm

    
 Participate in the WTG sizing and layout optimization in collaboration with consultants and manufacturers

    
 Specify equipment and review/evaluate proposals in collaboration with consultants

    
 Provide WTG design inputs for offshore cables and substations

    
 Establish the required values and parameters for the WTG design to be collected during the offshore geophysical and geotechnical campaign in collaboration with the Offshore G&G Engineering Manager

    
 Participate in the preparation of WTG technical packages to be submitted as part of the permitting process

    
 Work and collaborate with the commercial and finance teams to provide necessary cost modeling inputs, and collaborate on cost optimization

    
 Coordinate design interface according to the recommendations provided by the certified verification agent (CVA)

    
 Coordinate work with other areas inside the organization as follows:

   

  
 Construction and installation
   

    
 Collaborate with OEMs and the procurement and logistics teams to define needs for transportation, as well as, marshalling and storage facilities

    
 Participate in the de-risk process to identify solutions for the installation of WTGs offshore

   

  
 Operations and maintenance
   

    
 Work on the list of spare parts and requirements in collaboration with the O&M team and OEMs

    
 Identify risks and potential issues for the WTGs during operations

    
 Participate in the identification of recycling options for blades and components

    
 Understand and coordinate improvements in the architecture and logic control system for a good WTG operation

   

  
 Engineering best practice
   

    
 Developing offshore wind engineering reference manual as it relates to evaluation of WTGs

    
 Attending relevant external training and workshops, supporting internal trainings and workshops, as required by the company

    
 Providing periodic reports to management as needed

   

 

 

 

   Required Skills:
 

 

  
 Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in an engineering or related technical discipline.

  
 10+ years of experience in the renewable energy industry.

  
 Proficient with Microsoft Office products including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

  
 Ability to multi-task and manage deliverables for multiple projects at a time

  
 Excellent verbal, writing, and interpersonal skills

  
 Demonstrated interest in offshore renewable energy

  
 Desire to work in a dynamic environment alongside people with multiple interests and backgrounds.

 

 

 

   Preferred Skills:
 

 

  
 5+ experience in offshore wind engineering

  
 Experience managing interfaces between contractors

  
 Be an effective leader and communicator - strong verbal skills are required

  
 International travels may be required.

 

 

 

  

   

    

     

      

       

        

          Benefits
        

       

      

     

    

   

  

 

 

 

   Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), bonus, paid time off, etc.
 

 

 

   Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.
 
 
Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

  
 
  
 
  
Your Impact:

  
 Here at Jacobs, we apply our expertise and knowledge as we look into the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference. If you want to join a company invested in you, your success and the global community - join us as our Offshore Wind Engineering Lead to help our communities achieve a net-zero future.
 
  
As a vital member of our team, you’ll be recognized as an industry leader and expert within Jacobs and spearhead our growing Offshore Wind practice. Primary focus will be on the US market, but you’ll be coordinating and working across multiple disciplines and regions to leverage Jacobs’ advisory, planning, permitting, and engineering expertise to strengthen our position in the offshore wind market. As the OSW Engineering Lead, you will help lead and build a multi-disciplinary team that can successfully deliver on the design and review of structures needed for offshore wind projects.
 
  
At Jacobs you’ll be instrumental in the growth and development of our Offshore Wind business strategy. You’ll contribute to our alternative energy wind projects/initiatives that have a significant impact upon our business. Your expertise in the design and construction of offshore structures will be critical in the delivery and positioning of Jacobs for upcoming offshore wind opportunities and programs.
 
  
Working together, we’ll help you grow and pursue what fulfills you so that we can make impacts on the future – big and small, global and local.
 
  
At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.
 
  
Here’s What You’ll Need:

  

   
 Substantial years of experience in structural dynamics, numerical modeling, 3D finite element analysis, integrated load analyses, monopile design, steel jacket design, fatigue analysis, design of offshore structures, industry software, and program languages (e.g. STAAD.Pro, SAP, ROBOT, SACS, SESAM, BLADED, SQL, Matlab, Python)

   
Strong knowledge of industry standards, offshore regulations, health & safety, and environmental legislation associated with offshore construction projects

   
Be highly experienced in interfacing with other discipline specialists (structural, geotechnical, coastal, electrical, mechanical, BIM, etc.) and familiar with offshore codes and standards (DNVGL, ISO, UFC, AISC, API, etc.)

   
Proven track record delivering large, complex, multidisciplinary projects and execution of works in an offshore environment

   
Familiarity with the US offshore wind industry, its players, and market outlook and relationships with offshore wind developers, contractors, suppliers, or utilities involved in the development of offshore wind projects in the US

   
Have an outgoing and customer-oriented attitude with the ability to build, and develop client relationships, and be a demonstrated and recognized Project Director and technical leader

   
Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering with Structural Focus

   
Professional Engineering Registration

  

  
 
  

   
 
   
Ideally, You’ll Also Have:

   
 
   

    
Advanced degree in structural or geotechnical engineering

    
Experience in the development of an offshore wind including program management functions (e.g. budget, schedule, procurement).

    
Familiarity and experience in the design of offshore floating structures

    
Leadership skills and the ability to identify suitable candidates to help grow our offshore wind practice.

    
SE Designation

International Wind
 is a maintenance and repair service provider for the burgeoning commercial wind power generation industry. We specialize in providing repairs primarily in the field at customer locations (Wind farms). Our field workers are trained and are required to maintain certification for climbing, working at heights, confined space entry and specialty processes such as composite repair for blades.
Due to exceptional growth and future opportunity, we are seeking a detail oriented, well organized, and highly motivated individual to assist with Wind Operations. This person will provide day-to-day operations support for projects and customers under his/her purview to include work scheduling, training, logistics and management of personnel to ensure safe, smooth, and effective support for our client’s needs.


*
Job duties*
The Operations Support Manager’s over-arching purpose is ensuring that the business operates safely and effectively in support of our client’s needs. Duties and obligations that support that objective include but are not limited to:



 
Ensure a strong commitment to safety

 
Establish safety as our first core value

 
Foster a safety conscious work environment where all employees understand reporting options and are empowered to improve our safety culture

 
Ensure everyone understands they have the power to stop work when circumstances lead to uncertainty





 
Establish a strong relationship with designated customer contacts by demonstrating transparency, integrity, and honesty in dealing with each assigned client

 
Function as the single point of contact maintaining continuous client contact to build and/or strengthen the relationship

 
Deliver strong and frequent leadership engagement with assigned clients to ensure we understand and can deliver on their needs

 
Present a proactive posture regarding our performance – except and react promptly





 
Install a culture of continuous improvement and set high standards and expectations for our field personnel

 
Conducting periodic reviews of procedures and processes to identify improvement opportunities within the operation of the business

 
Communicate with field personnel frequently to understand operational challenges and support requirements to help ensure successful execution of contracted work

 
Remain available and approachable to our field employees





 
Oversight of operational and contract budgets with focus on establishing savings while maintaining or improving effectiveness

 
Understand all contracts associated with assigned clients

 
Ensure that operational plans support execution of the contract and identified work scope

 
Diligently enforce best practices with respect to spend for items such as vehicles, travel, hotel, materials, and contracted services





 
Conduct periodic site visits to:

 
Reinforce safety culture

 
Improve customer relationship

 
Garner feedback from field employees and

 
Ensure field performance and behavior supports contract requirements and best practices with respect to safety, quality, and schedule




*
Job Requirements: *



 
5 years of relevant Wind experience with at least 1 in an operations role preferred

 
Field Service experience in support of periodic maintenance activities including logistics for mobilization and demobilization

 
Experience with recruiting and staffing highly desirable

 
Can quickly identify key resources and build high performing teams

 
capable of providing input for a succession planning model that maintains a defense in depth for position evolutions.





 
Effective communication – written and verbal – with both management and craft

 
Ensure transparent communication regarding status, planning and expected outcome

 
Influence others (internal and external) to improve project outcomes





 
Effectively manages his/her time and that of other’s

 
Experience and/or active certifications as a trainer for GWO and/or ENSA a plus

 
Desire a candidate with established ties to Wind Industry management. OEM and Wind Farm connections desired in both USA and Europe

 
Understanding of wind turbine blade production/engineering principles highly considered

 
Rope Access experience highly desired

 
Existing certification to provide training in support of certification to Global Wind Organization (GWO) standards
