doc_title: US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead
doc_description:
Local Unit & Position Description

Do you want to come help lead decarbonization and the advancement of Renewable Energy?

Are you excited about working with a diverse, collaborative team at the world s largest renewable energy consultancy? Do you have a passion for permitting renewable energy projects, and furthering your professional development in a company that truly puts people first?

At DNV our organizational culture and how we collectively influence the world for future generations matters deeply to us. Our team works every day to increase the widespread deployment and operation of renewables to address climate change and positively impact society; endeavors to achieve our purpose through the success of our customers; and strives to be high-performing and innovative. Our approach reflects the equity, respect, and diversity we wish to see in the world.

DNV s Environmental and Permitting Services (EPS) team is growing rapidly, and we are seeking a US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead to help us provide comprehensive permitting services in Midwest US and the rest of the United States (US). You will be responsible for overseeing a team and leading project development and environmental and permitting activities, including the preparation of local, state, and federal renewable energy permit applications, associated environmental and social impact studies, stakeholder engagement sessions, and land use and zoning permit applications for renewable energy projects located in the Midwest and, as well as other regions within and outside of the US. You will also be engaged in leading proposal efforts, business development for wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen facilities across the US, as well as assisting with project due diligence activities.

Our Customers can choose any number of consultancies to execute on specific tasks. However, our EPS team strives to develop long-term partnerships with our Customers, acting as their trusted advisor from the early site selection stage through to operations. Our Customers are at the forefront of the energy transition. Our team is nimble, highly experienced, and driven by our mission to ensure renewable energy projects are safely and sustainably sited, permitted, and operated.

Our team

The EPS team is comprised of siting, environmental, and permitting specialists who work directly with our Customers to help identify and address project risks for terrestrial wind, offshore wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen projects. Our mission is to guide the sustainable, responsible growth of the renewables industry by providing innovative environmental and permitting expertise to support the greater good.

To facilitate this work, excellent written and oral communication skills are paramount. Broadly, our work falls into four categories:

  • Biological services, including field surveys, habitat conservation plans, corporate avian and bat protection plans, review of mitigation strategies, and associated permitting.
  • Permitting services, providing support for permitting at the federal, state/provincial, and local level for wind, solar, battery storage and hydrogen projects; including stakeholder engagement.
  • GIS services, including mapping, constraints reviews, radiocommunication surveys, and critical issues analyses.
  • Siting services, including layout optimization, acoustical measurements, noise impact assessments, shadow flicker studies, blade/ice throw assessments, glint and glare studies, and visual impact studies.

This is a Remote position

What You ll Do

  • Oversee a team of project analysts, biologists, and engineers to deliver projects within allocated time and budget. Perform technical checking and initial approval of all work products completed by project team.
  • Lead the preparation and submission of permit applications, coordination of environmental fieldwork, authoring of environmental reporting documentation including critical issues analyses, technical permitting studies and management plans, Phase I ESAs, environmental impact assessments and technical project proposals and, agency consultation and stakeholder engagement programs.
  • Provide people leadership, coaching, and quality control for a team of approximately five.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with Midwest regulatory agencies (and/or other US regions).
  • Stay informed of applicable regulatory frameworks and participate in regulatory discussions and feedback discussions related to renewable energy developments in the US.
  • Actively seek out practical and realistic business development opportunities in the US. Prepare proposals and bids and engage in facilitating innovative and new service offerings to anticipate/meet market needs.

Position Qualifications

What is Required

  • Bachelor s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • At least 5 years of environmental and/or permitting experience in the US, preferably in the renewable energy industry
  • Advanced knowledge of environmental assessment regulatory frameworks as applied to renewable energy (wind, solar, or battery storage)
  • Experience engaging with and contacts within the federal and state regulatory agencies such as the USFWS, local communities, and Tribes or First Nations
  • Demonstrated skills in people leadership (academic and/or professional experience); and
  • Demonstrated skills in project management, agency consultation, environmental analysis, and business development, including experience building and maintaining relationships with a client base
  • Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
  • We conduct pre-employment drug and background screening

What is Preferred

  • Master s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • 8+ years of relevant experience preferred
  • Experience leading winning proposal efforts for Customers in the renewable energy industry;
  • Capable of travelling to projects in development, construction, and operation sites in varying locations (10%-20% annual time); and
  • Comprehensive understanding of the Midwest wind, solar, and battery storage markets (or other US regions)
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) or other technical accreditation such P.Eng., P.Geo, P.Biol., etc

*Immigration-related employment benefits, for example visa sponsorship, are not available for this position*What We Offer

  • Generous paid time off (vacation, sick days, company holidays, personal days)
  • Multiple Medical and Dental benefit plans to choose from, Vision benefits
  • Spending accounts FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, company-seeded HSA
  • Special programs Employee Assistance Program, ID theft protection, and accident and critical illness options for you and your family
  • Employer-paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace
  • 401(k) with company match
  • Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits
  • Tuition assistance
  • Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities
  • Advancement opportunities

**Benefits may vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionHow We Do ItWe Care, We Dare, We Share

DNV is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially.

DNV is proud to announce being named one of Houston s best places to work in the 2022 Houston Business Journal Best Places to Work competition.

For more information

https://www.eeoc.gov/know-your-rights-workplace-discrimination-illegal-poster

Read more here

Diversity at DNV

Meet our Employees

About DNV

Careers in DNV

Please visit our website at www.dnv.com

As required by the various Pay Transparency laws, DNV provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado, California, Washington, or New York. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the states of Colorado, California, Washington, and New York only, the range of starting pay for this role is $100,000 - $145,000

Company & Business Area Description

DNV is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions.

We provide assurance to the entire energy value chain through our advisory, monitoring, verification, and certification services. As the world's leading resource of independent energy experts and technical advisors, we help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry. We are committed to realizing the goals of the Paris Agreement, and support all stakeholders to transition faster to a deeply decarbonized energy system.

DE1JP00002959 Commissioning Manager

Location: Richmond, VA

Start: ASAP

Duration: One year

Pay: Hourly, non-exempt

Per diem, if eligible: $145/day, seven days per week

MOB/DEMOB, if eligible: $500 max each way

This position is for a Commissioning Manager to represent Dominion Energy for the Coastal VA Offshore Wind project. The CVOW project entails the construction and installation of 176 wind turbine generators (WTG) and 3 offshore sub stations (OSS); as well as, associated cables and equipment.

The Commissioning Manager will report to the Director Construction Projects – Offshore Wind. The Commissioning Manager is responsible for organization, planning, and implementation of the Offshore Sub Station commissioning plan, and Wind Turbine Generator commissioning plan as required by the OEM, installation or fabrication contractor, and interconnect agreement. Close day to day interaction with the site construction team and the Construction Manager will be required to ensure all equipment is commissioned and delivered as required in a timely manner. The candidate will be required to work with the commissioning managers and teams of various prime Contractors to aid in the development of a commissioning strategy that will meet the Owner’s requirements. This person will use the contracted scope and technical specifications to ensure that the OSS and WTG’s are constructed, tested, and delivered with all required documents and certificates needed for service.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Review, comment, and assist in the development of commissioning plan/specifications for Offshore Sub Station and Wind Turbine Generator installation (including foundation and transition pieces).
  • Monitor and report of status of commissioning activities.
  • Confirm mechanical and electrical as built documentation is current and in compliance.
  • Liaise with Operations and Marine Coordinators regarding work plans and requirements of main component and installation contractors.
  • Provide advice and recommendations to ensure the continuing development of construction, commissioning and operations philosophies, strategies, and procedures.
  • Verify that all turnover documentation for testing, commissioning, and maintenance are provided per the Contract.
  • Liaise with BSEE (Bureau of Safety & Environmental Enforcement) in meeting requirements for Commissioning oversight.
  • Ensure that tests are carried out and commissioning work documented according to rules, procedures, and templates.
  • Review and monitor progress of commissioning. Provide accurate reporting in daily progress reports.
  • Act as the technical consultant for queries related to commissioning of all systems and equipment of the Offshore Wind project.
  • Provide support to the project team and assist in resolving technical, commissioning and warranty issues.
  • Attend FAT’s as required (may involve international or domestic travel); Including but not limited to components and equipment for the OSS, Foundations, Transition Pieces, Wind Turbine Generators
  • Ensure that all commissioning activities are fully documented, and that this documentation is properly controlled and made available to the Operations Group.
  • Manage closeout of any punch list items that arise during commissioning
  • Manage warranty issues, in conjunction with Operations Manager.
  • Conduct critical reviews and/or assessments of construction and commissioning systems and processes.
  • Prepare weekly and/or daily commissioning status reports.
  • Coordinate commissioning walk-downs together with the supplier.
  • Report in NCs, follow up on closure of relevant quality issues.
  • Participate in review, preparation, and coordination of detailed commissioning schedules.
  • Verify that tests are carried out and documented.
  • Review of tests to ensure compliance with commissioning manual / Contract.
  • Ensure readiness of take-over documentation and quality status for Operations team.
  • Participate in verifying that HSE procedures are implemented.
  • Co-ordinate handover from manufacturing and to installation.

High Level Project Overview:

Coastal VA Offshore Wind (CVOW) Dominion Energy is Engineering/Procuring/Constructing/Installing 176 Siemens Gamesa offshore wind turbines off the coast of VA, including offshore sub stations, cables, foundations and transition pieces. The project will create a nominal 2.6 GW of wind power. Each turbine is capable a producing 14MW.

  • Main Contractors
  • DEME Group w/Prysmian are responsible for transport and installation of Foundations, Transition Pieces, OSS, cable. Prysmian is manufacturing and installing cable (Offshore Export and Inter-array).
  • Siemens Gamesa with provide and install the WTG (Wind Turbine Generators) including Tower, Nacelle, Blades.
  • Bladt w/ Semco is designing and fabricating the Offshore Substations
  • Bladt is fabricating the Transition Pieces
  • EEW is fabricating the Monopile foundations

Required Experience:

  • 10 plus years’ experience in design/construction/commissioning.
  • Experience in offshore wind construction or industrial environment
  • Good knowledge of marine, mechanical, electrical, and controls system. Familiar with marine safety systems.

Preferred Experience:

  • GWO training
  • Offshore / Maritime experience

Education:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in marine engineering or other engineering discipline. Will also consider equivalent work experience.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $187,200.00 per year

Experience level:

  • 10 years

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Richmond, VA: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

  • design/construction/commissioning: 10 years (Required)
  • Offshore wind construction or industrial environment: 5 years (Required)
  • marine, mechanical, electrical and controls systems: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

doc_description:
Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.
 
 
Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

  
 
  
 
  
Your Impact:

  
 Here at Jacobs, we apply our expertise and knowledge as we look into the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference. If you want to join a company invested in you, your success and the global community - join us as our Offshore Wind Engineering Lead to help our communities achieve a net-zero future.
 
  
As a vital member of our team, you’ll be recognized as an industry leader and expert within Jacobs and spearhead our growing Offshore Wind practice. Primary focus will be on the US market, but you’ll be coordinating and working across multiple disciplines and regions to leverage Jacobs’ advisory, planning, permitting, and engineering expertise to strengthen our position in the offshore wind market. As the OSW Engineering Lead, you will help lead and build a multi-disciplinary team that can successfully deliver on the design and review of structures needed for offshore wind projects.
 
  
At Jacobs you’ll be instrumental in the growth and development of our Offshore Wind business strategy. You’ll contribute to our alternative energy wind projects/initiatives that have a significant impact upon our business. Your expertise in the design and construction of offshore structures will be critical in the delivery and positioning of Jacobs for upcoming offshore wind opportunities and programs.
 
  
Working together, we’ll help you grow and pursue what fulfills you so that we can make impacts on the future – big and small, global and local.
 
  
At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.
 
  
Here’s What You’ll Need:

  

   
 Substantial years of experience in structural dynamics, numerical modeling, 3D finite element analysis, integrated load analyses, monopile design, steel jacket design, fatigue analysis, design of offshore structures, industry software, and program languages (e.g. STAAD.Pro, SAP, ROBOT, SACS, SESAM, BLADED, SQL, Matlab, Python)

   
Strong knowledge of industry standards, offshore regulations, health & safety, and environmental legislation associated with offshore construction projects

   
Be highly experienced in interfacing with other discipline specialists (structural, geotechnical, coastal, electrical, mechanical, BIM, etc.) and familiar with offshore codes and standards (DNVGL, ISO, UFC, AISC, API, etc.)

   
Proven track record delivering large, complex, multidisciplinary projects and execution of works in an offshore environment

   
Familiarity with the US offshore wind industry, its players, and market outlook and relationships with offshore wind developers, contractors, suppliers, or utilities involved in the development of offshore wind projects in the US

   
Have an outgoing and customer-oriented attitude with the ability to build, and develop client relationships, and be a demonstrated and recognized Project Director and technical leader

   
Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering with Structural Focus

   
Professional Engineering Registration

  

  
 
  

   
 
   
Ideally, You’ll Also Have:

   
 
   

    
Advanced degree in structural or geotechnical engineering

    
Experience in the development of an offshore wind including program management functions (e.g. budget, schedule, procurement).

    
Familiarity and experience in the design of offshore floating structures

    
Leadership skills and the ability to identify suitable candidates to help grow our offshore wind practice.

    
SE Designation

   

  
 
  
Your most impactful mission in this role is to embrace living inclusion every day and enabling diversity and equality globally. For us, this means creating a culture of belonging where we all thrive by embracing all perspectives. An inclusive culture with many perspectives through diverse backgrounds allows us to leverage knowledge, leadership and connection to bring forth opportunity, creativity and growth.
 Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.
  
 At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Job Description Summary

This role is to be the leader of 2 mechanical testing and validation facilities in the Greenville, SC area for wind turbine components. In this role you will be responsible for the test planning, procurement of parts and execution. Activities are linked to technical improvement of existing products and components or validation of new products and components. There is moderate autonomy within the role. High levels of operational judgment are expected, to achieve outcomes required.

Job Description

About us:
GE’s Onshore Wind business has a total installed base of more than 50,000 wind turbines in more than 35 counties, with 100+ GW of global installed capacity. We harness increased onshore wind energy potential through a broad family of turbines that are uniquely suited for a variety of wind environments, including Cypress, GE’s most powerful onshore wind turbine, and GE’s 2MW platform, which has more than 20GW installed and in operation today. We are committed to our customers’ success in wind, offering a broad portfolio of products and services that make renewables the energy of choice for a cleaner future.

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Manages a team responsible for day to day execution of testing. Responsible for execution of laboratory validation testing, inspection and data acquisition for use in the design and validation of products and services.
  • Responsible for design, construction and maintenance of test facilities, instrumentation systems and the development of test software
  • May lead functional teams or projects with minimal resource requirements, risk, and/or complexity. Communicates difficult concepts and may influence others' options on particular topics. May guide others to consider a different point of view.
  • Responsibility covers mechanical labs and procurement of additional testing services from independent third party labs or other Business partners, when needed.
  • Equipment tested typically covers, but is not limited to; Pitch Bearings, Gearbox/Drivetrain, blade component testing or rotor subsystem, structural testing, bolted joint testing, pitch drive and control, yaw systems and lastly Product Controls software testing
  • Strong collaboration with Chief's Office, Senior Engineering Segment leaders in development of testing methods that simulate anticipated operating conditions. Consideration of pre-test analytical results and incorporation of operational turbines lessons learned are required.
  • Work across Engineering and Quality functions, relating test investment to eventual product quality improvement results for operational turbines.
  • Interprets simple internal and external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes or services. Stays informed of industry trends that may inform work.
  • Uses high level of judgment to make decisions and handle complex tasks or problems in areas of operational, product management, manufacturing, technology or engineering. Has ability to assess quality of information given and ask pertinent questions to stakeholders. Able to offer new solutions to problems outside of set parameters and is able to construct and provide recommendations. Uses multiple internal and some external sources outside of own function to help arrive at a decision.
  • Work to continuously monitor and develop Safe site working practices with evolving test equipment and practices. Safety first mindset is critical. A critical job performance indicator will be assessment of successful team Safety mindset development, continuous process/practices improvement and overall results delivered to EHS metrics.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Minimum of 7 years of work experience in testing and validation.

Desired Characteristics:

  • Experience leading day to day activities in a testing or manufacturing environment.
  • Previous managerial experience
  • Wind Turbine specific design or operational experience
  • Experience with testing data systems and architectures
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems
  • Demonstrated ability to lead programs / projects
  • Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs
  • Established project management skills

This role is restricted to U.S. persons (i.e., U.S. citizens, permanent residents, and other protected individuals under the Immigration and Naturalization Act, 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3)) due to access to export-controlled technology. GE will require proof of status prior to employment.

Additional Information

GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

About SkySpecs
 
 
SkySpecs envisions a world where wind energy is the most affordable form of electricity and therefore ubiquitous around the world. SkySpecs is helping to make this possible by automating the operations and maintenance of wind farms using advanced robotics paired with our custom-built asset performance management software, Horizon. SkySpecs launched the world's first completely autonomous blade inspection product in 2016 with a custom designed drone system. Since then, SkySpecs has inspected over 50,000 wind turbines in over 25+ countries, becoming the world leader in understanding the health of turbine blades. Identifying issues with turbine blades is only the first step.
 
 
In 2019 SkySpecs launched Horizon to be a platform for SkySpecs to offer a multilayered solution for customers that includes: data collection, wind turbine blade engineering expertise, and a place for all stakeholders to collaborate to manage and analyze massive amounts of data, spot trends, and create plans for high-cost repair campaigns. Ultimately, this will help reduce the cost and risk of operations for the industry.
 
 
What will I be getting myself into?

 
 
 
SkySpecs will probably be unlike any place you've ever worked. You will find a high energy environment filled with incredibly smart people solving hard problems. SkySpecs values collaboration, multidisciplinary problem solving, and a mantra of ‘under-promise, over-deliver'. SkySpecs is at a critical growth period where there are an endless number of opportunities to make an impact.
 
 
As a Manufacturing Manager, you will:
 
 

  
Management of global manufacturing team members; roles and responsibilities, organizational development, performance management

  
 Implement effective communication to ensure a collaborative work environment

  
 Implement lean process controls to evaluate and improve quality and training

  
 Lead, develop and coordinate with cross-functional teams in the execution of manufacturing and engineering projects

  
 Setting KPIs and key metrics for the manufacturing team

  
 Maintaining department budget

  
 Inventory Management and cost control for manufactured products

  
 Part procurement

  
 Global facility oversight

  
 Collaboration with Head of Global Property for facility needs or build out

  
 Oversight of all Health, Safety and Environmental protocols and compliance in all global facilities, under the direction of SkySpecs' HSE Manager

  
 Global equipment allocation in coordination with Resource Management

  
 Support Applied Technology in pilot training and pilot feedback loop to improve technical training, field support and equipment maintenance

 

 
 Requirements of the job:
 
 

  
Bachelor's Degree in Manufacturing, Business Management or related field

  
 3-5 years experience in manufacturing management

  
 Excellent analytical, organizational, planning and communication skills; high attention to detail; consistent follow through; a stellar team player.

  
 Ability to travel up to 20% - domestic and international

  
 A valid driver's license and passport

 
 
 
Bonus points for:
 
 

  
experience in UAS or aviation industries

  
 Lean manufacturing certification

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.
 
 
Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

  
 
  
 
  
Your Impact:

  
 Here at Jacobs, we apply our expertise and knowledge as we look into the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference. If you want to join a company invested in you, your success and the global community - join us as our Offshore Wind Engineering Lead to help our communities achieve a net-zero future.
 
  
As a vital member of our team, you’ll be recognized as an industry leader and expert within Jacobs and spearhead our growing Offshore Wind practice. Primary focus will be on the US market, but you’ll be coordinating and working across multiple disciplines and regions to leverage Jacobs’ advisory, planning, permitting, and engineering expertise to strengthen our position in the offshore wind market. As the OSW Engineering Lead, you will help lead and build a multi-disciplinary team that can successfully deliver on the design and review of structures needed for offshore wind projects.
 
  
At Jacobs you’ll be instrumental in the growth and development of our Offshore Wind business strategy. You’ll contribute to our alternative energy wind projects/initiatives that have a significant impact upon our business. Your expertise in the design and construction of offshore structures will be critical in the delivery and positioning of Jacobs for upcoming offshore wind opportunities and programs.
 
  
Working together, we’ll help you grow and pursue what fulfills you so that we can make impacts on the future – big and small, global and local.
 
  
At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.
 
  
Here’s What You’ll Need:

  

   
 Substantial years of experience in structural dynamics, numerical modeling, 3D finite element analysis, integrated load analyses, monopile design, steel jacket design, fatigue analysis, design of offshore structures, industry software, and program languages (e.g. STAAD.Pro, SAP, ROBOT, SACS, SESAM, BLADED, SQL, Matlab, Python)

   
Strong knowledge of industry standards, offshore regulations, health & safety, and environmental legislation associated with offshore construction projects

   
Be highly experienced in interfacing with other discipline specialists (structural, geotechnical, coastal, electrical, mechanical, BIM, etc.) and familiar with offshore codes and standards (DNVGL, ISO, UFC, AISC, API, etc.)

   
Proven track record delivering large, complex, multidisciplinary projects and execution of works in an offshore environment

   
Familiarity with the US offshore wind industry, its players, and market outlook and relationships with offshore wind developers, contractors, suppliers, or utilities involved in the development of offshore wind projects in the US

   
Have an outgoing and customer-oriented attitude with the ability to build, and develop client relationships, and be a demonstrated and recognized Project Director and technical leader

   
Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering with Structural Focus

   
Professional Engineering Registration

  

  
 
  

   
 
   
Ideally, You’ll Also Have:

   
 
   

    
Advanced degree in structural or geotechnical engineering

    
Experience in the development of an offshore wind including program management functions (e.g. budget, schedule, procurement).

    
Familiarity and experience in the design of offshore floating structures

    
Leadership skills and the ability to identify suitable candidates to help grow our offshore wind practice.

    
SE Designation

   

  
 
  
Your most impactful mission in this role is to embrace living inclusion every day and enabling diversity and equality globally. For us, this means creating a culture of belonging where we all thrive by embracing all perspectives. An inclusive culture with many perspectives through diverse backgrounds allows us to leverage knowledge, leadership and connection to bring forth opportunity, creativity and growth.
 Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.
  
 At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Description:

Keystone Engineering Inc. is a multi-disciplinary engineering company in the energy sector that is looking to expand its team even more. Keystone has been in the offshore business for over 30 years and more than half of that time has been involved in the Offshore Wind industry. We have provided engineering support and feasibility studies for offshore wind projects globally. Keystone was the foundation designer for Block Island Windfarm and provided fabrication support, loadout design, transportation analysis of blades, on-site engineering, and construction support for the project as well. Keystone s past and current project portfolio cover a wide range of foundation types (monopile, tripods, IBGS, suction buckets, GBS) and offshore substations.

Keystone Engineering is currently seeking an ambitious Technical Project Manager to join our Renewable Energies team. You will get to work on a wide variety of renewable energy projects from offshore wind to bio-fuel and carbon capture.

Position Type: Full-time

Location: Remote

Work Environment/Physical Demands: Office/Sedentary

Travel Requirements: Occasional site visits required.

Responsibilities:

  • The Technical Project Manager provides leadership to the offshore wind team.
  • Ensures project meets industry engineering standards and safety regulations.
  • Utilizes background in offshore/onshore wind energy in day-to-day projects.
  • Coordinate with clients and third parties regarding project scope, status, and technical interface issues.
  • Visit client sites to evaluate the site, project requirements, and conditions.
  • Provide concise, factual project solutions, allowing effective construction/installation.
  • Work effectively within established budgets and deadlines.
  • Identify various issues within projects, lead the development of solutions, and ensure solutions are implemented.
  • Prepare and reviews technical reports, models and drawings.
  • Understand project performance metrics and follow projects through completion.
  • Main point of contact for our clients and responsible for the preparation of our deliverables within the expected timeline, budget, and quality.

Requirements:

  • M.S. or Ph.D. in Engineering from an ABET-accredited program.
  • 5-10+ years experience in Energy and Offshore/Onshore Wind.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Self-motivated, organized, and solution advocate.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. for any employer.

Experience Preferred:

  • P.E. License and NCEES records holder.
  • Technical side background with some client-facing experience.

About TPI 

 
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. 
 TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability. 

 
About the Role 

 
We are looking for an experienced, highly organized technical manager to lead production and development operations in our quickly growing, high-volume automotive composites manufacturing press hall area. The manager will be responsible for the technical oversight of all critical process equipment and the launching of new equipment. The electro-mechanical systems include programable fiber cutting systems, hydraulic presses, resin injection systems, robotic pick-n-place, CNC cutting and machining systems, and ancillary support equipment. The manager will develop capacity plans, build and manage department schedules, assess and manage resource needs. 

 
The manager will be responsible for managing their department and working with support operations to ensure EH&S standards, materials, labor, planning, maintenance, and quality support needs for operations are being met to satisfy customer and business expectations while ensuring compliance to our IATF / ISO certified QMS. 

 
If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role. 

 
To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee several operations at a time with excellent time management and interpersonal skills. 

 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities 

 

  
Assume ownership of press hall production process including meeting production deadlines and quality specifications. 

  
Troubleshoot and solve challenging integrated equipment systems, support equipment, tooling design, and processing problems. 

  
Lead the development, implementation, and sustaining of a robust TPM system to drive significant OEE sustained improvements with goal to meet >/= 85% 

  
Improve shop organization and production workflow utilizing 5S and lean initiatives. 

  
Ensure all needed and developed safeguards are in place and maintained in areas where autonomous operations are performed by equipment and robotic systems. 

  
Estimate labor resources and capacity requirements for product build schedule. 

  
Maintain daily Gemba meetings are supported and effective in driving communication and continual improvement 

  
Provide updates to senior management on status of operations. 

  
Provide day-to-day direction for subordinate team members. 

  
Provide leadership to maintain an engaged and motivated work force. 

 

 
Who we’re looking for: 

 

  
Four-year degree in technical field such as mechanical or industrial engineering, plus 5 years of experience in machine building/design; 5 years of production experience in automation; 3 years of management experience in production environments; or equivalent combination of education and experience. 

  
Experience leading lean initiatives including TPM, SMED, 5S, and Kaizen events 

  
Experience in automotive manufacturing environment with ISO and IATF standards certification. 

  
Experience in leading RCCA projects, FMEA’s, Control Plans, and Flow Plans 

  
Very strong computer skills, particularly with the MS Office suite. 

  
Knowledge of safety standards for a manufacturing environment. 

  
Substantial knowledge of manufacturing and assembly processes such as machining, grinding, CNC, hand assembly, fasteners, etc. 

 

 
Extra Skills & Abilities 

 

  
SolidWorks or comparable CAD experience. 

  
Experience with project management methods, practices and tools including scoping, facilitations, delegation, and risk management best practices. 

  
A strong machine maintenance background. 

  
Experience with the application of motion components and electric actuators. 

  
Experience with automation or manufacturing related equipment. 

  
Experience working within cross-functional teams to handle multiple priorities and meet scheduled milestones. 

  
Ability to accurately estimate the level of effort required to complete a project build on time and within budget. 

  
Desire and capability to coach and mentor direct reports and other project partners. 

  
Demonstrated ability to create drawing packages, electronic bills of materials and engineering change orders. 

 

 
Location 
 This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island.

 Primary Responsibilities:

 Acts as technical consultant to ensure market segment programs, organizational marketing, field marketing and sales activities coincide.

 Develops quotes or bids for customized or non-standard products or services.

Position Requirements:

  

   
 Bachelor’s Degree in Composites Engineering or related major required.

   
 Minimum of 2 years in Advanced Composites Manufacturing and 2 years of experience with Closed Mold Manufacturing or related required.

   
 Proven track record of sales success and/or technical skills preferred for this position.

Graco manufactures and markets premium equipment to move, measure, control, dispense and spray a wide variety of fluid and powder materials. What does that mean? Well, we pump peanut butter into your jar, and the oil in your car. We glue the soles of your shoes, the glass in your windows and the screen on your phone. We spray the finish on your vehicle, coatings on your pills, the paint on your house and texture on your walls. Graco is part of your daily life.

Graco has excellent opportunities available to individuals who want to be part of fast-moving, growing company – especially candidates committed to quality, innovation and solving customer problems. Graco was proud to be named a Best Place to Work in Manufacturing and Production by Fortune Magazine in 2016, 2018, 2019 and 2021.

Job Purpose

In this role, you will work closely with product owners, design engineering and technical support to test, implement and deploy solutions to expand and maintain our product framework. Duties range from leading and contributing on product development efforts to diagnosing and troubleshooting escalated technical issues.

Graco is a global leader in the design, development and manufacture of highly-engineered systems for numerous industrial and commercial applications. This position supports our Lubrication Equipment Division (LED) in Anoka, MN. At LED, Industrial Lubrication products are used in wind energy, general manufacturing and steel and mining industries ( http://bit.ly/1jTCVMI ). Petroleum Management products control fluids traditionally used for servicing vehicles, including pumps, tanks, hose reels, and meters ( http:// bit.ly/ 1krX8Tf ).

Essential Duties

Perform software engineering tasks in the development of new products:

Participate in development of Product Specification

Produce conceptual designs

Guide development process to produce practical designs

Create software code

Assist with system tests per plan to produce defect-free software

Provide analysis of design to applicable standards

Review instruction manuals and product literature

Define and lead prototype development and lab and field tests

Work with manufacturing on process development

Conduct design reviews, safety reviews

Leader of small new product development projects as required.

Complete project feasibility and Pre-Prod authorizations

Create and maintain project schedules

Manage project to meet schedules, including:

Working with other team members to ensure satisfactory completion of all steps in development process

Identification and communication of threats to schedule to appropriate management

Work effectively in a team environment

Participate in release-for-sale activities

Provide periodic oral and written reports of project status

Participate in identification of new product opportunities for Graco by:

Recognizing customer product needs

Evaluating Graco and competitive products

Proposing and developing proper technology to fulfill customer needs

Direct and perform standard product support activities such as:

Troubleshooting product problems in manufacturing, lab or customer sites

Initiating corrective action activities

Learn, participate in development, and apply knowledge of:

Developments in technical field by staying abreast of developments to maintain technical knowledge

Graco product line

Operational systems

Graco and industry design standards

Graco Quality Management System

Graco customer applications and requirements

Emerging trends in our customers' markets

Other duties as assigned

Position Requirements

Education:

BS in Computer Science or related field

Experience:

Minimum of 2 years work related experience

Technical Skills:

Ability to implement, test and troubleshoot software updates

Java, Python, C# programming language expertise

Proven ability to produce executable code per design and quality standards

Prior hands-on experience with SQL, Linux OS, Spring and RESTful APIs a plus

Ability to research, diagnose and respond to escalated customer issues

Customer Support Skills:

Ability to learn new technologies quickly and discuss concepts with less technical customers and colleagues

Ability to solve challenging problems by combining input from multiple sources and forming your own solution

Excellent communication (oral and written) skills

Experience providing technical support to external customers and representing the company

Ability and willingness to travel to support customers, if needed

Proven Quality. Leading Technology. Launch your career with Graco!

Graco offers attractive compensation, benefits and career development opportunities. Graco’s comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, stock purchase plan, 401(k), tuition reimbursement and more.

Our expectations are high. That's why we are always looking to hire the brightest and the best!

doc_title: Technical Customer Manager – Fixed Structures, Renewables and Ocean Structures (Americas)
doc_description:
Local Unit & Position Description: 
 

   Product Line Renewables & Ocean Structures builds and distributes engineering software. Our mission is to “empower the world’s professionals to accelerate the energy transition, and sustainable use of the ocean”, and we aim “to be the most trusted engineering and digitalization partner, bringing value through our customer experience focus”. Our portfolio of software products includes a combination of successful industry favorites like Sesam, Bladed, and Nauticus Machinery, and new products aiming for hypergrowth WindFarmer and SolarFarmer.
 

 

  
 Our Product Line is part of the DNV – Digital Solutions business area, built up of functional teams across a collaborative organization structure. The Renewables & Ocean Structures product line includes a product Centre where software is developed, a product management team, sales regions and a marketing and communications team. 
  
 This technically focused Sales support role will report to the Head of Regional Sales, as part of the regional commercial team.
 

 

  
 The 
  
Technical Customer Manager
 will work with both Account Managers and the Business Development team, being a highly visible client facing position, taking the technical lead, from early-stage client interaction, contract closing and through to the onboarding process, with the main focus being on the highly active Americas offshore wind sector.
  
 An engineering background will be essential for this role; however, a natural commercial aptitude will also be required to ensure the value is always at the forefront of client engagement.
 

 

 

  
 A natural outgoing personally and ability to engage clients at all levels of their organization is essential, along with the willingness to travel to be sat with the client.
 

 

  
 This role will be supported technically by the Product Line and Product Center. These knowledge centers are located globally, so ability to build these remote relationships will be essential to the success of this position. 
  
 This role can be equally as suited to a graduate with a few years of experience who is looking to accelerated professionally develop, as someone with an extensive career history – the balance of technical and commercial mindset are the key traits for this position.
  
 
  
 
  
What You’ll Do

 

 

  
 Work hand in hand with the commercial team, supporting the Account Management and Business Development, taking the technical lead in client discussions, also leading product demonstrations and workshops

  
 Be the technical go to person within the American market for fixed structures, interacting with the global Product Center / Product Line for second line technical support

  
 Be customer facing and be energized by this

  
 Have / gain the high-level technical knowledge for the fixed structures products within the Renewable and Ocean

  
 Structure portfolio and the associated domain background

  
 Have a commercial mindset, ensuring the technical value proposition is demonstrated at all times.

  
 Lead customer technical meeting, either independently or as joint meetings with commercial colleagues.

  
 Attend conferences, presenting technical papers / sit on technical panels

  
 Work closely with Product Marketing to provide regional market feedback, being the voice of the customer and providing constructive input into the product roadmaps

  
 Support our Customer Advisory Board and be the regional conduit

 
 Position Qualifications: 
 

  
 What is required

 

 

  
 5+ years of Industry experience in pre-sales management (or similar customer facing technical position)

  
 Bachelors Degree in Engineering related field

  
 Working as part of an integrated sales team

  
 Proactively build and maintain strong relationships, both externally and internally

  
 Have worked in a multi-cultural technical and commercial environment

  
 Courage to make qualified independent decisions and move forward

  
 Solution oriented and highly proactive

  
 Collaborative, both within immediate team and the wider business

  
 Excellent communication skills and ability to inspire people, developing strong relationships

  
 Ability to travel to where the customer is – primarily east and west coast US, occasionally LATAM

  
 Strong written and verbal English communication skills

  
 Pre-employment drug and background screening

 

 

  
 What is perferred

 

 

  
 Experience and domain knowledge of the renewables and/or offshore energy industries within the Americas market

  
 A working knowledge of DNV Renewable and Ocean Structures software portfolio (or competitor products) would be a distinct advantage

  
 A professional network within the offshore and / or wind sector

  
 Portuguese & Spanish Language

 

 

 

  
 **Immigration-related employment benefits, for example visa sponsorship, are not available for this position**
 

 

 

  
 What We Offer

 

 

  
 Generous Paid Time Off (Vacation, Company Holidays, Parental Leave, Sick, and Disability)

  
 Multiple Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefit Plans to choose from

  
 Spending Accounts – FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, Company-Seeded HSA

  
 401(K) with company match

  
 Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits

  
 Education reimbursement program

  
 Employer-Paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace

  
 Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities

 

 

   **Benefits may vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee election
 

 

 

  
 How We Do It

 

 

 
 We Care, We Dare, We Share

 

 

  
 DNV is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
 

 

 

  
 For more information
 

 

 

  
 https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/migrated_files/employers/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf
 

 

 

  
 DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially
 

 

 

  
 Read more here
 

 

 
 Diversity at DNV 

 
Meet our Employees

 
 About DNV

 
 Careers in DNV

 

 

  
 Please visit our website at www.dnv.com
 

 
 
 
 Company & Business Area Description: 
 

   DNV is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions.
 

 

 

  
 We are a world-leading provider of digital solutions and software applications with focus on the energy, maritime and healthcare markets. Our solutions are used worldwide to manage risk and performance for wind turbines, electric grids, pipelines, processing plants, offshore structures, ships, and more. Supported by our domain knowledge and Veracity assurance platform, we enable companies to digitize and manage business critical activities in a sustainable, cost-efficient, safe and secure way.

Composites One LLC
 is the leading supplier of essential materials for 
wind energy, aerospace, defense, consumer recreation
 and 
construction composites manufacturing.
 We have a global presence and operate 
44
 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each team member with 
respect

offers opportunities for growth and personal success.

 
 Learn more about us compositesone.com!

 
 The 
Warehouse Manager
 will be responsible for the overall activity of the warehouse, including 
safety/risk management
, 
Quality,
 
RCCA
, 
receiving
,
 transportation
 (private fleet and 3rd party carriers), 
warehousing
 and 
equipment/building maintenance/repair operations
, all in accordance with established Company and regulatory policies and procedures. This person manages the processes and performance involved in daily activities of the warehouse to achieve established operating income and ROA goals. 
Adheres to and promotes Company core values
 by performing duties in a manner that is consistent with being a 
team leader
 and 
supports the continued growth of the company.

 

 
 Primary Job Responsibilities:

 

  
 Develops and establishes necessary staffing systems, processes and procedures to ensure consistent, accurate and timely customer order fulfillment.

  
 Investigates and establishes root causes of shipping and receiving errors and implements corrective action plans.

  
 Builds and maintains supplier partnerships; Works with suppliers to assure items are delivered to time and quality specifications.

  
 Works in conjunction with the regional Buyers and Supply Chain Managers to coordinate product movement, warehouse space requirements and stock rotation.

  
 Assists in developing plans for selling aged inventory in partnership with Sales team and regional Buyers.

  
 Monitors and approves all freight transactions, including review of freight adders on a semi-annual basis.

  
 Oversees the annual physical inventory process and regularly scheduled cycle counts.

  
 Develops systems, processes and procedures to optimize equipment and related resources, including effective material movement and logistics, while delivering value to our customers.

  
 Utilizes third party rating tools, routing techniques and mapping tools that assist in making quality decision that minimize freight costs.

  
 Monitors the receipt, coordination and safety of goods coming through the warehouse using the Warehouse Management System.

  
 Ensures orders arrive and are dispatched on time to appropriate destinations and in expected quantities.

  
 Traces history of items to determine reasons for discrepancies between inventory and stock control records; recommends corrective actions to resolve discrepancies.

  
 Plans layout of warehouse and other storage areas, considering turnover, size, weight and related factors of items stored.

  
 Analyze records and recommends corrective actions for reported non-usable, aged and excess stock.

  
 Reviews records for accuracy of information and compliance with established procedures, and to determine adequacy of inventory levels.

  
 Monitors and evaluates expectations and performance of warehouse and delivery staff through coaching and development opportunities.

  
 Promotes a high level of customer focus and leads a Quality Managed warehouse environment; creates an environment that encourages respect, teamwork, communication, customer satisfaction and productivity between team members and following the Integrity Service model.

  
 Communicates and ensures all requirements pertaining to warehousing/ material handling, safety and shipping are followed by staff.

 

 
 Position Requirements:

 

  
 High School Diploma or GED Equivalent required

  
 Associates Degree preferred

  
 Minimum 5 years experience in a warehouse environment, including supervisory experience

  
 Proven track record in a team development role

  
 Experience with order picking, shipping, receiving, inventory counts, pick/pack.

  
 In-depth knowledge of FIFO, OSHA, Safety Awareness and HAZMAT shipping.

  
 Management experience within a Quality System such as ISO 9001 or similiar strongly preferred

  
 Forklift Certification strongly preferred

  
 Must be proficient in MS Office; ability to learn and master internal systems required

 

 
 What we offer: 
 
Day 1 Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision),
 401K Plan with Company Match and Profit Sharing, 
Paid Time Off,
 Flexible Spending Accounts (Health and Dependent Care), 
Employee Assistance Program
, Educational Assistance Program.

 

 
 Why you should join our team!

 
 At Synergy55/Composites One we cultivate an environment of continuous growth and development. Our organization's culture is founded on the pillars of 
Respect, Teamwork, and Communication
. Much of our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as a cohesive team, respect each other in all of our daily interactions, and communicate effectively.

Core responsibilities as a DC Operations Manager include:

Qualifications:

doc_title: US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead
doc_description:
Local Unit & Position Description

Do you want to come help lead decarbonization and the advancement of Renewable Energy?

Are you excited about working with a diverse, collaborative team at the world s largest renewable energy consultancy? Do you have a passion for permitting renewable energy projects, and furthering your professional development in a company that truly puts people first?

At DNV our organizational culture and how we collectively influence the world for future generations matters deeply to us. Our team works every day to increase the widespread deployment and operation of renewables to address climate change and positively impact society; endeavors to achieve our purpose through the success of our customers; and strives to be high-performing and innovative. Our approach reflects the equity, respect, and diversity we wish to see in the world.

DNV s Environmental and Permitting Services (EPS) team is growing rapidly, and we are seeking a US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead to help us provide comprehensive permitting services in Midwest US and the rest of the United States (US). You will be responsible for overseeing a team and leading project development and environmental and permitting activities, including the preparation of local, state, and federal renewable energy permit applications, associated environmental and social impact studies, stakeholder engagement sessions, and land use and zoning permit applications for renewable energy projects located in the Midwest and, as well as other regions within and outside of the US. You will also be engaged in leading proposal efforts, business development for wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen facilities across the US, as well as assisting with project due diligence activities.

Our Customers can choose any number of consultancies to execute on specific tasks. However, our EPS team strives to develop long-term partnerships with our Customers, acting as their trusted advisor from the early site selection stage through to operations. Our Customers are at the forefront of the energy transition. Our team is nimble, highly experienced, and driven by our mission to ensure renewable energy projects are safely and sustainably sited, permitted, and operated.

Our team

The EPS team is comprised of siting, environmental, and permitting specialists who work directly with our Customers to help identify and address project risks for terrestrial wind, offshore wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen projects. Our mission is to guide the sustainable, responsible growth of the renewables industry by providing innovative environmental and permitting expertise to support the greater good.

To facilitate this work, excellent written and oral communication skills are paramount. Broadly, our work falls into four categories:

  • Biological services, including field surveys, habitat conservation plans, corporate avian and bat protection plans, review of mitigation strategies, and associated permitting.
  • Permitting services, providing support for permitting at the federal, state/provincial, and local level for wind, solar, battery storage and hydrogen projects; including stakeholder engagement.
  • GIS services, including mapping, constraints reviews, radiocommunication surveys, and critical issues analyses.
  • Siting services, including layout optimization, acoustical measurements, noise impact assessments, shadow flicker studies, blade/ice throw assessments, glint and glare studies, and visual impact studies.

This is a Remote position

What You ll Do

  • Oversee a team of project analysts, biologists, and engineers to deliver projects within allocated time and budget. Perform technical checking and initial approval of all work products completed by project team.
  • Lead the preparation and submission of permit applications, coordination of environmental fieldwork, authoring of environmental reporting documentation including critical issues analyses, technical permitting studies and management plans, Phase I ESAs, environmental impact assessments and technical project proposals and, agency consultation and stakeholder engagement programs.
  • Provide people leadership, coaching, and quality control for a team of approximately five.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with Midwest regulatory agencies (and/or other US regions).
  • Stay informed of applicable regulatory frameworks and participate in regulatory discussions and feedback discussions related to renewable energy developments in the US.
  • Actively seek out practical and realistic business development opportunities in the US. Prepare proposals and bids and engage in facilitating innovative and new service offerings to anticipate/meet market needs.

Position Qualifications

What is Required

  • Bachelor s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • At least 5 years of environmental and/or permitting experience in the US, preferably in the renewable energy industry
  • Advanced knowledge of environmental assessment regulatory frameworks as applied to renewable energy (wind, solar, or battery storage)
  • Experience engaging with and contacts within the federal and state regulatory agencies such as the USFWS, local communities, and Tribes or First Nations
  • Demonstrated skills in people leadership (academic and/or professional experience); and
  • Demonstrated skills in project management, agency consultation, environmental analysis, and business development, including experience building and maintaining relationships with a client base
  • Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
  • We conduct pre-employment drug and background screening

What is Preferred

  • Master s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • 8+ years of relevant experience preferred
  • Experience leading winning proposal efforts for Customers in the renewable energy industry;
  • Capable of travelling to projects in development, construction, and operation sites in varying locations (10%-20% annual time); and
  • Comprehensive understanding of the Midwest wind, solar, and battery storage markets (or other US regions)
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) or other technical accreditation such P.Eng., P.Geo, P.Biol., etc

*Immigration-related employment benefits, for example visa sponsorship, are not available for this position*What We Offer

  • Generous paid time off (vacation, sick days, company holidays, personal days)
  • Multiple Medical and Dental benefit plans to choose from, Vision benefits
  • Spending accounts FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, company-seeded HSA
  • Special programs Employee Assistance Program, ID theft protection, and accident and critical illness options for you and your family
  • Employer-paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace
  • 401(k) with company match
  • Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits
  • Tuition assistance
  • Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities
  • Advancement opportunities

**Benefits may vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionHow We Do ItWe Care, We Dare, We Share

DNV is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially.

DNV is proud to announce being named one of Houston s best places to work in the 2022 Houston Business Journal Best Places to Work competition.

For more information

https://www.eeoc.gov/know-your-rights-workplace-discrimination-illegal-poster

Read more here

Diversity at DNV

Meet our Employees

About DNV

Careers in DNV

Please visit our website at www.dnv.com

As required by the various Pay Transparency laws, DNV provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado, California, Washington, or New York. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the states of Colorado, California, Washington, and New York only, the range of starting pay for this role is $100,000 - $145,000

Company & Business Area Description

DNV is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions.

We provide assurance to the entire energy value chain through our advisory, monitoring, verification, and certification services. As the world's leading resource of independent energy experts and technical advisors, we help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry. We are committed to realizing the goals of the Paris Agreement, and support all stakeholders to transition faster to a deeply decarbonized energy system.
