doc_description: About TPI TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. The Production Manager is directly responsible for plant manufacturing operations on all production shifts. The main focus is to drive performance in the manufacturing processes through continuous improvement to deliver and sustain profitable growth. The fundamental task is to directly lead and manage the operation of the value stream, develop strategy, and provide direct supervision of Production Supervisors and indirect supervision of lead operators and production associates. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Directs all activities related to operations and production in accordance with the business plan and the strategic goals of the Company and business unit. Collaborates with colleagues to achieve safety and environmental performance objectives. Collaborates with site leadership to set short- and long-term production goals and meet key performance indicators (KPI). Directs and manages overall production plan for the operation. Collaborates with functional/support managers on the determination of materials, space, equipment and personnel needs as well as the development and implementation of processes, procedures, assignment and execution of functional responsibilities, and determination of budget and costs constraints. Communicates the Company's strategic goals and vision for site. Evaluates performance against production goals and adjusts allocations of resources (e.g., personnel, equipment, materials) as needed to optimize quality and amount of equipment, machinery and components produced, market share of customers, quality of services provided, and cost-efficiency of operations. Reviews and analyzes reports of key business performance data, collaborates with management team on operations, and maintains knowledge of current market trends and best practices for region and industry. Engages the team in supervising day-to-day operations. Provides strategic guidance and resources to troubleshoot highly complex issues related to departmental operations and customer service. Supports or leads Operational Excellence/Lean improvement projects. Develops and leads the implementation of operational initiatives in support of Lean Six-Sigma manufacturing (e.g., department utilization improvement, process capability enhancement, customer satisfaction, employee involvement). Suggests changes in working conditions and use of equipment to increase efficiency. Sets and communicates standards, deploys resources, and achieves clear and measurable performance expectations for the operation. Trains and ensures all assigned employees are aware of and comply with company, government, and customer policies, procedures, and regulations. Works with subordinate managers and supervisors to maintain a positive, motivated workforce. Who we’re looking for: Required BA or BS degree in a technical discipline; and 8 to 12 years of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Previous experience in automotive experience preferred. Previous IATF 16949 and/or ISO14001 experience preferred. Ability to work both independently and within a team, generating results with general/minimal guidance from management. Green Belt Certification preferred. Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with professional presentation and negotiation skills Demonstrated ability to effectively apply MS Excel and other analysis tools to real-world problem-solving. Must be flexible, innovative and comfortable in setting own priorities. Polished presentation, business acumen and facilitation skills Good understanding of Lean manufacturing principles Experience with high volume operations Strong organization and planning skills Change Agent experience. Location This position is based at our composite products manufacturing site in Warren, Rhode Island.

About TPI
TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.
TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability. TPI maintains fully accredited materials test laboratories in the USA and China to support material characterization, process optimization, and ensure production quality and traceability.
About the Role
We are looking for an experienced, highly organized technical manager to lead production and development operations in our quickly growing, high-volume automotive composites manufacturing press hall area. The manager will be responsible for the technical oversight of all critical process equipment and the launching of new equipment. The electro-mechanical systems include programable fiber cutting systems, hydraulic presses, resin injection systems, robotic pick-n-place, CNC cutting and machining systems, and ancillary support equipment. The manager will develop capacity plans, build and manage department schedules, assess and manage resource needs.
The manager will be responsible for managing their department and working with support operations to ensure EH&S standards, materials, labor, planning, maintenance, and quality support needs for operations are being met to satisfy customer and business expectations while ensuring compliance to our IATF / ISO certified QMS.
If this describes you, we invite you to apply to this role.
To be successful in this role, you must be able to multitask and oversee several operations at a time with excellent time management and interpersonal skills.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Assume ownership of press hall production process including meeting production deadlines and quality specifications.

 
Troubleshoot and solve challenging integrated equipment systems, support equipment, tooling design, and processing problems.

 
Lead the development, implementation, and sustaining of a robust TPM system to drive significant OEE sustained improvements with goal to meet >/= 85%

 
Improve shop organization and production workflow utilizing 5S and lean initiatives.

 
Ensure all needed and developed safeguards are in place and maintained in areas where autonomous operations are performed by equipment and robotic systems.

 
Estimate labor resources and capacity requirements for product build schedule.

 
Maintain daily Gemba meetings are supported and effective in driving communication and continual improvement

 
Provide updates to senior management on status of operations.

 
Provide day-to-day direction for subordinate team members.

 
Provide leadership to maintain an engaged and motivated work force.




Who we’re looking for: 



 
Four-year degree in technical field such as mechanical or industrial engineering, plus 5 years of experience in machine building/design; 5 years of production experience in automation; 3 years of management experience in production environments; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 
Experience leading lean initiatives including TPM, SMED, 5S, and Kaizen events

 
Experience in automotive manufacturing environment with ISO and IATF standards certification.

 
Experience in leading RCCA projects, FMEA’s, Control Plans, and Flow Plans

 
Very strong computer skills, particularly with the MS Office suite.

 
Knowledge of safety standards for a manufacturing environment.

 
Substantial knowledge of manufacturing and assembly processes such as machining, grinding, CNC, hand assembly, fasteners, etc.




Extra Skills & Abilities



 
SolidWorks or comparable CAD experience.

 
Experience with project management methods, practices and tools including scoping, facilitations, delegation, and risk management best practices.

 
A strong machine maintenance background.

 
Experience with the application of motion components and electric actuators.

 
Experience with automation or manufacturing related equipment.

 
Experience working within cross-functional teams to handle multiple priorities and meet scheduled milestones.

 
Ability to accurately estimate the level of effort required to complete a project build on time and within budget.

 
Desire and capability to coach and mentor direct reports and other project partners.

 
Demonstrated ability to create drawing packages, electronic bills of materials and engineering change orders.




Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren, Rhode Island.


Location: 373 Market Street, Warren, RI 02885


Job Type: Full-time

The WTG technician will perform fault finding, inspections-, maintenance- and repair works at offshore wind turbines. Those works will be done in joined teams with the turbine supplier or idenpendently.



LOCATION
Sassnitz; Port Neu Mukran; Germany



WORKING PATTERN
Permanent; full time; 14/ 14 rotation

RESPONSIBILITIES AND FUNCTIONS

  • Fault finding, Inspection, maintenance and repair of electrical, hydraulical and mechanical components at offshore wind turbines in accordance with European, national and company safety standards, norms and regullations
  • Statutory inspections, annual checks of safety equipment
  • Check and repair of cranes, ladders, Fallarrestsystems etc.
  • Check and repair of electrical components
  • Guidance and supervision of subcontractors
  • Execution of quality checks and audits
  • Support at generation or review of risk assessments and method statements
  • Maintenance and repair of tools and spares
  • Support of warehouse manager with administration and commissioning of spare parts
  • Reinforcement of the team at fire protection and fire fighting drills and exercises ( qualification as HLO/ HAD )
  • Provision of daily reports reflecting the executed works

MANDATORY SKILLS

  • Sucessfully completed vocational education preferable as electrician, industrial mechatronic or eelctrical engineer
  • Minimum 2 years experince in one of the above mentioned disciplins, preferably offshore
  • Fluent English and German skills, verbal and written
  • Medical fitness and willingness to work offshore
  • Ability to travel in Germany and abroad
  • Familiar with MS Office standard software

DESIRABLE SKILLS

  • Switching authorisation 33/66 kV
  • Experience in operations of cranes
  • GWO modules for offshore works

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Working in a fast growing industry with excellent future prospects
  • Adventurous job in an international environment with great team spirit
  • All technical trainings to fulfil the role
  • Long term employment
  • Competitive salary, performance related bonus and vacation package

Reporting to the Sr. Director, Global Strategic Sourcing, the Global Category Manager is responsible for strategically managing a segment of TPI’s key commodities on a global basis to leverage TPI’s buying power through global consolidation of spend, market intelligence, strategic supplier relationships, and the execution of global supply agreements. This is accomplished through a team of Category Leaders located globally. This role is analytical in nature while requiring a focus on supplier relationships and the ability to work cross functionally in a global organization.


Qualifications



 
Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Engineering, Business, Economics or equivalent

 
7+ years strategic supply chain experience, including previous experience in the development and execution of Category Strategies

 
Proven negotiation track record

 
Understanding and adaptability to work in a fast-paced manufacturing environment and growing company where processes and customer requirements evolve

 
Experience with supplier interaction in driving innovation and cost reduction programs and processes

 
Knowledge and experience with Lean concepts and driving operational excellence

 
Self-starter and proactive sourcing strategist

 
Ability to work at all levels in the organization

 
Excellent written and oral communication skills

 
Scottsdale, Arizona based with 25% travel expectations




Position Summary
Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to:



 
Develop global category strategy to achieve material costs savings targets through detailed analysis of the category portfolio, including global consolidation of spend across all geographical areas.

 
Work closely with cross functional teams in the development and execution of new material qualifications.

 
Aggressively pursue the strategy to ensure competitive advantage for TPI and to position TPI as a market leader.

 
Communicate and promote the strategy internally to TPI management and key stakeholders.

 
Ensure strategy execution through close collaboration with the global Supply Chain and Project Management community.

 
Ensure that the Commodity strategy evolves to adequately address the changing market conditions.

 
Negotiate global supply agreements with strategic suppliers through the Request for Proposal process.

 
Establish intelligence and market knowledge to enable bid and project teams to make informed decisions.

 
Closely monitor the supply market with regards to pricing, commodity trends, supplier capacity, supplier news, industry news and new product developments.

 
Identify new supplier entrants in current and developing best cost markets and assess their capabilities to offer TPI a competitive advantage over the existing supplier base.

 
Prepare and distribute a monthly commodity key performance indicator reports.

 
Develop and maintain a strategic partnership and leverage the supply base to meet the company’s procurement requirements related to quality, delivery and cost

 
Execute supplier management programs with suppliers, including the development of performance metrics.

 
Monitor and report on supplier performance and compliance.

 
Support Site Supply Chain to manage suppliers to ensure safety, quality, cost, and delivery timelines are achieved.

 
Support Global Supplier Quality management on Audits and Assessments of new and existing suppliers.

 
Support new customer projects through quotes and Bill of Materials analysis.

 
Responsible for supplier selection on a commodity basis and work with the buyers to implement these sourcing decisions.

 
Uses professional concepts to contribute to development of company concepts and principles and to achieve objectives in creative and effective ways.




Competitive Salary typically in the rang of $120,000 - $140,000 annually and is strictly dependent on experience. Excellent benefits package includes extensive company benefits, time off, and 4% dollar for dollar 401k matching.


About TPI


How does it feel to be part of the only independent manufacturer of composite wind blades for the wind energy market? Exhilarating, engaging and extremely satisfying, all at the same time. We’re the future of renewable, sustainable energy. We’re on the cutting edge of our industry. And we’re growing at a rapid pace. There could not be a better time to join our team and help us shape the future.Our manufacturing process is more manual than most people may realize, and the products we manufacture are large and weigh more than 16 metric tons on average. In addition, the manufacturing process requires a highly collaborative team-based approach.


When we select new associates to join TPI, we ensure that the individuals have high levels of learning agility and adaptability in addition to the skills needed for the role. Our associates embrace our Core Values – Safety, Operational Excellence, Commitment, Integrity, and Leadership – and bring these values to life by applying their diverse backgrounds and skillsets to everyday actions, demonstrating high discretionary effort, and embracing our Values in Motion program.


Location: 8501 N. Scottsdale Road, Scottsdale, AZ 85258


Job Type: Full-time


Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year


Benefits:



 
401(k)

 
401(k) matching

 
Dental insurance

 
Employee assistance program

 
Flexible spending account

 
Health insurance

 
Health savings account

 
Paid time off

 
Parental leave

 
Vision insurance




Schedule:



 
8 hour shift




Ability to commute/relocate:



 
Scottsdale, AZ: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)




Experience:



 
Category management: 5 years (Required)

 
Procurement: 1 year (Required)




Work Location: One location

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.
 
 
Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

  
 
  
 
  
Your Impact:

  
 Here at Jacobs, we apply our expertise and knowledge as we look into the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference. If you want to join a company invested in you, your success and the global community - join us as our Offshore Wind Engineering Lead to help our communities achieve a net-zero future.
 
  
As a vital member of our team, you’ll be recognized as an industry leader and expert within Jacobs and spearhead our growing Offshore Wind practice. Primary focus will be on the US market, but you’ll be coordinating and working across multiple disciplines and regions to leverage Jacobs’ advisory, planning, permitting, and engineering expertise to strengthen our position in the offshore wind market. As the OSW Engineering Lead, you will help lead and build a multi-disciplinary team that can successfully deliver on the design and review of structures needed for offshore wind projects.
 
  
At Jacobs you’ll be instrumental in the growth and development of our Offshore Wind business strategy. You’ll contribute to our alternative energy wind projects/initiatives that have a significant impact upon our business. Your expertise in the design and construction of offshore structures will be critical in the delivery and positioning of Jacobs for upcoming offshore wind opportunities and programs.
 
  
Working together, we’ll help you grow and pursue what fulfills you so that we can make impacts on the future – big and small, global and local.
 
  
At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.
 
  
Here’s What You’ll Need:

  

   
 Substantial years of experience in structural dynamics, numerical modeling, 3D finite element analysis, integrated load analyses, monopile design, steel jacket design, fatigue analysis, design of offshore structures, industry software, and program languages (e.g. STAAD.Pro, SAP, ROBOT, SACS, SESAM, BLADED, SQL, Matlab, Python)

   
Strong knowledge of industry standards, offshore regulations, health & safety, and environmental legislation associated with offshore construction projects

   
Be highly experienced in interfacing with other discipline specialists (structural, geotechnical, coastal, electrical, mechanical, BIM, etc.) and familiar with offshore codes and standards (DNVGL, ISO, UFC, AISC, API, etc.)

   
Proven track record delivering large, complex, multidisciplinary projects and execution of works in an offshore environment

   
Familiarity with the US offshore wind industry, its players, and market outlook and relationships with offshore wind developers, contractors, suppliers, or utilities involved in the development of offshore wind projects in the US

   
Have an outgoing and customer-oriented attitude with the ability to build, and develop client relationships, and be a demonstrated and recognized Project Director and technical leader

   
Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering with Structural Focus

   
Professional Engineering Registration

  

  
 
  

   
 
   
Ideally, You’ll Also Have:

   
 
   

    
Advanced degree in structural or geotechnical engineering

    
Experience in the development of an offshore wind including program management functions (e.g. budget, schedule, procurement).

    
Familiarity and experience in the design of offshore floating structures

    
Leadership skills and the ability to identify suitable candidates to help grow our offshore wind practice.

    
SE Designation

   

  
 
  
Your most impactful mission in this role is to embrace living inclusion every day and enabling diversity and equality globally. For us, this means creating a culture of belonging where we all thrive by embracing all perspectives. An inclusive culture with many perspectives through diverse backgrounds allows us to leverage knowledge, leadership and connection to bring forth opportunity, creativity and growth.
 Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.
  
 At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Composites One LLC
 is the leading supplier of essential materials for 
wind energy, aerospace, defense, consumer recreation,
 and 
construction composites manufacturing.
 We have a global presence and operate 
44
 North American distribution centers. As a family business, for over 60 years we have had a culture that treats each team member with 
respect
 and 
offers opportunities for growth and personal success.

 
 
Why you should join our team!

 
 At Composites One we cultivate an environment of continuous growth and development. Our organization's culture is founded on the pillars of 
Respect, Teamwork, and Communication
. Much of our success is largely attributed to our ability to operate as a cohesive team, respect each other in all of our daily interactions, and communicate effectively.

 
 Click here to hear about careers in Composites from our President/CEO 

 
Learn more about us compositesone.com!

 
 Are you a marketing professional looking for an opportunity to make a direct impact? 

 
Composites One is looking for a 
Marketing Communications Manager
 to join our growing Marketing team!

 
 This role is responsible for 
managing
 the Marketing Communications team in 
executing
 various cross-platform marketing and communication activities, in support of building North American and Global brands. This includes the implementation of strategies that align with short/long-term marketing objectives; aligning initiatives with business goals, aligning messaging across all communication channels, working cross-functionally on campaign plans and associated content, and ensuring Composites One Brand and value proposition are accurately represented across all activities. This position will serve as a collaborative thought partner on the 
strategy
, 
planning,
 and
 execution
 of the marketing communications team’s objectives.

 
 
Core responsibilities as the Marketing Communications Manager:

 

  
 Oversees marketing communication workstreams and leads in the development of the Marketing Communications team.

  
 Provides leadership and delegation of roles and responsibilities to Marketing Communications team members, as well as management of external service partners.

  
 Manages Social Media Specialist, SEO/Website Specialist, Content Specialists, and other Marketing Communications Team Members to develop content development strategy, including acquisition and management.

  
 Manages sales-related communications projects.

  
 Proactively partners with Marketing and Commercial Groups in supporting the execution of campaign and tactical plans including timing, roll-out, and reporting.

  
 Creates Sales tools, collateral, and promotional materials to fulfill both regional and global sales and market-specific needs and campaigns.

  
 Educates and supports Product Managers, Technical Support Teams, and Brand Experience Specialist on the development of impactful, customer-focused messaging and programs that enhance market position (Product launch and trade show support).

  
 Facilitates, manages, and works to continuously improve global Company Stores for Composites One and its Brands by seeking input from internal subject matter experts.

  
 Manages various internal communication platforms as well as public relations communications.

  
 Supports the development of press releases, press events, and rollouts.

  
 Manages Intranet Content Calendar, and ensures alignment of event, social, and campaign strategies to the global/centralized calendar.

  
 Provides writing and editing support to ensure internal and external communications are aligned with the brand message and C1’s culture.

  
 Manages the Lead Management Program.

  
 Coordinates with Marketing and Digital leaders to ensure data collected from lead generation programs capture desired data points.

  
 Develops marketing campaign/nurture efforts to brand Composites One to certain leads.

 

 
 
Must Haves
 to be successful in this role:

 

  
 Strong business writing skills.

  
 Ability to design graphics associated with campaign management.

  
 Self-starter with a strong sense of initiative focused on results; ability to manage multiple, simultaneous workstreams.

  
 Skilled in working with creative agencies and an understanding of print processes.

  
 Ability to design graphics associated with campaign management.

  
 Knowledge of video production, including editing and script development.

  
 Innate ability to pay attention to details when composing, typing, and proofing materials, establishing priorities, facilitating events, and meeting deadlines.

  
 Ability to work independently.

  
 Superior organizational and problem-solving skills.

 

 
 Qualifications:

 

  
 Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field is required, or a combination of related experience and education that is deemed to be commensurate with the degree requirement.

  
 A minimum of 6 years’ experience managing complex marketing projects and/or teams is required.

  
 Knowledge of today’s communication tools and current trends as it relates to the professional environment is strongly preferred. 

  
Composites industry knowledge is a plus, but not required.

  
 Willingness to travel if required – up to 35%

  
 Advanced proficiency using MS Office software.

  
 Requires experience with Adobe Creative suite, internal database, and software systems. 

  
Experience with basic html, Office 365, Outlook, Teams, and SharePoint is preferred.

  
 Knowledge of Infographic applications and experience using email delivery systems such as Constant Contact or Mail Chimp.

 

 
 What we offer as an employer of choice:

 

  
 Day 1 Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision)

  
 401K Plan with Company Match

  
 Profit Sharing

  
 Paid Time Off

  
 Flexible Spending Accounts (Health and Dependent Care)

  
 Employee Assistance Program

  
 Educational Assistance Program.

 

 

  
 Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO)
 Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or other protected classification as defined by applicable law and regulation.
 
 
ADA Accommodations
 Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please contact the ADA Coordinator by email at ADACoordinator@compositesone.com.

 

 

 
 Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

TPI Composites is a global provider of structural composites products and has 50 years of experience in the design, development, prototyping and serial production of advanced lightweight composite structures. We specialize in molding lightweight composite products for the Transportation and Wind Energy industries. TPI also provides a full range of services that can complement our customers’ extensive vehicle engineering capability.


The Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) Manager is the key individual responsible for ensuring a safe and environmentally compliant organization. The fundamental task is to plan, direct, and implement environmental, health and safety programs to ensure a safe, healthy, accident-free and sustainable organization by performing the following duties personally or through subordinate team members.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities



 
Plans and implements EHS policies and procedures in compliance with local, state, and federal Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) rules and regulations.

 
Plans and implements programs to train managers and employees in work site safety practices, fire prevention, and correct handling techniques for chemicals, equipment, and other materials.

 
Leads air permit, hazardous waste, community right to know, and other applicable regulatory compliance activities including record keeping and reporting and reporting requirements.

 
Prepares studies and analyses of industrial accident causes and hazards to health for use by company personnel and outside agencies.

 
Inspects organization facilities to detect existing or potential safety and health hazards, determines corrective or preventative measures where indicated, and follows up to ensure measures have been implemented.

 
Provides information, signs, posters, barriers, and other materials to warn of potential and actual safety hazards and to prevent access to hazardous conditions.

 
Leads and trains others in the investigation of accidents and injuries and cooperates in the preparation of material and evidence for organization use in hearings, lawsuits, and insurance investigations.

 
Oversees the administration of workers' compensation program, including working with the insurance carrier to reduce employee lost time.

 
Prepares and arranges safety exhibits and material for display, promotional work, industry conferences, and exhibitions.

 
Represents the organization in community or industry safety groups and programs.

 
Maintains safety files and records.

 
Directly supervises 1-2 employees within the EHS function. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws.

 
Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.




Who we’re looking for: 



 
Bachelor’s degree in Environmental (preferred) or related field (natural sciences, engineering, chemistry, or similar) and minimum of 7+ years work experience Safety/Environmental leadership experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 
Demonstrated success in improving EHS performance and establishing best practices.

 
Proven examples of effective communication and listening skills.

 
Demonstrated team leadership skills. Experience in managing EHS programs.

 
Passion and drive for environmental and safety compliance.

 
Knowledge of environmental and OSHA regulations.

 
Broad knowledge of workers’ compensation regulations and best practices.

 
Ability to read and interpret technical documents and regulations.




Location
This position is based at our automotive composites products manufacturing plant in Warren RI.

International Wind
 is a maintenance and repair service provider for the burgeoning commercial wind power generation industry. We specialize in providing repairs primarily in the field at customer locations (Wind farms). Our field workers are trained and are required to maintain certification for climbing, working at heights, confined space entry and specialty processes such as composite repair for blades.
Due to exceptional growth and future opportunity, we are seeking a detail oriented, well organized, and highly motivated individual to assist with Wind Operations. This person will provide day-to-day operations support for projects and customers under his/her purview to include work scheduling, training, logistics and management of personnel to ensure safe, smooth, and effective support for our client’s needs.


*
Job duties*
The Operations Support Manager’s over-arching purpose is ensuring that the business operates safely and effectively in support of our client’s needs. Duties and obligations that support that objective include but are not limited to:



 
Ensure a strong commitment to safety

 
Establish safety as our first core value

 
Foster a safety conscious work environment where all employees understand reporting options and are empowered to improve our safety culture

 
Ensure everyone understands they have the power to stop work when circumstances lead to uncertainty





 
Establish a strong relationship with designated customer contacts by demonstrating transparency, integrity, and honesty in dealing with each assigned client

 
Function as the single point of contact maintaining continuous client contact to build and/or strengthen the relationship

 
Deliver strong and frequent leadership engagement with assigned clients to ensure we understand and can deliver on their needs

 
Present a proactive posture regarding our performance – except and react promptly





 
Install a culture of continuous improvement and set high standards and expectations for our field personnel

 
Conducting periodic reviews of procedures and processes to identify improvement opportunities within the operation of the business

 
Communicate with field personnel frequently to understand operational challenges and support requirements to help ensure successful execution of contracted work

 
Remain available and approachable to our field employees





 
Oversight of operational and contract budgets with focus on establishing savings while maintaining or improving effectiveness

 
Understand all contracts associated with assigned clients

 
Ensure that operational plans support execution of the contract and identified work scope

 
Diligently enforce best practices with respect to spend for items such as vehicles, travel, hotel, materials, and contracted services





 
Conduct periodic site visits to:

 
Reinforce safety culture

 
Improve customer relationship

 
Garner feedback from field employees and

 
Ensure field performance and behavior supports contract requirements and best practices with respect to safety, quality, and schedule




*
Job Requirements: *



 
5 years of relevant Wind experience with at least 1 in an operations role preferred

 
Field Service experience in support of periodic maintenance activities including logistics for mobilization and demobilization

 
Experience with recruiting and staffing highly desirable

 
Can quickly identify key resources and build high performing teams

 
capable of providing input for a succession planning model that maintains a defense in depth for position evolutions.





 
Effective communication – written and verbal – with both management and craft

 
Ensure transparent communication regarding status, planning and expected outcome

 
Influence others (internal and external) to improve project outcomes





 
Effectively manages his/her time and that of other’s

 
Experience and/or active certifications as a trainer for GWO and/or ENSA a plus

 
Desire a candidate with established ties to Wind Industry management. OEM and Wind Farm connections desired in both USA and Europe

 
Understanding of wind turbine blade production/engineering principles highly considered

 
Rope Access experience highly desired

 
Existing certification to provide training in support of certification to Global Wind Organization (GWO) standards

Sprague is passionate about delivering the diverse products and programs that warm, power, and move the world. We keep homes warm through Northeastern winters and hospitals cool through summer. We help small businesses focus on serving their communities, and our renewable fuels keep our country’s infrastructure running. From importing wind energy components to deploying leading-edge solar technology to help power terminal facilities, we are committed to continually evolving to meet our customers’ changing energy needs. As a valued team member, the E. Providence Terminal Operator will work in a team environment, alongside leadership, to optimize efficiency while focusing on safety on every shift. Being a member of Sprague's terminal operations will give you the opportunity to execute a variety of operations including but not limited to taking in and off-loading ships/barges, conducting tank to tank transfers, assisting and training customers to load product, preventative maintenance, customer service and general upkeep of the terminal. Through on-the-job training, a successful terminal operator will have access to apply for promotional opportunities throughout our entire network of terminals. And you will also be able to enjoy extensive employee benefits including medical, dental and retirement as well as paid time off. Duties and Responsibilities: Assisting with loading and offloading of vessels Gauging oil and gasoline tanks Providing rack customer assistance Conducting Detex Rounds Troubleshooting VRU issues Maintenance and repair of storage tanks, loading rack and dock. Maintenance of grounds, buildings and/or equipment Conducting scheduled equipment inspections and repairs Operating of terminal equipment and machinery Data entry and tracking Participating in security and oil spill drills and exercises Education/Experience: Experience in bulk fuel storage plants preferred. Proficient in basic math, including fractions. Working knowledge of mechanical trades Minimum of 2 years' experience as a general laborer Basic computer knowledge Knowledge of blueprint reading piping diagrams, boiler, and fuel specifications preferred. Willingness to do shift work including nights, weekends, holidays, and overtime as needed. Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license. Must be able to obtain a valid TWIC card. High school diploma or equivalent Physical activity/strength requirements are demanding and may include: Occasionally (1%-33%) Frequently ( 34%-66%) Constantly (67%-100%) Frequent standing, climbing-stairs ladders, slopes (i.e., tank ladders/stairs/ramps), grasping/handling, and in/out of truck. Constant walking. Occasional bending/stooping, squatting, reaching forward/overhead, crawling, kneeling, twisting, neck flexion/extension, balancing, and sitting. Constant lifting/carrying 1-10 lbs., frequently 11-20lbs, occasionally 21-100lbs plus lbs. (i.e. oil, steel parts, spouts, tools) Constant pushing/pulling 1-10lbs, frequently 11- 50 lbs, occasionally 51- 100 plus lbs. (i.e. mooring lines, barge and ship hoses) Frequent exposure to outside weather conditions including extreme heat/cold, noise, petroleum products, chemical agents and fumes and odors and slippery surfaces caused by weather conditions. Occasional exposure to dust, and vibrations Frequent driving, vehicle equipment and use of power tools/equipment. hearing and talking We want to hear from you! Do you like to solve problems and consider yourself forward thinking? If you are looking for a place where you can learn a lot about the energy industry while constantly challenging yourself, then Sprague is your place. Sprague employees are dedicated and driven, and we constantly strive to be the best in the industry. We work best as a team, knowing that collaboration leads to innovation and the best customer experience. As a company that has continued to evolve with the energy industry for the last 150 years, we are looking for hardworking employees to join us as we remain at the forefront of the industry. What we offer: Do you like to get involved where you work? Is giving back important to you? It’s important to us, too! Sprague donates back to the communities in which we live and work every year. And, we collect employee donations to support the charity of the week. Sprague has a range of committees to support varying initiatives (Sustainability, Charitable, Scholarship, Innovation, etc.). Sprague is a place that cares about its employees, its community, and about creating a place where people want to come to work every day. Plus, we have some great benefits! Medical Dental Paid Time Off Retirement Plan with an automatic 5% contribution Come join us to learn why we are consistently celebrating 20-, 30-, and even 40-year anniversaries here at Sprague! Sprague is an EEO/AA employer. We strongly encourage minorities, females, Vets, and individuals with disabilities to apply. As a federal contractor we adhere to OFCCP employment regulations. Click here for OFCCP compliance information Job Type: Full-time

doc_description:
About SkySpecs


At SkySpecs, our mission is to simplify renewable asset management so less can do more for the planet. SkySpecs is helping to make this possible by automating the operations and maintenance of wind farms using advanced robotics paired with our custom-built asset performance management software, Horizon.


SkySpecs launched the world's first completely autonomous blade inspection product in 2016 with a custom-designed drone system. Since then, SkySpecs has inspected over 95,000 wind turbines in over 27 countries, becoming the world leader in understanding the health of turbine blades. Identifying issues with turbine blades is only the first step. In 2019 SkySpecs launched Horizon to be a platform for SkySpecs to offer a multi-layered solution for customers that includes: data collection, wind turbine blade engineering expertise, and a place for all stakeholders to collaborate to manage and analyze massive amounts of data, spot trends, and create plans for high-cost repair campaigns. In 2021, SkySpecs acquired two companies specializing in wind turbine drivetrain monitoring and financial management, further expanding our asset management portfolio. Ultimately, this will help reduce the cost and risk of operations for the industry


What we're looking for


SkySpecs is seeking a Solutions Manager who will work directly with customers, managing and delivering software onboarding, presales, and other consulting projects or analytic deliverables. You will be tasked with overseeing projects end-to-end, from ideation and scoping to delivery. You will work closely with customers to understand their unique renewable asset management needs and provide data-driven and actionable insights based on those needs. You will also be responsible for onboarding new customers into our SaaS platform (Horizon), overseeing any necessary training, process mapping, or technical integrations. In addition to working directly with customers, you will work with various SkySpecs teams to aid in the expansion of our solutions and products. The Solutions Manager role may at times be billable to the customer, and you may be responsible for generating revenue through your consulting projects, but your primary goal will be to help our customers learn how to best use our technology, software, and their own data to solve real business challenges in the renewable energy industry.


Requirements


Experience scoping and executing projects that deliver business value to enterprise, industrial, or commercial customers

3+ years in engineering or technical consulting practice and/or project management in a technical or renewable energy field

Strong communication skills to both internal and external stakeholders

Experience using and developing business intelligence tools such as Sisense or Tableau to perform analysis on large datasets that drive business value

Customer-focused with a self-starter mentality

Demonstrated project management skills in services, analytics, implementation, or technical analysis projects

BA/BS in Business, Engineering, or another technical/analytical field

Willing collaborator with cross-functional team experience

Comfort dealing with ambiguous situations and solving unique problems

Willingness to travel up to 25%


Nice to Have


Enterprise software implementation project experience

MBA or master's in engineering, supply chain, or another technical field.

Renewable or wind energy industry experience

Startup experience


The Work


As a SkySpecs' Solutions Manager, your role is to work together with customers to maximize the value they derive from SkySpecs' products and services. You will be responsible for developing, managing, and executing services and implementation projects for key customers, using their data and SkySpecs' expertise, analytics, and BI tools. You will need to have a deep technical understanding of the SkySpecs products, as well as a big-picture understanding of the challenges that our customers face, and the technologies and methods needed to solve those challenges. You will:


Create project plans for customers that account for project timelines, budgets, and expected deliverables.

Develop statements of work for customer projects, track billable/non-billable time and revenue generation.

Manage data collection, analysis, tracking, and execution of projects timely, accurately, and exceeding customers' expectations.

Manage technical implementation and integration projects, change management, and process development projects to bring customers into the Horizon platform.

Deliver analytic findings, presentations, and dashboards through SkySpecs' Horizon platform focused on providing business value to customers.

Talk to customers regularly to better understand their priorities and pain points, offering solutions and support whenever possible.

Foster relationships with key customers and broaden adoption of our products within their companies.

Work closely with Sales, Solutions Engineering, and Business Development roles to ensure customers' understanding of the services and capabilities available to them and that their needs are being met and communicated

Work closely with Product Management and Engineering to ensure that customer feedback and industry challenges are incorporated into future SkySpecs products and services


You are …


A motivated self-starter, able to prioritize, multitask and operate in the fast-paced environment of a growth-stage company

Comfortable creating processes and procedures where none may yet exist

Extremely focused on customer needs

A strong verbal and written communicator


Perks You'll Receive


A flexible work schedule and work environment

The respect of your teammates regardless of department or skillset

The option of working remotely when it suits you and your team

A fun, energetic, often zany workplace that is open and accepting of all interests

A great downtown Ann Arbor office with access to coffee, shopping, bars, restaurants, etc.

An open vacation policy (our policy is: Get your work done; be reliable; go above and

beyond because you want to; and take rest and relaxation when you need it!).

Medical, dental, and vision insurance

ABOUT SKYSPECS


At SkySpecs, our mission is to simplify renewable asset management so less can do more for the planet. SkySpecs is helping to make this possible by automating the operations and maintenance of wind farms using advanced robotics paired with our custom-built asset performance management software, Horizon.


SkySpecs launched the world's first completely autonomous blade inspection product in 2016 with a custom designed drone system. Since then, SkySpecs has inspected over 95,000 wind turbines in over 27 countries, becoming the world leader in understanding the health of turbine blades. Identifying issues with turbine blades is only the first step. In 2019 SkySpecs launched Horizon to be a platform for SkySpecs to offer a multi-layered solution for customers that includes: data collection, wind turbine blade engineering expertise, and a place for all stakeholders to collaborate to manage and analyze massive amounts of data, spot trends, and create plans for high-cost repair campaigns. In 2021, SkySpecs acquired two companies specializing in wind turbine drivetrain monitoring and financial management, further expanding our asset management portfolio. Ultimately, this will help reduce the cost and risk of operations for the industry


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


SkySpecs is seeking an Associate Product Manager that will gain a deep working understanding of SkySpecs' products and work with various stakeholders throughout the organization to coordinate various product activities. You will be tasked with helping SkySpecs take our autonomous inspection product to the next level to continue double-digit growth. The Associate Product Manager role is a high-visibility role within the organization, and you will have the opportunity to work directly with customers to understand their needs, work with SkySpecs leadership on product strategy, work with Sales and Marketing to build go-to-market materials and to work with the technology teams to develop amazing software.


REQUIREMENTS


Product instincts that focus on the user and drive delivering value to the customer

1+ years in a software product management, business analysis, or product engineering role working on web-based applications

BA/BS in Business, Engineering, or another technical/analytical field

Demonstrated project management skills in development, implementation, or technical analysis projects

Experience developing software requirements and communicating with development teams

Strong written, presentation, and communication skills to both internal and external stakeholders

Interest in Renewable or wind energy asset management

Product design, user interface design, or software development experience

Exposure to Pragmatic Marketing/Gartner marketing methodology experience is ideal

Startup mindset


THE WORK


As a SkySpecs' Associates Product Manager, your role is to build new products and features by combining existing ideas with new ideas from your experience and interactions with customers and prospects. You will need to have a deep technical understanding of the SkySpecs products, as well as a big-picture understanding of the challenges that face our customers and technologies needed to solve those challenges. You will:


Talk to customers as often as possible to better understand what they are doing, working on, and what challenges they have

Define product requirements and work with developers to design and build new features

Assist in QA of the software and documentation writing

Answer customer support questions and work with customers to find resolution on their issues

Work with Marketing to develop sales support materials, demos, and use cases

Work with Sales to develop technical sales materials, inspection analysis materials, and demonstrations

Develop relationships with key customers and broaden adoption of our products within their companies

Work with the Solutions Delivery team to help deliver value to customers and improve internal products

doc_title: US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead
doc_description:
Local Unit & Position Description

Do you want to come help lead decarbonization and the advancement of Renewable Energy?

Are you excited about working with a diverse, collaborative team at the world s largest renewable energy consultancy? Do you have a passion for permitting renewable energy projects, and furthering your professional development in a company that truly puts people first?

At DNV our organizational culture and how we collectively influence the world for future generations matters deeply to us. Our team works every day to increase the widespread deployment and operation of renewables to address climate change and positively impact society; endeavors to achieve our purpose through the success of our customers; and strives to be high-performing and innovative. Our approach reflects the equity, respect, and diversity we wish to see in the world.

DNV s Environmental and Permitting Services (EPS) team is growing rapidly, and we are seeking a US Permitting Project Manager and Team Lead to help us provide comprehensive permitting services in Midwest US and the rest of the United States (US). You will be responsible for overseeing a team and leading project development and environmental and permitting activities, including the preparation of local, state, and federal renewable energy permit applications, associated environmental and social impact studies, stakeholder engagement sessions, and land use and zoning permit applications for renewable energy projects located in the Midwest and, as well as other regions within and outside of the US. You will also be engaged in leading proposal efforts, business development for wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen facilities across the US, as well as assisting with project due diligence activities.

Our Customers can choose any number of consultancies to execute on specific tasks. However, our EPS team strives to develop long-term partnerships with our Customers, acting as their trusted advisor from the early site selection stage through to operations. Our Customers are at the forefront of the energy transition. Our team is nimble, highly experienced, and driven by our mission to ensure renewable energy projects are safely and sustainably sited, permitted, and operated.

Our team

The EPS team is comprised of siting, environmental, and permitting specialists who work directly with our Customers to help identify and address project risks for terrestrial wind, offshore wind, solar, battery storage, and hydrogen projects. Our mission is to guide the sustainable, responsible growth of the renewables industry by providing innovative environmental and permitting expertise to support the greater good.

To facilitate this work, excellent written and oral communication skills are paramount. Broadly, our work falls into four categories:

  • Biological services, including field surveys, habitat conservation plans, corporate avian and bat protection plans, review of mitigation strategies, and associated permitting.
  • Permitting services, providing support for permitting at the federal, state/provincial, and local level for wind, solar, battery storage and hydrogen projects; including stakeholder engagement.
  • GIS services, including mapping, constraints reviews, radiocommunication surveys, and critical issues analyses.
  • Siting services, including layout optimization, acoustical measurements, noise impact assessments, shadow flicker studies, blade/ice throw assessments, glint and glare studies, and visual impact studies.

This is a Remote position

What You ll Do

  • Oversee a team of project analysts, biologists, and engineers to deliver projects within allocated time and budget. Perform technical checking and initial approval of all work products completed by project team.
  • Lead the preparation and submission of permit applications, coordination of environmental fieldwork, authoring of environmental reporting documentation including critical issues analyses, technical permitting studies and management plans, Phase I ESAs, environmental impact assessments and technical project proposals and, agency consultation and stakeholder engagement programs.
  • Provide people leadership, coaching, and quality control for a team of approximately five.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with Midwest regulatory agencies (and/or other US regions).
  • Stay informed of applicable regulatory frameworks and participate in regulatory discussions and feedback discussions related to renewable energy developments in the US.
  • Actively seek out practical and realistic business development opportunities in the US. Prepare proposals and bids and engage in facilitating innovative and new service offerings to anticipate/meet market needs.

Position Qualifications

What is Required

  • Bachelor s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
  • At least 5 years of environmental and/or permitting experience in the US, preferably in the renewable energy industry
  • Advanced knowledge of environmental assessment regulatory frameworks as applied to renewable energy (wind, solar, or battery storage)

  • Experience leading winning proposal efforts for Customers in the renewable energy industry;

doc_title: Offshore Substation Engineering Manager - Kiewit Power Engineering
doc_description:
Requisition ID: 136088


Job Level: Mid Level


Department: Design Engineering


Market: Power


Employment Type: Full Time



Position Overview



Kiewit is seeking an experienced Offshore Substation Engineering Manager to provide design oversight, technical expertise, and guidance for HVAC and HVDC offshore wind collection stations and interconnections to onshore stations. This position is for an experienced engineering manager with a background in high-voltage station design, with expertise in offshore station equipment and functionality, design criteria and applicable codes. The candidate must possess leadership experience, excellent communication skills and demonstrate a strong desire to work collaboratively within a group of experienced professionals.

On our team, you’ll have the opportunity to see more and do more than you ever imagined. Working hard will not only bring you the satisfaction of a job well done but will help propel you forward in your career faster than you may expect. We’ll train you, develop your skills and allow you to take on power projects that will impact millions across North America. With top-notch health benefits, a wealth-building 401k plan and unbeatable growth opportunities, by joining Kiewit, you’re ensuring a lifetime of success.


District Overview



Kiewit Engineering Group, Inc is a full-service consulting and engineering firm serving the infrastructure and engineering markets. Our combined staff of more than 1,300 engineers and design professionals have expertise that spans all major engineering disciplines to serve transportation, power, water/wastewater, mining, building, and oil, gas & chemical markets. Backed by 130 years of construction experience, our construction-driven engineering focuses on constructability and safety in the earliest phases of projects to ensure on-time and on-budget project delivery.

Our rapidly growing Power district, which includes structural, civil, piping, mechanical, process, process safety, electrical, instrument and control disciplines, is a multi-faceted division of Kiewit with best-in-class technical expertise focused on the EPC delivery model for power facilities. We offer a variety of engineering services, including owner's engineering, project development, detailed engineering and design, construction management and plant services. Our engineering teams bring power projects to life across North America in the following areas:


Gas-fired generation
Power delivery
Environmental retrofits
Renewables and new technology
Water/wastewater

We are a high performing team of engineers and designers that develop projects through the project life-cycle engaging exciting projects throughout North America. Our staff leads the power markets engineering process and collaborates with Kiewit’s construction teams to approach construction-driven engineering with a focus on safe, cost-effective, and innovative designs that achieve client expectations and further Kiewit’s legacy of excellence.





Location



This position is US based. Sponsorship opportunities available.



Responsibilities


Provide engineering leadership, oversight, and coordination to assigned offshore substation projects.


Management of all technical team members and tasks including, but not limited to: definition of project scope, including functional layouts, optimization, and operability, design basis development


Contribute technical expertise to discipline lead engineers to ensure technical compliance, while maintaining optimal project cost and schedule.


Communicate and coordinate project activities with project director, clients and other stakeholders.


Lead project risk assessments and risk mitigation strategies


Manage the use and provide insight in the development/use of Kiewit tools in order to increase efficiency in planning, design, and project execution.


Monitor QA/QC of project and coordinate with QA/QC team to resolve any design or process issues.


Manage and support contractor RFIs.


Promote and support interdisciplinary coordination.


Responsible for ensuring compliance with Kiewit quality control program.


Develop and improve processes, tools and/or technology


Interface with clients on a regular basis.


Responsible for grid code compliance


Manage all lessons learned and incorporate them into department standards/processes


Qualifications


Bachelor of Science degree (B.S.) in electrical engineering from an ABET accredited university


Proven history of successful engineering management on offshore substation projects


Deep understanding of offshore wind farm electrical system design requirements and solutions including interface points between onshore and offshore substations


Experience working as a project engineer on an offshore wind project.


Capability to manage people effectively in order to meet quality and project schedule.


Professional Engineer (PE) preferred


Legally able to work within the United States for any length of time


Strong written and verbal communication skills; fluent in English language


Knowledge and understanding of US engineering standards including (but not limited to):


ANSI C2, C37, C57, C62


IEEE 1, 4, 80, 120, 1300, 1375, 1459, 1584, 1862


NFPA 70, 70E, 110, 780, 791, 850


Knowledge and understanding of US Regulatory Requirements including (but not limited to):


29 CFR 1910


29 CFR 1926


30 CFR 585 – Renewable Energy and Alternate Uses of Existing Facilities on the Outer Continental Shelf


CFR Title 33 – Navigation and Navigable Waters


NERC Reliability Standard FAC-001


Knowledge and understanding of international engineering standards including (but not limited to):


DNGL-ST-0145 – Offshore Substation Standard


DNVGL-OS-C101 – Design of Offshore Steel Structures


DNVGL-OS-D201 – Electrical Installations


DNVGL-RP-C205 – Environmental Conditions and Environmental Loads


DNVGL-ST-N001 – General Guidelines for Marine Projects


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

International Wind
 is a maintenance and repair service provider for the burgeoning commercial wind power generation industry. We specialize in providing repairs primarily in the field at customer locations (Wind farms). Our field workers are trained and are required to maintain certification for climbing, working at heights, confined space entry and specialty processes such as composite repair for blades.
Due to exceptional growth and future opportunity, we are seeking a detail oriented, well organized, and highly motivated individual to assist with Wind Operations. This person will provide day-to-day operations support for projects and customers under his/her purview to include work scheduling, training, logistics and management of personnel to ensure safe, smooth, and effective support for our client’s needs.


*
Job duties*
The Operations Support Manager’s over-arching purpose is ensuring that the business operates safely and effectively in support of our client’s needs. Duties and obligations that support that objective include but are not limited to:



 
Ensure a strong commitment to safety

 
Establish safety as our first core value

 
Foster a safety conscious work environment where all employees understand reporting options and are empowered to improve our safety culture

 
Ensure everyone understands they have the power to stop work when circumstances lead to uncertainty





 
Establish a strong relationship with designated customer contacts by demonstrating transparency, integrity, and honesty in dealing with each assigned client

 
Function as the single point of contact maintaining continuous client contact to build and/or strengthen the relationship

 
Deliver strong and frequent leadership engagement with assigned clients to ensure we understand and can deliver on their needs

 
Present a proactive posture regarding our performance – except and react promptly





 
Install a culture of continuous improvement and set high standards and expectations for our field personnel

 
Conducting periodic reviews of procedures and processes to identify improvement opportunities within the operation of the business

 
Communicate with field personnel frequently to understand operational challenges and support requirements to help ensure successful execution of contracted work

 
Remain available and approachable to our field employees





 
Oversight of operational and contract budgets with focus on establishing savings while maintaining or improving effectiveness

 
Understand all contracts associated with assigned clients

 
Ensure that operational plans support execution of the contract and identified work scope

 
Diligently enforce best practices with respect to spend for items such as vehicles, travel, hotel, materials, and contracted services





 
Conduct periodic site visits to:

 
Reinforce safety culture

 
Improve customer relationship

 
Garner feedback from field employees and

 
Ensure field performance and behavior supports contract requirements and best practices with respect to safety, quality, and schedule




*
Job Requirements: *



 
5 years of relevant Wind experience with at least 1 in an operations role preferred

 
Field Service experience in support of periodic maintenance activities including logistics for mobilization and demobilization

 
Experience with recruiting and staffing highly desirable

 
Can quickly identify key resources and build high performing teams

 
capable of providing input for a succession planning model that maintains a defense in depth for position evolutions.





 
Effective communication – written and verbal – with both management and craft

 
Ensure transparent communication regarding status, planning and expected outcome

 
Influence others (internal and external) to improve project outcomes





 
Effectively manages his/her time and that of other’s

 
Experience and/or active certifications as a trainer for GWO and/or ENSA a plus

 
Desire a candidate with established ties to Wind Industry management. OEM and Wind Farm connections desired in both USA and Europe

 
Understanding of wind turbine blade production/engineering principles highly considered

 
Rope Access experience highly desired

 
Existing certification to provide training in support of certification to Global Wind Organization (GWO) standards




Job Type: Full-time


Pay: $100,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year


Benefits:



 
401(k)

 
Dental insurance

 
Health insurance

 
Paid time off

 
Vision insurance




Schedule:



 
10 hour shift

 
12 hour shift

 
3x12

 
4 hour shift

 
4x10

 
4x12

 
5x8

 
8 hour shift

 
Day shift

 
Holidays

 
Monday to Friday

 
Night shift

 
No nights

 
No weekends

 
On call

 
Overnight shift

 
Weekend availability

 
Weekends only

Job Description Summary
 You will be part of the Project Management Office (PMO)—Marshalling Harbor department—in a cross-functional role which manages the various component preassembly functions at the New Bedford Marine Commerce Terminal, reporting directly to the Deputy Hub Manager. You may also be required to cover additional missions for the PMO to support the project.
 
 
 
 The Tower Preassembly Manager is responsible for overseeing and ensuring the full scope of Mechanical and Electrical/Preassembly operations of the Vineyard Wind 1 Project. The Tower Preassembly Manager is responsible for the management of the full tower erection on the quayside, ensuring they are carried out with good workmanship in accordance with project requirements/schedule, contractor procedures and strict compliance to EHS regulations and QA/QC policy.
 
 
 
 You will demonstrate excellent communication, proactivity, and in-depth knowledge in the field of Mechanical and Electrical completion/construction. The successful candidate will also be expected to follow and enforce GE’s Quality Management System for the Project.
 
 
 
 The position will be based in New Bedford, MA for the Vineyard Wind 1 Project.
 

 
 Job Description

 
 Roles and Responsibilities

 

 

  
 Tower section(T1/T2/T3) lifting operation including Upending of tower sections

  
 Assembly of tower section to erect the full tower on their respective foundation

  
 Installation and termination of cables inside the tower

  
 Customization activities when necessary

  
 Preparation of the full tower for load-out to the feeder barge

  
 Manage all preassembly activities of the main WTG components within the Hub including activities such as heavy lifting, component handling and preservation, operation method reviews, and mechanical and electrical completion works to achieve Customer & GE OFW goals and objectives

  
 Measure the on-time delivery of tower pre-assembly and loadout activities

  
 Verify that the work tasks are performed safely and in accordance with the approved procedure(s)

  
 Oversee the development of all Tower pre-assembly method statements and lift plans

  
 Manage all technical aspects of tower preassembly activities including all SIMOPS/COMOPS activities if necessary.

  
 Ensure all required equipment is mobilized and operational, including main components (nacelles, towers, and blades)

  
 Manage barge loadouts and backloading activities on quayside

  
 Ensure preassembly activities completed in time to meet internal targets and key loadout dates

  
 Support the issuing of Mechanical & Electrical certificates to make sure the tower is preassembled according to the schedule and quality procedure

  
 Ensure that highest level of Environmental, Health & Safety (EHS) standards are enforced and applied

  
 Sign work permits prior to start of lifting or preassembly activities

  
 Ensure that all EHS requirements are met prior to launch of operation. Ensure that documentation is in order and available (work permit, lift plans, Method Statements & Risk Assessment including all certificates as required)

  
 Troubleshooting and management of punch lists

  
 Ensure Toolbox Talks with the Marshalling Hub subcontractor are completed on each day of operations. Oversee toolbox talks and/or pre-lift meetings prior to the start of any preassembly operations

  
 Confirm with the Marshalling Hub subcontractor that Tooling, Material and PPE used for the operation is available, incl. certificate (when applicable)

  
 Interface with the warehouse team daily

  
 Management of offshore and onshore preassembly kits for bolting, tooling, and M&E equipment

  
 Confirm with Hub subcontractor that personnel have acquired the appropriate levels of training and certification for their respective tasks

  
 Monitor operations performed by the subcontractor on WTG components during Storage, Preservation, Preassembly and Loadout.

  
 Collect all required documentation provided by the subcontractor at the end of the operation and update system accordingly.

  
 Share any EHS, non-conformance or damage reports with the EHS or Quality team.

  
 Capture and escalate all changes in scope, schedule. Advise of any major issues, especially those affecting EHS, or schedule aspects of the contract to the Deputy Hub Manager

  
 Work on the Vineyard Wind 1 Marshalling Hub daily

  
 Undertake other tasks as may be requested by the PMO.

 

 

 
 Required Qualifications

 

  
 Bachelor's Degree

  
 Minimum of 8 years of experience managing Mechanical/Electrical/Construction activities

 

 

 
 Desired Characteristics

 

  
 Proven experience working on complex construction projects and schedule management

  
 Experience working on wind projects would be advantageous but is not a prerequisite

  
 Open to working with multinational people and team of diverse backgrounds and a subcontractor workforce made up of union and non-union personnel

  
 Knowledge & understanding of Heavy lifting activities and associated EHS requirements

  
 Strong experience managing Mechanical and Electrical activities

  
 Familiar with OSHA and standard site safety regulations

  
 Proven experience with subcontractor management

  
 Passionate and motivated

  
 Excellent ability to communicate at all levels

  
 Good inter-personal skills to bridge between customer representatives and various subcontractors working on site

  
 Ability to negotiate with different stakeholders

  
 Good English and excellent PC and Microsoft Office computer skills
